dialogue: You guys, um I know that this really doesn't have anything to do with me, but um I love you guys too.  Oh, I really needed that.

name: monica
dialogue: Look, I know that you are in a place right now where you really need to hate Julie's guts, but she didn't do anything wrong. I mean, she was just a girl who met a guy, and now they go out. I really think that if you gave her a chance, you'd like her. Would you just give that a chance, for me?

name: rachel
dialogue: I'd do anything for you, you know that.

name: monica
dialogue: I'd do anything for you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wait, wait, wait, wait!

name: joey
dialogue: Morning'.  I said, morning'.

name: hombre man
dialogue: I heard you.

name: store guy
dialogue: All right, everybody, I'm opening' the doors. You boys ready?

name: hombre man
dialogue: Ready.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, I'm ready.

name: customer
dialogue: You idiot, you stupid cowboy, you blinded me, I'm suing!

name: store guy
dialogue: Oh my god, Todd! What the hell did you do?

name: hombre man
dialogue: I'm sorry. I am such a doofus. I'm so sorry, I'm so sorry.

name: annabelle
dialogue: My god, what happened?

name: joey
dialogue: These new kids, they never last. Sooner or later, they all...stop lasting'. Listen, uh, what do you say I buy you that cup of coffee now?

name: annabelle
dialogue: Sure.

name: julie
dialogue: So

name: rachel
dialogue: So I just thought the two of us should hang out for a bit. I mean, you know, we've never really talked. I guess you'd know that, being one of the two of us, though, right?

name: julie
dialogue: I know, I probably shouldn't even tell you this, but I'm pretty much totally intimidated by you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Really? Me?

name: julie
dialogue: Yes. Oh my god, are you kidding? Ross is so crazy about you, and I really wanted you to like me, and, it's probably me being totally paranoid, but I kind of got the feeling that maybe you don't.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, you are not totally paranoid.

name: julie
dialogue: Oy.

name: rachel
dialogue: Um, ok, uh, oh god, um, when you and uh Ross first started going out, it was really hard for me, um, for many reasons, which I'm not going to bore you with now, but um, I just, I see how happy he is, you know, and how good you guys are together, and um, Monica's always saying how nice you are, and god I hate it when she's right.

name: julie
dialogue: Thanks. Hey, listen, would you like to go to a movie sometime or something?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, that'd be great. I'd love it.

name: julie
dialogue: I'd love it too. Shoot, I got to go. So, I'll talk to you later.

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, Julie.

name: julie
dialogue: Bye.

name: rachel
dialogue: Bye.  What a manipulative bitch.

name: ross
dialogue: that is not bad.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: monica
dialogue: So how was Joan?

name: chandler
dialogue: I broke up with her.

name: chandler
dialogue: They were huge. When she sneezed, bats flew out of them.

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on, they were not that huge.

name: chandler
dialogue: I'm telling' you, she leaned back, I could see her brain.

name: monica
dialogue: How many perfectly fine women are you going to reject over the most superficial insignificant things?

name: joey
dialogue: Hold it hold it. I got to side with Chandler on this one. When I first moved to the city, I went out a couple of times with this girl, really hot, great kisser, but she had the biggest Adam's apple. It made me nuts.

name: chandler
dialogue: You or me?

name: ross
dialogue: I got it. Uh, Joey, women don't have Adam's apples.

name: joey
dialogue: You guys are messing' with me, right?

name: all
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: That was a good one. For a second there, I was like, "whoa."

name: phoebe
dialogue: You name one woman that you broke up with for a real reason.

name: chandler
dialogue: Maureen Rosilla.

name: ross
dialogue: Not hating Yanni is not a real reason.

name: monica
dialogue: Hello, Mr. Heckles.

name: mr. heckles
dialogue: you are doing it again.

name: monica
dialogue: We're not doing anything.

name: mr. heckles
dialogue: you are stomping. It's disturbing my birds.

name: rachel
dialogue: You don't have birds.

name: mr. heckles
dialogue: I could have birds.

name: monica
dialogue: Ok, Mr. Heckles, we'll try to keep it down.

name: mr. heckles
dialogue: Thank you. I'm going to rejoin my dinner party.

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, bye-bye.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ok, Janice. Janice. You got to give me Janice. That wasn't about being picky.

name: ross
dialogue: We'll give you Janice.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I miss Janice though. "Hello, Chandler Bing."

name: rachel
dialogue: "Oh, my, god."

name: joey
dialogue: "Oh, Chandler, now, now, that is it. There, faster!"

name: monica
dialogue: Stop with the broom, we're not making noise.

name: rachel
dialogue: We won. We won!

name: monica
dialogue: Mr. Heckles.

name: rachel
dialogue: How did this happen?

name: mr. treeger
dialogue: He must have been sweeping'. They found a broom in his hand.

name: monica
dialogue: that is terrible.

name: mr. treeger
dialogue: I know. I was sweeping' yesterday. It could have been me.

name: mr. treeger
dialogue: You never know.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ok, it's very faint, but I can still sense him in the building. Go into the light, Mr. Heckles!

name: chandler
dialogue: Ok, Phoebe.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I'm sorry, but sometimes they need help. that is fine. Go ahead and scoff. You know, there're a lot of things that I don't believe in, but that doesn't mean they're not true.

name: joey
dialogue: Such as?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Like crop circles, or the Bermuda triangle, or evolution?

name: ross
dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What, you don't, uh, you don't believe in evolution?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Nah. Not really.

name: ross
dialogue: You don't believe in evolution?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don't know, it's just, you know...monkeys, Darwin, you know, it's a, it's a nice story, I just think it's a little too easy.

name: ross
dialogue: Too easy? Too...The process of every living thing on this planet evolving over millions of years from single-celled organisms, too easy?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I just don't buy it.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, excuse me. Evolution is not for you to buy, Phoebe. Evolution is scientific fact, like, like, like the air we breathe, like gravity.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ok, don't get me started on gravity.

name: ross
dialogue: You uh, you don't believe in gravity?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, it's not so much that you know, like I don't believe in it, you know, it's just...I don't know, lately I get the feeling that I'm not so much being pulled down as I am being pushed.

name: chandler
dialogue: Uh-Oh. It's Isaac Newton, and he's pissed.

name: mr. treeger
dialogue: There she is. And over there, that is the other one. This is Mr. Buddy Boyle, Mr. Heckles' attorney. He'd like to talk to you.

name: monica
dialogue: What can we do for you?

name: mr. boyle
dialogue: All right, kids. Here's the deal. According to my client's will, he wants to leave all his earthly possessions to "the noisy girls in the apartment above mine".

name: monica
dialogue: Well, what about his family?

name: mr. boyle
dialogue: He didn't have any.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ok, so let's talk money.

name: mr. boyle
dialogue: All right, there was none. Let's talk signing. You be noisy girl number one, you be noisy girl number two.

name: monica
dialogue: I can't believe that this whole time we thought he hated us. I mean, isn't it amazing how much you can touch someone's life, without even knowing it?...Would you look at this dump? He hated us. This is his final revenge!

name: rachel
dialogue: Have you ever seen so much crap?

name: chandler
dialogue: Actually, I think this apartment sullies the good name of crap

name: joey
dialogue: Check this out. Can I have this?

name: ross
dialogue: How can you not believe in evolution?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Just don't. Look at this funky shirt!

name: ross
dialogue: Pheebs, I have studied evolution my entire adult life. Ok, I can tell you, we have collected fossils from all over the world that actually show the evolution of different species, ok? You can literally see them evolving through time.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Really? You can actually see it?

name: ross
dialogue: You bet. In the U.S., China, Africa, all over.

name: phoebe
dialogue: See, I didn't know that.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, there you go.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Huh. So now, the real question is, who put those fossils there, and why?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, look at this. "My Big Book of Grievances."

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, there's me! April 17th. Excessive noise. Italian guy comes homes with a date. Hey Chandler, look, you are in here too.

name: chandler
dialogue: April 18th, excessive noise. Italian guy's gay roommate comes home with the dry-cleaning. Well that is excellent.

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica, Monica, look at this lamp. Is this tacky or what? We have to have this.

name: monica
dialogue: Rach, I think we have enough regular lamps.

name: rachel
dialogue: What? Come on, it's not like I'm asking for this girly clock or anything, which, by the way, I also think is very cool.

name: monica
dialogue: It doesn't go with any of my stuff.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, what about my stuff?

name: monica
dialogue: You don't have any stuff.

name: rachel
dialogue: You still think of it as your apartment, don't you?

name: monica
dialogue: No.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes you do. You think of it as your apartment, and I'm just somebody who rents a room.

name: monica
dialogue: Mmm.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ok, while you "mmm" on it for awhile, I'm going to go find a place for my new lamp.

name: ross
dialogue: Ok, Pheebs. See how I'm making these little toys move? Opposable thumbs. Without evolution, how do you explain opposable thumbs?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Maybe the overlords needed them to steer their spacecrafts.

name: ross
dialogue: Please tell me you are joking.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Look, can't we just say that you believe in something, and I don't.

name: ross
dialogue: No, no, Pheebs, we can't, ok, because--

name: phoebe
dialogue: What is this obsessive need you have to make everyone agree with you? No, what's that all about? I think, I think maybe it's time you put Ross under the microscope.

name: ross
dialogue: Is there blood coming out of my ears?

name: joey
dialogue: Check it out, check it out. Heckles' high school yearbook.

name: chandler
dialogue: Wow, he looks so normal.

name: phoebe
dialogue: He's even kind of cute.

name: joey
dialogue: "Heckles, you crack me up in science class. you are the funniest kid in school.

name: chandler
dialogue: Funniest? Heckles?

name: joey
dialogue: that is what it says.

name: chandler
dialogue: Wow, Heckles was voted class clown, and so was I. He was right. Would you listen to that?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I'd call that excessive.

name: chandler
dialogue: Whoa!

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: chandler
dialogue: Heckles played clarinet in band, and I played clarinet. And he was in the scale modeler's club, and I was, well, there was no club, but I sure thought they were cool.

name: joey
dialogue: So, you were both dorks. Big deal.

name: chandler
dialogue: I just think it's weird, you know? Heckles and me, Heckles, and me, me and Heckles...Would you knock it off?

name: joey
dialogue: Have you been here all night?

name: chandler
dialogue: Look at this. Pictures of all the women that Heckles went out with. Look what he wrote on them. Vivian, too tall. Madge, big gums. Too loud, too smart, makes noise when she eats. This is, this is me. This is what I do. I'm going to end up alone, just like he did.

name: joey
dialogue: Chandler, Heckles was a nut case.

name: chandler
dialogue: Our trains are on the same track, ok? Yeah, sure, I'm coming up 30 years behind him, but the stops are all the same. Bitter Town. Aloneville. Hermit Junction.

name: joey
dialogue: All right, you know what we got to do? We got to get you out of here. Come on, I'll buy you breakfast, let's go.

name: chandler
dialogue: What if I never find someone? Or worse, what if I've found her, but I dumped her because she pronounced it "supposably"?

name: joey
dialogue: Chandler, come on, you are going to find somebody.

name: chandler
dialogue: How do you know that? How?

name: joey
dialogue: I don't know, I'm just trying' to help you out.

name: chandler
dialogue: You'll see, you guys are all going to go off and get married, and I'm going to end up alone. Will you promise me something? When you are married, will you invite me over for holidays?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, I don't know. I don't know what we're going to be doin'. I mean, what if we're at her folks' place?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, I understand.

name: joey
dialogue: You can come over and watch the Super Bowl. Every year, all right?

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what? I'm not going to end up like this. I'll see you man.

name: joey
dialogue: Supposably. Supposably. Did they go to the zoo? Supposably.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi, it's me.

name: janice
dialogue: Oh, my, god.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Janice? You called Janice?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, Janice. Why is that so difficult for you to comprehend?

name: ross
dialogue: You remember Janice, right?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes. She was smart, she was pretty, and she honestly cared about me. Janice is my last chance to have somebody.

name: janice
dialogue: Hello!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, my, god!

name: joey
dialogue: Geez, look how fat she got.

name: janice
dialogue: Hey, it's everybody.

name: chandler
dialogue: Janice, you are--

name: janice
dialogue: Yes, I am.

name: chandler
dialogue: Is it--?

name: janice
dialogue: Is it yours? Ha! You wish, Chandler Bing. You are looking at a married lady now.

name: chandler
dialogue: Congratulations.

name: janice
dialogue: Oh, sweetie, I'm sorry.

name: chandler
dialogue: You couldn't have told me about this on the phone?

name: janice
dialogue: And what? Missed the expression on your face? Janice likes to have her fun.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, Rach. You know what we haven't played in a while?

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

name: monica
dialogue: Hide the Lamp.

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica, let it go.

name: monica
dialogue: Did you know I was allergic to shellfish?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, then, you'll just have to eat the other lamps.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uh-oh. It's Scary Scientist Man.

name: ross
dialogue: Ok, Phoebe, this is it. In this briefcase I carry actual scientific facts. A briefcase of facts, if you will. Some of these fossils are over 200 million years old.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ok, look, before you even start, I'm not denying evolution, ok, I'm just saying that it's one of the possibilities.

name: ross
dialogue: It's the only possibility, Phoebe.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ok, Ross, could you just open your mind like this much, ok? Wasn't there a time when the brightest minds in the world believed that the world was flat? And, up until like what, 50 years ago, you all thought the atom was the smallest thing, until you split it open, and this like, whole mess of crap came out. Now, are you telling me that you are so unbelievably arrogant that you can't admit that there's a teeny tiny possibility that you could be wrong about this?

name: ross
dialogue: There might be, a teeny, tiny, possibility.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I can't believe you caved.

name: ross
dialogue: What?

name: phoebe
dialogue: You just abandoned your whole belief system. I mean, before, I didn't agree with you, but at least I respected you. How, how, how are you going to go into work tomorrow? How, how are you going to face the other science guys? How, how are you going to face yourself? Oh! That was fun. So who's hungry?

name: rachel
dialogue: I am. Let me just get my coat.

name: monica
dialogue: Ok, all right. It was an accident, I swear, all right. I was putting on my jacket, and the thing, and the lamp, and it broke.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, please, Monica. You've always hated my lamp, and then, all of a sudden, it's just magically broken?

name: monica
dialogue: Phoebe, tell her!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ok, I didn't see it, because I was putting on my jacket, but I uh want to believe you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey Chandler. Monica just broke my seashell lamp.

name: chandler
dialogue: Neat. I'm going to die alone.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ok, you win.

name: monica
dialogue: Chandler, you are not going to die alone.

name: chandler
dialogue: Janice was my safety net, ok? And now I have to get a snake.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uh huh. Why is that?

name: chandler
dialogue: If I'm going to be an old, lonely man, I'm going to need a thing, you know, a hook, like that guy on the subway who eats his own face. So I figure I'll be Crazy Man with a Snake, y=know. Crazy Snake Man. And I'll get more snakes, call them my babies, kids will walk past my place, they will run. "Run away from Crazy Snake Man," they'll shout!

name: monica
dialogue: You have got to get over this. you are not going to end up alone.

name: chandler
dialogue: Of course I am. I reject anyone who's crazy enough to actually go out with me, and then I bitch about the fact that there aren't any great women out there.

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler, you have just described virtually every man that we have ever gone out with.

name: monica
dialogue: You are not a freak. you are a guy.

name: rachel
dialogue: She's right. She's right. You are no different than the rest of them.

name: monica
dialogue: Wait a minute, wait a minute. Yes he is. You are totally different.

name: chandler
dialogue: In a bad way?

name: monica
dialogue: No, honey, in a wonderful way. You know what you want now. Most guys don't even have a clue. You are ready to take risks, you are ready to be vulnerable, and intimate with someone.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah. you are not going to end up alone.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Chandler, you called Janice! that is how much you wanted to be with someone!

name: monica
dialogue: You made it!

name: phoebe
dialogue: you are there!

name: rachel
dialogue: You are ready to make a commitment!

name: chandler
dialogue: Whoa! Don't know about that.

name: rachel
dialogue: What you got there? Something else that is not yours that you can break?

name: monica
dialogue: No. Um, I know you like this, and I want you to have it. I think it'll look good in our apartment.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you.

name: monica
dialogue: that is fine.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey. Well, you will all be pleased to know that I have a date tomorrow night. This woman, Alison, from work. She's great. She's pretty, she's smart. And uh, I've been holding off on asking her out in the past, because she has an unusually large head. But, I'm not going to let that stuff hang me up anymore. Look at me. I'm growing.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, uh, you can't recycle yearbooks, can you?

name: chandler
dialogue: I'll take that.

name: joey
dialogue: You want his yearbook?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, yeah. Some people said some nice things about him. I think somebody should have it.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, gosh, this is so weird. I mean, his whole life was in this apartment, and now it's gone. You know, I think it would be nice if we just took a few moments, for Mr. Heckles. I mean, he was kind of a pain, he was, but, he was a person. you are all going to hell.

name: rachel
dialogue: It's really not that big!

name: chandler
dialogue: Takin' that with you, huh?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: You coming'?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, jus' second. Good-bye Mr. Heckles. We'll try to keep it down.

name: alison
dialogue: Oh, my major was totally useless. I mean, how often do you look in the classifieds and see "Philosopher wanted"?

name: chandler
dialogue: Sure.

name: ross
dialogue: Man, I sure miss Julie.

name: chandler
dialogue: Spanish midgets. Spanish midgets wrestling. Julie. Ok, yes, I see how you got there.

name: ross
dialogue: You ever figure out what that thing's for?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, see, I'm trying this new screening thing. You know, I figure if I'm always answering the phone, people will think I don't have a life. My god, Rodrigo never gets pinned.

name: jade
dialogue: Hello, I'm looking for Bob. This is Jane. I don't know if you are still at this number, but I was just thinking about us, and how great it was, and, well, I know it's been three years, but, I was kind of hoping we could hook up again. I barely had t he nerve to make this call, so you know what I did?

name: chandler
dialogue: What?

name: jade
dialogue: I got a little drunk...and naked.

name: chandler
dialogue: Bob here.

name: chandler
dialogue: What've you been up to?

name: jade
dialogue: Oh, you know, the usual, teaching aerobics, partying way too much. Oh, and in case you were wondering, those are my legs on the new James Bond poster.

name: chandler
dialogue: Can you hold on a moment? I have another call.  I love her.

name: ross
dialogue: I know.

name: chandler
dialogue: I'm back.

name: jade
dialogue: So, are we going to get together or what?

name: chandler
dialogue: Um, absolutely. Uh, how 'bout tomorrow afternoon? Do you know uh, Central Perk in the Village, say, five-ish?

name: jade
dialogue: Great, I'll see you then.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ok. Ok. Having a phone has finally paid off.

name: ross
dialogue: Even though you do do a good Bob impression, I'm thinking' when she sees you tomorrow, she's probably going to realize, "hey, you are not Bob."

name: chandler
dialogue: I'm hoping that when Bob doesn't show up, she will seek comfort in the open arms of the wry stranger at the next table.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh my god. You are pure evil.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ok, pure evil, horny and alone. I've done this.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, everybody's here. Hey, everybody, say hi to Julie in New Mexico.

name: all
dialogue: Hi, Julie!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi, Julie.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ok, while Ross is on the phone, everybody owes me 62 bucks for his birthday.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Um, is, is there any chance that you are rounding up? You know, like from, like 20?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, come on, we got the gift, the concert, and the cake.

name: joey
dialogue: Do we need a cake?

name: chandler
dialogue: Look guys, I know it's a little steep.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, whoosh!

name: chandler
dialogue: But it's Ross.

name: phoebe
dialogue: It's Ross.

name: joey
dialogue: All right.

name: chandler
dialogue: I'll see you guys later, I got to go...do a thing.

name: ross
dialogue: Ok, sweetheart, I'll call you later tonight. Whoa, whoa, whoa, hey, hey, hey, you are not really going to go through with this, are you?

name: chandler
dialogue: You know, I think I might just.

name: rachel
dialogue: So uh, what are you guys doing for dinner tonight?

name: joey
dialogue: Well I guess I got to start saving' up for Ross's birthday, so I guess I'll just stay home and eat dust bunnies.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Can you believe how much this is going to cost?

name: rachel
dialogue: Do you guys ever get the feeling that um, Chandler and those guys just don't get that we don't make as much money as they do?

name: joey
dialogue: Yes! Yeah, it's like they're always saying "let's go here, let's go there". Like we can afford to go here and there.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes, yes, and it's, and we always have to go to, you know, someplace nice, you know? God, and it's not like we can say anything about it, Because, like this birthday thing, it's for Ross.

name: joey
dialogue: For Ross.

name: rachel
dialogue: For Ross, Ross, Ross.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my god.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey.

name: joey
dialogue: Hi.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

name: monica
dialogue: I'm at work, ordinary day, you know, chop chop chop, saute, saute, saute. All of a sudden, Leon, the manager, calls me into his office. It turns out they fired the head lunch chef, and guess who got the job.

name: joey
dialogue: If it's not you, this is a horrible story.

name: monica
dialogue: Fortunately, it is me. And, they made me head of purchasing, thank you very much. Anyway, I just ran into Ross and Chandler downstairs, and they think we should go out and celebrate. You know, someplace nice.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, someplace nice.  How much do you think I can get for my kidney?

name: ross
dialogue: I'm telling' you. You can't do this.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, come on. I can never get a girl like that with conventional methods.

name: ross
dialogue: That doesn't matter. She wanted to call Bob. Hey, for all we know, Bob is who she was meant to be with. You may be destroying two people's chance for happiness.

name: chandler

And yes, I know, the taxes are a little higher than, let's say, Nassau county but the school system's supposedly great.

My sister Jill would be throwing up over the side and my dad would be upset because nobody was helping and then when we did help he would scream at us for doing it wrong. But then when the fireworks started, everybody just shut up, you know, and it'd get really cold, and we would all just sort of smush under this one blanket. It never occurred to anybody to bring another one. And now it's just...

dialogue: I, I, I'm hideous.

dialogue: It's going to be ok. Ryan's been under water. He's just going to be so glad that you don't have barnacles on your butt.

dialogue: What's going' on?

dialogue: Well, no no, you have to stay back. I, I have the pox.

dialogue: Chicken or small?

dialogue: Chicken. Which is so ironic considering I'm a vegetarian.

name: ryan
dialogue: Why aren't you at home in bed?

dialogue: Because my, my grandmother's never had chicken pox. Please, please tell me you have, Because oh my God, I forgot how cute you are.

name: ryan
dialogue: I'm sorry, I never had them.

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH, ohh.

name: ryan
dialogue: If I had one wish, it would be to build a time machine, go back to when I was 7, when Jimmy Hauser had the chicken pox. I would grab that kid and rub him all over my face.

dialogue: Your face could be covered with lochs, I wouldn't care.

name: phoebe

name: phoebe
dialogue: I hate this. Because I tell you, I had the most amazing two weeks planned for us, and almost everything I had in mind, we had to be a lot closer than this.

name: ryan
dialogue: Phoebe, I have spent the last eight months in a steel tube with men, thinking about this moment. I am not going to let a bunch of itchy spots stand between us.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ok, this is the most romantic disease I've ever had.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.

dialogue: Weird world. Your kids?

dialogue: I figure my character has kids.

name: chandler
dialogue: you know there isn't a part of that sentence I don't need explained.

dialogue: Well, see when you are acting you need to think about stuff like that. My character, Joseph the processor guy, has two little girls, Ashley and Brittany. Ashley copies everything Brittany does.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, invisible kids can be that way sometimes.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah. Joseph and his wife, Karen, are thinking of having a third kid... you know what? Just did.

name: chandler
dialogue: Really? Wow. that is some pretty powerful imaginary sperm you must have there.

name: ryan
dialogue: You know what makes the itching even worse?

dialogue: That you don't stop talking about it.

name: ryan
dialogue: Fine.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Let's just play, ok. Good, ok. Here we go, double sixes, here we go... Here we go, come to mama, just getting ready to roll the dice...

dialogue: What're you doing? Are you scratching?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No. This is what I do for luck, ok.

name: ryan
dialogue: you are scratching. Give me the dice.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No.

name: ryan
dialogue: Give me the dice.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No. Here. There. Ooh, double sixes.

name: ryan
dialogue: We can't scratch. You know we can't, we'll scar.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uhh, I can't stop thinking about it. It's just so hard. I just want to grab all these houses and rub them all over my body.

name: ryan
dialogue: No.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Give it.

name: ryan
dialogue: No.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, come on. You know you want it, you know you want it too, come on. Let's just be bad, it'll feel so good.

name: ryan
dialogue: Oh God help me.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Now do me, do my back. Oh come on, harder.

name: joey
dialogue: You and Milton have to join us on the boat. Karen will pack a lunch, you'll bring the kids, we'll make a day of it.

dialogue: Oh, that sounds lovely. We're going to have to set that up. Oh, I better get back. Hope the baby feels better.

dialogue: Oh, thanks, thanks. Bye bye Jeannie.

dialogue: Bye bye Joey.

dialogue: What a phony.

dialogue: I have a family, I'm going to be here.

dialogue: It's about cutting my people a little slack, you know, for morale. Look, if you want to see some rough numbers, I can get them to you by Wednesday.

dialogue: Rough numbers?

dialogue: This company was not built on rough numbers. Am I right Mr. Douglas.

dialogue: Have the final numbers on my desk by Tuesday.

name: joey
dialogue: Joseph's good, isn't he?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I'm going to kill you.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, hey, I just figure Joseph's the kind of guy that likes to mix it up. you know, get in there, ruffle some feathers.

name: chandler
dialogue: Why?

name: joey
dialogue: Look, I'm sorry but that is what Joseph does, ok. If you try to pull something', he'll call you on it. 'What're you trying' to pull,' he'll say.

name: richard
dialogue: Ooh, duct tape. Was I supposed to bring something too?

name: monica
dialogue: This is for the scratchy twins out there. I taped oven mits to their hands.

name: richard
dialogue: you are strict.

name: monica
dialogue: It's for their own good.

name: richard
dialogue: You know, I like the way you have efficiently folded this tab under. See in a tape emergency you could shave valuable seconds off your time.

name: monica
dialogue: Exactly. Oh, I love that I can be totally neurotic around you now. Tell me the truth. Don't you like it better now that everything on your desk is perpendicular?

dialogue: If it's not a right angle, it is a wrong angle.

dialogue: Very good.

dialogue: You know what. Tomorrow I'm going to do your clocks.

dialogue: you are going to do what to my clocks.

dialogue: I'm going to set them to my time.

dialogue: Well, I'm confused. I thought we shared time.

dialogue: No no. See, in my bedroom I set my clock six minutes fast. You want to know why?

dialogue: Because it's in a slightly different time zone than the kitchen.

dialogue: No forget it, I'm not going to tell you now.

dialogue: No. See you don't understand.

name: richard
dialogue: Come on.

dialogue: No. You don't have any of these cute little obsessive things.

dialogue: No that is not true. That is not true.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh yeah.

dialogue: Yeah.

dialogue: Ok. Ahh. One of my things is, I always separate my sweat socks from my dress socks.

dialogue: What if they get mixed up?

name: richard
dialogue: Boy I would just uh, I would freak out.

dialogue: See, if anyone overheard that, I didn't come off well.

dialogue: What- wh- why, why, why does he suspect that?

name: chandler
dialogue: Alright, that is it. Look Joey, I'm sorry, I realize this is the role of a lifetime for you, and if I could just fire Joseph, I would, but unfortunately that is not possible so I'm going to have to let both of you go.

dialogue: I don't, I hate Joseph, ok. I think he's a brown-nosing suck up.

dialogue: Oh yeah. Well you can't fire Joseph. You know why, Because he's not in your department.

dialogue: Alright, ok, alright. So I can't fire Joseph but uh, I can sleep with his wife.

name: joey

dialogue: Oh well it's not me, it's my character, Chandy. Yeah the rogue processor who seduces his co-worker's wives for sport and then laughs about it the next day at the water cooler. In fact, I have her panties right there in my drawer.

dialogue: Really?

name: chandler
dialogue: No freakshow, she's fictional.

name: joey
dialogue: Take it easy. If it means that much to you, I'll uh, I'll go find something else.

dialogue: Thank you.

dialogue: Well that wasn't easy.

dialogue: Sorry. You look beautiful.

dialogue: Oh.

dialogue: You know what, that is it, that is it.

dialogue: I thought of a thing.

dialogue: Yeah?

dialogue: Yeah. I have to sleep, have to, on this side of the bed.

dialogue: Oh my God, you are a freak.

name: ryan

dialogue: Bye you.

dialogue: Oh I'm sorry, we're clo-... Hey sailor.

name: rachel
dialogue: I'll say.

dialogue: I'm shipping out tomorrow.

dialogue: Well then uh, we better make this night count. Oh wait, I forgot to turn off the cappuccino machine. Anchors away. Oh no no, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse. Oh, you know what. I forgot to turn off the bathroom light.

dialogue: Alright you know, why don't I just meet you upstairs.

dialogue: Hey Joey, how'd the audition go?

dialogue: Incredible! I met the director this time and you'll never believe who it was.

dialogue: Wow!

dialogue: Yeah, there's just one thing that might be kind of a problem. See, I, uh, had to kiss this guy.

dialogue: Because he was just so darn cute.

name: joey
dialogue: No, as part of the audition. See, I'm up for this part of this guy, who the main guy kisses.

dialogue: Well, hey. you are an actor, I say you just suck it up and do it. Or you just do it.

dialogue: I did do it, I'm a professional.

dialogue: Then what's the problem?

name: joey
dialogue: See after the scene, Mr. Beatty comes up to me and says 'good actor, bad kisser'. Can you believe that, me not a good kisser, that is like, like Mother Theresa, not a good mother.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, come on, who cares what that guy thinks. What does Warren Beatty know about kissing. Ooh.

dialogue: Hey, what did your agent say?

name: joey
dialogue: Yep, this kiss thing is defiantly a problem, Mr. Beatty wants to see it again on Monday. Man, I got to figure out what I'm doing wrong. Oh, okay, one of you girls come over here and kiss me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, right.

dialogue: Come on, I need your help here.

dialogue: All right. I'll do it, I kissed him before I can do it again.

name: joey
dialogue: You see this, this is a friend.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uh-huh, let's go. Oh, wait I have gum. Okay. Good, very good, firm but tender. I'd recommend you to a friend.

name: joey
dialogue: Then I don't know what it is. What's the problem?

dialogue: Joey, you know, maybe your just not used to kissing men, maybe you just tensed up a little, maybe that is what you need to work on.

dialogue: Yeah, that makes sense.

dialogue: Over my dead body!

dialogue: Oh my God, you look so good!

dialogue: I can not believe I have to walk down the aisle in front of 200 people looking like something you drink when your nauseous.

dialogue: So don't, I don't see why we have to go to this thing anyway, it's your ex-fiancee's wedding.

dialogue: Yeah, well you promised Barry, you'd marry him.

dialogue: I may have.

dialogue: Woo-hoo, stuud!

dialogue: Well, we haven't exactly met, we just stayed up all night talking on the internet.

name: monica
dialogue: Woo-hoo, geeek!

name: chandler
dialogue: I like this girl, okay, I seriously like this girl, you now how sometimes I tend get a little defended and quipy...

name: ross
dialogue: Get out!

name: rachel
dialogue: Nooo!

name: monica
dialogue: Please!

name: chandler
dialogue: Well she totally called me on it, okay. She said, 'cut it out, get real', and I did.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wow! What's that like?

name: chandler
dialogue: It's like this, me, no jokes.

dialogue: All right, stop it, you are freaking me out.

dialogue: Oh, yeah, I don't like you this way. All right, I'll see you guys later.

dialogue: Bye, Richard.

name: monica
dialogue: Bye sweetie, I love you.

dialogue: I love you, too.

dialogue: I think my boyfriend ever so dreamy, I wonder what our wedding's going to be like.

name: monica
dialogue: What are you talking about? What wedding?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Come on, like you never talk that.

name: monica
dialogue: Nooo! Never! I mean, we're living in the moment. God, it is so nice for once to not have to get all hung up on 'Where is this going?'

name: rachel
dialogue: Afraid to ask him?

name: monica
dialogue: Could not be more terrified.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I think you should seriously consider the marriage thing, give Rachel another chance to dress up like Princess Bubble Yum.

dialogue: Where's Benny? There he is! Where's Benny, there he is.

name: richard
dialogue: Awww! You know that is probably why babies learn to talk, so they can tell grown ups to cut it out.

dialogue: Hey, you know I got a question for you. Just a little thing, no pressure.

dialogue: Okay.

dialogue: Did you ever, uh, like, think about the future?

dialogue: Sure I do.

dialogue: Yeah, am I in it?

dialogue: Honey, you are in it.

dialogue: Oh God, you are about to get sooo lucky.

name: richard
dialogue: Oh, yeah!

name: monica
dialogue: Keep talking'.

dialogue: Well, uh, sometimes I think about selling my practice, we could move to France, make French toast.

dialogue: Okay, so, uh, we're in France, we're making the toast. Do you see a little bassinet in the corner?

dialogue: Like a hound?

dialogue: Not a basset, a bassinet.

dialogue: You really need the bassinet?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, I just think the baby would keep falling off the dog. Do you, uh, do you , do you not see kids in our future.

name: richard
dialogue: Oh, hey. I love children, I have children. I just don't want to be 70 when our kids go off to college, and our lives can finally start.

name: monica
dialogue: Uh-huh.

name: richard
dialogue: Look I want you, now.

name: monica
dialogue: that is Great. You know we don't need to talk about this now. Really, I mean this is, is so way, way, way, in the future, I'm talking' hovercrafts and apes taking over the planet.

dialogue: Come on, Chandler, I want this part soo much. Just one kiss, I won't tell anyone.

dialogue: Joey, no means no!

dialogue: Hey!

dialogue: I'm sorry we, we don't have your sheep.

dialogue: Aww, Rach, I think you look cute. And you, uh, you, you I could eat with a spoon.

dialogue: Get away from me I said no!

dialogue: Oh, Richard's here. I should run down say bye to him.

dialogue: Bye.

dialogue: Bye, good luck.

dialogue: So how's your date with your cyberchick going. Ooh, hey, what is all that

dialogue: Oh, it's a website, it's the, uh, the Guggenheim museum. See, she likes art, and I like funny words.

dialogue: What does she mean by HH?

dialogue: It means we're holding hands.

dialogue: Are you the cutest?

dialogue: I'm afraid I might just be.

dialogue: You know, what I think is so great that you are totally into this person and yet for all you know she could be like 90 years old, or have two heads, or. It could be a guy.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, it's not a guy, all right, I know her.

dialogue: It could be like a big giant guy.

dialogue: Man, I got this close to him and Monica kneed me in the back. What's going on?

dialogue: We were just wondering if Chandler's girlfriend is a girl.

dialogue: Oh, well. Just ask her how long she's going to live. Women live longer than men.

dialogue: How do you not fall down more?

dialogue: Okay, ask her 'What is her current method of birth control?'

dialogue: All right. "My husband is sleeping with his secretary." She's married!

dialogue: Well at least we know she's a woman.

dialogue: I can't believe she's married.

dialogue: So, I read this article in the paper the other day that says you are not supposed to throw rice at weddings, because when pigeons eat rice it kills them.

dialogue: Oh, that is why you never see pigeons at sushi bars. See, we're having fun.

dialogue: Oh, absolutely. Yeah, you know I'm not even thinking about that thing that we're not supposed to think about.

dialogue: Neither am I.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi.

dialogue: No, it's like all of the sudden, we were this couple. And this alarm started going off in my head

name: rachel
dialogue: Men are unbelievable.

dialogue: What is it with you people! I mean, the minute you start to feel something, you have to run away?

name: chandler
dialogue: I know, that,  that is why I don't want to go tonight, I'm afraid I'm going to say something stupid.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, you mean like that guy thing where you act mean and distant until you get us to break up with you.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, you know about that?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Look what do I do? I want to get past this, I don't want to be afraid of the commitment thing. I want to go through the tunnel, to the other side!

name: ross
dialogue: Where there is no fear of commitment.

name: chandler
dialogue: Do we have any... Do we have any thoughts here?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, I've never been through the tunnel myself, Because as I understand it, you are not allowed to go through with more than one girl in the car, right. But, it seems to me it's pretty much like anything else, you know, face your fear. It have a fear of heights, you go to the top of the building! If you are afraid of bugs.....get a bug. Right. In this case, you have a fear of commitment, so I say you go in there and be the most committed guy there ever was.

name: rachel
dialogue: Amazingly, that makes sense.

name: chandler
dialogue: You think?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, yeah. Go for it man, jump off the high dive, stare down the barrel of the gun, pee into the wind!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, Joe, I assure you if I'm staring down the barrel of a gun, I'm pretty much peeing every which way.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, it's your audition from this morning. Can I use the phone again?

name: rachel
dialogue: Sure Pheebs, you know, that is what it's there for, emergencies and pretend agents.

name: joey
dialogue: Come on baby, come on!

name: phoebe
dialogue: 'Hi, I have Phoebe Buffay returning a page. Okay, well, um, she's in her car I'll have to patch you through.'

name: rachel
dialogue: Very nice touch.

name: phoebe
dialogue: 'Okay, go ahead.'  Um, hi Annie.  Fantastic!  You got it.  Oh, okay, um, 'Will he work for scale?' you ask me. Well, I don't know about that,  except that I do and he will. Great, oh you are such a sweetheart. I would love to have lunch with you, how about we have lunch next.... Op, went through a tunnel.

name: rachel
dialogue: Unbelievable.

name: joey
dialogue: Thank you so much.

dialogue: It was really fun, I mean I've never talked on a car phone before.

dialogue: You were amazing, could you just do me this huge favour, you see there's this one other audition that I really, really want, and Estelle couldn't get me in.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, I don't know. I mean it was fun one time.

name: joey
dialogue: Come on, please, it'll be just this one more, well actually it's two.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Two?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! Well, well really it's three. Please. you are so good at it. I love you.

name: joey
dialogue: Nooo, four.

name: janice
dialogue: So, how come you wanted to eat in tonight?

name: chandler
dialogue: Because, I wanted to uh, give you this.

name: janice
dialogue: oh, are you a puppy!  Contact paper! I never really know what to say when someone you are sleeping with gives you contact paper.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, wait there's, there's more. See the contact paper is to go into your brand new drawer.  See, the drawer actually goes in my dresser.

name: janice
dialogue: Oh, you didn't have to do this.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, I did. Yes, I did. Because, you are my girlfriend, and that is what girlfriends should, should get.

name: janice
dialogue: Well, I got to buy a vowel. Because, oh my Gawd! Who, would've thought that someday, Chandler Bing would buy me a drawer.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, not me. But that is what's happened, and, ah, and, and there's more. We should take a trip.

name: janice
dialogue: We should?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yep, we're a couple and that is what couples do. And, I want to meet your parents. We should take a trip with your parents!

name: janice
dialogue: I don't think we need to, because you are tripping me out right now! Are you okay?

name: chandler
dialogue: I am, I actually am. I mean this is amazing. My entire life I have feared this place, and now that I'm here it's like what was the big deal. I could probably say 'Let's move in together.' and I'd be okay.

name: janice
dialogue: You probably want us to move in together?

name: chandler
dialogue: It doesn't scare me!

name: janice
dialogue: Yeah, well, it scares me! I mean I not even divorced yet, Chandler. You know, you just invited me over here for pasta, and all of the sudden you are talking about moving in together. And, and I wasn't even that hungry. You know what, it's getting a little late, and I-I should just, um...

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, no, no, no, don't go! I've scared you'! I've said too much! I'm hopeless, and awkward, and desperate for love!!  Hey, Janice! It's me. Um, yeah, I-I-I just want to apologize in advance for having chased you down the street.

dialogue: Honey, this will help.

name: chandler

name: rachel and monica
dialogue: Uff.

name: monica
dialogue: That is never good.

dialogue: Then I got all needy and clingy.

name: rachel

name: rachel and monica
dialogue: OH!

dialogue: Oh God.

dialogue: Yeah, well that is that lo-cal, non dairy, soy milk junk. We sort of, we save the real stuff for those really terminal cases.

name: monica
dialogue: You know, when you start get screwed over all the time, you got to switch to low-fat.

dialogue: Yeah, you do.

dialogue: So, you don't think I'm terminal?

dialogue: Well, no, not at all, you are not terminal, you just, you just need some damage control.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, okay. So, should I call her?

name: rachel and monica
dialogue: Nooo!

name: rachel

name: monica
dialogue: She has to know that your not ready.

name: rachel
dialogue: Right. So, what you have to do is, you have to accidentally run into her on purpose. And then act aloof.

name: chandler
dialogue: So I'm not, not going to lose her?

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, honey, you are not a total loser.

name: chandler
dialogue: I said, 'So I'm not going to lose her?'

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh.

dialogue: Go Joe!!!

dialogue: Hello! Oh!

name: joey
dialogue: Pheebs! There you are!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No it's not, sorry.

name: joey
dialogue: But Phoebe, wait! Wait! Phoebe. Phoebe!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, Joey! Oh, okay, see I didn't recognize you wearing, in those....pants.

name: joey
dialogue: Look listen, that TV movie I went in for? Did you hear anything? I think I got a shot at it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes! They called and you didn't get it! Okay, I mean you didn't get it, I'm sorry, I'm sorry.

name: joey
dialogue: It's okay, these things happen.

name: phoebe
dialogue: But they shouldn't happen, you know what, you are, you are in a terrible, terrible business. Oh God, I don't want to be the person who makes your face look like that.

name: joey
dialogue: I'm, I'm okay. See.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, now you are sad and creepy, oh. You know what, I, I'm sorry I quit, okay, I just quit.

name: joey
dialogue: No! No, no you can't quit! you are the best agent I ever had! Look Pheebs, rejection is part being an actor, you can't take it personally.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Not personal, really, well they said that they never met an Italian actor with a worse Italian accent.

name: joey
dialogue: They actually said that?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah. Ooh God, there's that face again! See I can't do this job! I...

name: joey
dialogue: No, no, no, see that is why you have to do this job, agents always lie. You know, Estelle just says stuff like 'They went another way', but this, I can use this.  I canna work on a new accent.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah okay, no if it helps you okay. Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: You'll never get me, Joe!!!

name: janice
dialogue: No, thank you.  Chandler!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hello, Janice.

name: janice
dialogue: What are you doing here?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, just a bit of shopping. How've you been?

name: janice
dialogue: Are you being British?!

dialogue: No. Not anymore.

dialogue: Why are you shopping here? You don't live in this neighbourhood. Were you here waiting for me?

dialogue: Well, I'm sorry if my friends aren't as sophisticated as yours.

dialogue: Here in Chelsea.

name: chandler
dialogue: A woman's

name: chandler
dialogue: Chelsea.

name: janice
dialogue: Okay, you know, one of two things is happening here. Either you are seeing somebody behind my back, which would make you the biggest jerk on the planet. Or, else you are pretending that you are seeing somebody, which just makes you so pathetic that I could start crying right here in the cereal aisle. So like which of these two guys do you want to be?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh.

dialogue: that is-ah what I suspected-ah.

dialogue: Hello!

dialogue: Hey!

dialogue: Yeah!

dialogue: Ah, Kim Basinger, Cindy Crawford, Halle Berry, Yasmine Bleeth, and ah, Jessica Rabbit.

dialogue: I know, I know, I just always wondered if I could get her eyes to pop out of her head.

dialogue: Peter Parker.

dialogue: Hey! Where ‘you heading’ in those pants? 1982?

dialogue: Yeah I know what I wanted to ask you. Um, can you roll your tongue? Because I can, and my Mom couldn’t, and I thought you know, I figured that was something I got from our Dad.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, yeah. You can do it to.

dialogue: Your not doing it.

dialogue: Oh right, yeah okay, my Mom could, and I can’t. We don’t have that....

name: phoebe
dialogue: February 16th.

dialogue: Melt stuff.

dialogue: Yeah.

dialogue: So is it like art?

dialogue: Good night.

dialogue: Oh, excellent.

dialogue: Oh honey, we’re close now but you-you wouldn’t believe the years of-of nugies, and wedgies, and flying wedgies, and atomic wedgies, and.... That’s where the waistband actually goes over your head.

dialogue: Ah!!

dialogue: Okay, I have a problem I have to go into work for a few hours, some kids messed up the Homo Sapien display.

name: janice
dialogue: Okay.

name: chandler
dialogue: I think you should go back with Gary. I don’t want to be the guy that breaks up a family, you know when my parents split up, it was because of that guy. Whenever I would see him I was always think you know ‘You’re the reason, you are the reason why their not together.’ and I hated that guy. And it didn’t matter how nice he was, or how happy he made my Dad.

name: janice
dialogue: Wow!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, well. It’s the right thing to do.

name: janice
dialogue: Oh! You’re right. Oh God. But, before I can say ‘good-bye’, there’s something I really need you to know, Chandler. The way I feel about you, it’s like, I finally understand what Lionel Richie’s been singing about. You know, I mean what we have, it’s like movie love, you’re my soulmate, and I can’t believe we’re not going to be spending the rest of our lives together.

dialogue: What?

dialogue: Forget what I said, I was babbling! Pick me!

name: chandler
dialogue: oh. Don’t go.

dialogue: Yes! You mean the world the world to me. Oh...

dialogue: I know.

dialogue: I know.

name: chandler
dialogue: I’ve found.

dialogue: I’ve found....

dialogue: ...in you, my endless  love.  My endless love.

dialogue: Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Aww!

dialogue: It was so not an accident. She saw I was about to tag her, so she threw her big fat grandma arm elbow right into my face. And just keep running.

dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa, ho, ho, ho, you did not win the game, the touchdown didn’t count, because of the spectacularly illegal, oh and by the way savage nose breaking.

dialogue: And was the curse lifted?

name: ross
dialogue: Anyway. That’s when our Mom said we were not to play football ever again.

name: monica
dialogue: Once!!

dialogue: All right, we’re going to play.

name: chandler
dialogue: And then Tineals.

dialogue: Okay, so how do we decide that?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, why don’t we just bunny up.

name: rachel, chandler, and joey
dialogue: What?

name: monica and ross
dialogue: Bunny!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, looks like Ross and I are captains. Okay, so um, I bunnied first so that means I get to pick first. Joey.

name: joey
dialogue: Thank you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica, I’m your best friend.

name: ross
dialogue: Sweetie, don’t worry you’ll get picked. Chandler.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross!

name: monica
dialogue: Phoebe.

name: ross
dialogue: Sweetie, now I pick you.

name: rachel
dialogue: You don’t pick me! You’re stuck with me!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay. All right. So let’s see, let’s play from the trash can, to the light post. Right. Two hand touch, we’ll kick off.

name: monica
dialogue: All right people listen, I’ve got exactly twenty-eight minutes before I have to baste again.

name: chandler
dialogue: Wow! Just like in the pros.

name: monica
dialogue: Huddle up.

name: joey
dialogue: All right, huddle up, right over here.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wait for me! Wait for me! Wait for me! Oh cool, this is my first huddle.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, so what do you guys really think of Chandler?

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, Phoebe you know what you’re doing right?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, Joey’s going to catch it, and you and I are going to block.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What’s block?

name: monica
dialogue: Phoebe, I thought you said you know what you’re doing?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I thought you meant in life.

name: monica
dialogue: Break.

name: chandler
dialogue: The ball is Janice. The ball is Janice.

name: ross
dialogue: Oww!! Son of a...!! Ow! Come on!

name: chandler
dialogue: Sorry. I’m sorry. You know what, we’re just going to throw it.

name: joey
dialogue: I got it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Go! Go! Go!

name: monica
dialogue: Score!! 7 to nothing!

name: rachel
dialogue: Are you okay?

name: ross
dialogue: Come on, let’s go!

name: monica
dialogue: Losers walk!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, losers talk!

name: chandler
dialogue: No, no, no, actually losers rhyme.

name: chandler
dialogue: Twenty-three!! Seventy-four!!  You want to go shotgun?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hike!

name: monica and joey
dialogue: One-Mississippi. Two-Mississippi. Three-Mississippi.

name: rachel
dialogue: Over here!

name: rachel
dialogue: I almost caught that one!

name: chandler
dialogue: Great! Now, the score is 7 to almost 7.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay,  this play, I want you to do a down and out to the right. Okay. Break!

name: rachel
dialogue: Wait, what am I going to do?

name: ross
dialogue: You, you go long.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wait, how long?

name: ross
dialogue: Until we start to look very small.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.

name: ross
dialogue: Break!!

name: joey
dialogue: Set....hike!

name: ross
dialogue: One-Mississippi, two-Mississippi, switch! Switch! Switch!!

name: chandler
dialogue: No, no, no, no, no!

name: joey
dialogue: Haaaaa! Hey-hey, thanks for stopping our ball.

name: woman
dialogue: You are playing American football?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! Wow, your like from a whole other country.

name: woman
dialogue: I’m Dutch.

name: joey
dialogue: Hi-hi, I’m Joey.

name: woman
dialogue: I’m Margha.

name: joey
dialogue: I’m sorry Dutch, I didn’t get that last little bit.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey Joey, do you want to play football or you want to..  Hi, I’m Chandler.

name: margha
dialogue: Hello, Chandler.

name: joey
dialogue: Her name is Dutch, and also Marklan.

name: margha
dialogue: Margha.

name: joey
dialogue: Mar-klan.

name: margha
dialogue: Mar-gha.

name: chandler
dialogue: Mar-haaaan.

name: monica
dialogue: Come on guys! Let’s go! Come on, it’s second down.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, hello, it’s third down.

name: monica
dialogue: No it’s not, it’s second.

name: ross
dialogue: Wow!

name: monica
dialogue: Wow, what?

name: ross
dialogue: It just amazes me that your still pulling stuff like this.

name: monica
dialogue: Pulling what? It’s second down.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, it’s second down.  Take all the second downs you need.

name: monica
dialogue: I heard that!

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I said it loud.

name: margha
dialogue: It is okay, if I stay and watch?

name: chandler and joey
dialogue: Yeah! Why don’t you stick around. You can sit right there.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, that went well.

name: joey
dialogue: I think so.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know, I was thinking about ah, asking her for her number.

name: joey
dialogue: Thanks man, but I think it makes a stronger statement if I ask for it myself, you know.

name: chandler
dialogue: Whoa-ho, whoa! No, I was thinking about you know for me, as a part of that whole getting over Janice thing you were talking about.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, yeah, that. All right, means that much to you, I’ll let you have her.

name: chandler
dialogue: Thanks. What, let me have her?! What do mean? Like if you didn’t I wouldn’t have a shot?

name: joey
dialogue: Well I don’t like to say it out loud, but, yeah! Don’t feel bad man, we all have our strengths. You’re better with numbers and stuff.

name: chandler
dialogue: Math!! You’re giving me math! All right, look you know what, forget about it, you go for the girl, we’ll see who gets her.

name: ross
dialogue: Chandler, I want you to run a post pattern to the left, okay. And sweetie..

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, I know, go long. you know, it’s like all I’m doing is running back and forth from the huddle.

name: ross
dialogue: Well ah, you want to just stay out there?

name: rachel
dialogue: Can I see that for second.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay. Hut! Hike!

name: joey
dialogue: Fumble!

name: joey
dialogue: What the hell’s the matter with you?! This is my favourite jersey.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well now you have two. Hey, I am good at math.

name: joey
dialogue: All right, that’s it. you know I was still going to let you have her. But now, forget about it. Prepare to feel very bad about yourself.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey! Well, I’ve been preparing for that my entire life! Or something about you that’s mean!

name: monica
dialogue: All right, come on guys, let’s go! Tie score, and we’re running’ out of time. Forty-two!! Thirty-eight!! Hike!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh I got it!!  Oh! Ew! Broken boob! Ow!

name: joey
dialogue: Pheebs, run!

name: monica
dialogue: Run, Phoebe, run!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Touchdown!! Touchdown!!

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, hello, the buzzer buzzed. It doesn’t count.

name: monica
dialogue: After the snap!

name: ross
dialogue: Before the snap!

name: joey
dialogue: After!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Before!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Now, does it really matter?

name: all
dialogue: Yes!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, okay, I made a touchdown. It was my first touchdown. So?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh Pheebs, that’s great. It doesn’t count.

name: monica
dialogue: Does so count!

name: ross
dialogue: Cheater, cheater, compulsive eater.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God!

name: monica
dialogue: You know what, that’s fine, maybe you haven’t grown up, but I have.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh-ho, okay.

name: monica
dialogue: Dead leg!!

name: ross
dialogue: Ow! Ow! Okay, okay, fine, fine! All right, you want to win by cheating, go ahead, all right. Phoebe the touchdown does count, you win.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Woo-yay!!

name: monica
dialogue: No! Listen, I’m not going to go through this with you again, okay. Just once I want to beat when you can’t blame it on the broken nose, the buzzer, or the fact that you thought you were getting mono. Let’s just call this, tie score and it’s halftime.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, first of all, I don’t play with cheaters, and second of all, you know I had swollen glands!!

name: monica
dialogue: You know what? I’ll think you’ll play.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh really! Why is that?

name: monica
dialogue: Because the winner gets this!

name: ross
dialogue: The Geller Cup.

name: chandler
dialogue: Is everybody else seeing a troll doll nailed to a two by four?

name: all
dialogue: Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, good.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, where in the hell did you get that?!

name: monica
dialogue: When Mom and Dad drove you to the hospital to get your nose fixed, I swam into the lake and fished it out.

name: ross
dialogue: That cup is mine!

name: monica
dialogue: No it’s not! You want it, you’re going to have to win it!

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, so are we not having dinner at all?

name: monica
dialogue: Come on Phoebe, let’s go! Come on, it’s time to get serious, huddle up. Joey, keep your head in the game.

name: joey
dialogue: It’s hard, you know, his huddle is closer to Dutch girl.

name: monica
dialogue: All right look, if I take Chandler out of the running will you be able to focus?

name: joey
dialogue: What are you going to do?

name: monica
dialogue: All right, you just make sure that Chandler catches the ball, I’ll take care of the rest.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.

name: monica
dialogue: Break!

name: joey
dialogue: Here you go!

name: ross
dialogue: Chandler! Chandler!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi.

name: monica
dialogue: Whoa! Whoa!! Tackled by a girl! Bet you don’t see that everyday, do you?

name: ross
dialogue: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What’s with the tackling?

name: monica
dialogue: What?! I just touched him and he went over.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, you want to play rough, we can play rough.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I love this game!!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, where’d you get that?

name: rachel
dialogue: I went really long.

name: monica
dialogue: Forty-two to twenty-one! Like the turkey, Ross is done!

name: ross
dialogue: It’s no surprise that your winning, because you got to pick first, so you got the better team.

name: monica
dialogue: You’re so pathetic! Why can’t you just accept it, we’re winning because I’m better than you.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, what a great argument, exhaling! All right, you know what, I’ll prove it to you, okay. I’ll trade you Joey for Rachel, and I’ll still win the game.

name: ross
dialogue: What?! The guys against the girls? See, that’s ridiculous Monica, because I’m only down by three touchdowns.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, then bring it on! Oh, unless of course your afraid you might lose to a bunch of girls.

name: ross
dialogue: Fine, fine, Rachel your with Monica, Joey you’re with me.

name: rachel
dialogue: I can not believe your trading me!!

name: monica
dialogue: Come on Rach, come on. Let’s see what’s it like to be on a winning team for a change.

name: rachel
dialogue: Are you going to let me play?

name: monica
dialogue: All right then.

name: margha
dialogue: The game is over, we eat now?

name: chandler
dialogue: No-no-no-no, the game’s not over, we’re just switching teams.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, Chandler finds me so intimidating that it’s better if we’re on the same team.

name: ross
dialogue: Right. Okay, let’s play. Let’s go.

name: chandler
dialogue: No ah, hold on a second Joe, where do Dutch people come from?

name: joey
dialogue: Ah well, the ah, Pennsylvania Dutch, come from Pennsylvania.

name: chandler
dialogue: And the other ah, Dutch people, they come on from somewhere near the Netherlands, right?

name: joey
dialogue: Nice try.  See the Netherlands is this make believe place where Peter Pan and Tinker Bell come from.

name: margha
dialogue: Oh, my.

name: ross
dialogue: Enough with geography for the insane, okay? Let’s play some ball, guys.

name: joey
dialogue: Whoa, whoa, no, no, I-I’m not playing with this guy, now.

name: chandler
dialogue: Fine with me.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, you know what, let’s just cut to the chase here. Okay? Heidi, which of my boys do you like?

name: chandler and joey
dialogue: What are you doing? What are you doing? What are you doing?

name: margha
dialogue: Which do I like?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, you know for dating, general merriment, taking back to your windmill...

name: margha
dialogue: Well, if I had to chose right now, which by the way I find really weird, I would have to say, Chandler.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes!!

name: joey
dialogue: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! She obviously didn’t understand the question.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, you don’t you have Captain Hook explain it to her.

name: margha
dialogue: I’m sorry, Joey, that is my chose.

name: chandler
dialogue: You hear that! That is her chose, mister I’ll let you have her! I win! You suck! I rule all! A mini-wave in celebration of me!!

name: margha
dialogue: I’m now thinking I would like to change my answer to, no one.

name: chandler
dialogue: Wh-what?

name: margha
dialogue: I now find you shallow and um, a dork. All right, bye.

name: joey
dialogue: Nice going. You just saved yourself a couple months of sex.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what, it doesn’t matter, because she picked me. Me! From now on I get the dates and you have to stay home on Saturday nights watching Ready, Set, Cook!

name: ross
dialogue: Save the breakthroughs for therapy, okay. The clock is ticking. We have no time, and we are losing, we are losing to girls.

name: chandler
dialogue: We’re not going to lose to girls.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey! It’s 42-21!

name: joey
dialogue: This sucks, I was just up by that much!

name: monica
dialogue: Are we playing football or what? Come on you hairy-backed Marries.

name: monica
dialogue: We have to do this. We are playing for women everywhere. Okay, just think about every lousy date that you ever had, okay, every guy who kept on the TV while you’re making out...

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God! You dated someone with a glass eye too?!

name: monica
dialogue: Come on, okay, come on this is for all womankind. Let’s kill ‘um!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah!!! Kill ‘um!!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: All right, no, well I want to kill them to, but their boys, you know how are we going to beat three boys?

name: monica
dialogue: All right, we still have a minute and a half to go, and we’re down by two points. Two points....  Phoebe you do a button-hook again. Rachel, you go long.

name: rachel
dialogue: No! Come on! Don’t make me go long. Use me. They never cover me.

name: monica
dialogue: Honey, there’s a reason.

name: rachel
dialogue: God, I’m not lame, okay. I can do something. I can throw, would you let me throw, come on this is my game too.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Come on Mon, let her throw the ball.

name: monica
dialogue: All right Rachel, you sweep behind, I’ll pitch it to you, you throw it down field to Phoebe. All right. Break.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you! Break!

name: monica
dialogue: Thirty-two! Seventy-one! Hike!

name: the guys
dialogue: One-Mississippi! Two-Mississippi! Three-Mississippi!

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m so sorry! Are you okay?

name: monica
dialogue: No! I’m not okay!

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m sorry, they were just all coming at me, and I didn’t know what to do.

name: joey
dialogue: Thirty seconds left on the timer!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, okay, so we get to take that stupid troll thing home!

name: monica
dialogue: Come on! Come on! Hurry! We’re running out of time! Huddle up!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay. Ooh! Oh, this is our last huddle, yeah.

name: monica
dialogue: All right, Phoebe get open. Rachel, go long.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.

name: monica
dialogue: Break!

name: rachel
dialogue: I got a touchdown! We did it!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey-hey-hey Rachel, funny thing. Actually, the ah, end zone starts at that pole, so you’re five feet short, so we win!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wait-wait-wait-wait! So, explain something to me though, if, if nobody tagged Rachel, then isn’t the play still going.

name: ross
dialogue: Let go! Let go!

name: monica
dialogue: Let go! I’m a tiny little woman!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Guys! Guys! Come on! It’s Thanksgiving, it’s not important who wins or loses. The important thing is,  the Dutch girl picked me! Me! Not you! Holland loves Chandler! Thank you, Amsterdam! Good night!!

name: monica
dialogue: Ow!!

name: rachel
dialogue: We should defiantly play football more often. Maybe there’s a like league we could join or something.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Isn’t there a national football league.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes. Yes, there is, they play on Sundays and Monday nights.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh shoot! I work Monday nights.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Umm, this stuffing is amazing. Do you think we should bring them some?

name: joey
dialogue: When they’re hungry enough, they’ll come in.

name: monica
dialogue: Let go!

name: ross
dialogue: No! You let go!

name: monica
dialogue: No!

name: ross
dialogue: How come it’s always us left in the field holding the ball?

name: monica
dialogue: I don’t know. I guess the other people just don’t care enough.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey! It’s starting to snow.

name: ross
dialogue: give me the this!

name: monica
dialogue: Let go!

name: chandler
dialogue: Eh..., I don’t, I don’t know.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, as old as he is in dog years, do you think Snoopy should still be allowed to fly this thing?

name: gunther
dialogue: Rachel?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: gunther
dialogue: Do you remember when you first came here, how you spent two weeks getting trained by another waitress?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, sure! Do you need me to train somebody new?

name: gunther
dialogue: Good one. Actually, ah, Terry wants you to take the training again, whenever.

name: rachel
dialogue: Eh, do you believe that?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah?

name: sarah
dialogue: So that’s two boxes of the Holiday Macaroons. On behalf of the Brown Birds of America, I salute you.

name: ross
dialogue: Just admit it Chandler, you have no backhand.

name: chandler
dialogue: Excuse me little one, I have a very solid backhand.

name: ross
dialogue: Shielding your face and shrieking like a girl... is not a backhand.

name: chandler
dialogue: I was shrieking... like a Marine.

name: ross
dialogue: All right here. Watch me execute the three ‘P’s of championship play. Power.  Precision.  and penache.

name: monica
dialogue: You broke a little girl’s leg?!!

name: ross
dialogue: I know. I feel horrible. Okay.

name: chandler
dialogue: Says here that a muppet got whacked on Sesame Street last night.  Where exactly were around ten-ish?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I’m going to go see her. I want to bring her something, what do you think she’ll like?

name: monica
dialogue: Maybe a Hello Kitty doll, the ability to walk...

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m going to get back to retraining.

name: ross
dialogue: All right, see you guys.

name: chandler
dialogue: Look out kids, he’s coming!

name: joey
dialogue: And I got to go sell some Christmas trees.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Have fun. Oh wait, no, don’t! I forgot I am totally against that now.

name: joey
dialogue: What? Me having a job?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, no, I am against innocent trees being cut down in their prime, and their, their corpses grotesquely dressed in like tinsel and twinkly lights.  Hey, how do you sleep at night?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, I’m pretty tired from lugging the trees around all day. Hey, Phoebe listen, you got this all wrong. Those trees were born to be Christmas trees, their fulfilling their life purpose, by, by making people happy.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Really?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes. Yes, and ah, ah, the trees are happy too, because for most of them, it’s the only chance to see New York.

name: gunther
dialogue: ...and after you’ve delivered the drinks, you take the empty tray....

name: rachel
dialogue: Gunther, Gunther, please, I’ve worked here for two and a half years, I know the empty trays go over there.

name: gunther
dialogue: What if you put them here.

name: rachel
dialogue: Huh. Well, you know that’s actually a really good idea, because that way they’ll be closer to the mugs. You know what, you should have the other waitresses do that too.

name: gunther
dialogue: They already do. That’s why they call it the 'tray spot.’

name: rachel
dialogue: Gee, I always heard them talk about that, I just always thought that it was a club they went to. Oh God, I’m, I’m sorry.

name: gunther
dialogue: It’s all right. Sweetheart.

name: ross
dialogue: So, this must be kind of neat for you, huh? I mean, your Dad tells me that you get a couple of days off school, and you, you ah, don’t have to sell those cookies anymore.

name: sarah
dialogue: Well, I kind of wanted to sell the cookies. The girl who sells the most wins a trip to Space camp, and gets to sit in a real space shuttle.

name: ross
dialogue: Wow, you ah, you really like all this space stuff, huh?

name: sarah
dialogue: Yeah. My Dad says if I spend as much time helping him clean apartments, as I do daydreaming about outer space, he’d be able to afford a trip to the Taj Mahal.

name: ross
dialogue: I think you would have to clean a whole lot of apartments to go all the way to India.

name: sarah
dialogue: No. The one in Atlantic City, Dad loves the slots. He says he’s going to double the college money my Grandma left me.

name: ross
dialogue: Huh. Well, good luck to Dad. Say, how many more boxes would you have to sell in order to win?

name: sarah
dialogue: The girl who won last year sold four hundred and seventy-five.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: sarah
dialogue: So far, I’ve sold seventy-five.

name: ross
dialogue: Four hundred, huh? Well, that sounds do-able.  How much are the boxes?

name: sarah
dialogue: Five dollars a box.

name: ross
dialogue: And what is second prize?

name: sarah
dialogue: A ten speed bike. But, I’d rather have something my Dad couldn’t sell.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, that makes sense.

name: sarah
dialogue: Could you do me one favour, if it’s not too much trouble?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, Sarah, anything.

name: sarah
dialogue: Could you pull open the curtains for me? The astronauts from the space shuttle are going to be on the news, and since we don’t have a TV, the lady across the alley said she’d push hers up to a window, so I could watch it.

name: woman
dialogue: Yes?

name: ross
dialogue: Hi, I’m selling Brown Bird cookies.

name: woman
dialogue: You’re no Brown Bird, I can see you through my peephole.

name: ross
dialogue: No, hi, I’m, I’m an honorary Brown Bird

name: woman
dialogue: What does that mean?

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, well, it means that I can sell cookies, but I’m not invited to sleep-overs.

name: woman
dialogue: I can dial 9-1-1 at the touch of a button, you know. Now, go away!

name: ross
dialogue: No, please, please, um, it’s for a poor little girl who wants to go to Space camp more than anything in the world.

name: woman
dialogue: I’m pressing, a policeman is on his way.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, okay! I’m going. I’m going.

name: woman
dialogue: I can still see you!

name: ross
dialogue: All right!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey. What, what are you doing here?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, I-I thought a lot about what you said, and um, I realized duh, all right maybe I was a little judgmental. Yeah,  oh, but oh...

name: joey
dialogue: Look now, Phoebe remember, hey, their just fulfilling their Christmas....

name: phoebe
dialogue: Destiny.

name: joey
dialogue: Sure.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes.

name: joey
dialogue: All right.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.  Yikes! That one doesn’t look very fulfilled.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, that’s, that’s ah, one of the old ones, he’s just taking it to the back.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You keep the old ones in the back, that is so ageist.

name: joey
dialogue: Well we have to make room for the fresh ones.

dialogue: So, what happens to the old guys?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, they go into the chipper.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Why, do I have a feeling that’s not as happy as it sounds?  No! No!!!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! Hey!!

dialogue: ...and these come in the shapes of your favourite Christmas characters, Santa, Rudolph, and Baby Jesus.
