dialogue: All right, I’ll take a box of the cream filled Jesus’s.

name: ross
dialogue: Wait a minute, one box! Come on, I’m trying to send a little girl to Space camp, I’m putting you down for five boxes. Chandler, what about you?

name: chandler
dialogue: Ahh, do you have any coconut flavoured deities?

name: ross
dialogue: No, but ah, there’s coconut in the Hanukkah Menoreoes. I tell you what, I’ll put you down for eight boxes, one for each night.

name: ross
dialogue: Mon?

name: monica
dialogue: All right, I’ll take one box of the mint treasures, just one, and that’s it. I-I started gaining weight after I joined the Brown Birds.  Remember, how Dad bought all my boxes and I ate them all?

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, no Mon, Dad had to buy everyone of your boxes because you ate them all. But ah, you know I’m sure that’s not going to happen this time, why don’t I put you down for three of the mint treasures and just a couple of the Rudolph’s.

name: monica
dialogue: No.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, come on, now you know you want ‘them.

name: monica
dialogue: Don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t do this.

name: ross
dialogue: I’ll tell you what Mon, I’ll give you the first box for free.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh God! I got to go!

name: ross
dialogue: Come on! All the cool kids are eating ‘them!

name: gunther
dialogue: And when you have a second later, I want to show you why we don’t just trap spiders under coffee mugs and leave them there.

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m training to be better at a job that I hate, my life officially sucks.

name: joey
dialogue: Look Rach, wasn’t this supposed to a temporary thing? I thought you wanted to do fashion stuff?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, yeah! I’m still pursuing that.

name: chandler
dialogue: How... exactly are you pursuing that? You know other than sending out resumes like what, two years ago?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I’m also sending out.... good thoughts.

name: joey
dialogue: If you ask me, as long as you got this job, you’ve got nothing pushing you to get another one. You need the fear.

name: rachel
dialogue: The fear?

name: chandler
dialogue: He’s right, if you quit this job, you then have motivation to go after a job you really want.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well then how come you’re still at a job that you hate, I mean why don’t you quit and get ‘the fear’?

name: chandler
dialogue: Because, I’m too afraid.

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t know, I mean I would give anything to work for a designer, you know, or a buyer.... Oh, I just don’t want to be 30 and still work here.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, that’d be much worse than being 28, and still working here.

name: gunther
dialogue: Rachel?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: gunther
dialogue: Remind me to review with you which pot is decaf and which is regular.

name: rachel
dialogue: Can’t I just look at the handles on them?

name: gunther
dialogue: You would think.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, fine. Gunther, you know what, I am a terrible waitress, do you know why I’m a terrible waitress? Because, I don’t care. I don’t care. I don’t care which pot is regular and which pot is decaf, I don’t care where the tray spot is, I just don’t care, this is not what I want to do. So I don’t think I should do it anymore. I’m going to give you my weeks notice.

name: gunther
dialogue: What?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Gunther, I quit.

name: chandler
dialogue: Does this mean we’re going to have to start paying for coffee?

name: chandler
dialogue: I spelled out boobies.

name: monica
dialogue: Ross, but me down for another box of the mint treasures, okay. Where, where are the mint treasures?

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, we’re out. I sold them all.

name: monica
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: Monica, I’m cutting you off.

name: monica
dialogue: No. No, just, just, just a couple more boxes. It-it-it’s no big deal, all right, I’m-I’m cool. You got to help me out with a couple more boxes!

name: ross
dialogue: Mon, look at yourself. You have cookie on your neck.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh God!

name: chandler
dialogue: So, how many have you sold so far?

name: ross
dialogue: Check this out. Five hundred and seventeen boxes!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh my God, how did you do that?

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, the other night I was leaving the museum just as ‘Laser Floyd’ was letting out of the planetarium, without even trying I sold 50 boxes! That’s when it occurred to me, the key to my success, ‘the munchies.’ So I ah, started hitting the NYU dorms around midnight. I am selling cookies by the case. They call me

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, stop what you’re doing, I need envelope stuffers, I need stamp lickers.....

name: ross
dialogue: Well hey, who did these resumes for you?

name: chandler
dialogue: Me! On my computer.

name: ross
dialogue: Well you sure used a large font.

name: chandler
dialogue: Eh, yeah, well ah, waitress at a coffee shop and cheer squad co-captain only took up so much room.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey-hey-hey that’s funny! Your funny Chandler! Your a funny guy! You want to know what else is really funny?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Something else I might have said?

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t know, I don’t know, weren’t you the guy that told me to quit my job when I had absolutely nothing else to do. Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha!!

name: ross
dialogue: Sweetie, calm down, it’s going to be okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: No, it’s not going to be okay Ross, tomorrow is my last day, and I don’t have a lead. Okay, you know what, I’m just going to, I’m just going to call Gunther and I’m going to tell him, I’m not quitting.

name: chandler
dialogue: You-you-you don’t want to give into the fear.

name: rachel
dialogue: You and your stupid fear. I hate your fear. I would like to take you and your fear....

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! I got great news!

name: chandler
dialogue: Run, Joey! Run for your life!

name: joey
dialogue: What? Rachel, listen, have you ever heard of Fortunata Fashions?

name: rachel
dialogue: No.

name: joey
dialogue: Well my old man is doing a plumbing job down there and he heard they have an opening. So, you want me to see if I can get you an interview?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God! Yes, I would love that, oh, that is so sweet, Joey.

name: joey
dialogue: Not a problem.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thanks.

name: joey
dialogue: And now for the great news.

name: ross
dialogue: What, that wasn’t the great news?

name: joey
dialogue: Only if you think it’s better than this...  snow-in-a-can!! I got it at work. Mon, you want me to decorate the window, give it a kind of Christmas lookie.

name: monica
dialogue: Christmas cookie?

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, and ah, this one here is a Douglas Fir, now it’s a little more money, but you get a nicer smell.

name: guy
dialogue: Looks good. I’ll take it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait! No, no, you don’t want that one. No, you can have this cool brown one.

name: guy
dialogue: It’s-it’s-it’s almost dead!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay but that’s why you have to buy it, so it can fulfil it’s Christmas destiny, otherwise there going to throw it into the chipper. Tell him, Joey

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, the ah, trees that don’t fulfil their Christmas destiny are thrown in the chipper.

name: guy
dialogue: I-I think I’m going to look around a little bit more.

name: joey
dialogue: Pheebs, you got to stop this, I working on commission here.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, guys. I’m here to pick out my Christmas tree.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well look no further,  this one’s yours! Ah.

name: monica
dialogue: Is this the one that I threw out last year?

name: phoebe
dialogue: All right you know what, never mind! Everyone wants to have a green one! I’m sorry, I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to get so emotional, I guess it’s just the holidays, it’s hard.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh honey, is that because your Mom died around Christmas?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, I wasn’t even thinking about that.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi there. How many, how many ah, did you sell?

name: girl
dialogue: I’m not going to tell you! You’re the bad man who broke Sarah’s leg.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey now! That was an accident, okay.

name: girl
dialogue: You’re a big scrud.

name: ross
dialogue: What’s a scrud?

name: girl
dialogue: Why don’t you look in the mirror, scrud.

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t have too. I can just look at you.

name: leader
dialogue: All right girls, and man. Let’s see your final tallies.  oh, Debbie,  321 boxes of cookies,  Very nice.

name: ross
dialogue: Not nice enough.

name: leader
dialogue: Charla, 278. Sorry, dear, but still good.

name: ross
dialogue: Good for a scrud.

name: leader
dialogue: Oh, yes Elizabeth. Ah, 871.

name: ross
dialogue: That’s crap!! Sister Brown Bird.  Good going.

name: leader
dialogue: Who’s next?

name: ross
dialogue: Hi there!

name: leader
dialogue: Hi. And batting for Sarah, Ross Geller, 872. Although, it looks like you bought an awful lot of cookies yourself.

name: ross
dialogue: Um, that is because my doctor says that I have a very serious.... nuget.... diffency.

name: chandler
dialogue: Tell us what happened, Brown Bird Ross.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I lost. Some little girl loaned her uniform to her nineteen year old sister, who went down to the U.S.S. Nimitz, and sold over 2,000 boxes.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey! How’d the interview go?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, I blew it. I wouldn’t of even hired me.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, come here sweetie, listen, you’re going to go on like a thousand interviews before you get a job.  That’s not how that was supposed to come out.

name: phoebe
dialogue: This is the worst Christmas ever.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what Rach, maybe you should just, you know stay here at the coffee house.

name: rachel
dialogue: I can’t! It’s too late! Terry already hired that girl over there.  Look at her, she’s even got waitress experience. Last night she was teaching everybody how to make napkin....  swans.

name: ross
dialogue: That word was swans.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well seeing that drunk Santa wet himself, really perked up my Christmas.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh! Oh my God!

name: joey and monica
dialogue: Merry Christmas!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: You saved them! You guys! Oh God, you’re the best!

name: chandler
dialogue: It’s like ‘Night of the Living Dead Christmas Trees.’

name: rachel
dialogue: Hello?  Yeah, this is she.  Oh! You’re kidding! You’re kidding!  Oh thank you! I love you!

name: chandler
dialogue: Sure, everybody loves a kidder.

name: rachel
dialogue: I got the job!

name: all
dialogue: That’s great! Hey! Excellent!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, God bless us, everyone.

name: rachel
dialogue: Here we go. I’m serving my last cup of coffee.  There you go.  Enjoy.

name: chandler
dialogue: Should I tell her I ordered tea?

name: ross

name: rachel
dialogue: Um, excuse me, everyone. Ah, this is my last night working here, and I ah, just wanted say that I made some really good friends working here, and ah, it’s just time to move on.  Ah, and no offence to everybody who ah, still works here, you have no idea how good it feels to say that as of this moment I will never have to make coffee again.

name: ra boss
dialogue: Now Mr. Kaplan Sr. likes his coffee strong, so your going to use two bags instead of one, see. Now pay attention, because this part’s tricky, see some people use filters just once.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m, I’m sorry you didn’t get to go to Space camp, and I’m hoping that maybe somehow, this may make up for it. Presenting Sarah Tuttle’s Private Very Special Space camp!!

dialogue: Really Mr. Geller, you don’t have to do this.

name: joey
dialogue: Ten, ten.., nine, nine, nine...., eight, eight, eight...  Okay, Blast off!

dialogue: I’m an alien. I’m an alien.

name: rachel

name: monica
dialogue: I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there to yell and then I end up apologizing to him.

name: phoebe

name: monica

name: rachel

dialogue: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right, you really want to know how I did it, I’ll show you. When you handed me back the card, what you didn’t see was, I looked at it so fast that it was invisible to the naked eye.  I just did it.  I just did it, again. Here, I’ll slow it down so that you guys can see it.

name: all
dialogue: Oh, I got it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, look I was with my friend downstairs and we hear everything up here that you do, and I am sick and tired... .

name: guy
dialogue: Whoa, you are very beautiful.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, thank you.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, anybody got a length of rope about six feet long with a little nouse at the end?

name: monica
dialogue: Honey, what’s the matter?

name: chandler
dialogue: I just saw Janice.

name: all
dialogue: Oh.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, she was at Rockefeller Centre skating with her husband, she looked so happy. I almost feel bad for whipping that kid’s pretzel at them.

name: joey
dialogue: Man, I remember the first time I saw that girl Katherine, after we broke up. She was just walking with her friend Donna, just laughing and talking. God, it killed me.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, but you ended up having sex with both of them that afternoon.

name: joey
dialogue: Sorry, I just, any excuse to tell that story you know....

name: chandler
dialogue: OH, you know what, I’m going to be okay, you don’t have to throw a party for me.

name: monica
dialogue: It’s Joey’s birthday.

dialogue: Oh, well then, if anybody should have a party it should be him.

name: monica
dialogue: Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, well he totally screwed up the punch line. You know, it’s supposed to be arrghh-eh og-errigh.

dialogue: How’s that coffee coming,’ dear?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, right away Mr. Kaplan.

dialogue: I’m not supposed to drink coffee, it makes me gassy.

name: rachel
dialogue: I know!

name: mr. kaplan
dialogue: I’ll bet your thinking, 'What's an intelligent girl who wants to be in fashion, doing making coffee?’ Eh?

name: rachel
dialogue: Op.

name: mr. kaplan
dialogue: Eh.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, you got me.

dialogue: Well, don’t think I haven’t noticed your potential. Well, I’ve got a project for you that’s a lot more related to fashion. How does that sound?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, that sounds great.

name: mr. kaplan
dialogue: Come on over here, sweetheart.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh thank you so much Mr. Kaplan, thank you so much.

name: mr. kaplan
dialogue: I need these hangers separated ASAP.  You’re welcome.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh God, I hate my job, I hate it, I hate my job, I hate it.

name: monica
dialogue: I know honey, I’m sorry.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, I want to quit, but then I think I should stick it out, then I think why would such a person stay in such a demeaning job, just because it’s remotely related to the field they’re interested in.

name: monica
dialogue: Gee, I don’t know Rach. Order up!! I got a Yentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh honey, come on, I’m sorry, I didn’t.... I don’t mind paying my dues, you know, its just how much am I going to learn about fashion by walking Mira, the arthritic seamstress, to the bathroom.

dialogue: Hi! Is my misery amusing to you?

name: guy
dialogue: I’m sorry, I wa, I wa, I was just ah....

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh well then, so I’m just going to go back to talking to my friend here. And you can go back to enjoying your little hamburger.

dialogue: Yes?!

dialogue: Do you want my pickle?

dialogue: Hey guys.

dialogue: Hey Gunther. Hi.  I mean you’re going out on a date with the noisy guy upstairs?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, he’s very charming.

name: monica
dialogue: I know, he’s too charming, but if you two start going out, then it’s just going to make it so much harder for me to hate him.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, you’re just going to have to try.

dialogue: Joey, where are the Jell-o shots?

name: joey
dialogue: I don’t know, Chandler is supposed to be passing’ ‘them around...

name: chandler
dialogue: Hello-dillillio!!

dialogue: Oh, somebody’s feeling better.

name: monica
dialogue: Stick out your tongue.

name: chandler
dialogue: Take off your shirt!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my!!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh my God! How many of these things did you have? These are pure vodka.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, Jell-o just like Mom used to make.

name: rachel
dialogue: The most unbelievable thing happened to me today.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi! So I’m out having lunch at Monica’s and this guy starts talking to me, and it turns out he works for a buyer at Bloomingdale’s and there happens to be an opening in his department. So I gave him my phone number and he’s going to call me this weekend to see if he can get me an interview!

name: ross
dialogue: Wow!

name: rachel
dialogue: I know!

name: ross
dialogue: What, so this guy is helping you for no apparent reason?

name: rachel
dialogue: Uh-huh!

name: ross
dialogue: And he’s, he’s a total stranger?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah! His name is um, Mark something.

name: ross
dialogue: Huh. Sounds like Mark Something wants to have some sex.

name: rachel
dialogue: What!?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I’m just saying, I mean why else would he just, you know, swoop in out of nowhere for no reason.

name: rachel
dialogue: To be nice.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, Joey. Are men ever nice to strange women for no reason?

name: joey
dialogue: No, only for sex.

name: ross
dialogue: Thank you.  So did you ah, did you tell Mark Something about me?

name: rachel
dialogue: I didn’t have to, because I was wearing my ‘I heart Ross’ sandwich board and ringing my bell.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh-huh.

name: j sisters
dialogue: Joey!!! Happy Birthday!!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!! Hey-hey-hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, how many of that girl are you seeing?

name: monica
dialogue: How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joey’s sisters.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi Joey’s sisters!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: cookie
dialogue: Hey. What are we drinking’ over here.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, I have ah, vodka and cranberry juice.

name: cookie
dialogue: No kidding,’ that’s the exact same drink I made myself right after I shot my husband.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow. Okay, I don’t know how to talk to you.

name: sister 1
dialogue: What are you doing?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, I’m taking my ex-girlfriend of my speed dialler.

name: j sisters
dialogue: Oh!!

name: chandler
dialogue: No-no-no-no, no, it’s a good thing. Why must we dial so speedily anyway? Why must we rush through life? Why can’t we savour the precious moments?  Those are some huge breasts you have.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi.

name: monica
dialogue: Hi.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah. So um, I-I heard about this ah, Mark guy that ah, Rachel met today.

name: monica
dialogue: Isn’t that great?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh yeah! So ah, kind of pretty, pretty good. He sounds like a nice, good guy.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, you know what, when he left I actually used the phrase, ‘Hummina-hummina-hummina.’

name: ross
dialogue: That’s excellent.

name: ross
dialogue: So, he’s just a nice guy. You really think this Mark doesn’t want anything in exchange for helping him?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I assume I’ll have to take showers with him, but you know, that’s true of any job.

name: monica
dialogue: How you feeling’?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, my apartment isn’t there anymore, because I drank it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Where’d you get too? We lost you after you opened up all the presents.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, I ended up in the storage room, and not alone.

name: all
dialogue: Woooo hoooo!!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Ow, no ‘woo-hooing,’ no ‘woo-hooing.’

name: phoebe
dialogue: Why, what happened?

name: chandler
dialogue: Ah, I fooled around with Joey’s sister.  Well, that’s not the worst part.

dialogue: What is the worse part?

name: chandler
dialogue: I can’t remember which sister.

name: ross
dialogue: You see what men do! Don’t tell me men are not nice!  This is men!!

name: monica
dialogue: Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, he’s actually going to kill you dead.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay! You don’t think I thought of that?

name: phoebe
dialogue: How can you not know which one?

name: rachel
dialogue: I mean that’s unbelievable.

name: monica
dialogue: I mean, was it Gina?

name: ross
dialogue: Which one is Gina?

name: rachel
dialogue: Dark, big hair, with the airplane earrings.

name: monica
dialogue: No, no, no, that’s Dina.

name: chandler
dialogue: You see you can’t tell which one is which either, dwha!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: We didn’t fool around with any of them. Dwha! Dwha!

name: chandler
dialogue: Veronica. Look, it’s got to be Veronica, the girl in the red skirt. I definitely stuck my tongue down her throat.

name: monica
dialogue: That was me.

name: chandler
dialogue: Look, when I’ve been drinking, sometimes I tend to get overly friendly, and I’m sorry.

name: monica
dialogue: That’s okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: That’s all right.

name: ross
dialogue: That’s okay.

name: joey
dialogue: Can I talk to you for a second?!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, Joey.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey.

name: joey
dialogue: Come on!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Why can’t we talk in here? With, with, witnesses.

dialogue: I just got off the phone with my sister.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, which, which one?

name: joey
dialogue: Mary-Angela.

name: ross
dialogue: Mary-Angela.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah.

name: monica
dialogue: You know which one was she again?

name: joey
dialogue: Why don’t you ask Chandler, because he’s the one that fooled around with her. She told me you said you could really fall for her. Now is that true? Or are you just getting’ over Janice by groping my sister.

name: chandler
dialogue: It’s got to be the first one.

name: joey
dialogue: Really? That’s great! You and my sister, sitting’ in a tree.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yep, I’m in a tree.

name: rachel
dialogue: Did he call? Did Mark call?

name: monica
dialogue: No honey, I’m sorry, but the weekend’s not over yet.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh.  Oh my God, is that Phoebe?

name: monica
dialogue: I guess they’re back from their date.

name: rachel
dialogue: Music. Very nice.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God!

name: rachel
dialogue: So, how are you?

name: monica
dialogue: I am good. I finished my book.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah, what’s it about?

name: monica
dialogue: I don’t remember. Do you want to take a walk?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, I do.

name: ross
dialogue: Dear Mary-Angela. Hi. How’s it going. This is the hardest letter I’ve ever had to write.  What the hell’s a matter with you? How do you think Joey’s going to react when he finds out that you blew off his sister with a letter?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, that’s the part where you tell him that I moved to France. When actually I’ll be in Cuba.

name: ross
dialogue: All right, look, look, you’ve got to do this yourself, okay in person. At least you know her name. You just go to the house and you ask for Mary-Angela, okay, when which ever one she is comes to the door, you take her for a walk, you let her down easy.

name: chandler
dialogue: What if Mary-Angela comes to the door and I ask for Mary-Angela?

name: ross
dialogue: Where in Cuba?

name: chandler
dialogue: Joey, what-wh-wh-what-wh-what-wh-what-wh-what-what are you doing here?

name: joey
dialogue: Waiting for my Grandma to finish my laundry. What about you?

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m here to see Mary-Angela.

name: joey
dialogue: You are so the man!  Now look, listen, listen, you got to be cool, because my Grandma doesn’t know about you two yet, and you do not want to tick her off. She was like the sixth person to spit on Mussolini's hanging body. Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: Where’s Mary-Angela?

name: joey
dialogue: She’s right in there.

name: j sisters
dialogue: Hey, Chandler!

name: rachel
dialogue: I can’t believe Mark didn’t call. It’s Sunday night, and he didn’t call.

name: ross
dialogue: Bummer.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, right. Look at you, you’re practically giddy.

name: ross
dialogue: No, I’m genuinely sorry the Mark thing didn’t work out. Look, Rach, I want only good things for you.

name: monica
dialogue: Wait a minute, why don’t you just call Mark.  I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, you’ve got to make stuff happen.

name: ross
dialogue: But, you, you don’t want to seem too pushy.

name: monica
dialogue: Honey, it’s not pushy, he gave her his home number.

name: ross
dialogue: What, he gave you his home number? As in like, to, to his home?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, and you don’t mind if I call, because you only want good things for me.

name: ross
dialogue: That’s right good things, that-that is what I said.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hello, Mark? Hi, it’s Rachel Green.  Oh no, don’t you apologize.  Yeah, I’ll hold.  He left my number at work, but he was helping his niece with her report on the pioneers.

name: ross
dialogue: That is so made up!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, oh my God, tomorrow! That, no, it’s perfect. Oh God, thank you so much. Great! Bye!  I got the interview!

name: monica
dialogue: Yay!

name: ross
dialogue: There you go.

name: rachel
dialogue: He even offered to meet me for lunch tomorrow to prep me for it.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, that is amazing!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah well, if I know Mark, and I think I do, I’d expect nothing less.

name: rachel
dialogue: I got to figure out what I’m going to wear.

name: ross
dialogue: High collar and baggy pants say I’m a pro.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah! Right! Okay, I’ll see you guys later.  Woo hoo!

name: ross
dialogue: You go get ‘them.  What did I do to you? Did I hurt you in some way?

name: monica
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: ‘Why don’t you call him?!’ Well, thank you very much! You know now he is going to prep her, you know prep her, as in what you do when you surgically remove the boyfriend!

name: monica
dialogue: Are you crazy?!

name: ross
dialogue: Am I! Am I! Am I out of my mind! Am I losing my senses!! This dreamy guy is taking my girlfriend out for a meal.

name: monica
dialogue: What?! Ross you know this isn’t even about you! I mean this is about Rachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if you’re right, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?

name: ross
dialogue: No.

name: monica
dialogue: I mean don’t you trust her?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, yeah!

name: monica
dialogue: Then get over yourself! Grow up!

name: ross
dialogue: You grow up.

name: chandler
dialogue: This tiramisu is, is excellent. Did you make it Mary-Angela?

name: j grandma
dialogue: No! I did!

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, it’s, it’s yummy. So Mary-Angela do you like it?

name: j grandma
dialogue: Of course! It’s her favourite.

name: chandler
dialogue: So um, Mary-Angela, what’s your second favourite?

name: j grandma
dialogue: More of Grandma’s tiramisu.

name: chandler
dialogue: Would you just please....give me the receipt because this is great. It’s top notch.

name: j grandma
dialogue: That dies with me.

name: chandler
dialogue: So will I.

name: j sisters
dialogue: Excuse yourself, and go to the bathroom.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh no-no-no I was just squinting. That doesn’t mean anything.

name: j sisters
dialogue: Just do it.

name: chandler
dialogue: Will you excuse me I have to um.....

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey!

name: j sisters
dialogue: Finally, I thought we’d never be alone. Can I just tell you something, I have not stopped thinking about you since the party.

name: chandler
dialogue: Look, I may have jumped the gun here.  Um, I just got out of a relationship and I’m not really in a, in a commitment kind of place.

name: j sisters
dialogue: So! Me neither! God, Mary-Angela was right you do have the softest lips.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ah, you’re not Mary-Angela.

name: j sisters
dialogue: No, I’m Mary-Theresa.

name: chandler
dialogue: This is so bad. If-if you’re not Mary-Angela, then-then who is?

name: mary-angela
dialogue: I am!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, this is so bad.

name: mary-angela
dialogue: Joey!!!

name: chandler
dialogue: No Joey! No Joey! Don’t Joey! Joey!

name: joey
dialogue: What’s going’ on?

name: chandler
dialogue: You’re it! Now run and hide!

name: mary-theresa
dialogue: It’s no big deal. Chandler was just kissing’ me because he thought I was Mary-Angela.

name: joey
dialogue: What?! How could you do that, how could you think she was Mary-Angela?

name: chandler
dialogue: I wasn’t sure which one Mary-Angela was.  Look, I’m sorry okay, I was really drunk, and you all look really similar.

name: j sisters
dialogue: I say, punch him Joey.

name: all
dialogue: Yeah! Punch him!!

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what, we should all calm down because your brother’s not going to punch me.  Are you?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, that is usually what I would do. But I just never thought you’d be on the receiving end of it. How could you do this?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Joey if you want to punch me, go ahead, I deserve it. But I just want you to know that I would never soberly hurt you or your family, you’re my best friend. I would never do anything like this ever again.

name: cookie
dialogue: So what. I say, punch him.

name: all
dialogue: Yeah! Punch him! Punch him!

name: joey
dialogue: No! No! No! No, I’m not going to punch Chandler.

name: cookie
dialogue: I’ll do it.

name: joey
dialogue: No you won’t. Look he knows he did a terrible thing and I believe him, he’s sorry. But,  you’ve got one more apology to make, all right, you’ve got to apologize to Mary-Angela.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, absolutely!

name: joey
dialogue: All right.

name: chandler
dialogue: You’ve got it.

name: joey
dialogue: Cookie, now you can punch him!

name: chandler
dialogue: What?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hi!

name: rachel
dialogue: What are you doing here?

name: ross
dialogue: Ah you know, this building is on my paper route so I...

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi.

name: ross
dialogue: How’d did it go?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh well, the woman I interviewed with was pretty tough, but you know thank God Mark coached me, because once I started talking about the fall line, she got all happy and wouldn’t shut up.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m so proud of you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Me too!

name: ross
dialogue: Listen, I’m ah, I’m sorry I’ve been so crazy and jealous and, it’s just that I like you a lot, so...

name: rachel
dialogue: I know.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: mark
dialogue: Rachel?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.  Hi Mark!

name: mark
dialogue: Hi. I just talked to Joanna, and she loves you. You got it, you got the job.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, I did!

name: mark
dialogue: Yes.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God!!

name: ross
dialogue: Congratu!!  -lations-lations.

name: monica
dialogue: So ah, Phoebe, how was your date?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh well you know.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, I do know.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ick, you were eavesdropping.

name: rachel
dialogue: Eavesdropping. Pheebs, the ceiling tiles were falling down.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, I’m sorry. But I really like this guy. And I think he really happens to like me.

name: ross
dialogue: Maybe he’s just jumping on a pogo-stick and really likes it?

name: ross
dialogue: Maybe the pogo-stick likes it too?

name: joey
dialogue: All right, that’s it! He cannot do this to Phoebe.  This guy is going to get the butt kicking of a lifetime!  But, is he a big guy?

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, we’ll all go.  Come on.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Thanks you guys! Thank you.

name: chandler
dialogue: Don’t worry.

name: phoebe
dialogue: God, I hope they kick his ass!

name: rachel
dialogue: Honey, I’m sorry.

name: monica
dialogue: You know if it’s any consolation, he really did sound like he was having more fun with you.

name: guy
dialogue: May I help you?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's going to focus on that as long as your wearing that towel dress.

name: rachel
dialogue: Tell him.

name: ross
dialogue: It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?

name: ross
dialogue: Why?

name: chandler
dialogue: I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert, you know he's the botanist.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh God. You know, botanists are such geeks.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?

name: ross
dialogue: Hmm? Oh, yeah.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Morning. Rach, I'm here with the purses!

name: chandler
dialogue: It must take you forever to find your keys.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.

name: rachel
dialogue: No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.

name: ross
dialogue: Honey, just relax, it's going to be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down there and I'll take you out to lunch?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out.

name: ross
dialogue: Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, it's kind of like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing.  Is this actually a lunchbox?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, so can you make it on Friday?

name: ross
dialogue: What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can see a stripper.

name: phoebe
dialogue: A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so cliche. Why don't you get a magician?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all right.

name: ross
dialogue: She's having lunch with him. She's having lunch with him. And you should of seen the hug she gave him when she got the job. And, and, and,  he's really good looking.  What am I going to do?

name: chandler
dialogue: Don't do anything. Keep it inside. Learn how to hide your feelings!  Don't cry out loud.

name: joey
dialogue: Yes! Guess who's in an audition for a Broadway musical?

name: chandler
dialogue: I want to say you but, that seems like such an easy answer.

name: joey
dialogue: It is me! It's a musical version of Tale of Two Cities. So I think I'm going to sing New York, New York, and ah, oh I left My Heart in San Francisco.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah Joey, I don't think you get to pick the cities.

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: Mr. Dickens gets to pick them.

name: joey
dialogue: Who?

name: chandler
dialogue: I'll get you the Cliff Notes.

name: joey
dialogue: The what?

name: chandler
dialogue: The abridgment.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, okay.  The what?

name: mark
dialogue: ...and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date. Good. Any questions so far?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah. What kind of discount do we get?

name: mark
dialogue: Twenty percent.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh!! I love this job!  Wow! My first call.

name: mark
dialogue: Here, let me.  Rachel Green's line, how may I help you?

name: ross
dialogue: Hi, is Rachel there?

name: mark
dialogue: And who may I say is calling?

name: ross
dialogue: This is Ross?

name: mark
dialogue: Ross of.....

name: ross
dialogue: Of Ross and Rachel.

name: mark
dialogue: Oh hi. It's, it's Mark.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh hey, hey Mark.

name: mark
dialogue: Hey, hold on a second.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi honey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hi! What's ah, what's Mark doing answering your phone?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, he's just goofing around.

name: ross
dialogue: oh yeah, that is, that is funny. Why ah, why isn't he goofing around in his own office?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we're Joanna's two assistants.

name: ross
dialogue: Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do?

name: ross
dialogue: What?

name: rachel
dialogue: I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I got to go.  Mark, I need you!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, bye-bye.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ow! Ross!!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, oh, I'm, I'm, I'm sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I'm dialling another number.

name: jeannine
dialogue: All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can be alone with him. You'd better go for it.

name: monica
dialogue: Please, I'm not going for anything.

name: jeannine
dialogue: Well, if you don't, I will.

name: monica
dialogue: Would you please go?

name: jeannine
dialogue: Night Mon. Night Julio.

name: julio
dialogue: Adios.

name: monica
dialogue: Look Julio, someone left their book here.

name: julio
dialogue: Ah actually, that is mine.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh yeah, what are you reading?

name: julio
dialogue: Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it?

name: monica
dialogue: Have I read it?  No, are you enjoying it?

name: julio
dialogue: I thought I would, but the translation's no good.

name: monica
dialogue: Your a poet and don't know it.

name: julio
dialogue: Actually I ah, I am a poet.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, then you do know it.  So um what kind of things do you write about?

name: julio
dialogue: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip.

name: monica
dialogue: Mine?  Right here?

name: julio
dialogue: I can write an epic poem about this lip.

name: monica
dialogue: How would that go?  Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.

name: joey
dialogue: You've got to pick a pocket or two. Boys,  you've got to pick a pocket or two..........

name: director
dialogue: Lovely, just lovely.

name: joey
dialogue: Really? Thanks.

name: director
dialogue: Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the call back on Saturday.

name: joey
dialogue: Excellent, I'll be there.

name: director
dialogue: Okay, and listen don't forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance audition.

name: joey
dialogue: Ah! My ah, my agent said it wasn't a dancing part.

name: director
dialogue: Joey, all the roles got to dance a little. But believe me with your dance background it'll be a piece of cake.

name: chandler
dialogue: ....three years of modern dance with Twila Tharp! Five years with the American Ballet Theatre?!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, everybody lies on their resume, okay. I wasn't one of the Zoom Kids either.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, can you dance at all?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, I can dance, you know.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh no, no, no, no.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What, what is that?

name: joey
dialogue: Sure, it looks stupid now, there's no music playing.

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, I have to get that, but no-no.  Hello?   Hi! Yeah listen, I'm, I'm in need of a stripper and I was told that you do that.  Let me ask you this, what, what do you do for the extra hundred?  So would I, would I have to provide the grapes?

name: monica
dialogue: Hi!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, how was last night with Julio, senorita?

name: monica
dialogue: It was so amazing, he is so sexy, and smart, which makes him even sexier. Oh gosh, I got to so you this. Last night, we were fooling around and he stops to write a poem.

name: joey
dialogue: Get out! I couldn't stop if a meteor hit me.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, we have our stripper. A miss Crystal Chandelier.

name: joey
dialogue: Well sure, you name a kid that, what do you expect them to grow up to be?

name: monica
dialogue: Anyway um, when he left he forgot to take the poem with him. Now, I am like totally dense about poetry, but I think it's pretty good all right. Check it out.

name: joey
dialogue: The Empty Vase. Translucent beauty...

name: chandler
dialogue: To yourself.  Hey-hey-hey, you know what that is pretty good.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh good, I think so too. Pheebs?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh yeah.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, I'm so glad you guys like it. Yay! All right I got to go to work.

name: joey
dialogue: Whoa, I'm not done.

name: monica
dialogue: All right, just give it back to me when your done. See you guys.

name: chandler
dialogue: Bye-bye.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God, oh my God! Poor Monica!

name: chandler
dialogue: What, what, what?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?! He was with her when he wrote this poem. Look,  'My vessel so empty with nothing inside. Now that I've touched you, you seem emptier still.' He thinks Monica is empty, she is the empty vase!

name: chandler
dialogue: You really think that is what he meant?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, totally. Oh, God, oh, she seemed so happy too.

name: joey
dialogue: Done.

name: mark
dialogue: Do you have the, the Ralph Lauren file?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, yeah, sure, it's umm...

name: mark
dialogue: Wh-what's that?

name: ross
dialogue: It's from Ross, it's a love bug.

name: mark
dialogue: Wow! Somebody wants people to know you have a boyfriend.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh no, no-no-no, that is not, not, not, what he is doing. He's just, he's just really romantic.

name: man
dialogue: Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes.

name: man
dialogue: One, two, three...

name: quartet
dialogue: Congratulations on your first week at your brand new job! It won't be long before your the boss.

name: the bass barber
dialogue: Omm-pah, omm-pah, omm-pah.

name: quartet
dialogue: And you know who will be there to support... you?! Your one and only boyfriend...

name: the bass barber
dialogue: It's nice to have a boyfriend.

name: quartet
dialogue: Your loyal loving boyfriend Ross..... Ross!

name: ross
dialogue: I'm hurt! I'm actually hurt, that you would think that I would send you any of those things out of any thing other than love. Hurt! Hurt!

name: rachel
dialogue: All right Ross!! I get it!!

name: ross
dialogue: I mean my God...

name: rachel
dialogue: you are hurt!

name: ross
dialogue: ...can't, can't a guy send a barbershop quartet to his girlfriend's office anymore!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, please, Ross it was so obvious! It was like you were marking your territory. I mean you might have well have just come in and peed all around my desk!

name: ross
dialogue: I would never do that!

name: rachel
dialogue: Look, I know what's going on here, okay, Mark explained it all to me. He said this is what you guys do.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah well if, if, if Mark said that, than Mark's an idiot.

name: joey
dialogue: Mark's a genius!

name: ross
dialogue: Why?! How?! How is he a genius?

name: chandler
dialogue: Look, don't you see what's happening here. Instead of hitting on her right away, he's becoming her confidant. Now he's going to be the guy she goes too to complain about you.

name: ross
dialogue: What am I going to do?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, why don't you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did that. All right look, you are going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few surprise visits.

name: ross
dialogue: I don't know you guys.

name: chandler
dialogue: All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us, meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she starts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.'

name: joey
dialogue: And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'OH, man!' And he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be like,  'Hi,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!'

name: chandler
dialogue: He paints quite a picture doesn't he?

name: woman
dialogue: Here's the Shelly Siegal stuff from December.

name: mark
dialogue: And wait, I've got something for you.

name: woman
dialogue: Mark!!

name: mark
dialogue: It's okay, Rachel knows.

name: woman
dialogue: Yeah, but even so.

name: mark
dialogue: I can't help it, I'm just, I'm just crazy about you.

name: rachel
dialogue: oh! That is so sweet!

name: mark
dialogue: Okay, okay look, I know I'm being Mr. Inappropriate today, but it's just so tough, I mean see you walking around and I just want to touch you and hold you, come on no one's around, just, just kiss me.

name: ross
dialogue: All right that is, that is it!! Get off her!

name: mark
dialogue: What is going on?

name: ross
dialogue: What's going on?!  that is what's going on!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross!

name: ross
dialogue: I have been down in your store for twenty minutes trying to get a tie! What do I have to do to get some service?!  Hi Rach.

name: director
dialogue: Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long Island.

name: joey
dialogue: So, does that mean the audition is off?

dialogue: Hello.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, honey.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, hi.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, what’s going on?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, there was a disaster in shipping and I’ve got to get this order in. Honey, I’m so sorry, but it looks like I’m going to be here all night.

name: ross
dialogue: What, do you, well umm, oh how about I come up there?

name: rachel
dialogue: No-no-no, no, honey please, I’ve got, I’ve just have so much to deal with.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Anyway, I’m going out with Sergei again tonight, and um, could you come and be the translator’s date? So that when we, it’s time for our alone time, you two could split off. You know, he’s really, he’s kind of cute.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, well kind of cute, like really kind of cute, or kind of cute like your friend Spackel Back Larry?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey, don’t call him that! His name is Spackel Back Harry!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, you know what, maybe we should get going. I mean what time did Chloe say we should be there?

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, 10

name: chandler
dialogue: What time is it now?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah all right, so we’ll hang out.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah. Hey, remember when she brought up that thing about the three of us?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes. Vividly.

name: joey
dialogue: She was kidding about that right?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, I-I-I think so.  Yeah, I-I think so...

name: joey
dialogue: God, that would be weird it that situation presented itself tonight, huh?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah. Yeah, I mean what, what would we do?

name: joey
dialogue: Dude, I don’t know.

name: chandler
dialogue: She was kidding.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: She was.... But you know what, just in case, maybe we should come up with a set of ground rules.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, for sure. Okay. Probably want the first thing to be, never open your eyes. You know, because you don’t want to be doing something and then look up and see something you don’t want to be seeing.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah. Good call, nice one. Hold it!! Hold it! What if me eyes are closed, and, and my hand is out there....

name: joey
dialogue: Ah!! Okay! Eyes open at all times! Oh, hey, how do we decide where we... you know each would, you know  be?

name: chandler
dialogue: Right. Right. Well ah, you know we could flip for it.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, I guess, but what’s like heads and what’s tails?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well it you don’t know that, then I don’t want to do this with you.

name: rachel
dialogue: No, no, no, I’m looking at a purchase order right here and it clearly states that we ordered the Rivera bikini in a variety of sizes and colours. And....  What does it matter, what I’m wearing?! Can I please speak to your supervisor?  Thank you.  We’re holding.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh!! My God, what are you doing here?

name: ross
dialogue: Well you said you couldn’t go out so....

name: sophie
dialogue: You brought a picnic, oh, what a boyfriend. That’s it, on Monday I start wearing make-up.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross honey, this is very nice, but, but I-I got a crisis.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, but I got cous-cous!

name: rachel
dialogue: Honey, honey, I’m sorry, I know it’s our anniversary but I told you on the phone I don’t have time to stop.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, you don’t have to stop, I’m invisible, I’m not here.

name: rachel
dialogue: But I don’t, hmm...  Oh, who approved that order?!  Well there is no Mark Robbinson in this office.  Get me Mark on the phone!

name: sophie
dialogue: I love Mark.  Do you know Mark?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, let me just check that with what I got here, all right see 038 is not the number for  this store, 038 is Atlanta. And I...

name: ross
dialogue: Pepper?

name: rachel
dialogue: None for me.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay sorry, whew.

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m sorry, as I was saying the store number is wrong, and I’m sorry but that’s...  Oh my God!!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, that’s a fire. Oh yeah. Oh yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: Excuse me, I’m sorry, I’m going to have to call you back, I’ve got a Schemp in my office.   What are you doing?

name: ross
dialogue: I’m sorry. But ah, hey, oh, somebody’s off the phone, how ‘bout a glass of wine by the fire, I could get it going again.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross you’re not listening to me, I don’t have time to stop.

name: ross
dialogue: Come on Rach, you don’t have what, ten minutes?

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t have ten minutes!!

name: ross
dialogue: What?  Sophie, does she have ten minutes?

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, Ross!!! I told you I don’t!

name: ross
dialogue: Don’t yell at me okay, this is the most I’ve seen you all week.

name: rachel
dialogue: Look, I cannot do this right now, okay, I’ve got a deadline, would you just go home, I’ll talk to you later.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, but wait...

name: rachel
dialogue: Good bye!

name: sophie
dialogue: Actually, that’s our three hole punch.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi. Look um, about what happened earlier...

name: ross
dialogue: No, hey, well, I-I completely understand. You were, you were stressed.

name: rachel
dialogue: I was going to give you a chance to apologise to me.

name: ross
dialogue: For what? For letting you throw me out of your office?

name: rachel
dialogue: You had no right coming down to my office Ross. You do not bring a picnic basket to somebody’s work! Unless maybe they were a park ranger!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, well excuse me for wanting to be with my girlfriend on our anniversary, boy what an ass am I.

name: rachel
dialogue: But I told you, I didn’t have the time!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, well you never have the time. I mean, I don’t feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore, Rachel.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wh, Ross what do you want from me? You want me, you want me to quit my job so you can feel like you have a girlfriend?

name: ross
dialogue: No, but it’d be nice if you realised, it’s just a job!

name: rachel
dialogue: Just a job!

name: ross
dialogue: Yes.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I’m doing something I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I’m doing something that I’m actually good at. I mean. if you don’t get that...

name: ross
dialogue: No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I’m happy for you, but I’m tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I don’t know what to do anymore.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well neither do I!

name: ross
dialogue: Is this about Mark?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, it’s not, it’s not.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again, Ross, no, you’re, you’re, you’re making this too hard.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh I’m, I’m making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to do.

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t know, I don’t know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take a break.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, okay, fine, you’re right. Let’s ah, let’s take a break,  let’s cool off, okay, let’s get some frozen yogurt, or something..

name: rachel
dialogue: No.  A break from us.

name: chloe
dialogue: And the advances in collating in the past five years, I mean we just got in an X-5000,you know. The X-5000 makes the X-50 look like a T-71.

name: chloe
dialogue: Hey, it’s the dinosaur guy.  Hi, Ross.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, hi Chloe.

name: chloe
dialogue: I want you to met some friends of mine.  This guy is my hero, he comes in with some stuff he wants it blown up 400%, we said we don’t do that, and he says you got to. And you know what, we did it. And now anytime anybody wants 400, we just say ‘let’s Ross it!’

name: chandler
dialogue: And that’s the only colour that comes in.

name: issac
dialogue: Yo, Chloe, do you have a quarter for the condom machine?

name: chloe
dialogue: Oh!

name: chandler
dialogue: So, what are you doing here? I thought tonight was your big anniversary dinner.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, little change in plans. Ahh, we’re going to break-up instead.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir?  Why? What did I say?

name: mischa
dialogue: Well, you just asked if I wanted to go to bed with you tonight.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Knock, knock, knock, knock, hi. Um, could you please tell Sergei that um, I was fascinated by what Boutros Boutros Gali said in the New York Times.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You didn’t say Boutros Boutros Gali.

name: mischa
dialogue: Boutros Boutros Gali.

name: mischa
dialogue: He says he was too.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Interesting.

name: mischa
dialogue: So I was wondering....

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, ah, before you get all talky again, umm, could you also please tell Sergei that I really like his suit.

name: mischa
dialogue: Eh, he said, thank you very much, he thinks you look very pretty tonight, your hair, golden like the sun.  So you are a chef?

name: monica
dialogue: I’m also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.

name: mischa
dialogue: Oh, really.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Monica, can I talk to you behind my menu, please.  What are you doing?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, I was having a conversation.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah but, Mischa is so interested in you, that Sergei and I haven’t been able to say two words to each other.

name: monica
dialogue: What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a conversation?

name: phoebe
dialogue: That would be great. Thank you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hello!

name: mark
dialogue: Oh, hi. It’s Mark.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh.

name: mark
dialogue: What? Is it my breath?

name: rachel
dialogue: No! Sorry, I just thought you were somebody else. Hi!

name: mark
dialogue: Hi. Well, look, I was just going to leave a message, isn’t tonight your, your big anniversary dinner?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah. Well, umm.....

name: mark
dialogue: Rach, are you okay?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, I’m fine.

name: mark
dialogue: You want to talk, I mean I can come over?

name: rachel
dialogue: No! Really, no, please, please, that’s, that’s okay.

name: mark
dialogue: All right, all right, I’m coming over, and I’m bringing Chinese food.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, yeah, I’m not, I’m not hungry.

name: mark
dialogue: It’s for me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh. Okay, bye.

dialogue: So what are you going to do?

name: ross
dialogue: What can I do? One person wants to break-up, you break-up.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, no way! Come on, this is you guys, call her and work it out.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh come on, we just had this huge fight, all right, don’t I have to wait a while?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, this isn’t like swimming after you eat, pick up the phone!!

name: chandler
dialogue: You know that whole swimming thing is a myth.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, tell that to my Uncle Lenny.

name: chandler
dialogue: Why? What happened to him?

name: joey
dialogue: Nothing, he’s just really believes in that.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, and then, we got into this big, stupid fight. I just, it was awful. I told him he treats me like a park ranger, or something, oh and then I told him I wanted to take a break, I don’t want to take a break.

name: mark
dialogue: Wow. I’m sorry. Eggroll?

name: rachel
dialogue: No.  And then I called him, and he wasn’t there.

name: mark
dialogue: Well, then he’s, he’s probably just, out.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, thank you that’s very helpful, I’m glad you came over.

dialogue: Hello.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi! It’s me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi! Oh, I’m so glad you called.

name: ross

name: mark
dialogue: Hey, what do you want to drink?

name: ross
dialogue: Who’s that?

name: rachel
dialogue: Nobody.

name: mark
dialogue: Is it okay if I finish the apple juice?

name: ross
dialogue: Is that Mark?

name: rachel
dialogue: Umm, honey, look he just came over to....

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah! Got it!

name: chloe
dialogue: Hey, dinosaur guy, look at you, so sad. Come dance.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, that’s okay, thanks.

name: chloe
dialogue: Hey, you don’t have to smile. You just have to dance.

name: ross
dialogue: Look, I don’t feel like dancing, I feel like having a drink. Okay?

name: chloe
dialogue: Oh, okay.  Hey, two beers.

name: mischa
dialogue: And the vet said it was time. And so from half a world away, while my Mother held the phone to his ear, I said good bye to my dog,. In seven languages.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.  Can I have a tissue?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, yeah, sure. I just hope you, hope you don’t accidentally suck it up through your nose and choke on it.

name: mischa
dialogue: Sergei, would like to apologise for my behaviour tonight.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, tell him, apology accepted.

name: mischa
dialogue: Oh, he’s unbelievable. I mean for the first time in three years somebody wants to actually want to talk to me, but do you think he would let me enjoy that, no!!  You silly diplomat, why don’t you learn some English, Sergei?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Excuse me, but umm, isn’t he paying for your dinner?

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, the man’s dog just died.

name: mischa
dialogue: I have just resigned my post. Would you care to accompany me to the Rainbow Room? I have diplomatic coupons.

name: monica
dialogue: It will be my pleasure.  My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your guy can’t even say coupons.

name: sergei
dialogue: Uh,  plate?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Plate! Yes, plate.

name: sergei
dialogue: Plate. Plate. Plate.

name: phoebe
dialogue: See, we don’t need them.

name: sergei
dialogue: Plate?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: I like this song.

dialogue: Well, you’re practically dancing already. Why don’t you just do it over here?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, no, no.

name: chloe
dialogue: What? Are you married? because that’s okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, be home, be home, be home, be home, be home, be home. Be home. Be home, be home, be home. Oh, you’re not home.

name: chloe
dialogue: Still no smile?

name: sergei
dialogue: Touchet, touchet, Miss Americccan pie.  Ameri-ccan.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ameri-can.

name: sergei
dialogue: Ameri-ccan.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ameri-can. you know it’s a very hard language. Let’s do it again.

name: sergei
dialogue: Everybody!!

dialogue: Previously on Friends.

dialogue: I mean, I don’t feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore.

dialogue: Oh my God.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, it’s not, it’s not.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight with you Ross! Look, urrgh, maybe we should take a break.

name: ross
dialogue: Fine, you’re right. Let’s ah, let’s take a break,  let’s cool off, okay, let’s get some frozen yoghurt, or something..

name: rachel
dialogue: No. A break from us.

name: rachel
dialogue: Then, we had this big, stupid fight, and I said I wanted to take a break, I don’t want to take a break.

name: ross
dialogue: I’ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don’t, don’t you think we can work on this?

dialogue: Umm, honey, look he just came over to....

dialogue: Yeah! Got it!

dialogue: Hey, come dance. What? Are you married? because that’s okay.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey.

dialogue: Hey.

dialogue: How’s the big anniversary dinner?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, we never actually got to dinner.

name: monica
dialogue: oh, nice.

name: rachel
dialogue: No, we kind of broke up instead.

name: monica
dialogue: What?!

name: rachel
dialogue: God, Monica it’s on the ceiling.

name: monica
dialogue: That’s okay, this is more important than fruit   on my ceiling! You broke up?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, but it’s okay, because when Ross left Mark came over.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh no!!

name: rachel
dialogue: No.

name: monica
dialogue: Rachel, you and Mark?!

name: rachel
dialogue: No, no-no, it’s okay, calm down. Mark and I talked, and I realised how much I love your stupid brother, and, yeah, we got our problems, but I really want to make it work.

name: chloe
dialogue: Morning!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi, it’s me. I’ve been trying to reach you all night. I feel awful. Please, Ross, you got to know there is nothing between me and Mark. This whole break-up thing is just stupid.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Eh, I’m just so sorry I put you through it. And, I you know, I don’t want to get back together over a machine.

name: ross
dialogue: Na-huh.

name: rachel
dialogue: So, I love you.

name: ross
dialogue: I love you.

name: rachel
dialogue: And you know what, I’m going to, I’m going to go to bed now, but ah, on my way to work tomorrow morning, I’m going to stop by around 8

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Bye.

name: ross
dialogue: Chloe, Chloe how’s it coming?!!

dialogue: Hey, what kind of puppy do you think I should get?

name: ross
dialogue: Umm, oh, hey, I don’t know. How about a big one?

name: chloe
dialogue: But my apartment is so...

name: ross
dialogue: Well then a small one!! Listen, let’s, we kind of have to get going!

name: chloe
dialogue: Wait! Where’s my shoes?

name: ross
dialogue: You, you sure you need shoes?  Okay.

name: chloe
dialogue: Do I know why we’re rushing?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, you know the ah, the girlfriend I told you about last night?  Well it turns out she ah, she wants to get back together with me. Oh, I found it!!

name: chloe
dialogue: That’s so great for you guys!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!

name: chloe
dialogue: You must be so happy!

name: ross
dialogue: Yes, yes I am, one of the many things I’m feeling. Well....

name: chloe
dialogue: Good luck, with your girlfriend.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, thank you.  Hey, hey.  Rachel!!!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi. oh, you got my message.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, oh hey, you are right on time.

name: rachel
dialogue: So what do you say? Can I be your girlfriend again?

name: ross
dialogue: Yes, you can, very much.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey, why are you mopping your ceiling?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, there’s banana on it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow, I have the spirit of an old Indian women living in mine.

name: monica
dialogue: So then you know?

name: phoebe
dialogue: The mailman was downstairs, so I brought up your mail.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, good. Thanks.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Now what is Fabutec?

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, all right don’t judge me to much. Okay? Um, but I saw this info-mercial, and um, I swear to you I have never-ever bought anything on TV before, except for this mop. But there was this stuff on leg waxing, it just, it looked so amazing....

name: phoebe
dialogue: Waxine!!

name: monica
dialogue: Yes! Have you seen it?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, it’s incredible! I so want to be a Waxine girl.

name: monica
dialogue: I know!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: God. Do think it really doesn’t hurt? Because how can they do that?

name: monica
dialogue: Hello! Organic substances recently discovered in the depths of the rain forest!

name: phoebe
dialogue: They have the best stuff in there.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh my God! Oh my God!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah. We figured when we couldn’t find you, you’d gone home to make up with Rachel. Which is probably what you should have done. Huh?

name: ross
dialogue: You think?! God, I, ah, I’m in hell. I mean what, what am I going to do? Rachel’s all like, ‘I love you and, and let’s work on this.’ And all I can think about is, ‘What is she going to do? What is she going to say?’ when I tell her what I did.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, before we answer that, I think we should address the more important question. How dumb are you?

name: ross
dialogue: What?! Look, we’re trying to rebuild a relationship here, right. How am I supposed to do that here, without being totally honest with each other?

name: joey
dialogue: Look, Ross look, I’m on board about this totally honesty thing, I am, just not about stuff that’s going to get you in trouble.

name: chandler
dialogue: He’s right. Nobody’s going to benefit, and you’re just going to hurt her.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, and there won’t be a relationship left to rebuild.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, but don’t you think....

name: chandler
dialogue: All right look, if you absolutely have to tell her, at least wait until the timing’s right. And that’s what deathbeds are for.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, okay.

name: joey
dialogue: All right, okay, now, we just have to make sure she doesn’t find out some other way.  Did you think about the trail?

name: ross
dialogue: What trail?

name: joey
dialogue: The trail from the woman you did it with to the woman you hope never finds out who did it!  You always have to think about the trail!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, I-I don’t think there’s any trail.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, okay-okay, ah, Chloe works with that guy Issac. Issac’s sister is Jasmine. And Jasmine works at that message place with Phoebe. And Phoebe’s friends with Rachel. And that’s the trail, I did it!

name: phoebe
dialogue: After applying the Waxine and linen strips to leg number one,

name: monica
dialogue: Did that!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Grasp one of the linen strips by its ‘easy grab tab’ and pull it off in one quick pain free motion.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.  Ow!!!!! Ow-oh-oh!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Was it not pain-free?

name: monica
dialogue: No. It was painful. Oh my God , they should call it Pain-zine, now with a little wax.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Huh, well, the girls in the satin nighties on the commercial don’t seem to think it’s that bad.

name: monica
dialogue: That’s because their nerves are probably deadened from being so stupid. But hey, you know if you don’t believe me, please, by my guest.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ow-ow-ow-ow! Oh my God!!!

name: monica
dialogue: Now, are you glad we didn’t start with the bikini strips?

name: ross
dialogue: Chloe? Hi..

name: chloe
dialogue: Is this about me taking your watch?

name: ross
dialogue: You took my watch?

dialogue: I’m sorry, I do that.

name: ross
dialogue: Just you keep it, listen did you, did you tell anyone about us?

dialogue: Oh no. I feel it isn’t really anybody’s business, you know.

name: ross
dialogue: Exactly. So you didn’t, didn’t mention anything to Issac right?

name: chloe
dialogue: Oh, well I tell Issac everything.

name: ross
dialogue: You tell, of course you do. Issac. Issac. Hey, Issac. Issac, HI! You know we haven’t actually met...

dialogue: You dog!

name: ross
dialogue: Yes, I suppose I am a dog. But Issac, see I-I happen to have a girlfriend.

dialogue: Oh right, that Rachel chick from the coffee place.
