dialogue: Well, oh just ah, I was just wondering, when you and I split up, did you get the tape that was half the last episode of M*A*S*H and half the hostages coming home?

name: carol
dialogue: Ah yeah, but now it’s Susan and me in Mexico and the hostages coming home.

name: ross
dialogue: Where’s Ben?

name: carol
dialogue: He’s sleeping.

name: ross
dialogue: Ahh.  Ooh, is this a ah, is this a bad time?

name: carol
dialogue: Umm, yeah, actually, Susan’s going to be home any minute, it’s kind of an anniversary.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh! I thought you guys got married in uh, January?

name: carol
dialogue: It’s not that kind of anniversary.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah!  Oh.

name: carol
dialogue: So!! Anyway...

name: ross
dialogue: Umm, candles, champagne, yeah anniversaries are great. Because you know love lasts forever, you know. Nothing like it in this lifetime, money in the bank, so Rachel and I broke up.

name: carol
dialogue: Oh God, Ross I am so sorry.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, well.

name: carol
dialogue: You know what, I want to talk to you about this so much, but we should probably do it when we could really get into it, are you free for dinner tomorrow night?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh yeah, I’d love that.

name: carol
dialogue: Oh, great! Me too.

name: ross
dialogue: I guess it all started when Rachel got this new job.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, yeah.  Triple A can pick us up.

name: rachel
dialogue: Great!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, what town are we near?

name: monica
dialogue: Freemont. West-Westmont, ah Westburg?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Then why are you answering? Do you at least know what route we’re on?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, we are definitely on Route 27.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.  We are at a rest stop on Route 27. Okay.  There is no Route 27.   Okay, either 93 or 76?

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t know, I’m sorry, I always slept in the back when we drove up here.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.  Hey, can you send somebody up and down 76 and check every rest stop, and, and also 93?  Okay!  Yeah, no they don’t do that.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ugh, okay, well somebody will come and save us.

name: monica
dialogue: Who? I mean have you seen a car come by here in the last hour and a half? I think we should call Ross, maybe he can get a car and come pick us up.

name: rachel
dialogue: No! No, I am not getting in a car with Ross, we will just have to live here!

name: phoebe
dialogue: But if...

name: rachel
dialogue: No you guys, I am not getting in a car with him, you’ll have to think of something else.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh good, oh Joey and Chandler are back.

name: monica
dialogue: So the going for help went well?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh yeah, Smokey Joe here got half way to the highway and collapsed.

name: chandler
dialogue: I have the lung capacity of a two year old.

name: monica
dialogue: Then why are you smoking?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well it’s very unsettling.

name: ross
dialogue: ....right? Right? I mean it’s pretty unbelievable you know, I mean they just took off, took off without even looking back. You know I don’t, I don’t need them, huh, I’ve got you guys now as friends, you and Susan.

name: carol
dialogue: Ah, Susan will be so pleased.

name: ross
dialogue: 717?  Where’s 717?  Hey, you’ve have more of these for Susan right?

name: carol
dialogue: No. But it’s okay, I’ll just put out pickles or something.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ross, thank God.

name: ross
dialogue: Pheebs? What, why are you whispering?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I ate a bug.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey Rach, the tampons here are only a penny. Let’s stock up.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Listen Ross, we ran out of gas, and we don’t know where we are, so we can’t get a tow truck.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, now you want a favour?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes, please.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, oh, I’m sorry your car broke down Pheebs, but I’m a little too busy with some of my real friends right now, but please call to let me know you got home safely okay?

name: carol
dialogue: Phoebe, hang on a second.  Here, take my car, go pick up your friends.

name: ross
dialogue: No, I’m not going to pick them up.

name: carol
dialogue: Listen, we both know you’re going to do it because you’re not a jerk. Okay? So you can either sulk here for a half hour and then go pick them up, or save us both time and sulk in the car.

name: ross
dialogue: No, Rachel doesn’t want me to....

name: carol
dialogue: Look, I-I-I am sorry that Rachel dumped you because she fell in love with that Mark guy, and you are the innocent victim in all of this, but don’t punish your friends for what Rachel did to you.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, you’re right.

name: carol
dialogue: Phoebe hang on a second Ross wants to say something.  What?   You slept with someone else?!

name: ross
dialogue: We were on a break!!! Okay!!  We were, we were...,  yeah. Where are you? I’ll find you.

name: carol
dialogue: You slept with another woman?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, you-you’re-you’re one to talk.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, done.

name: monica
dialogue: What’s ‘pleh’?

name: joey
dialogue: That’s ‘help’ spelled backwards so that the helicopters can read it from the air!

name: monica
dialogue: Huh. What’s doofus spelled backwards?

name: rachel
dialogue: Op, op, car! Car!!  Ugh!!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, it’s Ross on one of his drives!

name: chandler and joey
dialogue: Hey!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hi!

name: rachel
dialogue: What is he doing here?!

name: ross
dialogue: He is saving your butt, ah, unless of course I’m stepping on some toes here, in which case I can just mosey on, I’ve got plenty of people to help on the Interstate.

name: all
dialogue: No! Come on!

name: rachel
dialogue: All right!! Fine! Fine.

name: joey
dialogue: Arrrghh!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh no, now it’s not going to make any sense!

name: phoebe
dialogue: You guys, what, what do we do about Ross who drove all the way up here? What do we do? Just like send him back and we’re then going to go skiing?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, this is horrible, it’s just horrible.

name: joey
dialogue: Guys, do you think we should ask Ross to come along?

name: monica
dialogue: I know, what about Rachel? I mean how are we even going to ask her?

name: rachel
dialogue: Ask me what?

name: monica
dialogue: Umm, if ah, it might be okay if Ross came skiing?

name: chandler, phoebe, and joey
dialogue: No, I wasn’t going to ask you that, no.

name: rachel
dialogue: You guys are unbelievable. No! He cannot come.

name: ross
dialogue: Excuse me?

name: chandler
dialogue: It’s horrible.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh please, can’t I come to your special, magical cabin?

name: rachel
dialogue: Why would you even want to come Ross? You’re a horrible skier.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh-oh, hitting me where it hurts, my ski skills.

name: monica
dialogue: Here we go again.

name: joey
dialogue: I-I can’t handle this, you guys.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what, I can handle it, handle’s my middle name. Actually it’s the ah, middle part of my first name.

name: ross
dialogue: All right Pheebs, your cab’s ready.

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, let’s go!

name: ross
dialogue: You’re welcome.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, I’m sorry, were you speaking to me or sleeping with someone else?

name: ross
dialogue: We were on a break!

name: rachel
dialogue: You know Ross why don’t you put that on your answering machine!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey-hey, it’s valid okay? And I’m not the only one who thinks so, Monica agrees with me.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?!

name: monica
dialogue: I don’t know.

name: ross
dialogue: That’s what you said last night.

name: monica
dialogue: What I said was, was that I understood. Joey’s the one who agreed with you!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Really Joey?

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: phoebe
dialogue: You know what, but there is, there is no right or wrong, here.

name: rachel
dialogue: No, I think it’s very obvious who’s wrong here.

name: ross
dialogue: Obviously not to Joey.

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: Look both, Joey and Monica feel the same way that I do. No-no-no-no.

name: chandler
dialogue: Guys, guys, guess who I am?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! Hey!!!  Look what you’re doing to Chandler!!   Yeah, look, we know this is really, really hard for you guys. Okay?  You don’t, all right you don’t have to love each other, okay? You don’t, you don’t even have to like each other much right now. But please, you have to figure out a way to be around each other.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, and not put us in the middle.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, otherwise, I mean that’s, that’s, that’s just it for us hanging out together. You know is that what you want?  Can you be civil?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: I can.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay. Good, all right, let’s get back in the car, because it’s freezing, and my chest is unsupported.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh what, wait, wait a second, I mean, what are we doing? Who’s going with who?

name: ross
dialogue: Look, you guys, you guys should go.  No, I’m, you, you planned this all out, and I don’t want to ruin it, so you guys should just go.

name: joey
dialogue: Come on man, you drove all the way up here.

name: ross
dialogue: No, no, really, I’ve got to take the car back anyway, I’m spending all day tomorrow with Ben, It’s fine, no guilt I promise.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you.

name: monica
dialogue: All right, we’ll call you when we get back.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Maybe we can like go to a movie or something.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Or, or the rodeo!!

name: ross
dialogue: That would be great.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay!

name: chandler
dialogue: I was being Shelly Winters from The Poseidon Adventure.

name: ross
dialogue: I know!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Bye!!!

name: carol
dialogue: Ugh.  Ross!

name: ross
dialogue: Hi! Sorry I’m late. Were you sleeping?

name: carol
dialogue: Ahh, no!!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, great! Listen, oh I had to get you a whole new battery. I got you the best one I could, because that’s not where you want to skimp.

name: carol
dialogue: You’re a genius, Ross.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, well it came to about $112, but what the hell, just call it an even 110?

name: carol
dialogue: Okay, I’ll pay you tomorrow.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: carol
dialogue: Okay, bye!!

name: ross
dialogue: So they ah, they all took off, it was pretty hard watching them go, you know?

name: carol
dialogue: Yeah, okay, bye.

name: ross
dialogue: So I’m going to take off then!

name: monica
dialogue: What’s so funny?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, nothing, no. It’s an acting exercise, I’m practising my fake laugh.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.

name: joey
dialogue: What-what’s so funny?

name: gunther
dialogue: Oh, no-no, no-no-no, there’s none of that in here.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh come on man! At least let me finish this last one.

name: gunther
dialogue: Okay, but only if you give me a drag.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay.

name: gunther
dialogue: Oh dark mother, once again I suckle at your smokey tit.

name: chandler
dialogue: No-no, why don’t you hang on to that one.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, that’s like the least fun game ever.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I’m really sick of your smoking, so I brought something that is going to help you quit.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh.  Nope, that patch is no good.

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on, it’s a hypnosis tape. This woman at work used it for two weeks straight and she hasn’t smoked since.

name: ross
dialogue: Pffhah.

name: rachel
dialogue: What’s your problem?

name: ross
dialogue: Nothing, it’s just that hypnosis is beyond crap.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross, I watched you get hypnotised in Atlantic City.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, that guy did not hypnotise me! Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh right, because you always pull your pants down at the count of three and play Wipe-out on your butt cheeks.

name: phoebe
dialogue: All right, you know forget hypnosis. The way to quit smoking is you have to dance naked in a field of heather, and then bath in the sweat of six healthy young men.

name: chandler
dialogue: Or what my Father called Thursday night.

name: ross
dialogue: Here you go.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, you know what, I didn’t want cinnamon on this.

name: ross
dialogue: Sorry.

name: frank
dialogue: Hi!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God!!

name: frank
dialogue: Hi!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Frank! Hi!

name: frank
dialogue: How are you?

name: phoebe
dialogue: What are you doing here?

name: frank
dialogue: Oh, well you know, I would’ve called but I lost your phone number and then ah, my Mom locked me out of the house so I couldn’t find it. And then, I tried to find a pay phone, and ah, the receiver was cut off. So...

name: phoebe
dialogue: What happened?

name: frank
dialogue: Ah, oh, the ah, vandalism.

name: phoebe
dialogue: But, also, what happened between you and your Mom?

name: frank
dialogue: Well, we got into a fight because ah, she said I was to immature to get married.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Your getting married?!

name: frank
dialogue: Oh, yeah!

name: all
dialogue: Wow!

name: phoebe
dialogue: My little brother’s getting married!!

name: frank
dialogue: Oh, I knew you’d be so cool about this. All right, ah, hey, do you want to meet her?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Do I?

name: frank
dialogue: Do you?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I do, yeah.

name: frank
dialogue: Okay, cool, all right, she just ah, parking the truck.  I’m going to, I’m going to get my ah, my fiance man!

name: chandler
dialogue: You know, I would’ve bet good money that he’d be the first one of us to get married.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, isn’t it fantastic?

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, ah, but Pheebs don’t you think he’s a little young to get married?

name: phoebe
dialogue: What, he’s 18.

name: ross
dialogue: Exactly, it’ll be illegal for him to drink at his own bachelor party.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, or-or to get a hooker.

name: chandler
dialogue: Always illegal Joe.

name: frank
dialogue: Hey! Hey! This is ah, my fiance, Mrs. Knight.

name: alice
dialogue: You know it-it’s funny, um, Frank told me so much about you, but your not how I pictured you at all.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I’m a big surprise.

name: monica
dialogue: So, um, how-how did you guys meet?

name: frank
dialogue: Well um, I was in ah Mrs. Knight’s ah, I mean Alice, sorry, Alice, I always do that. I was in her ah, Home Ec class.

name: alice
dialogue: And he was my best student.

name: frank
dialogue: Yeah, she was my best teacher.

name: alice
dialogue: oh.

name: chandler
dialogue: If that doesn’t keep kids in school, what will?

name: ross
dialogue: And so now you guys are going to be married?

name: alice
dialogue: Yeah. you know we-we talked about just living together, but um, we want to have kids right away.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God!! Great!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow, kids. Frank, are you sure you’re ready for that?

name: frank
dialogue: I mean, how hard can it be? You know, I mean, you know, babies, you know who doesn’t want babies right? And besides you know, I never had a Dad around, and ah, now-now I always will,‘because you know, it’ll be me. Right?

name: alice
dialogue: You know, I mean, really we do realise that there’s an age difference between us.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh good! Okay. Because you were acting like you didn’t.

name: alice
dialogue: Oh no, but when it comes to love, what does age matter?

name: hypnosis tape
dialogue: You are falling fast asleep. Deeper. Deeper. Deeper. You are now completely asleep. You don’t need to smoke. Cigarettes don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman.

name: monica
dialogue: And you know what, I just realised, in the last year I’ve only gone out with two guys, Richard and Julio. You got to help me out here, you got to set me up, you got to get me back in the game.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, that shouldn’t be a problem. I mean I work in fashion and all I meet are eligible straight men.

name: monica
dialogue: Pete, can I get you something else?

name: pete
dialogue: Yeah, a slice of cheesecake and-and a date if you’re given’‘them out.

name: monica
dialogue: Haven’t you and I covered that topic?

name: pete
dialogue: Hmm, come on, you just said to her that you….

name: monica
dialogue: Aww, the only reason you want to go out with me because my blond wig, and the big boobs, and the fact that I serve you food.

name: pete
dialogue: Well, if that were true, I’d dating my Aunt Ruth. And the two times we went out were just plain awkward.  Come on, you think she should go out with me, don’t you?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I mean, are you sure you want to go out with her? I mean that isn't a pretty picture in the morning, you know what I mean. That wig all in disarray, and boobs flung over the night stand, you know.

name: monica
dialogue: I mean really, think about it.

name: pete
dialogue: Ho-ho, I will.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, I know, I know, that this is Frank’s life, you know. You know, I don’t want to be all judgmental, you know, but this is sick, it’s sick and wrong!

name: ross
dialogue: Pheebs, what, is it the age thing?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No-no, oh, I’m fine with the age thing you know, until it starts sticking it’s tongue down my little brother’s throat!

name: joey
dialogue: Pheebs, he seems to enjoy it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: But, I mean, do you think he’s going to enjoy it when he’s up to his elbows in the diapers from all the babies they have to have right away?! This is not fair to Frank,  and it-it’s not fair to the babies, and you know what, it’s not good home economics.

name: joey
dialogue: Well, have-have you told him how you feel?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes. Not out loud.

name: ross
dialogue: Pheebs, if you don’t tell him, soon he’s going to be married, and then you’re going to hate yourself.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, but if I do tell him, then he’s going to hate myself. I mean look at him and his Mom, I can’t.  But, you guys can, please you got to talk him out of it.

name: ross and joey
dialogue: No-no-no-no-no.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Come on, you guys, you have nothing to lose, I have everything to lose. Do you want me to lose everything? Everything?!

name: ross and joey
dialogue: No.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, I’m going to go get Frank.

name: joey
dialogue: So, we’re walking down the street and I turn to you and I say, “Hey, let’s go hang out at Totally Nude Nudes,” remember? And then, and then, you turn to me and say, “Nah, let’s just hang out at your place.” Well, that was a nice move dumb ass.

name: rachel
dialogue: I think you should definitely go out with this guy.

name: monica
dialogue: Nah, he doesn’t do anything for me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica, last Saturday night, what happened on Walker

name: monica
dialogue: Well, umm, Walker was looking for this big bus load of kids….  All right, I get your point.

name: rachel
dialogue: All right.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know, I forgot the combination to this about a year ago? I just carry it around. Do you have any Chap Stick?

name: monica
dialogue: Uh, yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, how are those tapes working out for you?

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what, pretty good.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah?

name: chandler
dialogue: Good! I haven’t smoked yet today, I feel great, and-and-and confident, that is a stunning blouse.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you.

name: monica
dialogue: Here you go.

name: chandler
dialogue: Thanks

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey Mon, let’s give Pete a chance Come on, he was funny, he seems really nice, and that check thing was adorable.

name: chandler
dialogue: What check thing?

name: monica
dialogue: As a joke, this customer at work who has a crush on me gave me a $20,000 tip. His number is on the check, he just did so I’d call him.

name: chandler
dialogue: Pete Becker. Pete…   Is this him?

name: monica
dialogue: That’s Bill Clinton.

name: chandler
dialogue: Who’s he hugging’?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! That’s Pete! But why is Bill hugging’ Pete?

name: chandler
dialogue: This guy invented Moss 865! Every office in the world uses that program!

name: rachel
dialogue: We use it!!

name: chandler
dialogue: There you go!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God, Monica’s going to go out with a millionaire.

name: monica
dialogue: I’m not going to go out with him.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God, I can’t believe this is a real $20,000 check, oh this is just so exciting.

name: monica
dialogue: Or incredibly offensive.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah, sure, that too.

name: chandler
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: All we’re saying is don’t rush into anything.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, come on, think about it. You’re 18, okay, she’s 44, when you’re 36, she’s going to be 88.

name: frank
dialogue: What, you don’t think I know that?

name: joey
dialogue: Look, the point is, there’s a lot of women out there you haven’t even had sex with yet!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, he-he’s right, he’s right. This is your time you know, yeah, you’re young, you’re-you’re weird, chicks dig that.

name: frank
dialogue: Okay, but isn’t sex better when it’s with one person that you really, really care about.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, in a poem maybe.

name: ross
dialogue: No the man’s right, that’s what I had with Rachel.

name: frank
dialogue: You don’t have it anymore?

name: ross
dialogue: No, I ah, I slept with someone else.

name: frank
dialogue: Okay, so wait, all right, so how does that make things better?

name: ross
dialogue: It didn’t.

name: frank
dialogue: Okay, so what you used to have with Rachel, is what I’ve got with Alice.

name: joey
dialogue: Now, wh-what, what is that like?

name: frank
dialogue: It’s so cool man, it’s so, it’s just because being with her is so much better than like not being with her.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: Why can’t I find that?

name: ross
dialogue: Don’t ask me, I had it and I blew it!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, I want it!

name: frank
dialogue: You can have it!

name: joey
dialogue: I don’t know, maybe I can’t. I mean, maybe there’s something wrong with me.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, no! No!

name: frank
dialogue: It’s out there man! I’ve seen it! I got it!!

name: joey
dialogue: Then you hold on to it!!

name: frank
dialogue: All right, man!!

name: joey
dialogue: All right, congratulations you lucky bastard!

name: phoebe
dialogue: You’re Frank’s best man?!

name: joey
dialogue: I couldn’t help it, there love is so pure.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well then,  what about you?! Huh?!

name: ross
dialogue: I’m the ring bearer.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hi! Oh, Alice, hi! Thanks. I’m so glad you could come, because I’ve got a real umm, Home Ec emergency.

name: alice
dialogue: Oh my God, who died on this?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I know. It’s a real mustard-tastrophe. Can you help me?

name: alice
dialogue: Absolutely. Okay, first we’ll start with a little club soda and salt, and then if that doesn’t work we can go back to

name: phoebe
dialogue: You know what, forget it. It’s ruined.

dialogue: Oh no-no, never say that. If we can’t get it out then we can cut around the stain, add a little lace, you make a stylish throw.

dialogue: You guys make me fly! High! Okay, we’re going to pick it up here, tomorrow.

dialogue: Well, that was ah...

name: joey
dialogue: Better?

name: kate
dialogue: Yeah! Yeah, it was definitely an improvement. Good night.

name: joey
dialogue: Ah, Kate?

name: kate
dialogue: Yeah?

name: joey
dialogue: You ah, you forgot your shoes.

name: kate
dialogue: I’m probably going to need those. Huh?

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, listen you ah....

name: kate
dialogue: Hmm?

name: joey
dialogue: ...feel like getting a cup of coffee?

name: kate
dialogue: Umm.

name: the director
dialogue: Kate?

name: kate
dialogue: Yep.

name: the director
dialogue: You ready to go?

name: kate
dialogue: Yeah.

name: the director
dialogue: Very nice. Very nice.

name: kate
dialogue: So umm, I’ll see you tomorrow, huh?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, yeah sure, goodnight.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!  Why isn’t it Spiderman? You know like Goldman, Silverman...

name: chandler
dialogue: Because it’s-it’s not his last name.

name: phoebe
dialogue: It isn’t?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, it’s not like, like Phil Spiderman. He’s a spider, man. you know like ah, like Goldman is a last name, but there’s no Gold Man.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, okay. There should be Gold Man!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, Rach, how was work?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, great. Although I did sit down where there wasn’t a chair.

name: monica
dialogue: By the way, Ross dropped by a box of your stuff.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, well, I guess I had that one coming. I’m just going to throw it out, it’s probably just a bunch of shampoo and...

name: monica
dialogue: Something wrong?

name: rachel
dialogue: No. Nothing.

name: chandler
dialogue: So, ahh, what kind of powers would Gold Man have?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay well, he would turn things to gold.

name: chandler
dialogue: What about things that are already gold?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ahh, his work is done.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, let’s play my game now.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay. All right you yellow-bellied-lilly-livered-DRAW!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Wait a minute, wait. You’re telling me this actress person is the only woman you ever wanted who didn’t want you back?!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! Oh my God!  Is this what it’s like to be you?

name: monica
dialogue: Wow, you’re really crazy about her, huh?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, you have no idea. And-and when we’re on stage I get to-to kiss her and-and touch her, but then she goes home with the director, and it’s like somebody’s ripping out my heart!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, it’s so great to see you feeling like this!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Monica, uh Dad called this morning and ah, Aunt Silvia passed away.

name: monica
dialogue: Yes!! Yes! Yeah, yeah, yeah!

name: ross
dialogue: We were all pretty shaken up about it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wait, am I missing something though? Because I thought death was something that’s supposed to be sad, in a way.

name: ross
dialogue: Well ah, Aunt Silvia was, well not a nice person.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, she was a cruel, cranky, old bitch!   And I’m sorry she died. Did Dad say I get the dollhouse?

name: ross
dialogue: You get the dollhouse.

name: monica
dialogue: I get the dollhouse!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow, a house for dolls, that is so cool! When I was kid, I had a barrel.

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, Pheebs, you had a barrel for a dollhouse?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, just a barrel.

name: monica
dialogue: You know what, you can play with my dollhouse.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Really?! Really?!

name: monica
dialogue: Any time you want. You know, when I was younger, all I wanted to do was to play with this dollhouse, but no!! It was to be looked at, but never played with.

name: chandler
dialogue: My Grandmother used to say that exact same thing to me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, Sophie!

name: sophie
dialogue: Hey, Rach!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: sophie
dialogue: Hey.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thanks for lunch, Chandler. You know, you didn’t have to walk me all the way back up here.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, that’s-that’s okay, no problem.

name: rachel
dialogue: Honey um, honey, you do realise that we don’t keep the women’s lingerie here in the office?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, I realise that.

name: rachel
dialogue: Summer catalogue!

name: chandler
dialogue: That’s the stuff!

name: joanna
dialogue: Rachel, I need the Versachi invoice.  Hello! You don’t work for me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Joanna, this is my friend Chandler Bing  Joanna.

name: joanna
dialogue: Bing! That’s a great name.

name: chandler
dialogue: Thanks, it’s ah, Gaelic, for ‘Thy turkey’s done.’ So ah, I’m going to go, nice, nice meeting you.

name: joanna
dialogue: Me too.

name: rachel
dialogue: Bye, Chandler.

name: joanna
dialogue: So ah, what’s wrong with him?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, nothing, he’s just goofy like that, I actually, hardly notice it anymore.

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh no, no-no-no, is he ah, married, or involved with anyone?

name: rachel
dialogue: No!! No! He’s not married, or involved, with anyone!

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh, Rachel,  actually, you know what, forget it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I’ll ask him for you, if you want me too?

name: joanna
dialogue: Would you? Or, is it just to sad and desperate, and you know something that Sophie would do?

name: sophie
dialogue: Uh, uh, uh, I am here.

name: joanna
dialogue: I know that.

name: monica
dialogue: Look at it! oh! Wallpaper’s a little faded, that’s okay. Carpet’s a little loose. Hardwood floors!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hello.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh! Ooh! Oh Monica! It’s so beautiful.

name: monica
dialogue: I know!!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: So, I’m here, ready to play.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I brought a bunch of stuff for the house, so check it out. Ha-ha.

name: monica
dialogue: What’s this?

name: phoebe
dialogue: That’s a dog, every house should have a dog.

name: monica
dialogue: Not one that can pee on the roof.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, maybe it’s so big because the house was built on radioactive waste.

name: chandler
dialogue: And is this in case the house sneezes?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, no, that’s the ghost for the attic.

name: monica
dialogue: I don’t want a ghost.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, nobody wants a ghost. But you’ve got one, because the house is sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground.

name: ross
dialogue: Wait a minute, the house was built on radioactive waste, and an ancient Indian burial ground? That would never happen.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, obviously you don’t know much about the U.S. government.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: all
dialogue: Hello.

name: rachel
dialogue: I need to talk to you!

name: ross
dialogue: Sure, what’s up?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, sorry. I meant Chandler.

name: ross
dialogue: I-I know. Well if something comes up...

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, I'm glad you guys are past that little awkward phase.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, my boss, Joanna, when you left, she started asking questions about you...

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh-ho, liked what she saw, huh? Dug my action, did she? Checking’ out the Chan-Chan man!

name: rachel
dialogue: That was  surreal. Okay, what do think? Are you interested at all?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, she seemed cool, attractive. I’ll do it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh thank you, Chandler, this is so great, she’s going to love me.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, dinosaur attack!! Quick, everybody into the house!! Ahh-ahh!  Roof! Rrroof-roof-roof!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, Phoebe, you know what? That-that’s it, that’s it, all right? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? They’re not the right size, they’re not Victorian, and they just don’t go.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay,  fine. Come dinosaur, we’re not welcome in the house of no imagination.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, Pheebs, while we’re hovering around the subject. I just have to say dinosaurs, they-they don’t go, rrroof!

name: phoebe
dialogue: The little ones do.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, Kate!

name: kate
dialogue: Morning.

name: joey
dialogue: Listen, I ah, went to that restaurant that you were talking about last week...

name: the director
dialogue: Hey, lovely! Come, talk to me a minute!

name: joey
dialogue: And I ate the food, I had the fish, it was good, yeah. It was good, yeah...

name: woman
dialogue: Hi, oh, I’m Lauren, Kate’s understudy.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, hey! Joey Tribbiani.

name: lauren
dialogue: I know! I-I’m a big fan of yours.

name: joey
dialogue: What?!

name: lauren
dialogue: I used to umm, schedule my classes so I could watch Dr. Drake Ramoray on Days of Our Lives.

name: joey
dialogue: Get out of here, really?!

name: lauren
dialogue: Absolutely!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah?

name: lauren
dialogue: Oh but then, they went and dropped you down that elevator shaft.

name: joey
dialogue: They gave me the shaft all right.

name: lauren
dialogue: Oh, you’re so funny. Listen, umm, what are you doing after rehearsals? Do you want to get a drink, or something?

name: joey
dialogue: Well Ahh,  yeah! Yeah, sure, a drink sounds great.

name: lauren
dialogue: Cool! I-I’ll see you then.

name: joey
dialogue: All right.

name: the director
dialogue: All right, it’s time to act, my talking props.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Look everybody, look at my new dollhouse!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Wow!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Look, look!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, what’s this?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, okay, it’s the slide instead of stairs. Watch this.

name: monica
dialogue: It’s very interesting, Phoebe.

name: rachel
dialogue: What’s this?

name: phoebe
dialogue: The Licorice Room, you can eat all the furniture. And, when guests come over, they can stay on the tootsie roll-away bed.

name: ross
dialogue: This is the coolest house ever!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey, does anybody want to join me in the aroma room?

name: rachel
dialogue: All right!

name: ross
dialogue: I would!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!

name: ross and rachel
dialogue: Uh-huh.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Watch, watch.

name: ross and rachel
dialogue: Ooh!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: And, and!

name: ross and rachel
dialogue: Ah!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, my Father’s house does that!

name: rachel
dialogue: O-o-o-okay, how did it go? Tell me everything.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, the movie was great, dinner was great, and there’s nothing like a cool, crisp New York evening.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hmm.

name: chandler
dialogue: Of course, I didn’t get to enjoy any of that, because Joanna’s such a big, dull dud!

name: joanna
dialogue: Chandler is fantastic!!

name: rachel
dialogue: What?!

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh God, we just clicked! You know how people just click? Like he came by to pick me up, and I opened the door, and it was just like, click! Did he tell you?

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh, and he’s got such a good heart! Doesn’t he have a good heart?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, I know...

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh, I know and he’s so sweet! Listen, he said he was going to call, so put him straight through.

name: sophie
dialogue: Isn’t this great?!

name: joanna
dialogue: Don’t spoil it.

name: joey
dialogue: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?

name: the director
dialogue: Hello. Oh! It’s you. Just ah, just one-one sec.  I am going to take this call. When I continue, I hope that there will appear on stage this magical thing that in the theatre we call, committing to the moment!

name: joey
dialogue: That guy’s like a cartoon. What do you see in him anyway?

name: kate
dialogue: He happens to be brilliant. Which is more than I can say for that sweater you’re dating.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, I’m not interested in her sweater! It’s what’s underneath her sweater that counts. And besides, since ah, since when do you care who I’m going out with?

name: kate
dialogue: I don’t care. Why, do you want me to care?

name: joey
dialogue: Do you want me to want you to care?

name: kate
dialogue: Do you?

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: the director
dialogue: Okay, I’m afraid to say this, but let’s pick it up where we left off.

name: joey
dialogue: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?

name: kate
dialogue: I’ve got no reason to stay.

name: the director
dialogue: Stop!! Stop it! You must stop! You are bad actors! This is a terrible play! I’ll see you in the morning.

name: kate
dialogue: I can’t believe we go on in, in a week.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, it’s going to be all right.

name: lauren
dialogue: Hey! So since we’re getting off early, do you want to go and paint mugs?

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: lauren
dialogue: You know! At the place I told you about last night?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, yeah, with the mug painting. Yeah. I was so listening to that. But ah, you know what, I think I kind of need to work on my stuff tonight.

name: lauren
dialogue: Oh, okay.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.

name: lauren
dialogue: I’ll see you tomorrow.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.

name: lauren
dialogue: Good night.

name: joey
dialogue: Ah, are you okay?

name: kate
dialogue: Yeah, I guess. Look, what are we going to do about this scene, huh?

name: joey
dialogue: I don’t know.

name: kate
dialogue: Well umm, maybe if it had more heat.

name: joey
dialogue: How do you mean?

name: kate
dialogue: Well, Adrian’s looking for a reason to stay, right? Victor can’t just kiss her, he’s got to, got to really give her a reason, you know?

name: joey
dialogue: Maybe he could slip her the tongue.

name: kate
dialogue: Or maybe, maybe he could grab her, and, and, and, and lift her up.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, and then Adrian, she maybe she could wrap her legs around his waist.

name: kate
dialogue: And then she could rip off his shirt and kiss his chest, and, and his stomach!

name: joey
dialogue: And then, then he could use his teeth, his teeth to undo her dress, and, and, and bite her!

name: kate
dialogue: And then right, right when the scene ends, he could take her with this raw, animal....

name: joey
dialogue: Something like that?

name: kate
dialogue: Yeah, that’s pretty much what I had in mind.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.

name: ross
dialogue: It’s a little early to be drinking’.

name: joey
dialogue: No-no, things ah, finally happened with Kate.

name: ross
dialogue: oh!

name: monica
dialogue: You’re kidding?! That’s great!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, it was so amazing. After the  love making...

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my.

name: joey
dialogue: Yep. I just, I just watched her sleep for like hours, just breathing in and breathing out. And then I knew she was dreaming because, because her eyes keep going like this.

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m telling you, Joanna’s got it all wrong. Okay? All I said was, ‘This was fun. Let’s do it again sometime. I’ll give you a call.’

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, gee. I wonder why she thinks you’re going to call her?

name: chandler
dialogue: That’s what you say at the end of a date.

name: rachel
dialogue: You can’t just say, ‘Nice to meet you, good night?’

name: chandler
dialogue: To her face? Look it’s the end of the date, I’m standing there, I know all she’s waiting for is for me to say ‘I’ll call her’ and it’s just you know, comes out. I can’t help it, it’s a compulsion.

name: monica
dialogue: Come on Rach, when a guy says he’s going to call, it doesn’t mean he’s going to call. Hasn’t it ever happened to you?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, they always called.

name: monica
dialogue: Hmm, bite me.

name: joanna
dialogue: Did he call?

name: rachel
dialogue: No. Sorry.

name: joanna
dialogue: Why?! Why?! He said he’d call. Why hasn’t he called?

name: sophie
dialogue: Maybe he’s intimated by really smart, strong, successful women.

name: joanna
dialogue: Sophie, would you please climb out of my butt. Why hasn’t he called, Rachel? Why?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, okay. Umm, well ah, maybe he, maybe he feels awkward because you are my boss.

name: joanna
dialogue: Awkward? Why should he feel awkward?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well...

name: joanna
dialogue: The only person that should feel awkward is you, and you didn’t tell him not to call me, did you?

name: rachel
dialogue: No. I...

name: joanna
dialogue: Because if you feel uncomfortable with your friend dating someone you work for, there are always ways to fix...that.

name: rachel
dialogue: Call her! Call her now!

name: chandler
dialogue: Multiple, so many paper cuts.

name: rachel
dialogue: Why hasn’t he called Rachel? Why? Why? I don’t understand. Why? He said he’ll call. Why? Why? Chandler I’m telling you she has flipped out, she’s gone crazy!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, well give me the phone then.

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on, this isn’t funny. She thinks it’s my fault that you haven’t called her. You have to call her!

name: chandler
dialogue: Look, you can’t call somebody after this long just to say, ‘In case you didn’t notice, I don’t like you!’

name: rachel
dialogue: Well then you’re going to have to take her out again.

name: chandler
dialogue: Nooo!! She’s really dull! And she gets this gross mascara goop thing in the corner of her eye!

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t care! I don’t care! You are going to have to take her out again and end it, and end it in way that she knows it’s actually ended. And, I don’t care how hard it is for you, do not tell her that you will call her again!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right! Fine! But it’s just a lunch date, no more than an hour! And from now on I get my own dates, I don’t want you setting me up with anybody ever again!

name: rachel
dialogue: That’s fine!

name: chandler
dialogue: That’s just a lot of big talk, you know.

name: rachel
dialogue: I know.

name: ross
dialogue: Mon?

name: monica
dialogue: I’m in the shower!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, fire! There, there’s a fire! Fire!!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.

name: kate
dialogue: Hi.

name: joey
dialogue: So I ah, talked to Lauren, kind of told her how things were with us. Did you ah, did you talk to Marshall?

name: kate
dialogue: About what?

name: joey
dialogue: You know, about what happened with us.

name: kate
dialogue: Nooo. And there’s really no reason he should find out, so ah let’s not make a big deal about it, okay?

name: joey
dialogue: What are you talking about? It was a big deal. I mean, come on you can’t tell me last night didn’t mean something to you. I-I was there, you’re not that good an actress.

name: kate
dialogue: Look umm, I, I was, I was just caught up in the moment. That’s all it was. Joey, I’m-I’m sorry you feel bad, but haven’t you ever sleep with a women where it meant more to her than it did to you?

name: joey
dialogue: Nooo.

name: lauren
dialogue: Hi, Kate!

name: kate
dialogue: Hi, Lauren.

name: joey
dialogue: Hi, Lauren.

name: lauren
dialogue: Hi, pig!

name: ross
dialogue: Sorry I ah, I scared you in there.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, that’s okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower massager.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: I tried to reach you at work. There’s....been a fire.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?! Oh my...  Oh my God!! What happened?!

name: ross
dialogue: Well, we believe it originated here.  In the Aroma Room.

name: phoebe
dialogue: All right. Did everyone get out okay?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, the giraffe’s okay. And so is the pirate.

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH. What is this?

name: ross
dialogue: No Phoebe, don’t look! You don’t want to see what’s under there!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH, the-the Foster puppets!

name: chandler
dialogue: It’s not a big deal. It’s, just it’s right here,  and it’s all the time.

name: joanna
dialogue: Well, thanks again for lunch.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, this, this was pleasant.

name: joanna
dialogue: It was, wasn’t it?

name: chandler
dialogue: The food there was, was great.

name: joanna
dialogue: Wasn’t it?

name: chandler
dialogue: So take care.

name: joanna
dialogue: You too.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, this was great. I’ll give you a call. We should do it again sometime.

name: joanna
dialogue: Great! I’m looking forward to it. Rachel, any messages?

name: rachel
dialogue: Sophie’s desk.

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler!! Are you going to call her!

name: chandler
dialogue: No!

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Look, I’m sorry. Okay? I’m weak, and pathetic, and sorry.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, you are going to tell her and you’re going to tell her now.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ah—I’m not going to call you.

name: joanna
dialogue: What?

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m sorry. I’m-I’m-I’m sorry that I said I was going to when I’m not. Look, this has nothing to do with you, you know? And this isn’t Rachel’s fault. It’s me. I have serious, serious problems when it comes to women. I have issues with commitment, intimacy,  mascara goop. And I’m really sorry, it’s just that this is not, this isn’t going to work out.

name: joanna
dialogue: Well, this isn’t how I was hoping how this would end, but I guess I have to appreciate your honesty.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, o-okay.

name: joanna
dialogue: So...

name: chandler
dialogue: Well this is great! I’ll give you a call! We should do it again sometime!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, so anyway Beth, what I’m saying is I should’ve considered your feelings before I went home with you that night. I’ve ah, I’ve recently learned what’s it like to be on your side of it, and I’m sorry. So, do you think you can forgive me?  Great. Thanks. Okay, bye.  Hello, Jennifer?  Oh hi, Mrs. Loreo, is Jennifer there?  Oh, she’s not home huh?  Well ah, actually I kind of need to talk to you too.

name: rachel
dialogue: So who’s idea was it to put everybody in the diner on skates?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God, they took my idea!

name: monica
dialogue: That was you?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah! Okay, here you go.

name: gunther
dialogue: Rachel, I made you a cocoa.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God, are you guys okay?

name: gunther
dialogue: Are you all right?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh my.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey. you know with that goatee you kind of look like Satan.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, so that’s why the priest threw holy water on me.  Okay, listen, you have to cheer up! Okay? You should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here crying all day about Kate.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey I was crying because, because nobody believed Quincy’s theory. Okay?

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m going to be on TV!!

name: chandler

But when I return, 200 years from now, you’ll be long gone. But I won’t have aged at all.  So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because Adrienne, baby, I’m going to want to meet her.

dialogue: Well I hope you have fun tonight.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Thanks! You too.

name: rachel
dialogue: You said she was bald.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, she was bald, she’s not now.

name: rachel
dialogue: How could you not tell me that she has hair?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don’t know, I hardly ever say that about people.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, well, this is just perfect!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well I’m sorry, I thought you said it was okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, I said what was okay when I thought she was some weird bald chick. I mean, you know, that girl has hair got all over head!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, maybe it won’t work out. Maybe Ross won’t like her personality.

name: rachel
dialogue: Why, does she have a bad personality?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh no, Bonnie’s the best!

name: doug
dialogue: Bing!  Read your Computech proposal, a real homerun.  Ooh. Barely got you that time, get over here. Come on.  Wham!  Good one. That was a good one.  Keep at it team.

name: chandler
dialogue: What is with him?

name: phil
dialogue: With him? You’re is favourite, you’re his guy!

name: stevens
dialogue: We never get smacked.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, that’s not true, he-he smacked you once.

name: phil
dialogue: Not on purpose, he ricocheted of you and got me.

name: stevens
dialogue: I’m telling you, I need some smacks. I got a kid starting Dartmouth in the fall.

name: doug
dialogue: Dartmouth? Who went to Dartmouth? Dartmouth sucks. Did you go to Dartmouth Bing?

name: chandler
dialogue: No sir.

name: doug
dialogue: There you go.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: God Ross, what is that?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, it’s the Ultimate Fighting Combo. Yeah, I saved thirty cents, plus I get to keep the cup. Yay!!

name: announcer
dialogue: From New York City, New York! Appearing in his Ultimate Fighting Championship debut! He’s known for his confrontational business style. Ladies and Gentlemen, introducing Pete Beck-errrr!!

name: monica
dialogue: I love you, Pete!!!

name: announcer
dialogue: And his opponent, from Hunnington Beach, California! He’s a 300 pound street fighter, Tank Abbottttttt!!!!

name: monica
dialogue: Pete! Pete!! That guy’s pretty huge!

name: pete
dialogue: Don’t worry, Hoshi taught me how to use an opponent’s strength and weight against him.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, then that guy is in serious, serious trouble.

name: ross
dialogue: All right! You go get him! Let’s go!

name: referee
dialogue: Here we go gentlemen, here we go!  Are you ready?   Are you ready?  Let’s get it on!!

name: pete
dialogue: Uh-oh.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey!  It’s me. Mon-I-ca! Can I just tell you how proud I am of you.

name: pete
dialogue: It would be nice after hearing 20,000 people chant “You suck!”

name: monica
dialogue: I mean I-I thought you were nuts at first, but you-you did it. And now you can just look back at this thing with no regrets.

name: pete
dialogue: What, look back?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, you’re not going to get going are you?

name: pete
dialogue: Well let me ask you a question. Am I the Ultimate Fighting Champion?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, no. But...

name: pete
dialogue: Well I’m not going to stop until I’m the Ultimate Fighting Champion.

name: monica
dialogue: That guy stood on your neck until you passed out!

name: pete
dialogue: Let me tell you a story. When I set out to create Moss 865, do you think it just happened overnight? No. There was Moss 1, that burnt down my Dad’s garage, there was Moss 2 that would only schedule appointments in January, and 862 others that I learned from, just like I learned from this fight, never to let a guy stand on my neck.

name: monica
dialogue: You didn’t know that already?

name: pete
dialogue: Look, I’m going to get better. Okay? I promise you.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, just get a lot better.  Fast.

name: pete
dialogue: Oh, one other thing. Hoshi thinks that you being ringside may have affected my concentration.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah. That-that was the problem.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey! How long until Pete’s fight?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, about five minutes. Right now they’re interviewing his opponent. Apparently he trains by going to Iran and pulling the arms off thieves.

name: ross
dialogue: Hot dog?

name: monica
dialogue: Four, please.  I’m really nervous.  Thank you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: So Ross, how umm, how did it go with Bonnie?

name: ross
dialogue: What? Oh! I got to tell you, I-I wasn’t expecting to like her at all, I mean I actually wasn’t expecting to like anyone right now, but she’s really terrific.

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH, that’s too bad!

name: ross
dialogue: No, I-I’m saying I liked her.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, you know what, there are other fish in the sea.

name: ross
dialogue: Pheebs, I think she’s great. Okay? We’re going out again.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, I hear you! Are you capable of talking about any thing else?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey! Which one’s my turkey burger?

name: ross
dialogue: Ahh, the one next to my foot. Sorry.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, the fight’s starting!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, we’ll be right in.  So ah, did your boss try to slap you again today?

name: chandler
dialogue: Nine times! Okay, I had to put on lotion! But, it’s going to be okay, because as of tomorrow I’m conducting an experiment, and if all goes as planned, my butt will be smack free.

name: joey
dialogue: Fight’s over!

name: chandler
dialogue: Excuse me, Doug?  Hey there sports fan!!

name: doug
dialogue: Bing! You got those numbers for me?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, I ah, I didn’t do them.

name: doug
dialogue: Oh, you forgot?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, no I just ah, didn’t do them. Instead, I ah, hung out with a couple of friends and had a couple of beers so I certainly don’t deserve any praise, verbal or otherwise.

name: doug
dialogue: Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi Bridge never looked smaller.  That’s okay, you’re still my number one guy!  Bing!

name: chandler
dialogue: Doug!!

name: doug
dialogue: Hmm.

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m a little bit uncomfortable with the that way you express yourself.

name: doug
dialogue: Oh, is it the swearing? I mean is it the constant swearing? Because I got to tell you, if it is, you can just... kiss my ass!

name: chandler
dialogue: No, no. It-it’s not about the swearing, it’s more about ah, the way, that you ah, occasionally, concentrate, your enthusiasm on my buttock.

name: doug
dialogue: Oh?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, and don’t get me wrong, I appreciate the sentiment. It’s just that I, I have a rather, sensitive posterior, and ah, besides, it’s making all the other guys jealous.

name: doug
dialogue: Well, say no more. You know it takes guts to bring this up. Bing! You’re okay.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay.

name: doug
dialogue: Ha!  Ah!

name: chandler
dialogue: Ah!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay. Would you rather live in the shirt pocket of a sweaty giant, or inside his shower drain?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God! Phoebe look, it’s Ross and that girl.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No! No! Look at that!  It’s a line of ants! They’re working as a team!

name: rachel
dialogue: Phoebe!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is breaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let’s go.

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on Phoebe, look at that! They are not breaking up, look at them. Okay that’s, you know what that is? That is a, that is a second date, that’s what that is! Look at that, she just put her hand on his thigh...

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh no! That really is nothing, she is very sexually aggressive.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH!  Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now he loves her, he’s going to marry her, and this is all your fault.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You said it was okay!

name: rachel
dialogue: You said she was bald!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?! What-what-what-what-what?!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Phoebe, we can’t, we just can’t just let it happen! Okay, we have to do something! We have to break them up! Okay? Just go in there and like, shave her head! You owe me one bald girl!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, first of all, breathe. Second of all, I don’t get it. Aren’t you the one that decided that you didn’t want to be with Ross?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well isn’t he your friend? Don’t you want him to be happy?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes.

name: phoebe
dialogue: So?

name: rachel
dialogue: I just you know, I didn’t expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff. Ooo-ooh!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh no.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, we killed them all.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh!

name: pete
dialogue: It’s okay, it’s not as bad as it looks, it’s a precaution. Ah, I’m not supposed to move my spine.

name: monica
dialogue: Please tell me you’re stopping now.

name: pete
dialogue: I’m fine! I’d fight tonight, if they’d let me.  See this circle I’m marking off here? This is my zone of terror.

name: monica
dialogue: You are insane! You-you got to give this up!

name: pete
dialogue: I can’t until I’m the ultimate fighter. I will do it. I’m telling you, the day will come when children will argue over who will win a fight, me or Superman. Now, I’m not saying I could beat Superman, but you know, kids are stupid.

name: monica
dialogue: Sit down. All right? Please, just listen to me. You are terrible at this! Okay? You are the worst ultimate fighter ever! Ever!!

name: pete
dialogue: You know I have a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture in my right forearm, and a severely bruised Adam’s Apple, but that really hurt.

name: monica
dialogue: Well then, you know what? I care about you to much to watch you hurt yourself like this. So if you have to do this, then you’re going to have to do it without me.

name: pete
dialogue: Well if you’re asking me to quit, then you’re asking me to be someone I’m not. I’ve got to do this.

name: monica
dialogue: Then I’ve got to go. Bye.

name: pete
dialogue: Mon-Monica?

name: monica
dialogue: Yes?

name: pete
dialogue: Could you leave a note? because I’m on a lot of pain killers now, and I don’t know if I’ll remember this tomorrow.

name: doug
dialogue: So, in conclusion, the lines all go up , so I’m happy. Great job team! Tomorrow at 8

name: chandler
dialogue: Thank you, sir.

name: stevens
dialogue: Oh, excuse me. I forgot my briefcase you know, by accident.

name: doug
dialogue: Of course, you did. Forgot something else too you bastard!   Well, what about you? You’re not feeling left out or anything are you?

name: chandler
dialogue: No. No, not at all, that’s-that’s ridiculous.

name: doug
dialogue: Everybody else got one, and you want one too. Don’t you?

name: chandler
dialogue: Ye-ye-yeah, yes I do!

name: doug
dialogue: Now get on out of here, you!

name: tv announcer
dialogue: Pete Becker is circling the ring now. It looks like, he’s just trying to feel him out. Oh, Bruiser is just...

name: chandler
dialogue: Run! Run you crazy, rich freak!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, I can’t watch this.

name: monica
dialogue: Really?!

name: joey
dialogue: No-o-o!!

name: all
dialogue: Oh! Oh!

dialogue: Well, this is ironic. Of your last two boyfriends, Richard didn’t want to have kids, and from the looks of it, now Pete can’t.

name: all
dialogue: OH!!

name: chandler
dialogue: So ah, your first sexual experience was with a woman?!

name: bonnie
dialogue: All right, I was 15, it was my best friend, Ruth, and we got drunk on that hard cider, and then suddenly, I don’t know, we were, we were making out.

name: chandler
dialogue: Tell it again.  Seriously.

name: rachel
dialogue: I mean is that woman capable of talking about anything else but sex?

dialogue: Yeah, sure. Well you know, earlier she was talking about geography.

name: monica
dialogue: Joey, she was listing the countries she’s done it in.

name: joey

name: chandler

name: phoebe
dialogue: You know what that means?

name: joey
dialogue: That you’re actually 50?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No-no, that’s not, that’s not me Phoebe, that’s her pal Phoebe. According to her high school yearbook, they were like B.F.F.  Best Friends Forever.

name: all
dialogue: Oh!

name: rachel
dialogue: That is so cool.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I know! So this woman probably could like have all kinds of stories about my parents, and she might even know like where my Dad is. So I looked her up, and she lives out by the beach. So maybe this weekend we could go to the beach?

name: all
dialogue: Yeah! Yeah, we can!

name: ross

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, big, fat bummer.

name: phoebe

name: monica
dialogue: Would you look at them. Am I ever going to find a boyfriend again? I going to die an old maid.

dialogue: You’re not going to die an old maid, maybe an old spinster cook.

name: monica
dialogue: Thanks!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey now besides, if worst comes to worst, I’ll be your boyfriend.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah right.

name: chandler
dialogue: Why is that so funny?

name: monica
dialogue: You made a joke right? So I laughed.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ha-ha-ha. A little to hard. What am I not ah, boyfriend material?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, no. You’re Chandler. You know, Chandler!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, so we’ve established my name, and hit me. But theoretically you know, I mean say we weren’t friends, say it’s a blind date. I show up at your door, and I’m like  “Hey, nice to meet, you. Hey, oh-hey.”

name: monica
dialogue: Well I’d probably be scared of a guy using a fake voice.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, hey! Oh good, you brought food!

name: joey

name: chandler, monica, and joey
dialogue: Hey!!

name: joey
dialogue: Woo-hoo! All right! Yeah!

name: phoebe

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah? What about ah, that bike messenger you hit?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, I wasn’t talking about his karma.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: Seriously, where did you get the hat?

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross gave it to me.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, I think she looks good.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, thank you.

name: chandler
dialogue: Buy it for you, or win it for you?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well excuse me, my fashion-impaired friends, I am here to tell you that hats are back.

name: phoebe
dialogue: And this time, they’ve ganged up to form one giant, super hat.

name: ross
dialogue: Go, go, go!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah, now everybody wants to be under this hat!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oy!!

name: monica
dialogue: What’s with all this sand?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, yeah, Bob said there might be flood damage.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, either that, or he has a really big cat.

name: p senior
dialogue: Well, yes, it’s kind of an unusual house. It has umm, three beautiful bedrooms and ah, no baths. But you know, the ocean is right there.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Knock, knock, knock.

name: p senior
dialogue: Ah, oh, hang on a second.  Come in, come in.  All right, so think about it, and call me back.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Are you ah, Phoebe Abott?

name: p senior
dialogue: Ahh, yes.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hi Phoebe Abott, I’m your best friends daughter!

name: p senior
dialogue: You’re Erwin’s daughter?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, I-I mean your-your old best friend, here.  Lily, from high school. Remember?

name: p senior
dialogue: Oh gosh, Lily, yes. Of course I remember Lily. I... Then you must be?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Phoebe.  Phoebe. Phoebe, yeah. She named me after you I guess.

name: p senior
dialogue: Uh-huh. Wow! Well, look! There’s Frank.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes!! Yes! Yes! Yes!! That’s my Dad, that’s Frank! Yeah! I’m sorry I’m getting all flingy.

name: p senior
dialogue: Take it easy--if you want, there’s cookies on the counter, or, or--sangria!  I can make sangria!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No-no, sorry. Cookies are good, thanks.

name: p senior
dialogue: Oh.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, so, umm, anyway umm, I’ve been, I’ve been looking for my Father, and umm, have you heard from him, or seen him?

name: p senior
dialogue: Oh no, I-I’m sorry, I guess we lost track of everybody after high school.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, okay. Well, so tell me everything about my parents. Everything.

name: p senior
dialogue: OH, well. You know we were always together, in fact the had a nickname for the three of us.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, what? What was it?

name: p senior
dialogue: The three losers. Oh, poor Lily.  Oh, you know I-I heard about what happened, that must have been just terrible for you, losing your mother that way.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, no, it was great.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, you know what a really good rainy day game is?

name: monica
dialogue: What?!

name: joey
dialogue: I mean naked game. Strip poker, we should totally play strip poker.

name: all
dialogue: No, no!

name: monica
dialogue: What are you crazy?!

name: joey
dialogue: Come on! When you go away, you-you have to play, it’s like a law!

name: rachel
dialogue: All done!

name: monica
dialogue: Aww, thank you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, who’s next?!

name: ross
dialogue: No-o-o!  No way!

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on, please?! I’m bored! You let me do it once before.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah well, if ah, if that’s the rule this weekend...  No!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes!

name: ross
dialogue: Get away!

name: rachel
dialogue: Just once!

name: ross
dialogue: Stay away!

name: rachel
dialogue: Take it like a man, Ross!

name: ross
dialogue: No!  No!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, come on!

name: chandler
dialogue: Big bullies!!

name: ross
dialogue: Ow! Ow! Oh, no-no-no!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, so, how are we doing?

name: chandler
dialogue: Bored and bored!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, you know what naked card game is never boring?

name: all
dialogue: No!!

name: monica
dialogue: So what’s Phoebe like?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I’m kind, caring, and sweet. What’s Monica like?

name: monica
dialogue: Ah no, the other Phoebe, the one you went to go see.

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH, I think she knows where my Dad is.

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: rachel
dialogue: Really?!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh well, where is he?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: She was acting, she was pretending like she hasn’t heard from him on years, but I found this picture on her fridge, and look ! Isn’t this what he would look like now?

name: monica
dialogue: Totally familiar.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, yeah.

name: the guys
dialogue: Yeah!

name: monica
dialogue: Well, why would she lie to you?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don’t know, but we’re having dinner tomorrow night, so I figured, she’s going to tell me then. You know maybe she just wanted to give him time to, buy me presents, I don’t know! So, you’re all bored?

name: all
dialogue: OH!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes!

name: phoebe
dialogue: All right, I’m going to close my eyes and point to someone, and you, whoever I point has to come up with something fun for us to do, and we have to do it.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, all right.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.

name: joey
dialogue: Fan out! Fan out!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.  Ooh, you know we could just do this.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, umm, we all have to play strip poker.

name: joey
dialogue: OH YES!!!!!

name: monica
dialogue: Strip Happy Days Game?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, well, I couldn’t find any cards, so it was either this or Strip Bag Of Old Knitting Stuff.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay,  Fonzy gives you two thumbs up, collect two cool points. Yeah.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Monica, if you get five cool points, you get to make somebody take off one item of clothing. It hasn’t happened yet, but we’re all very excited.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, come on!  Daddy needs a new pair of electromagnetic microscopes for the Prehistoric Forensics Department!   Okay.  Take Pinky Tuscadero up to Inspiration Point, collect three cool points!! Yeah! Which gives me five, and let’s see who is going to lose their clothes. Ummmm, I think I pick our strip poker sponsor Mr. Joey Tribbiani.

name: the girls
dialogue: Woo-hooooo!!!!

name: joey
dialogue: All right, relax. It’s just a shoe.

name: all
dialogue: Wooooo!!!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, your band is playing at Arnold’s, collect three cool points. Which means, I have five, and that means I get Joey’s boxers!

name: joey
dialogue: Fine. Gang up on me! I got you all right where I want you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Come on, take ‘them off!!

name: joey
dialogue: Actually, you know it’s kind of cold, so how about I keep my boxers on, and give you all a peek at the good stuff?

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, I’m going to make more margaritas!

name: ross
dialogue: Whoa, hey! What are doing? Trying to get me drunk?

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m just making margaritas.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: monica
dialogue: I think I’ll help her out.   What is going on here?

name: rachel
dialogue: What?!

name: monica
dialogue: You painting his toenails?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, come on!

name: monica
dialogue: Chasing him all around the room?

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica, please?

name: monica
dialogue: He’s totally flirting with you too.

name: rachel
dialogue: He is, isn’t he? I don’t know, I don’t know, I mean maybe it’s just being here at the beach together or, I don’t know. But it’s like something...

dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!  Hi Bonnie!

name: bonnie
dialogue: Hi! My boss let me off early, so I took the train.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh.

dialogue: What are you guys doing?!

dialogue: We’re playing Strip Happy Days Game!

dialogue: Cool! I’ll catch up!

dialogue: So, you still don’t think I’m boyfriend material?

dialogue: Huh?

dialogue: I saw you checking me out during the game last night.

name: monica
dialogue: You didn’t even take off your pants.

dialogue: Yeah, well, lucky for you.

name: monica
dialogue: What?

name: chandler
dialogue: I don’t know.
