dialogue: Well! Is everybody else having just the best time?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Shh! Shh! Joey’s asleep.

name: phoebe
dialogue: After he passed out, we put the sand around him to keep him warm.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well I assume the ah, happy couple isn’t up yet. Did you guys hear them last night?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, yeah, I don’t know what they were doing, but at one point sea turtles actually came up to the house.

name: ross
dialogue: Good morning.

name: all
dialogue: Hey.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Hey! How did everybody sleep?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, great.

name: monica
dialogue: Like a log.

name: ross and bonnie
dialogue: Us too.

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m going for a walk.

name: ross
dialogue: Good morning. Nice breasts by the way.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Hey, what happened to you?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, ah nothing’. I just felt like hanging’ out here and reading.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Oh, the water was so great! We jumped off this pier and my suit came off.

name: rachel
dialogue: oh, sorry I missed that.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Yeah, Joey and Chandler sure are funny.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH-ha-ha!

name: bonnie
dialogue: I think I brought back half of the beach in my hair. It was so much easier when I used to shave my head.

name: rachel
dialogue: You know, I got to tell you, I just loved your look when you were bald.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Really?!

name: rachel
dialogue: OH!

name: bonnie
dialogue: Because I think about shaving it all off again sometime.

name: rachel
dialogue: Really?!

name: bonnie
dialogue: Yeah!

name: rachel
dialogue: I mean you definitely should do that.

name: bonnie
dialogue: You know what, I should do it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah!

name: bonnie
dialogue: Yeah, thank you Rachel, you are so cool.

name: rachel
dialogue: Aww, stop. Come on. Now go shave that head!

name: bonnie
dialogue: All right.

name: joey
dialogue: What’s the matter, Pheebs?

name: phoebe
dialogue: She cancelled! My namesake cancelled on me!

name: joey
dialogue: What?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, she clamed she had to go out of town suddenly. She’s avoiding me, she doesn’t want to tell me where my Father is. She knows, and she won’t tell me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Aww Pheebs, that sucks!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, well, don’t “Aww Pheebs, that sucks!” me yet.

name: chandler
dialogue: Where you going?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, she’s out of town so, there’s got to be something in her house that tells me where my Father is.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, Pheebs, some people call that breaking and entering.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, are any of those people here?!

name: all
dialogue: Oh, no!! No, no!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, look I-I-I do something nice, okay? I’ll-I’ll fill her ice trays.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Hey, everybody!

name: all
dialogue: Wow!!

name: ross
dialogue: Wh-haa-haa! Look what ‘cha did!

name: bonnie
dialogue: You want to touch it?

name: ross
dialogue: Nooo, but it, but it’s great.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Come on, touch it!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.  You can feel all the bones in your skull.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi!

name: ross
dialogue: I was having a little chat with ah, Bonnie, and ah, guess what, she-she happened to bring up you know, who was behind the um, whole head shaving idea, and now, who was it? Oh, that’s right, that’s right, it was you!

name: rachel
dialogue: That was her idea, I just gave her a nudge.

name: ross
dialogue: She said you gave her the razor!

name: bonnie
dialogue: Hey guys.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: bonnie
dialogue: So, anyone up for a midnight dip in the ocean?

name: ross
dialogue: Ahh, no, I’m good.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Okay, I’ll see you in a bit.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, have fun! Woo!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on see, she doesn’t look that bad.

name: ross
dialogue: You can see the moonlight bouncing off her head! What the hell were you thinking?!!

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t know.

name: ross
dialogue: You don’t know?! Rach, you balded my girlfriend!

name: rachel
dialogue: All right! Ross, do you think it’s easy for me to see you with somebody else?

name: ross
dialogue: You know, hey! You’re the one who ended it, remember?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, because I was mad at you, not because I stopped loving you!

name: ross
dialogue: You still love me?

name: rachel
dialogue: No.

name: ross
dialogue: You still love me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, y-yeah, so, you-you love me!

name: ross
dialogue: No, nnnnn. What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you want to, get back together?

name: rachel
dialogue: No! Maybe! I, I don’t know. Ross, I still can’t forgive you for what you did, I can’t, I just, but sometimes when I’m with you I just, I feel so...

name: ross
dialogue: What?!

name: rachel
dialogue: I just, I feel, I-I just...

name: ross
dialogue: What?

name: rachel
dialogue: I feel...

name: chandler
dialogue: No!! I don’t care! I’m not, I’m not going to playing one-on-one strip poker with you for practice!

name: joey
dialogue: But I made cards!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well! Good night.  I’m going upstairs.

name: joey and chandler
dialogue: Good night.

name: joey
dialogue: want to play strip poker for practice?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ow! My ass. Okay. Okay.  Oh, shh!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No! No!! It’s me! It’s me! I-I didn’t want to make any noise!

name: p senior
dialogue: Then don't break in!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: I’m sorry.

name: p senior
dialogue: What are you doing here?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: I-I, came to fill your ice cube trays.

name: p senior
dialogue: What?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Umm, okay, okay, look. I took this picture from your fridge. Okay, because I know that this is my Father. Yeah, this is Frank Buffay and you are standing right there next to him. Now, look I deserve to know where I came from. All right? So if you can help me find my Father then you should! Otherwise, you’re just mean!  So, just tell me the truth!

name: p senior
dialogue: All right, the man in the picture is Chuck Magioni.

name: phoebe
dialogue: My Father is Chuck Magioni?

name: p senior
dialogue: No, no, that’s just Chuck Magioni, I-I sold him a house last year! And I’m very sorry, but I don’t know where your Father is, and that’s the truth.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh.

name: p senior
dialogue: But umm, you’re right. I think that a person should know where they come from. Wh-which is why I ah,  ahh,  okay. I’m your mother.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Heh?

name: p senior
dialogue: You know I wanted to tell you yesterday, but I just, I kind of felt all floopy, and...

name: joey
dialogue: I’m telling you, you guys are totally getting back together!

name: ross
dialogue: That’s not true! Her, she doesn’t even know what she wants! Rachel’s still mad about the whole thing.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, then you got to back away, all right? You don’t need that kind of hurt. Take it from a guy who’s never had a long term relationship......

name: ross
dialogue: I know, but ah!! I really want to go up there and finish that kiss!

name: bonnie
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Ah!

name: bonnie
dialogue: You guys, the water’s great. You should really go in.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, ahh, no thanks, I just had an M&M.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Okay, well good night.

name: ross
dialogue: Good night.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Don’t be too long.

name: ross
dialogue: Okey-dokey!

name: chandler
dialogue: There is not one hair on that head.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, it’ll grow back, right? And she-she’s really fun, and she’s cool, and-and I’m finally moving on. You know? I mean getting over Rachel was so ,you know? You know, and I’m finally feeling sane again. And now if I go up there, and-and I kiss her, and, Good I want to kiss her, and-and-and it doesn’t work out, right? Do I really want to put myself through that again?

name: joey
dialogue: So let me get this straight. If you go with Bonnie tonight, you’re doing the smart, healthy thing and moving on.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: Right, and you go with Rachel, Bonnie’s free tonight?

name: ross
dialogue: Hi.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi there.

name: monica
dialogue: That’s that weird voice again.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay! Okay! Let me try it again, you’re going to want to date this next guy, I swear!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi! I’m Dorf! You’re date for the evening.  Oh come on! Dorf on dating, that’s good stuff!!

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, so we went to the beach, because Phoebe found out about this lady who knew her mom and dad, and I don’t really know what happened with that.

name: p senior
dialogue: I’m your mother.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Eh?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, and then Monica joked that she wouldn’t go out with a guy like Chandler...

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi there.

name: joey
dialogue: ...and he couldn’t let it go, and... I don’t really know what happened with that either.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh-oh! And then Ross’s new girlfriend, Bonnie, shows up and Rachel convinced her to save her head. And then Ross and Rachel kiss, and now Ross has to choose between Rachel and the bald girl and I don’t know what happened there either...

name: joey
dialogue: You know what, hold on, let me go get Chandler.

name: ross
dialogue: Hi!

name: rachel and bonnie
dialogue: Hi!

name: bonnie
dialogue: Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned.

name: ross
dialogue: Aww.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Thanks a million.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, you’re welcome a million.

name: bonnie
dialogue: Okay, I’ll see you in our room.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God.

name: ross
dialogue: I know.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, I got to go.

name: rachel
dialogue: Whoa! What?! Why?!

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I-I got to go break up with Bonnie.

name: rachel
dialogue: Here?! Now?!

name: ross
dialogue: Well, yeah. I can’t-I can’t stay here all night, and if I go in there she’s-she’s going to want to... do stuff.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, can’t you tell her that you are not in the mood?

name: ross
dialogue: No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn’t work either, I can’t tell you how many mornings I woke up with her...

name: rachel
dialogue: Whoa-ho.

name: ross
dialogue: Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that?

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t know.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, yeah.  It wasn’t every morning.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, making it worse!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: p senior
dialogue: So I guess you’d like to know how it all happened.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess you know I was born, and everyone started lying their asses off!

name: p senior
dialogue: No! No! It wasn’t like that I... Remember how I told you how Lily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.

name: phoebe
dialogue: How close?

name: p senior
dialogue: Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don’t even know how that would work!

name: p senior
dialogue: Well, we were...

name: phoebe
dialogue: I’m not asking!

name: p senior
dialogue: Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was stupid and selfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what it’s like to be eighteen years old?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah. Let’s see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off, and I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.

name: p senior
dialogue: Well, I’m so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best parents in the world, I didn’t even hear about your Mom and Dad until a couple of years ago, and by then you were already grown up. I don’t know, you’re here, and I would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, well, everybody does! I’m a really cool person. And you know you had 29 years to find that out, but you didn’t even try! You know what, you walked out on me, and I’m just, I’m going to do the same thing to you.

name: p senior
dialogue: Wait!

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don’t ever want to see you again!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Umm, where’s my purse?

name: monica
dialogue: Shoot! We’re out of soda.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, I’ll go out and get you some.

name: monica
dialogue: Really?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Nope! Because I’m not your boyfriend.  Hey Pheebs, how did it go?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, umm, my Mom’s friend, Phoebe, is actually my birth Mom.

name: chandler
dialogue: I found a dried up seashores.

name: monica
dialogue: Sweety, what are you talking about?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, my new Mom, who-who’s a big, fat abandoner!

name: joey
dialogue: Whoa, wait, Pheebs, wait a second! Don’t you want to stay here and talk about it?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No. I’m just, I want to, I need to be alone.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Monica!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.

name: ross
dialogue: It’s over.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, was it awful?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, it was long. I didn’t even realise how late it was, until I noticed the 5 o’clock shadow on her head.  Anyway, she didn’t want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.

name: rachel
dialogue: I wrote you a letter.

name: ross
dialogue: OH! Thank you! I like mail.

name: rachel
dialogue: It’s just some things I’ve been thinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us getting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.  Wow, it’s-it’s 5

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I’ll be waiting for you, just come up when you’re done.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, I’ll be up in,  18 pages. Front and back. Very exciting.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh.  Oh-oh.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!  What happened to you? Why didn’t you come up?

name: ross
dialogue: Done!

name: rachel
dialogue: You just finished?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very important to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice!

name: rachel
dialogue: So umm, does it?

name: ross
dialogue: I’m sorry.

name: rachel
dialogue: Does it?

name: ross
dialogue: Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole ‘Does it?’ part just another glance.

name: rachel
dialogue: What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice! Look, you know what, either it does or it doesn’t, and if you have to even think about it...

name: ross
dialogue: No, Rach, no. I don’t, I don’t, I don’t have to think about it, in fact, I’ve decided, I’ve decided that, that it.......does.

name: rachel
dialogue: Are you sure?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, sure! I’m sure.

name: rachel
dialogue: I know.

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, there’s a nuclear holocaust, I’m the last man on Earth. Would you go out with me?

name: monica
dialogue: Ennnh.

name: chandler
dialogue: I’ve got canned goods.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, you guys! Take a look at this!  Check this baby out, dug me a hole!

name: chandler
dialogue: Excellent hole, Joe.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh no! No!! My hole!!

name: monica
dialogue: Ow!! Ow!!!

name: joey
dialogue: What?! What?!! What is it?!

name: monica
dialogue: Jellyfish sting! Oh, it hurts! It hurts!! It hurts!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, can we help?! You want us to take you back to the house?!

name: monica
dialogue: It’s like two miles!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, and I’m a little tired from digging the hole.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh damn the jellyfish. Damn all the jellyfish!

name: chandler
dialogue: We’ve got to do something!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, there’s really only one thing you can do.

name: monica
dialogue: What?! What is it?!

name: joey
dialogue: You’re going to have to pee on it.

name: monica
dialogue: What?!! Gross!!

name: joey
dialogue: Don’t blame me, I saw it on The Discovery Channel.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what, he’s right. There’s something like uh, ammonia in that, that like kills the pain.

name: monica
dialogue: Well forget it! It doesn’t hurt that  bad!!!!

name: joey
dialogue: If you want some privacy you can use my hole.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, I’m ready to get the hell out of here!  Oh. Are you? Are you?!!  OH! That’s so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie.  But for you, yay! OH.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: How was the beach?

name: monica
dialogue: Nothing, I don’t know.

name: ross
dialogue: What happened?

name: monica
dialogue: Nothing. I’m going to take a shower.

name: chandler
dialogue: Me too!!

name: joey
dialogue: Me too.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, I’m going to put this  in the car.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, I have to go pack.  It really does?

name: ross
dialogue: It does. It really and truly does.

name: ross
dialogue: It so does not!!!

name: ross
dialogue: She wants me to take responsibility for everything that went wrong in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful to her!   WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh my God! If you say that one more time, I’m going to break up with you!

name: ross
dialogue: Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says here,  “If you accept full responsibility...”  Full responsibility! “...I can begin to trust you again. Does that seem like something you can do.  Does it?!!”

name: joey
dialogue: No?

name: chandler
dialogue: Look, Ross, you have what you want, you’re back with Rachel. If you bring this up now you’re going to wreck the best thing that even happened to you.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you’re right. Yeah I guess I’ll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.

name: joey
dialogue: Sure, it’s hard to forget! But that doesn’t mean you have to talk about it! A lot of things happened on that trip that we should never,  ever talk about.

name: ross
dialogue: What the hell happened on that beach?!

name: joey
dialogue: It’s between us and the sea, Ross!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hi, Ursula.

name: ursula
dialogue: Hey!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, well umm, I know that we haven’t talked in a long time, but umm okay, our Mom is not our birth Mom. This-this other lady is our birth Mom.

name: ursula
dialogue: Right, okay, the one that lives in Montauk, umm-hmm.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You know her?!

name: ursula
dialogue: No, I umm, I read about her in Mom’s suicide note.

name: phoebe
dialogue: There-there was a suicide note?!  Well, do you still have it?

name: ursula
dialogue: Hang on.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me there was a suicide note!

name: ursula
dialogue: Yeah. So how have you been doing?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I, umm, shut up!

name: phoebe
dialogue: “Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I’ll miss you. P.S. Your Mom lives in Montauk.” You just wrote this!

name: ursula
dialogue: Well, it’s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You read the poem, right?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No!!

name: ursula
dialogue: All right, hang on!

name: monica
dialogue: Pass the cheese, please.

name: monica
dialogue: My God, you can’t even look at me! Can you?

name: joey
dialogue: Nope.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey! Phoebe! We can talk to Phoebe!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No. I’m-I’m to depressed to talk.

name: chandler
dialogue: I’ll give you a thousand dollars to talk to us.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, you guys! What do you, what do you think about making that beach trip an annual thing?

name: chandler, monica, and joey
dialogue: NO!!!

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, that’s it, you guys! What happened out there?

name: monica
dialogue: What? We took a walk, nothing happened. I can back with nothing all over me.

name: ross and rachel
dialogue: Come on!

name: ross
dialogue: What happened? Joey?

name: joey
dialogue: All right.

name: monica
dialogue: No! Joey, we swore we’d never tell!

name: chandler
dialogue: They’ll never understand!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, we have to say something! We have to get it out! It’s eating me alive!! Monica got stung by a jellyfish.

name: monica
dialogue: All right!! All right.  I got stung. Stung bad. I couldn’t stand. I-I couldn’t walk.

name: chandler
dialogue: We were two miles from the house. Scared and alone. We didn’t think we could make it.

name: monica
dialogue: I was in too much pain.

name: joey
dialogue: And I was tired from digging the huge hole!

name: chandler
dialogue: And then Joey remembered something.

name: joey
dialogue: I’d seen this thing on The Discovery Channel...

name: ross
dialogue: Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel, yeah! About jellyfish and how if you...  Eww!! You peed on yourself?!

name: phoebe and rachel
dialogue: Eww!!

name: monica
dialogue: You can’t say that!! You-you don’t know!! I mean I thought I was going to pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn’t...bend that way. So..

name: phoebe, ross, and rachel
dialogue: Eww!!

name: joey
dialogue: That’s right I stepped up! She’s my friend and she needed help! And if I had too, I’d pee on anyone of you! Only, uh, I couldn’t. I got the stage fright. I wanted to help, but there was too much pressure. So-so I uh, I turned to Chandler.

name: chandler
dialogue: Joey kept screaming at me, “Do it now! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!” Sometimes late at night I can still here the screaming.

name: joey
dialogue: That’s because sometimes I just do it through my wall to freak you out.

name: phoebe
dialogue: “...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my bedroom.”  Thank you, thank you. OH, and I invite you to count the colours in your bedroom.  Except for you. You go away.

name: p senior
dialogue: I’ll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there hasn’t been a day where I didn’t regret giving you up.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, bye.

name: p senior
dialogue: No, I’m not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the reason I didn’t look you up was, well I was afraid that you’d react, just well like, the way, the way you’re reacting right now, and can’t we just, you know, start from here?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No.

name: p senior
dialogue: Sorry. But just one last thing. You know you came looking for family. I’m family, I’m it. Now, now I’m done.

name: phoebe
dialogue: But, it’s not like we’re losing anything. You know?

name: p senior
dialogue: Yeah, I guess you’re right.

name: phoebe
dialogue: It’s not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have anything in common.

name: p senior
dialogue: Well, I don’t know. I mean it’s not like we don’t have anything in common. I mean I like uh, pizza.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I-I like pizza!

name: p senior
dialogue: You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God, so do I!

name: p senior
dialogue: I knew it, wow!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly?

name: p senior
dialogue: OH, so cute.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I’m-I’m mad at you.

name: p senior
dialogue: I know. I’m mad at me too.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well umm, do you want to get something to eat? I’m kind of hungry.

name: p senior
dialogue: Hey! Me too!

name: phoebe
dialogue: All right, stop it. Now you’re just doing it to freak me out.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh-hooo, I missed you.

name: ross
dialogue: I missed you too.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, I was so nervous about that letter. But the way you owned up to everything, it just showed me how much you’ve grown. You know?

name: ross
dialogue: I suppose.

name: rachel
dialogue: You have! Ross, you should give yourself credit. I mean my Mom never thought this would work out. It was all, “Once a cheater, always a cheater.”

name: ross
dialogue: Umm-hmm.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, I just wish we hadn’t lost those four months, but if time was what you needed just to gain a little perspective...

name: ross
dialogue: WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Coffee house?

name: monica
dialogue: You bet.

name: ross
dialogue: And for the record, it took two people to break up this relationship!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took full responsibility for!!

name: ross
dialogue: I didn’t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didn’t finish the whole letter!

name: rachel
dialogue: What?!!

name: ross
dialogue: I fell asleep!

name: rachel
dialogue: You fell asleep?!

name: ross
dialogue: It was 5

name: rachel
dialogue: You know I can’t believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!

name: ross
dialogue: FINE BY ME!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, oh, and hey-hey-hey, those little spelling tips will come in handy when you’re at home on Saturday nights playing Scrabble with Monica!!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Sorry!!  I just feel bad about all that sleep you’re going to miss wishing you were with me!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, no-no-no don’t you worry about me falling asleep. I still have your letter!!!

name: rachel
dialogue: And hey! Just so you know, it’s not that common! It doesn’t happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!

name: chandler
dialogue: I KNEW IT!!!!

name: monica
dialogue: Gin.

name: chandler
dialogue: We were playing Gin? you know if we were a couple, we could play this game naked.

name: monica
dialogue: Will you stop!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay. All right.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, all right, I think you’re great, I think you’re sweet, and you’re smart, and I love you. But you will always be the guy who peed on me.

name: chandler
dialogue: Wow! That ripped! That ripped real nice!

name: joey
dialogue: How many times do I have to tell you! You, turn and slide! you know, turn and slide.

name: chandler
dialogue: You don’t turn and slide, you throw it out! I’m tired of having to get a tetanus shot every time I get dressed!

name: joey
dialogue: Look, we’re not throwing it out! I built this thing with my own hands!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, how about we, how ‘bout we sell it.

name: joey
dialogue: All right. But, you’re going to have to tell them.

name: chandler
dialogue: Do you mind if we stick you in another cabinet?  They seem all right with it!

name: chip
dialogue: Hey Monica, it’s Chip.

name: monica
dialogue: Yes!!

name: ross
dialogue: Who’s Chip?

name: monica
dialogue: Shh!

name: chip
dialogue: Good running’ into you at the bank today, so ah, here’s my number, 555-9323. Give me a call. Later.

name: monica
dialogue: Chip, is Chip Matthews.

name: ross
dialogue: The guy who took Rachel to the prom? Why is he calling you?

name: monica
dialogue: Because I ran into him at the bank, he is still so cute.

name: ross
dialogue: Monica, you’re so lucky! He’s like the most popular guy in school!!

name: monica
dialogue: I know!!   Chip? Hi! It’s Monica.  ‘Kay.  ‘Kay.  Okay.  Okay, good-bye.  Oh my God, we just had the best conversation!!

name: ross
dialogue: I was just leaving.

name: rachel
dialogue: Good! Because I’ve got a product report to read, it’s like eight pages, I hope I don’t fall asleep.

name: ross
dialogue: Why? Did you write it?

name: rachel
dialogue: Wow! Look at that, Chip Matthews called. I wonder what he wants?

name: ross
dialogue: Well ah, actually...

name: rachel
dialogue: I bet he sensed that I was ready to have sex with another guy.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, umm, why don’t you give him a call?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.  Are you sure you want to hear this?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, I’m sure.

name: rachel
dialogue: Chip! Hi, it’s Rachel.  Rachel Green. Yeah, umm, you left me a message.  Yes you did, my roommate wrote it down.  Monica Geller.  OH.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, that’s right! He called to ask out Monica! That-that’s got to be embarrassing!

name: phoebe
dialogue: ...DUMB, DRUNKEN, BITCH!!!   Thank you, thanks.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, here’s a question; where did you guys get the finest oak East of the Mississippi?

name: chandler
dialogue: Uh-huh, first you tell us where you got the prettiest lace in all the land.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m reading your ad.

name: joey
dialogue: Looks good, uh?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: Stunning entertainment centre. Fine,  fine Italian craftsmanship.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God, you guys are selling the entertainment centre?

name: rachel
dialogue: Why? I love that thing.

name: chandler
dialogue: You want it?

name: phoebe and rachel
dialogue: Oh no.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ahh, Gepeto, $5,000 dollars? Are you insane?

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, the ad alone cost 300 bucks!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right look, I’m changing it to 50 bucks, or your best offer.

name: joey
dialogue: What kind of profit is that?! And you call yourself an accountant.

name: chandler
dialogue: No.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh. What do you do?

name: chandler
dialogue: I can’t believe you don’t know what I do for a living!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I actually don’t know...

name: ross
dialogue: Good, so do I

name: rachel
dialogue: Something to do with numbers?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God! No! Shoo! Kitty! No! No-no-no! Shoo! Come on, you!  Come on. Crazy.  Oh my God.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Nothing. Nothing.

name: joey
dialogue: What? What’s wrong?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I just, I just have this really strong feeling that this cat is my Mother.

name: rachel
dialogue: You mean the mom you met in Montauk. She was a cat?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, no-no, she was a human lady. This is the spirit of my Mom Lily, the one who killed herself.

name: ross
dialogue: Are you sure she’s in the cat, or have you been taking your grandma’s glycoma medicine again?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No Dr. Skeptismo! I’m sure. First of all, okay, there’s the feeling.  Okay, and for another, how about the fact that she went into my guitar case which is lined with orange felt.  My Mother’s favourite fish is Orange Roughy...  Cats....like....fish!   Hi, Mommy.  Oh, I haven’t seen this smile in 17 years!

name: joey
dialogue: Dude, Phoebe’s mom has got a huge peni...

name: chandler
dialogue: Let it go!!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Umm, when were you going to tell me that you’re going out with Chip Matthews?

name: monica
dialogue: Now? Is it okay if I go out with Chip Matthews?

name: rachel
dialogue: Nooo! It’s not okay! I can’t believe you would want to after what he did to me!

name: monica
dialogue: What, that little thing at the prom?

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica! I couldn’t find him for two hours! He was having sex with Amy Welch!

name: monica
dialogue: Come on, that was back in high school! How could that still bother you?

name: rachel
dialogue: I mean why, of all people would you want to go out with Chip?!

name: monica
dialogue: Look, you and I went to different high schools...

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, that doesn’t help me, because we went to the same high school.

name: monica
dialogue: You went to one where you were popular, and you got to ride off Chip’s motorcycle, and wear his letterman jacket. I went to one where I wore a band uniform they had to have specially made.

name: rachel
dialogue: They had to have that specially made?!

name: monica
dialogue: It was a project for one of the Home Ec classes.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God, they told us that was for the mascot!

name: monica
dialogue: Back then, I thought that I would never, ever get the chance to go out with a Chip Matthews, and now he’s-he’s called me up and asked me out. And the fat girl inside of me really wants to go. I-I owe her this. I never let her eat.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, you go out with him.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, really?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah. Just, if it’s possible, could you leave him somewhere and go have sex with another guy?

name: monica
dialogue: I’ll try.

name: ross
dialogue: So you guys having any luck getting rid of the entertainment centre?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, there were a couple of calls last night, but ah, I don’t think any of them are going to work out.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, Joey has a very careful screening process. Apparently, not everyone is qualified to own wood and nails.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Stop it! Stop it! She keeps squirming, trying to get away! Just like when she was alive.

name: ross
dialogue: So Pheebs, how long is your mom going to be with us?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, I’m not sure. I mean, I guess until she you know, gets used to the fact that there's you know, a new mom. You know, I think she’s worried that you know, she’s going to, she’s going to be replaced.  Well, that’s not going to happen is it? No.  Okay, I have to return a call in the other room.

name: monica
dialogue: Why can’t you use the phone in here?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, I’m returning a call from a certain mom at the B-E-A-C-H. I just spelled the wrong word.

name: ross
dialogue: So, guys, am I crazy, or does Phoebe’s mom remind anyone of a cat?

name: monica
dialogue: Ross, don’t start.

name: ross
dialogue: Come on, you-you can’t tell me you actually believe that-that there’s a woman inside that cat!

name: rachel
dialogue: I believe it.

name: ross
dialogue: No you don’t.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, I do.

name: ross
dialogue: No you do—You know what, you’re not going to suck me into this.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh sure I am, because you always have to be right.

name: ross
dialogue: I do not always have to be—okay, okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Jurassic Park could happen.

name: tony
dialogue: Wow! That’s ah, that’s pretty nice!

name: joey
dialogue: Pretty nice?

name: chandler
dialogue: You’ll have to pardon my roommate, he wanted to marry this.

name: tony
dialogue: We don’t have 50 bucks, but would you be willing to trade for it? We’ve got a canoe.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know, I, I really don’t think we need a canoe.

name: tony
dialogue: You got to take the canoe!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, just, just take the entertainment centre, and then when you get home, throw the canoe away!

name: peter
dialogue: We’re not throwing it away! I built that canoe!

name: joey
dialogue: Good for you!!

name: rachel
dialogue: You guys, you’re never going to believe what I just found tacked up on a telephone pole!  Look kind of familiar?

name: ross
dialogue: Apparently Phoebe’s mother also goes by the name Julio.

name: rachel
dialogue: You guys, there’s a little girl in Soho looking for this cat. I mean, you know what that means?!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah-eah! 200 dollar reward, split five ways!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Do we have to tell her?

name: ross
dialogue: Yes, we have to tell her!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, but it’s made her so happy.

name: ross
dialogue: Little girl misses her cat.  Crazy lady thinks her mother is in a cat.  Okay, you know what, I have to go have dinner with my son, can I trust that when you see Phoebe, you will tell her.

name: all
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: Thank you.

name: rachel
dialogue: I hate when Ross is right!

name: monica
dialogue: He is right, isn’t he?

name: chandler
dialogue: You know what, I think this might be one of the times he’s wrong.

name: all
dialogue: You think?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh-no, he’s right.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hi.

name: monica
dialogue: Hi!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, Pheebs, about your mom...

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah?

name: joey
dialogue: How’s that going?

name: phoebe
dialogue: So great. Oh, we took a nap today and my Mom fell asleep on my tummy and purred.

name: joey
dialogue: That’s so sweet.  I’m going to get some coffee.

name: monica
dialogue: Huh? What’d you say Joe? I’ll be right there.

name: rachel
dialogue: Pheebs...

name: phoebe
dialogue: I just feel so, uh.....

name: rachel
dialogue: All right!!

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m coming already!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Jeez!

name: monica
dialogue: Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hello, Chip.

name: chip
dialogue: Hey, Rach! How you doin’?

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m great! I’m great. I’ve got a great job at Bloomingdale’s, have wonderful friends, and even though I’m not seeing anyone right now, I’ve never felt better about myself.

name: chip
dialogue: So ah, Monica ready yet?

name: rachel
dialogue: She’ll be out in a second. So, Chip, how’s umm, Amy Welch?

name: chip
dialogue: Amy Welch? Wow! I haven’t seen her since... So, Monica about ready?

name: joey
dialogue: This is the unit for you my friend. Sturdy construction, tons of storage compartments, some big enough to fit a grown man.

name: guy
dialogue: What?!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh yeah! I got in there myself once. My roommate bet me five bucks that I couldn’t, and then he stuck a board through the handles that locked me in. Yeah. It was funny ‘til I started feeling like I was in a coffin.

name: guy
dialogue: No, you, you can’t fit in that thing. That’s not deep enough.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh yeah?  If I can’t, I’ll knock five bucks off the price off the unit.

name: guy
dialogue: All right, you have yourself a deal.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.  See?! I told you!

name: joey
dialogue: Sometimes I get in here just to get away from it! Hey, a nickel!!

name: chip
dialogue: Here, we are.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! You still have the Chipper!

name: chip
dialogue: The what?

name: monica
dialogue: That’s what we used to call your ah, your motorcycle in high school. You know how a motorcycle is a Chopper, and you’re Chip. Never mind.

name: chip
dialogue: No, I think it’s cute.

name: monica
dialogue: Wow! A lipper from Chipper.

name: chip
dialogue: So you still in touch with anyone from high school?

name: monica
dialogue: Umm. Well, there’s Rachel, and umm, I think that’s it. How bout you?

name: chip
dialogue: Oh yeah, I still hang with Simmons and Zana, you know. I see Spindler a lot. Devane, Kelly, and I run into Goldie from time to time. Steve Brown, Zuchoff, McGwire, J.T., Breadsly.

name: monica
dialogue: Is that all?

name: chip
dialogue: Eh, you know after high school, you just kind of lose touch. Oh yeah! I ran into Richard Dorfman.

name: monica
dialogue: OH, how is he?

name: chip
dialogue: Not so good, Simmons and I gave him a wedgie.

name: monica
dialogue: Isn’t he an architect now?

name: chip
dialogue: Yeah, they still wear underwear.

name: chandler
dialogue: OH MY GOD!!!

name: joey
dialogue: WHAT?!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Are you all right?!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah...

name: chandler
dialogue: What happened?!!

name: joey
dialogue: Aww, man! He promised he wouldn’t take the chairs!!

name: chandler
dialogue: What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell is all of our stuff?!!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn’t think big enough to fit a grown man!

name: chandler
dialogue: So—You got in voluntarily?!

name: joey
dialogue: I was trying’ to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what I’m going to do?

name: chandler
dialogue: BEND OVER?!!!

name: chip
dialogue: ...and then Zana, just let one rip!!

name: monica
dialogue: Look, not that I enjoy talking about people who I went to high school with, because I do, but umm, maybe we could talk about something else? Like you, I don’t even know where you work?

name: chip
dialogue: You know where I work!

name: monica
dialogue: I do?

name: chip
dialogue: The movie theatre, you used to come in all the time.

name: monica
dialogue: You still work at the multiplex?

name: chip
dialogue: Oh, like I’d give up that job! Free popcorn and candy, anytime I want. I can get you free posters for your room.

name: monica
dialogue: Thanks, I’m set. Do you still live with your parents?

name: chip
dialogue: Oh yeah, but I can stay out as late as I want.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wow! They really got you guys. Your T.V. The chairs.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh yeah, your microwave. The stereo.

name: joey
dialogue: Aww, man, he took the five of spades!! Oh, no-no-no, here it is!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! What happened?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, umm, Joey was born, and then 28 years later, I was robbed!!

name: rachel
dialogue: So, how was your date?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, you know how I always wanted to go out with Chip Matthews in high school?

name: rachel
dialogue: Um-hmm.

name: monica
dialogue: Well, tonight, I actually went out with Chip Matthews in high school.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh honey, I’m sorry.

name: monica
dialogue: No, it’s okay, not only did I get to go out with Chip Matthews, I got to dump Chip Matthews.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH! That’s so great!

name: monica
dialogue: I know!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey! So ah, what did the insurance company say?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, they said uh, “You don’t have insurance here, so stop calling us.”

name: ross
dialogue: You didn’t tell her?!  Okay, fine! Pheebs?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah?  Hi!

name: ross
dialogue: Hi! Listen uh, this cat belongs to a little girl. There are flyers all over the place.

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m sorry, sweetie.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, we can take her back with you if you want.

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH. Um-hmm. But you know, she choose to find me. I mean, I have to respect her decision. Right?

name: chandler, monica, joey, and rachel
dialogue: That’s a good call. Right.

name: ross
dialogue: No! No! Look—Hey, enough is enough! Look, I am sorry that you feel guilty or whatever about spending time with your new mom, but this is not your old mom. This is a cat! Okay, Julio the cat! Not mom! Cat!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ross, how many parents have you lost?

name: ross
dialogue: None.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, then you don’t know what it feels like when one of them comes back. Do you? I believe this is my Mother. Even if I’m wrong, who cares? Just be a friend. Okay? Be supportive.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m sorry.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t know what to say.

name: rachel
dialogue: You could.... say you’re sorry to her mom.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I think she would like that.

name: ross
dialogue: Come here, here, come here, come here,  Mrs. Buffay. Sorry, about what I said, umm, it was, it was insensitive of me to say that you were just a cat. When clearly you are also the reincarnated spirit, of my friend’s mother.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Thank you. We both forgive you.

name: rachel
dialogue: So honey, what are you going to do about the little girl?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, okay, listen, umm, Mom, I hope you know you still mean a lot to me. And you’re welcome to come back anytime.

name: chandler
dialogue: Pheebs, if she could come back as a couch, we’d really appreciate it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Come on, Mom, I’ll take you home.

name: rachel
dialogue: I’ll go with you.

name: monica
dialogue: Me too.

name: ross
dialogue: OH! You know, I’ve got an extra futon.

name: joey
dialogue: Dude, you don’t have to brag! We got nothing here!!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!! We are so in luck! Treeger said that we could have all this cool stuff from the basement. Wait right there.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh no-no-no, I’m, I’m paddling away!

name: joey
dialogue: Huh?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Wow! Really?! We get all this rusty crap for free?!

name: joey
dialogue: Uh-huh. This and a bunch of bubble wrap. And, some of it is not even popped!

name: chandler
dialogue: Could we be more white trash?

name: monica
dialogue: How desperate am I?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh! Good thing Chandler’s not here, he always wins at this game.

name: monica
dialogue: I just told my Mom I’d cater a party for her.

name: phoebe
dialogue: How come?

name: monica
dialogue: Because I need the money, and I thought that it’d be a great way to get rid of that last little schmidgen of self-respect.

name: ross
dialogue: Come on, I think this is a good thing. I don’t think Mom would’ve hired you if she didn’t think you were good at what you do.

name: monica
dialogue: You don’t have to stick up for her. She can’t here you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey! Umm, do you guys have any juice?

name: joey
dialogue: Just pickle.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey uh, Rach, funny story. I ah, bumped into Joanna on the street yesterday.

name: rachel
dialogue: My boss, Joanna? Wow, that must’ve been awkward.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, no, actually she uh, asked me if I wanted to get a drink.

name: rachel
dialogue: You ah, you didn’t say ‘Yes’ to that did you?

name: chandler
dialogue: No. No!

name: joanna
dialogue: Hello, Rachel.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, not at first.

name: rachel
dialogue: What is she doing here?

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t understand! Last time you went out with her you said she was a ‘big, dull dud.’

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I think I judged her too quickly, and this time we were able to take the relationship to the next level.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, last time I almost got fired. You must end it, you must end it now!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, come on! It’s not like this is an everyday occurrence for me! I mean usually I’m pretty much just in there by myself.

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler!!  Promise me, you will end it.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, I promise, I’ll end it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you.

name: chandler
dialogue: I hope you know what I’m giving up for you, because she’s not just the boss in your office, if you know what I mean.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah-eh-eah!  Oh-oh, sorry, I-I knew what he meant.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: How’s the hired help?

name: monica
dialogue: Doing great, the quiches are coming along.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: What’s this? Blue nail polish?

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, I thought it was cute.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Ahh, that’s what your Grandmother’s hands looked like when we found her.

name: monica
dialogue: Let me ask you a question.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Hmm.

name: monica
dialogue: Why did you hire me?

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Oh, well Richard raved about the food at his party, of course you were sleeping with him. Then I heard the food at that lesbian wedding was very nice, I assume you weren’t sleeping with anybody there. Though, at least that would be something.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! Did you hear that? She hired me because she thinks I’m good.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, I didn’t hear that.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh yeah, she didn’t hire me out of pity, it wasn’t so she could pick on me in front of her friends, she actually thinks I’m good.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow! And hey, it’s cool if you’re a lesbian!

name: the salesman
dialogue: Good afternoon, are you the decision maker of the house?

name: joey
dialogue: Uh.

name: the salesman
dialogue: Do you ah, currently own a set of encyclopaedias?

name: joey
dialogue: No! No. But ah, try the classifieds, people sell everything in there.

name: the salesman

dialogue: What?

dialogue: Kathy was being really nice and you just walked away. I thought we had a deal.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, look, what do you want from me?

name: joey
dialogue: I want you to like her! But if that is too damned difficult for you, then the least you can do is pretend.

name: chandler
dialogue: I am pretending.

name: joey
dialogue: Well then, do it better!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, what do you saw I go over there and say how much I like her?  No-no it'll be good, I can tell her much I've been thinking about her. That I haven't stopped thinking about her since the moment I met her. That I'm so fantastically, over-the-top, want to-slit-my-own-throat in love with her, that for every minute of every hour of every day I can't believe my own damn bad luck that you met her first!!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, that is pretty good. But you might want to tone it down a little.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey! So, uhh, Amanda just-just dropped me off. Yeah, that is one of the things I love about her, she's...uh, she's old enough to drive.  So uhh, I guess you are not going to mom and dad's tonight?

dialogue: No, sorry.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well where's Amanda?

name: monica
dialogue: Hey Rach, could you get me some cough drops?

name: rachel
dialogue: I mean you know, I'm thinking. You could bring her, and you guys could go up to your old room, and not make out.

name: monica
dialogue: Ross, cough drops, please?

name: ross
dialogue: At least I know she's not going out with me to get into R rated movies.

name: rachel
dialogue: Why don't you just marry her? Oh no, wait a minute you can't, I'm sorry I forgot, she's not a lesbian.

name: ross
dialogue: You see Amanda and I have a very special...

name: monica
dialogue: You have nothing! you are not even going out! you are her baby sitter! You have a 12-year-old girl's job!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, that is so sad.

name: monica
dialogue: And what are you laughing at, Miss `My-keg-sucking-boyfriend-is-stealing-from-me!'

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, so he stole a couple bucks from me! At least he bought me something with it!

name: monica
dialogue: that is mine!! Now, would you both please start acting like adults? And get me my cough drops!

name: ross
dialogue: Fine.

name: rachel
dialogue: Sorry.

name: ross
dialogue: Here.   At least I made ten bucks in my relationship.

name: rachel
dialogue: You know...

name: phoebe
dialogue: Platting goats are platting. Platting down the street. Platting goats are platting, leaving little treats.  Does it even work without my sexy voice?

name: gunther
dialogue: I like it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Gunther, kiss me.

name: gunther
dialogue: What?

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!  Now, we're not actually going to be sleeping in her, but do you mind?

name: chandler
dialogue: Can I sleep on your couch?

name: phoebe
dialogue: And I'm still waiting for my paper mache man. Thank you my babies.

name: gunther
dialogue: Rachel?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: gunther
dialogue: I don't know if you heard about what happened between me and Phoebe the other day_

name: rachel
dialogue: No!

name: gunther
dialogue: Well, we kissed. I-I-I didn't initiate the kiss, but-but I also didn't stop it, and I've been feeling guilty.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.

name: gunther
dialogue: So umm, are we cool?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.

name: gunther
dialogue: I knew you'd understand.

dialogue: So, thank you for the delicious dinner.

name: ross
dialogue: you are welcome for a delicious dinner.

dialogue: Hey what are you guys looking at?

name: chandler
dialogue: Ross and the most beautiful girl in the world.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, come to papa.

name: ross
dialogue: I know!

name: monica
dialogue: Probably the only time I'll ever say this, but did you see the ass on her?

name: chandler
dialogue: Where did you, when did you, how did you...  How did you get a girl like that?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, so what is she, like a... like a spokesmodel, or an aerobics instructor, what?

name: ross
dialogue: Actually she's a palaeontology doctoral candidate, specializing in the centazoic era.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, but that is, like, the easiest era.

name: ross
dialogue: I've seen her at work, but I always figured, ah-huh? But, uh, I made her dinner. We had a great time. And we're going out again tomorrow.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well maybe she and her friends are just having a contest to see who can bring home the biggest geek.

dialogue: Hi. You guys have any wrapping paper?

dialogue: Pheebes, it was your birthday, like, months ago.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I have a call in about that.

name: phoebe
dialogue: 'Kay.

name: chandler
dialogue: Actually, this is for Kathy's birthday. It's an early edition of her favourite book.

name: rachel

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, but don't touch it, because you fingers have destructive oils.

name: rachel
dialogue: Huh. Well, then you'd better keep it away from Ross's hair. So this is pretty rare. How did you get that?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, it wasn't a big deal. I just went to a couple of bookstores, talked to a couple of dealers... called a couple of the author's grandchildren.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, honey, that is so sweet.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, and what a great way to say, "I secretly love you, roommate's girlfriend!"

name: chandler
dialogue: It doesn't say that. Does it?

name: ross
dialogue: How do you think it's going to look when you get her something incredibly meaningful and expensive and her boyfriend Joey gives her an orange?

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, all right, I'll just uh, make sure that uh, Joey gets her something really great.

name: phoebe
dialogue: It's got to be better than that book. Ooh! Like a crossbow!

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, once again, I am sorry. Thank you. Bye.  I just had to turn down a job catering a funeral for sixty people.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God! What happened?

name: monica
dialogue: Sixty guests.

name: ross
dialogue: So, uh, why did you have to turn it down?

name: monica
dialogue: Because I don't have the money or the equipment to handle something that big on such short notice. I mean there's no way.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow, what is with all the negativity? You sound like Monican't , not Monican...  ...Monica. Look, you know, you have been playing around with this catering thing for over three years. Do you want to be a caterer or not?

name: monica
dialogue: I don't know.

name: phoebe
dialogue: There you go, that is the spirit! Okay! Now, if you need money, I will lend you money, but just get moving!

name: monica
dialogue: Really? Cause I'd need like $500 for all the food and the supplies and stuff.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay! It's worth it, if it will get you moving. You haven't worked in months.

name: monica
dialogue: Well, you are not working either.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes, but I'm doing this.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, that'd be great! Thank you!

dialogue: Hey!

name: everyone
dialogue: Hey.

dialogue: Can I borrow the keys to your apartment?

dialogue: Why?

dialogue: You can pee here!

dialogue: We've only been going out for a couple of weeks, do you think I got to get her something?

name: monica
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel

dialogue: Oh my God, it was the best funeral ever! I mean, everyone loved the food, and guess what? I even got another funeral for tomorrow—the dead-guy-from-today's best friend. I mean, it is like I am the official caterer for that accident!

dialogue: Mon! I'm so happy for you!

name: monica
dialogue: Thanks. Like, check out my new catering stuff.  Look at this! I'm an omelette station! Omelette? Made to order!

dialogue: I'll have one, please. Plus my money.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh. Well, I didn't realize that you needed it back right away. I mean, you told me to go and be a caterer. So I went. I beed. I mean, I... I used it to buy all this stuff. But look—I've got another job tomorrow, so I'll pay you back with the money I make from that.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh. Okay. Ooh, sorry I acted like a bank.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.

dialogue: Huh...

name: ross
dialogue: Did homo-erectus hunt with wooden tools?

name: cheryl
dialogue: According to recent findings!

dialogue: Oh, good. Thank you.

dialogue: Dear?

dialogue: Oh, Phoebe, she couldn't stop crying! With those thick glasses, her tears looked giant.

It's either, you know, "that massage wasn't long enough, or, "I don't recognize any of those songs," or, you know, "these sombreros aren't big enough. Bad little white girl!"

name: monica
dialogue: Okay. So what do you.... you think she's faking?

dialogue: Well, it seems like there weren't any tears 'til you showed her the bill.

dialogue: Phoebe, she sounded pretty upset to me.

dialogue: you are a grand old' flag, you are a high-flying flag, and forever in peace may you wave....

dialogue: She seems fine now.

dialogue: ...emblem of the land I love. The home of....

dialogue: You know how you throw your jacket on a chair at the end of the day?

dialogue: Well, like that, only instead of a chair, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of a jacket, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of the end of the day, it's the end of time, and garbage is all that has survived!  Here.

dialogue: All right, look. Why don't you just return the book, let Joey give her the clock pen, and you give her something worse than that. Like... a regular pen.

dialogue: She's really going to love this, you know? The bottom line is I want her to have it, even if I don't get to be the one who gives it to her.

dialogue: Where?

dialogue: Our place, the hall! I...

dialogue: I got something for her.  It's a book!

dialogue: A book?  Is it like a book that is also a safe?

dialogue: No, it's a book that is just a book, okay? It's an early edition of the Velveteen Rabbit. It was her favourite book as a kid. So, uh, just... let me know if she likes it, okay?

name: joey
dialogue: You got it. Thanks man. Thanks for doing this, I owe you one.  Oh, hey! There wasn't any change from that twenty, was there?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, it came out to an even twenty.

name: joey
dialogue: Wow. that is almost as much as a new book.

name: mrs. burkart
dialogue: Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those peepers? Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those eyes?

dialogue: You didn't get the money, did you?

name: monica
dialogue: Maybe I can try at intermission? Phoebe, come on... you know what? Let's just go!

dialogue: No! Hey, we're not leaving until we get paid! I don't know who she thinks she is! Enough is enough!  Hey, widow?

name: mrs. burkart
dialogue: Come on along and listen to...

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, Widow!

name: mrs. burkart
dialogue: ...the lullaby of...

name: phoebe
dialogue: Excuse me. Excuse me!  Thanks. Um, clearly this is a very, very hard time for you. Um, but, um, we provided a service, and we deserve to be paid because you ate that service, and, um, we are not leaving here until we're paid every penny. Because you know what, lady? We're part time caterers, and we have no place else to go.

name: mrs. burkart
dialogue: All right. I'll get my bag.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Good.

name: monica
dialogue: I'm going to leave some cards here. Please think of us for you next event.

dialogue: It's me!

dialogue: Oh!  Ah.  Aw!

dialogue: What?

dialogue: Oh, Ross!

dialogue: Wait! No! No! It's my hamster! It's Mitzi!

dialogue: Oh my god! I'm so sorry, Cheryl. I must have freaked out.

dialogue: Oh, thank god, it's not Mitzi. It's just a rat.

dialogue: I did it! Oh! I finished it! I did it all by myself! And there's nobody to hug!

dialogue: Move!

dialogue: Hey! Hey, you guys, I finished the crossword all by myself! Hug me!

dialogue: Uh... yay!

dialogue: Thanks!

dialogue: Oh, that is great! Congratulations!

dialogue: Thank you! Hey, how'd the catering go?

dialogue: Oh, it was great! The widow wouldn't pay, so Phoebe yelled at her 'til she did.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah. I'm a hard ass.

dialogue: And I'm a wuss. And we should be partners.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah. Hard Ass and Wuss. We could fight crime!

dialogue: Wait a minute, Phoebe! We should be partners. We should be catering partners. I mean, think about it! you are not working right now, and we have such a great time together!

dialogue: Okay!

name: monica
dialogue: I can cook and you can take care of the money.

dialogue: Yeah. Oh! It'll be like I have a wife in the fifties!

dialogue: Hey!

dialogue: Hey, how'd it go? How'd she like the gift?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah? that is great!

dialogue: Aahhuuhhh....

dialogue: Hey.

dialogue: Hey!

dialogue: Hey! Happy birthday.

dialogue: Thank you!

dialogue: You know, uh... Chandler got you a gift, too.

dialogue: No he didn't.

dialogue: Yeah, he did, look... look, it's right there on the counter! Ha-ho-ho!

name: chandler
dialogue: Happy birthday! I'm sorry.

name: kathy
dialogue: You really didn't have to.  Wow.

name: chandler
dialogue: See, you think it's just a pen, but then you turn it over and it's also a clock.

name: kathy
dialogue: Yeah. No, this is great. Thank you, Chandler. .

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, yeah... yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: Ah. Hm.  want to go to bed?

dialogue: I'll be in in a minute.

dialogue: Oh, uh... don't forget your coupon. .

dialogue: Goodnight.

dialogue: Um, thank you for the gift.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, uh, yeah... I just knew that sometimes when you are writing, you... you don't always know the exact time.

name: kathy
dialogue: No, I... I didn't mean the pen. Thank you for the book.

name: chandler
dialogue: Uh, the book?

name: kathy
dialogue: The Velveteen Rabbit. I kind of have the feeling you had something to do with it.

dialogue: What do you mean?

name: kathy
dialogue: Well, uh, when Joey gave it to me, he said, "This is Because I know you like Rabbits, and I know you like cheese." Thanks. I love it. And I know how hard it must have been for you to find.

name: chandler
dialogue: Uhl..ell. By the way, in case you missed that, that sound was, "Uhl, ell."

dialogue: You must really like... Joey... to go to all that trouble for him.

dialogue: Oh, yeah, he's my... he's my best friend.

dialogue: Well....

dialogue: Oh, yeah. Oh, you know, that is too bad that didn't work out.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah. Anyway, he told me about your apartment. And, um, I couldn't sleep, thinking about it. So, uh, would it be okay if I cleaned it?

dialogue: No?

dialogue: I just walked in the bathroom and saw Kathy naked! It was like torture!

name: ross
dialogue: You know if we ever go to war and you’re captured, you’re in for a big surprise.

name: chandler
dialogue: It just keeps getting worse and worse! You know? I mean it’s bad enough that I’m in love with my roommates girlfriend—which by the way, I think she knows. Because every time we’re in the room together there’s this weird like energy between us. And call me crazy, but I think she likes me too. And now I have seen her naked. I mean at least when I’ve seen her with clothes on, I could imagine her body was like covered in boles or something. But there are no boles, she’s smooth! Smooth!

dialogue: Wow! Could everyone totally see up his robe?

dialogue: Yeah! Oh my God!

dialogue: Here you go.

dialogue: Great! All right, so I’ll call you later.

dialogue: Great!

dialogue: Hey-Hey-Hey! Who was that?

dialogue: That would be Casey. We’re going out tonight.

dialogue: Going’ out, huh? Wow! Wow!  So things didn’t work out with Kathy, huh? Bummer.

dialogue: No, things are fine with Kathy. I’m having a late dinner with her tonight, right after my early dinner with Casey.

dialogue: What?

dialogue: Yeah-yeah. And the craziest thing is that I just ate a whole pizza by myself!
