dialogue: Oh my God, is it really that bad?

name: chandler
dialogue: I walk into a room and he won’t even talk to me, he just mumbles something in Italian. And I know he only knows the bad words.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey Gunther, have you uh, have you seen Chandler?

name: gunther
dialogue: I thought you were Chandler. But umm, one of who is over there.

name: kathy
dialogue: Oh.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey Joe.

name: doctor
dialogue: I’ll be right with you. Okay?  Thanks, Wendy.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! How cute is the on-call doctor?

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, so cute, that I’m thinking about jamming this pen in my eye.

name: nurse
dialogue: Dr. Burke will see you know.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh no-no-no, not Dr. Burke. Dr. Burke is out of town. The-the on-call doctor will see me now.

name: nurse
dialogue: Dr. Richard Burke is out of town. Dr. Timothy Burke, his son, will see you now.

name: dr. timothy burke
dialogue: Ready?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey! I’m sorry! That— where are you going?

name: joey
dialogue: My folks.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, uh, when-when are you coming back?

name: joey
dialogue: I don’t know. I might stay there for a few days while I look for an apartment.

name: chandler
dialogue: What?!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, you know at first I thought we could talk about this you know, work it out, but uh, seeing you two together I don’t think I

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, look, what do you want me to say? Do you want me to say that I’ll stop seeing her?

name: joey
dialogue: Look, it’s not about her. Okay? But seeing you two together just reminds me of what you did. And I don’t want to live with some one who doesn’t know what it is to be a friend. So, I’ll see you.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, look, I know what it is to be a friend, I just-I just screwed up!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! You did! And that’s why I’m leaving.

name: chandler
dialogue: All right look, if you’re not going to stay for me, then at least stay for them! Okay, they have had a very difficult year! What with the robbery and all!

name: joey
dialogue: When that guy was robbing us, and I was locked in the entertainment unit for like six hours, you know what I was doing in there all that time? I was thinking about how I let you down!

name: chandler
dialogue: What?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! But if would’ve know what kind of friend you were going to turn out to be, I wouldn’t have worried about it so much! See you around!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, wait! Come on! Just wait one second! There has to be something that I can do! Something! If we still had that entertainment unit I would get in it for six hours and think about how I let you down.  What?

name: joey
dialogue: We’ve got a box.

name: tim
dialogue: Last time I saw you, it was the morning I left for college. And you were just standing outside The Dairy Queen.

name: monica
dialogue: I was probably waiting for it to open.

name: tim
dialogue: I got to tell you, you look great now.

name: monica
dialogue: You look great too.

name: tim
dialogue: You’re an excellent patient!

name: monica
dialogue: So how does it look?

name: tim
dialogue: Well, you’ve got a little scratch on your cornea, your going to have to wear a patch for a couple of days.

name: monica
dialogue: Like a pirate?!

name: tim
dialogue: If that helps you.

name: monica
dialogue: Umm, so how long have you been working with your dad?  Come on, one of us had to mention him.

name: tim
dialogue: I moved back here a couple of months ago.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh. Big family dinner tonight?

name: tim
dialogue: Uh.

name: monica
dialogue: No way!

name: tim
dialogue: I was going to have Thanksgiving at my girlfriend’s.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.

name: tim
dialogue: But we broke up.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.

name: tim
dialogue: She-she wasn’t ready for a serious commitment.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.  So you made her walk the plank? Aye, matie?

name: tim
dialogue: You’re not wearing the patch yet.

name: monica
dialogue: I know.

name: ross
dialogue: He’s coming here for Thanksgiving!

name: rachel
dialogue: I know, it’s sick.

name: monica
dialogue: Why is it sick?

name: rachel
dialogue: Because it’s Richard’s son! It’s like inviting Greek tragedy over for dinner!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, come on, Phoebe, you understand don’t you?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I can see where I’d be your best shot but, no. I’m sorry, but I think it’s twisted.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: What’s twisted?

name: monica
dialogue: Me going out with Richard’s son.

name: joey
dialogue: Eww!! Ew! Ew! Ew!

name: chandler
dialogue: Sounds like a really bad idea to me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Is he okay in there?

name: joey
dialogue: He’s fine!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, you know, Mon, if things wrong out between you and Richard’s son, you’d be able to tell your kids, that you slept with their grandfather.

name: monica
dialogue: Fine! Judge all you want to but,  married a lesbian,  left a man at the altar,  fell in love with a gay ice dancer,  threw a girl’s wooden leg in a fire,  living’ in a box!!

name: rachel
dialogue: So now, what exactly is the point of the box?

name: joey
dialogue: Chandler?

name: chandler
dialogue: The meaning of the box is three fold. One , it gives me the time to think about what I did. Two , it proves how much I care about my friendship with Joey. And three , it hurts!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh hey! Hey uh, you remember the necklace I gave you last year? Can I see it?

name: rachel
dialogue: Why?

name: ross
dialogue: I just want to check something.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.

name: ross
dialogue: Now, we’ll see.

name: chandler
dialogue: Air hole! Air hole!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Here it is! I love it. I wear it all the time.

name: ross
dialogue: The necklace I got you was gold, this one is silver.

name: rachel
dialogue: Huh, well maybe it uh, it changed.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh my God! You actually exchanged it!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well isn’t it better that I exchanged it for something that I enjoy and that I can get a lot of use out of?

name: ross
dialogue: What did you get?

name: rachel
dialogue: Credit.

name: monica
dialogue: I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it!  Hi, Tim.

name: tim
dialogue: Hi.

name: monica
dialogue: Thank you. Come meet my friends. This is uh, Phoebe.

name: tim
dialogue: Hi, nice to meet you.

name: monica
dialogue: And Joey.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!

name: tim
dialogue: Hi, Joey.

name: monica
dialogue: My brother, Ross.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey.

name: monica
dialogue: And Rachel.  And that’s Chandler.

name: chandler
dialogue: How do you do.

name: tim
dialogue: What’s

name: monica
dialogue: Umm, well, he’s

name: joey
dialogue: He’s doin’ some thinking’!

name: chandler
dialogue: What happened? What happened?!

name: joey
dialogue: You kissed my girlfriend!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, I like those sunglasses.

name: ross
dialogue: Like ‘them, like ‘them? Or, I’d like to get store credit for that amount like ‘them?

name: monica
dialogue: All right everybody, this turkey is ready!

name: tim
dialogue: Where can I wash up?

name: monica
dialogue: Here, let me show you. Okay, the towels are hanging next to the sink, and umm, you can use the fancy soap.

name: tim
dialogue: Thank you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Fancy soap? I thought we were saving’ that for the Pope!

name: monica
dialogue: See he’s nice. Right?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, but Monica, do you actually want to be in a relationship where you can actually use the phrase, "That’s not how your dad used to do it."

name: tim
dialogue: Wow! Everything looks great! Where should I sit?

name: monica
dialogue: I saved you a seat.

name: rachel
dialogue: Sick-sick-sick-sick.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, I’ll get it.

name: chandler
dialogue: Gotcha!

name: joey
dialogue: That doesn’t sound like thinking to me!

name: chandler
dialogue: Sorry!

name: joey
dialogue: you know I don’t think you should be talking at all in there! I think you’ve got to much thinking to do to be talking and making jokes!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, okay, you got it!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross, can you pass me the yams?

name: ross
dialogue: Sure! Oh, and Joey’s got the mashed potatoes if you want to exchange them.

name: rachel
dialogue: Would you stop?! What is the matter with you?!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh-ho-ho, we’ve got company.

name: ross
dialogue: There’s nothing the matter with me. See, I’m not completely devoid of sentiment, see I have feelings.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, fine.

name: chandler
dialogue: You can’t tell, but I’m trying to break the tension by mooning you guys!

name: joey
dialogue: All right, look! If this is just a big joke to you, then forget about it, all right?! This means something to me! And if it doesn’t mean anything to you, then you should get out of there, otherwise you’re just an idiot in a box!

name: chandler
dialogue: You’re right, and I’m sorry! This means a lot to me! I want you to be my friend again! I swear, I won’t say another word tonight.

name: joey
dialogue: So are you going to start taking this thing seriously?

name: chandler
dialogue: Absolutely!

name: joey
dialogue: That sounds like another word to me! Are you going to take this seriously?  Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Don’t say that I have no sentiment!  This is a movie stub from our first date! This is an eggshell from the first time you made me breakfast in bed!  This is from the museum from the first time we… were together. Okay, maybe I exchange gifts sometimes, but I keep the things that matter!

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t know what to say, I’m sorry. Though, you’re not supposed to take these.  It’s like a million years old, we, we actually, we had people looking for that.

name: monica
dialogue: Ooh, this always happens.

name: tim
dialogue: Here, let me help.

name: monica
dialogue: Thank you.

name: tim
dialogue: You-you have a very beautiful… eye.

name: monica
dialogue: you know all my friends think this is weird.

name: tim
dialogue: you know I-I thought it was going to be weird, I mean I almost called and cancelled, but it really isn’t.

name: monica
dialogue: I know! I mean it’s like me and your dad, that’s a totally separate thing.

name: tim
dialogue: Oh, I totally agree.

name: monica
dialogue: We’re just two people who find each other very attractive. Right?

name: tim
dialogue: What?

name: monica
dialogue: Nothing. Nothing.

name: tim
dialogue: No-no really, was-was that not okay?

name: monica
dialogue: No-no-no that was good, it was, that was uh, that was a good kiss

name: tim
dialogue: Oh my God! It didn’t remind you of

name: monica
dialogue: Don’t say it!

name: tim
dialogue: No, but it did! Didn’t it?!

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah!

name: tim
dialogue: Oh man!!

name: monica
dialogue: I know!

name: joey
dialogue: I’ll get it.

name: kathy
dialogue: Oh.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.

name: kathy
dialogue: Hey. Listen, I want you to know how sorry I am

name: joey
dialogue: That’s okay. Chandler’s the one I’m mad at.

name: kathy
dialogue: Well, I’m still sorry. Is he here?

name: joey
dialogue: In the box.

name: kathy
dialogue: Chandler?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, he-he can’t talk right now.

name: kathy
dialogue: Why not? What’s going on?

name: phoebe
dialogue: He’s just trying to show Joey how much he means to him.

name: kathy
dialogue: By being in a box?

name: rachel
dialogue: Joey, had reasons.

name: phoebe
dialogue: They were threefold.

name: kathy
dialogue: Oh. Well uh,  you not being able to talk may make this easier. Listen umm…  Listen I don’t want to be someone who comes between two best friends. I just, I can’t stand seeing what this is doing to you guys, and I don’t want to be the cause of that. So, I don’t think we can see each other anymore. I’m going to go to my mom’s in Chicago, I’m going to stay there for awhile. I think this could’ve be something really amazing, but you know this is probably for the best. you know? I’m going to miss you. Good-bye, Chandler.

name: joey
dialogue: Open the box!!

name: rachel
dialogue: What?!

name: joey
dialogue: He can still catch her! Come on, get out of there!  Get out of there!

name: chandler
dialogue: So?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, we’re going to be fine! Get out!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, you did some real good thinking’ in there.

name: chandler
dialogue: Man, this is

name: joey
dialogue: Now go! because you can still catch her! And Merry Christmas from you’re secret Santa!

name: joey
dialogue: All right, who got Chandler? because I uh, need to trade.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, he sees her!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, he’s catching up to her!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, she sees him! Oh, they’re hugging!

name: ross
dialogue: He’s taking her purse!

name: joey
dialogue: Uhh, that’s not them. I’m going to go call the police.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, there they are!

name: phoebe
dialogue: All right, get a room.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay!

name: monica
dialogue: Come on, no peeking!

name: chandler
dialogue: Our eyes are closed and we’re about to cross the street. Very good.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, open up!

name: ross
dialogue: What did you want to show us? Because all I can see is this bitchin' van!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, it’s for our catering business!

name: joey
dialogue: I think I know that girl.

name: monica
dialogue: All right, umm, we’re not going to really keep it this way though.

name: rachel
dialogue: No?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, we’re going to paint over the sword, and replace it with a baguette.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh!

name: phoebe
dialogue: And also, we don’t know what to do with this.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh yeah, I definitely know her.

name: monica
dialogue: Remember that guy from cooking school I told you about that put cilantro with everything?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh sure, Cilantro Larry.

name: monica
dialogue: Well, I’m going to fill in for him as food critic for the Chelsea Reporter.

name: monica
dialogue: Wow, Monica! What an amazing opportunity to influence… dozens of people.

name: phoebe
dialogue: How could you say yes, what about our catering business?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh no-no-no, it’s only one night a week, and plus I get to take all of you out for a lot of free dinners.

name: all
dialogue: Yay!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, in that case——Yay!  That was me hopping on board.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, you guys! Hey, Ross, quick question for you. Are you ready to party?

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t know, I could maybe go out for a couple of beers, but there’s this thing about bumblebees on The Discovery Channel that I was planning to watch.

name: chandler
dialogue: No-no, I don’t think you heard me. Are you ready to party?!

name: ross
dialogue: No!! Gandalf?! Gandalf is coming to town?

name: chandler
dialogue: Kathy’s with her parents, I have nothing to do, so tomorrow we are partying with Gandalf dude!

name: ross
dialogue: Dude, we are so going to party!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow! Okay, dude alert! And who is this guy?

name: ross
dialogue: Mike "Gandalf" Ganderson, only like the funnest guy in the world.

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m going to call and get off work tomorrow!

name: ross
dialogue: I’m going to call after you!

name: chandler
dialogue: This is going to be so cool, dude, we never party anymore!

name: chandler and ross
dialogue: Woooo!!!

name: monica
dialogue: All right, were you guys smoking something in the back of our van?

name: joey
dialogue: Really. And what do you mean you never have fun anymore? You have fun with me, remember that time we saw those strippers and you paid me 50 bucks to eat that book?

name: ross
dialogue: Joey, you are going to love this guy. Gandalf is like the party wizard!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, why do you call him Gandalf?

name: ross
dialogue: Gandalf the wizard.  Hello! Didn’t you read Lord of the Rings in high school?

name: joey
dialogue: No, I had sex in high school.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, uh, Joanna I was wondering if I could ask you something. There’s an opening for an assistant buyer in Junior Miss

name: joanna
dialogue: Okay, but that would actually be a big step down for me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, actually, I meant for me. The hiring committee is meeting people all day and

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh. Well, I wish I could say no, but you can’t stay my assistant forever. Neither can you Sophie, but for different reasons.

name: rachel
dialogue: God, I am so glad you don’t have a problem with this, because if you did, I wouldn’t even consider applying.

name: joanna
dialogue: Really? Well, in that case

name: rachel
dialogue: And that’s I’m so glad… there’s no problem.

name: joanna
dialogue: That’s fine, actually I’m on the hiring committee, so there’ll be at least one friendly face.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH! That’s great!

name: joanna
dialogue: You know, Junior Miss is where I started. Oh, I had to sleep with the ugliest guy to get that job.

name: rachel
dialogue: Really?!

name: joanna
dialogue: No-ho-ho!  Yeah.  I mean, no-no-no-no-no, don’t you worry, I’m sure with your qualifications you won’t need to sleep with some guy to get that job. Although, I might need some convincing.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I, umm

name: joanna
dialogue: Kidding! God, I feel wild today!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh man! I am so excited—I may vomit!

name: joey
dialogue: Will you calm down, he’s just a human guy.

name: chandler
dialogue: Look you don’t understand, Gandalf is amazing. you know you’re never know what’s going to end up happening, you go out for a couple of beers and end up on a fishing boat to Nova Scotia!

name: joey
dialogue: Really?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah, it’s beautiful country up there.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey! Okay! I got my passport, fresh socks, and a snake bite kit!

name: chandler
dialogue: It’s not going to be exactly like last time.

name: joey
dialogue: All right, I’ll see you guys.

name: chandler and ross
dialogue: Whoa-whoa-whoa!

name: chandler
dialogue: Whoa-wh-wh-whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa!

name: joey
dialogue: I have an audition, but I’ll definitely hook up with you later. Where are you going to be around noon?

name: ross
dialogue: Somewhere maybe along the equator?

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hello.   It’s Gandalf!!!  So, are you in town?   Oh, well, well maybe next time then.

name: ross
dialogue: What happened?

name: chandler
dialogue: He’s not going to make it, he’s stuck in Chicago.

name: ross
dialogue: OH, man! Chicago, is so lucky!

name: chandler
dialogue: Stupid, useless Canadian money!

name: mr. posner
dialogue: You have a very impressive resume, Ms. Green. I especially like what I see here about implementing a new filing system.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you.

name: joanna
dialogue: Filing system? Oh-oh! You mean those-those little coloured labels you put on all the folders?  It certainly did brighten up the inside of the filing cabinets.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, they uh, they-they do more than that.

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: I notice that you’ve been trusted with a lot of rather important responsibilities.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, Joanna really has been an incredible mentor to me.

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh. And Rachel has been really incredible in getting my morning bagel for me. It’s amazing how she gets it right almost every time!

name: rachel
dialogue: I-I-I of course, I have more responsibilities than that.

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh yes, well there’s the coffee too.  Rachel can carry two things at once!

name: mr. posner
dialogue: Yes, that’s very good. Now a uh, big part of this job is cultivating personal relationships, especially with designers.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, I realize that

name: joanna
dialogue: And Rachel shouldn’t have any problem with that. The only problem might be getting a little too friendly, if you know what I mean.

name: rachel
dialogue: I love working with designers!

name: joanna
dialogue: With them, under them, what’s the difference? Eh, Rach?

name: monica
dialogue: Hey! My first review is out!

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH! Oh, the Chelsea Reporter, oh, this used to keep me so warm.

name: monica
dialogue: All right, look at my on the back page.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, okay!  "Would I go back to Allesandro’s? Sure, but I’d have to order two meals, one for me and one for the guy pointing the gun to my head."  Wow! You really laid into this place.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, they don’t pay me a penny a word to make friends.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh, I got to go. I found a guy that who could fix up the van for catering.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh! Do you need me to go with you?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No-no, it’s okay. But are we sure we don’t want the waterbed?

name: monica
dialogue: Haven’t we made this decision?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, all right.

name: monica
dialogue: Bye!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Bye!

name: monica
dialogue: Who is it?

name: allesandro
dialogue: It’s Allesandro, from Allesandro’s.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God.

name: allesandro
dialogue: I want to talk to you about your review.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God, oh my God.  Call me on the phone!

name: allesandro
dialogue: Why? So you could hang up on me?

name: monica
dialogue: Look, I-I’m never going to let you up so you may as well just go away.

name: allesandro
dialogue: Just give me a chance too

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey, do you need to get in? Here you go.

name: monica
dialogue: No! Phoebe!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey, Monica!

name: allesandro
dialogue: I want a retraction! Our food is not inedible swill!

name: monica
dialogue: I couldn’t eat it! I had five friends who couldn’t eat it, and one of them eats books.

name: allesandro
dialogue: Well our service is not grossly incompetent.

name: monica
dialogue: The waiter carried the breadsticks in his pants!

name: allesandro
dialogue: Well, you said that we except the Discover Card, which we do not!

name: monica
dialogue: All right, that I’ll retract. But I stand by my review, I know food and that wasn’t it. You’re marinara sauce tasted like tomato juice! You should serve it with vodka and a piece of celery.

name: allesandro
dialogue: Hey! I’m proud of that sauce, it’s delicious.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! You own an Italian restaurant and you think that tastes good?! Where are you even from?

name: allesandro
dialogue: Lebanon.

name: monica
dialogue: Hand me those tomatoes, I’m going to show you what it should taste like! Come on, hand me them.

name: allesandro
dialogue: How long is this going to take? Because I got another critic to go yell at.

name: rachel
dialogue: Umm, Joanna? I want to talk about that interview.

name: joanna
dialogue: I thought it went very well.

name: rachel
dialogue: No! It didn’t! That’s what I want to talk to you about.  Now, just to brief you…  I may cry, but they are not tears of sadness or of anger, but just of me having this discussion with you.

name: joanna
dialogue: Rachel, please, don’t make a scene.

name: rachel
dialogue: There’s nobody here!

name: joanna
dialogue: Sophie, get in here!  You see! Now you’re making Sophie uncomfortable!

name: sophie
dialogue: She’s not making me uncomfortable.

name: joanna
dialogue: Congratulations! You now just crossed the line into completely useless. Get out.

name: rachel
dialogue: Do you want me to quit?

name: joanna
dialogue: What?! What would make you think that?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well of those things that you said in the interview, I mean if you believe any of them, I must not be a very good assistant. you know what? I am just going to pack up my desk,  and I will be gone by the end of the day!  Well, I guess there’s no use to me sticking around ‘til the end of the day!

name: joanna
dialogue: Wait-wait-wait-wait! You can put your sad little muffin back in it’s drawer. If you must know the truth, I didn’t want to lose a perfectly good assistant.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

name: joanna
dialogue: That’s why I said all those things about your flirting and your drinking

name: rachel
dialogue: My drinking?

name: joanna
dialogue: Oh, I must’ve said that after you left.

name: rachel
dialogue: Said what? Exactly.

name: joanna
dialogue: That you enjoyed the occasional drink…ing binge.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God!! OH, that is it! I’m leaving! You are just a horrible person!

name: joanna
dialogue: Wait-wait-wait-wait-wait-wait-wait-wait!! If you’re going to get all sensitive about it! I don’t want to lose you. What if I, create a position for you? I’ll make you an assistant buyer in this department.

name: rachel
dialogue: Say more things like that.

name: joanna
dialogue: You can have your own office, and a raise! Effective tomorrow.

name: rachel
dialogue: I’d need an expense account.

name: joanna
dialogue: Done!

name: rachel
dialogue: And an assistant.

name: joanna
dialogue: Sophie, get in here!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! What are you guys doing here? I thought you’d be out partying with Gandel-worf.

name: ross
dialogue: It’s Gandalf, and he’s not coming.

name: joey
dialogue: So you’ve been sitting’ around here all morning’?

name: ross
dialogue: No! I balanced my check book.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, and I-I gave first names to all of the foosball players.

name: ross
dialogue: I can’t believe he didn’t come!

name: joey
dialogue: So what if he didn’t come! We can still go out and party ourselves!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh-no, you know with Gandalf we’d be out all night!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah! We’d meet, we’d meet total strangers, and hang out with them!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, we could do that!

name: ross
dialogue: There’s other stuff too.

name: joey
dialogue: We’ll do it all, and better! Look, after tonight, Gandalf will want to party with us, dude! Come on!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah!!

name: ross
dialogue: It’s not like we don’t know how to party!!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! All right? Let’s go!

name: chandler
dialogue: And may-maybe we could end up on a boat again?

name: joey and ross
dialogue: Yeah!!!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right!!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey-hey-hey, when uh, when were we on a boat?

name: chandler
dialogue: Remember that really cold morning, you woke up and those dogs were licking your face?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, those were seals, man.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey Mon, little question for you! How do you think this suit will look on an assistant buyer?

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, the owner of Allesandro’s came over to yell at me, but instead I made him some sauce, and he offered me the job as head chef!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God!! You just ruined the thing I was practicing the whole way home, but I’m so happy!

name: monica
dialogue: Can you believe it? I finally get to run my own kitchen!

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, you’ve waited so long.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, Pheebs, quick question for you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: How do you think this suit would look on an assistant buyer at Bloomingdale’s?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don’t know, it would totally depend on her colouring and…  You got the job!!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes!!!

name: monica
dialogue: You got the job?! Why didn’t you tell me?

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, it’s going to be so great! I’m going to get to help decide what we sell, I’m going to have an office with walls and everything.  I’m going to have walls!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, is this the day of good news or what? I got us a job! The wedding reception.

name: monica
dialogue: OH! Umm, Phoebe, I kind of need to talk to you about that.  Umm, well I-I-I think it might be time for me to take a step back from catering.

name: phoebe
dialogue: But we’ve only had one job.

name: monica
dialogue: I know, but now we have this second one and it just, it feels like it’s snowballing, you know?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah! What are you saying?

name: monica
dialogue: I got offered the head chef job at Allesandro’s.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?

name: monica
dialogue: It’s okay, ‘cause you know what? You don’t really need me for the business.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You’re the cook! With out you it’s just me driving up to people’s houses with empty trays and asking for money!

name: monica
dialogue: All right. But umm, I-I-I’ll pay you back all the money you invested, and you can keep the van.

name: phoebe
dialogue: For what? I can’t believe this! I got to get out of here.

name: monica
dialogue: Phoebe, wait a minute!

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m an assistant buyer!!

name: joey
dialogue: All right, so we’ll get a little coffee, and get energized, and we’ll head back out.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, all right.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: joey
dialogue: So, we’re having fun, right?

name: chandler and ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: We don’t need that wizard guy. We hit a couple of clubs, talked to some strangers, and uh, after this, we’ll head down to the docks and see about that boat thing.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m kind of beat.

name: chandler
dialogue: Actually, me too.

name: joey
dialogue: Are you serious?!

name: chandler and ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: Thank God! I’m exhausted!

name: gunther
dialogue: So you guys want coffees?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, but uh, I don’t want to be up too late, so uh, I’ll have a decaf.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, me too.

name: chandler
dialogue: Actually, can I get some hot water with a little lemon? I think I strained my voice screaming in there. Does it have to be so loud?

name: joey
dialogue: I can’t hear a word you’re saying, my ears are ringing so bad.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m just glad I brought that extra pair of socks, you know? I used them as mittens, I didn’t want to touch a thing in that last place.

name: ross
dialogue: How sad are we?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, I know.

name: chandler
dialogue: you know what? We’re not sad, we’re not sad, we’re just not 21 anymore. you know? I’m 29 years old, damnit! And I want to sit in a comfortable chair, and watch television and go to bed at a reasonable hour!

name: joey and ross
dialogue: Yeah!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! And I like to hang out in a quiet place where I can talk to my friends.

name: chandler and ross
dialogue: Yeah!

name: ross
dialogue: And so what if I like to go home, throw on some Kenny G, and take a bath!

name: joey
dialogue: We’re 29, we’re not women.

name: monica
dialogue: OH, here you are. you know, I’m-I’m glad you decided to hear me out.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, I’m hearing.

name: monica
dialogue: I’ve been doing a lot of thinking. A lot! And umm, well, I came up with a whole bunch of businesses you can do with your van. Okay umm, you could be flower delivery person.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?!

name: monica
dialogue: Or! A bakery delivery person.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I wa-I wa-I wa

name: monica
dialogue: Pizza?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Monica!

name: monica
dialogue: All right, I’ve got a whole bunch of uh-uh, stuff in this area, but umm, I’m getting the feeling that you don’t want to deliver.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay. I’m guessing that if you don’t want to deliver, you probably don’t want to pick stuff up either.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No.

name: monica
dialogue: you know what, let’s do the catering business.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Really?! Are you sure?

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, you know I-I made a commitment to you. you know what, it’d be, it’d be fun.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh! It will be fun! OH! Yay! Oh! Okay, ooh, let’s plan the wedding reception.  Wow! You really wanted me to do something with this van.  you know what, I want you to take the chef job.

name: monica
dialogue: Really?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah. That’s what you really want. Yeah, I don’t want to be the reason you’re unhappy, that would just make me unhappy, and I really don’t want to be the reason I’m unhappy.

name: monica
dialogue: Thank you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Besides, it might be kind of fun to form the new A-Team.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, hi Mrs. Lynch! Is Joanna in already?

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: Oh my goodness! You haven’t heard!

name: rachel
dialogue: Heard what?

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: Joanna passed away last night.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God! How?!

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: Well, she was leaving work and she was hit by a cab.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God! Oh, I cannot believe it!

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: I know!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, God. Oh, God.  Oh God.

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: I didn’t realize that she was so close.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, so close. Mrs. Lynch, I know that this is an emotional and difficult time, for all of us. But by any chance did Joanna send any paperwork your way before… it happened.

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: No. Nothing. Imagine, if she had just stepped off that curb a few seconds later.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes-yes, just a few seconds and she’d still be with us—nothing about an assistant buyer?

name: mrs. lynch
dialogue: No, I’m sorry. I have to go.

name: sophie
dialogue: Good morning!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, Sophie, I guess you didn’t hear about Joanna

name: sophie
dialogue: I sure did!

name: allesandro
dialogue: I’m so excited about having Monica come on board with us. Although I do feel bad about having fired chef Emilio, it’s like losing a member of the family. Of course, that literally is the case for several of you. Tony, Carlos, Marie, please, tell your father how much we’re going to miss him. Now, I know that Monica has a lot of great ideas for this place, well, you all read the review. So without much further ado, I present to you our new head chef.

name: monica
dialogue: Umm, I just want to say, uh  that with a pinch of excitement, a dash of hard work, a dollup of cooperation, we can have the recipe...  Are you going to kill me?

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler, joey, and phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: I’m sorry I’m late, did I miss anything?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth.

name: ross
dialogue: 15?  Your personal best!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Where were you?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, which museum?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, answer his.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so she’d have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.

name: chandler
dialogue: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?

name: ross
dialogue: No, I’m getting back down because she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but she’s like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.

name: chandler
dialogue: How can she be great if she’s from Poughkeepsie?  That joke would’ve killed in Albany.

name: joey
dialogue: Done! I did it! Heh, who’s stupid now?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, look at this!  They’re lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Umm, that paper’s two weeks old.

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I can’t believe I missed it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, you know, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know it’ll be Valentine’s Day, then my birthday, then bang!—before you know it, they’re lighting that damn tree again. OH, I want somebody!  you know, I want a man!!  I mean, it doesn’t even have to be a big relationship, you know, just like a fling would be great.

name: chandler
dialogue: Really?! I didn’t think girls ever just wanted a fling.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, believe me, it’s been a long time since I’ve been flung.

name: joey
dialogue: Well, I know what I’m giving you for Christmas.

name: chandler
dialogue: you know what? There’s some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah! Wait a minute, it’s been a long time that I’ve been single. How come you never offered this before?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I have a girlfriend, I’m-I’m happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I don’t like guys with boring jobs.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: phoebe
dialogue: What’s wrong Mon?

name: monica
dialogue: OH, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh.

name: monica
dialogue: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this  on my chef’s hat.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey, maybe they meant to write, ‘Quiet, bitch.’

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, honey! What’s the matter?  Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!

name: monica
dialogue: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me.

name: joey
dialogue: oh!

name: monica
dialogue: I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, wait a minute, you’re the boss! Why don’t you just yell at them? Or, fire them?

name: monica
dialogue: I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, who’s boss.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, Mon! I’m not doing anything, why don’t you fire me?

name: monica
dialogue: That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?

name: joey
dialogue: Good enough to get fired.

name: monica
dialogue: All right, you’re hired!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes.

name: chandler
dialogue: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now?  Og-ee-op, I’m not asking for me, I’m… I mean… No, I’m-I’m not gay, I’m not asking you out. I’m not-I’m not-I’m not gay!

name: drew
dialogue: I didn’t think you were gay. I do now.

name: chandler
dialogue: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.

name: drew
dialogue: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, I’m not looking for any thing serious.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, you know what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.

name: mike
dialogue: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, by the way, that is her full name.

name: mike
dialogue: Oh wow! I’m free for her!

name: drew
dialogue: Oh, wait a second! I didn’t say I wasn’t free!

name: mike
dialogue: Hey, Chandler, why don’t we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?

name: drew
dialogue: Hold on, you know I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh well, that’s uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!

name: mike
dialogue: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I don’t really know what that is, but let’s!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey! You guys, I’m writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?

name: monica, rachel, and joey
dialogue: Yes!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!

name: rachel
dialogue: Pheebs, that’s great!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, yay!

name: rachel
dialogue: But you know umm, Rachel doesn’t rhyme with draddle.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I know but it’s so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!

name: joey
dialogue: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.

name: phoebe
dialogue: All good, thanks.  Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname that’s easier to rhyme?

name: monica
dialogue: Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hello, children!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Have I got the 50 guys for you!

name: rachel
dialogue: Really?!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! They’re buying me drinks! They’re giving me stuff!  Knicks tonight?

name: joey
dialogue: Sure! Where are the seats?

name: chandler
dialogue: Wherever! I’ve got like 20!

name: rachel
dialogue: So, will I like any of these guys?

name: chandler
dialogue: you know what, I’m going to uh, play the field just a little more.

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler!

name: chandler
dialogue: Guys are signing over their 401-K’s to me?

name: phoebe
dialogue: You work with robots!!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes.  Okay, there’s this one guy, Patrick, I think you’re going to like him, he’s really nice, he’s funny, he’s a swimmer.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, I like swimmer’s bodies!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.

name: rachel
dialogue: Op, I like credit cards!

name: chandler
dialogue: See, I’m not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, so what does he do?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.

name: rachel
dialogue: Your company has a fine foods division?

name: chandler
dialogue: It’s a big company, I don’t—if you—I

name: joey
dialogue: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No! No, the robots just work for them.

name: monica
dialogue: All right, I’m going to go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!

name: monica
dialogue: You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, what are you going to do? You’re going to fire me?

name: monica
dialogue: You bet your ass, I’m going to fire you! Thank you.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah! With who?

name: ross
dialogue: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I can’t decide between the two of them. you know the one from Poughkeepsie, even though she’s a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. you know she’s, well she’s-she’s just as pretty, I guess she’s smart, she’s not fun.

name: phoebe
dialogue: If she’s no fun, why do you want to date her at all?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, you know? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that was—if she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasn’t kidding, she’s not fun, she’s stupid, and kind of a racist.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, man!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?

name: joey
dialogue: Damn!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, what happened to your fancy chef’s jacket?

name: monica
dialogue: They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m going to call a meeting tonight, I’m going to fire you tonight.

name: joey
dialogue: You got it! Oh-oh!

name: monica
dialogue: What are you doing?!

name: joey
dialogue: It’s still a tiny bit on fire there.

name: monica
dialogue: Thanks.  I think you got it!

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, like father, like son.

name: rachel
dialogue: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.

name: chandler
dialogue: Really?! I-I thought you weren’t looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, you know, possibly.  You didn’t tell him that, though? Right?

name: chandler
dialogue: Umm, no.

name: rachel
dialogue: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You don’t tell the guy that!

name: chandler
dialogue: Why not?! I’d be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to get—oh I see.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first date—oh, he’s so going to get the wrong idea.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah. Listen uh, I’d prefer it if you didn’t call me Joey. Since I don’t know anyone here, I thought it’d be cool to try out a cool work nickname.

name: a waiter
dialogue: Hey, dragon! Here’s your tips from Monday and Tuesday.

name: joey
dialogue: There’s like-there’s like 300 bucks in this one!

name: the waiter
dialogue: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?

name: the waiter
dialogue: Because we can remember them.

name: monica
dialogue: Because your all going to make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?

name: the waiter
dialogue: Well, sure, that too.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm,  tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere

name: the waiter
dialogue: Can’t hear you!

name: monica
dialogue: A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here.  From now on, it is going to be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!!  Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!

name: joey
dialogue: No ma’am.

name: the waiter
dialogue: Hey! He has a name, it’s Dragon. Do you want to know your name? Check your hat.  We did the hat right?

name: monica
dialogue: What the hell happened?!

name: joey
dialogue: I am so-so-so sorry. I was going to do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, "Wow! It’s been a long time since I had…  327 + 238 dollars!"

name: monica
dialogue: Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!

name: joey
dialogue: And I got to pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You don’t fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and they’ll start listening to all the nice things I’ve been saying about you.

name: monica
dialogue: What kind of things have you been saying?

name: joey
dialogue: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, you know, you know what Pheebs?

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m not Jewish, so

name: phoebe
dialogue: So! Ross doesn’t really decorate his tree with floss, but you don’t hear him complaining do you? God!

name: chandler
dialogue: Bad dream?

name: ross

dialogue: Oh, I’m packing. you know I’m-I’m packing because I’m moving to Yemen tomorrow.

name: joey
dialogue: Thanks for telling me!

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m only going to pretend I’m moving to Yemen, it’s the only way I can get rid off her.

name: joey
dialogue: oh, good one! And Yemen that actually sounds like a real country.

name: janice
dialogue: Chandler! Come on, I’m going to show how to roll up your underwear and stuff it in your shoes. It’s a real space saver.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I know, I do that because it makes me look taller.

name: janice
dialogue: Okay, Chandler, come on!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay.  Joey, trade lives with me!

name: joey
dialogue: Nope.  Man look at this! Ross, I can’t believe you said you’d play rugby. I mean look how brutal this is!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, I can handle it! All right?

name: rachel
dialogue: Please, Ross, you-you got hurt playing badminton with my dad.

name: ross
dialogue: That’s ‘because you’re mom’s dog kept-kept looking at me.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, Ross, look-look-look-look, look right here. That’s called a scrum, okay? It’s kind of like a huddle.

name: ross
dialogue: And is a hum, kind of like a scruddle?

name: joey
dialogue: Ross!  They’re going to kill you!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, why are you doing this anyway?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, you should’ve seen the guy that she used to go out with. I mean, he’s like Joe Rugby.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You’re kidding! And he plays rugby?! That’s so funny.  OH! I see how you did that. All right.

name: ross
dialogue: Anyway, she thought the very idea of me playing rugby with him was like hilarious. So I’m going to show her how tough I really am!

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. You’re right, you are a tough guy. You’re the toughest palaeontologist I know.

name: joey
dialogue: All right, come on look, Ross can take care of himself! It’s not like he’s…Chandler!

name: chandler
dialogue: Thanks!

name: ross
dialogue: Look, don’t worry about me. Okay? I’ll just stay real energetic and stay away from the ball. I’ll uh, I’ll be that guy right out of the circle.

name: all
dialogue: Oh!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, well maybe there was a dog looking’ at him.

name: joey
dialogue: Ross-Ross-Ross-Ross! Stay away from that guy , and that guy . And that one—Dude! They’re all huge!

name: ross
dialogue: They don’t look any bigger than me!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, maybe that’s because you’re closer to you. So you look bigger to you from where you are.

name: emily
dialogue: I’m just going to say hi to the lads. All right?

name: ross
dialogue: All right.

name: emily
dialogue: Okay.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hi.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Whoa!  I kind of liked it.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, I know what I have to do. I’ve got to go Red Ross.  you know, Red Ross!

name: joey
dialogue: I totally don’t know what you’re talking about.

name: ross
dialogue: Come on! The time we were all waiting in line for Dances With Wolves and that one guy cut in line in front of us and I just lost it?! Screamed at him! Turned all red! Red Ross!!

name: joey
dialogue: No.

name: ross
dialogue: You’ll see.

name: emily
dialogue: Liam, do me a favour. Tell the lads to go easy on Ross, it’s his first time.

name: liam
dialogue: You don’t say!

name: emily
dialogue: Good luck, babe.

name: liam
dialogue: Ross! Ross! Come on! Get in here!  Ross! Come on!

name: liam
dialogue: Ross, come on! Get in the bloody scrum! Ross, get in!

name: ross
dialogue: JOEY!!!!!!

name: rachel
dialogue: You…are…not going to believe it! Joshua came into work today, and guess what happened?

name: monica
dialogue: He asked you out?!

name: rachel
dialogue: No. But I was showing him some cufflinks and I felt his pulse.

name: monica
dialogue: Saucy!

name: rachel
dialogue: What are these?

name: monica
dialogue: Electrical plans for the building.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, okay, okay should I be scared?

name: monica
dialogue: I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall and got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wow! If only more people knew.

name: chandler
dialogue: you know you, really didn’t have to take me to the airport.

name: janice
dialogue: Oh please. Every moment is precious. you know? Besides, somebody had to ride in that other taxi with the rest of your luggage, and your friends don’t really seem to care too much that you’re leaving.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, we’re really not that close.  Okay, so I guess this is uh, good-bye then.

name: janice
dialogue: On no! No! It’s not good-bye, I’m not leaving until you get on that plane.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay. Then I guess it’s just, wait here then.   Hi. I need one fake ticket to Yemen.

name: ticket counter attendant
dialogue: One ticket to Yemen?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh no-no-no, no. No, no, no, I just, I just need a pretend ticket.

name: ticket counter attendant
dialogue: I’m sorry sir, I don’t understand.

name: chandler
dialogue: What would you give to a kid if he wanted a ticket to play with?

name: ticket counter attendant
dialogue: Are you travelling with a child?

name: chandler
dialogue: No. All right, you know what, she’s  going to think that I’m handing you a credit card, but what I’m really going to do is hand you a library card.

name: ticket counter attendant
dialogue: Ah, sir a ticket to Yemen is $2,100 and we don’t take library cards.

name: janice
dialogue: What’s the matter? Is something wrong? Do you have to stay?

name: chandler
dialogue: American Express?

name: emily
dialogue: I can’t believe they’re doing that to him! I told them to go easy on him!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No offence but, you know sometimes it’s hard to understand you, you know with the accent, so

name: emily
dialogue: That’s just halftime, there’s more of this.

name: ross
dialogue: Did you see me? I was pretty good, huh? That is one fun game!

name: emily
dialogue: Right.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, could you do me a favour? Could you just grab me a bottle of water?

name: emily
dialogue: Okay.

name: ross
dialogue: Thanks.  I-I think I’m dying. I really do.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, poor baby.

name: ross
dialogue: Tell my son that I love him.  Excellent! Well, okay, I got to have some more fun!

name: emily
dialogue: Ross, they are killing you out there!

name: ross
dialogue: That’s not true!

name: phoebe
dialogue: She’s right! You have to stop!

name: ross
dialogue: What? No! No, I’m not stopping. I’m Red Ross!

name: joey
dialogue: Dude, if you go back out there, you’re going to be Dead Ross!

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t care! I am not quitting! I insist on finishing this game!

name: emily
dialogue: All right, all right, if you insist on doing this, at least let me help you.

name: ross
dialogue: No, God no! That is no place for a woman. Those guys will grab anything.

name: emily
dialogue: No. That’s not what I’m saying. I just may know a few things that might help you inflict some pain.

name: ross
dialogue: I like that.

name: emily
dialogue: Yeah? Listen closely, Devon has got a weak ankle.

name: ross
dialogue: Huh?

name: emily
dialogue: One swift kick and he’ll back off.

name: ross
dialogue: All right, bad ankle, got it!

name: emily
dialogue: And that big bloke with the beard, he has got a trick hip. Yeah. And uh, and David over there, I heard he doesn’t wear a cup.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah? I can use that, trick hip, no cup, okay! Okay!

name: emily
dialogue: And uh, Liam, Liam’s got bad knees. You hit him right and he’ll go down like a lamp.

name: ross
dialogue: But-but, Liam’s on my team.

name: emily
dialogue: I don’t care! You just get him!

name: ross
dialogue: I’m going to go get him! Okay, I am going back in!

name: joey
dialogue: The Red Ross! Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: Hi!

name: rachel
dialogue: What-what are-what are these?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought they’d brighten up the place. They do don’t you think?

name: monica
dialogue: No-no-no, no!

name: monica
dialogue: I know that there’s no hole there, I just really liked that picture.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God! Look at this!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, but there is a wire back there! I mean that switch is connected to something!

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t care! The wires have come loose in your head!

name: monica
dialogue: I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it did.

name: rachel
dialogue: And did you?!

name: monica
dialogue: No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there, I thought it went downstairs.

name: monica
dialogue: But it didn’t. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God.

name: mrs. chatracus
dialogue: Hello darling.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hello, Mrs. Chatracus.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Now, are you sure you don’t want to go see a doctor?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh no! That-that’ll just bring me down! This was great! I mean I-I-I was great! This is a great day! you know what? I’m buying everyone coffee. All right? If someone would just grab my wallet, it’s in my pocket.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, sure.

name: ross
dialogue: No, not you.

name: joey
dialogue: Uhh, look, your eye’s still popping out a little, I’m going to go get some ice.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh, ice! I am so in the mood for ice!

name: emily
dialogue: You were amazing out there.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, I kind of was, wasn’t I?

name: emily
dialogue: Oh my God!

name: ross
dialogue: I made a man twice my size cry. I mean, I haven’t done that since I was four and I washed my dad’s Porsche with rocks.

name: emily
dialogue: You really enjoyed yourself didn’t you?

name: ross
dialogue: Please! Are you kidding? I-I hurt three huge men, I gave a guy a bloody nose—I mean I-I’m not proud of it but, I really am. And it’s all because of you, wonderful, amazing you.

name: emily
dialogue: I think you’ve got concussion.

name: ross
dialogue: No, no, I’m serious. Thank you.

name: emily
dialogue: You’re welcome.  I’m sorry. Did I hurt you?

name: ross
dialogue: It’s worth the pain.  you know what, you know what? It’s not.

name: ticket counter attendant
dialogue: This is the final boarding call for Flight 664 to Yemen.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I-I guess I got to go.

name: janice
dialogue: Oh, my Bing-a-ling. I’ll wait for you. Do you even know how long you’re going to be gone?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, just until we find an energy source to replace fuel.

name: janice
dialogue: Oh. Well, I’ll right you everyday.  15 Yemen Road, Yemen.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, good-bye. Good-bye.

name: janice
dialogue: Chandler?

name: chandler
dialogue: No!

name: janice
dialogue: Chandler!

name: chandler
dialogue: Janice! There you are! There you are! I had to have one last kiss, and also-also you said that you were going to leave right after I got on the plane!

name: janice
dialogue: No! No! I want to see you take-off.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I then guess I’m going to Yemen! I’m going to Yemen!  When we get to Yemen, can I stay with you?

name: monica
dialogue: All right. The super couldn’t figure out what it did. A $200 an hour electrician couldn’t figure out what it did. I’ve had seven pretty serious shocks. I officially give up.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank God.

name: monica
dialogue: I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.

name: phoebe
dialogue: See? I’m doing it. I am totally doing it.  I lost it.

name: monica
dialogue: What is it hon?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I-I can’t find anything that I want to eat! Everything I eat makes me nauseous! I’m telling you, being pregnant is no piece of cake—ooh! Cake!  No.

name: monica
dialogue: Aww, honey I’m sorry.

name: phoebe
dialogue: God! Ooh! What is that smell? It’s coming from the bathroom. Ooh!

name: chandler
dialogue: Wow! Pregnancy does give you some weird cravings.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah?

name: phoebe
dialogue: It’s me. It’s Phoebe. Listen there’s something in here I want to eat, what-what smells so good?

name: joey
dialogue: Is it the shampoo? It’s guava.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh! Wait-wait!  Is it my bologna sandwich?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes. Yes. Yes. I can’t believe it! The baby wants bologna! Maybe he wants me to eat meat? I can’t eat meat!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, wait-wait!  Maybe it’s a pickle?!

name: chandler
dialogue: What are you writing?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, Joshua’s coming in tomorrow and since I don’t have the guts to ask him out, I’m going to sell him a coat and put this note in the pocket.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah?  Joshua, give me a call sometime, guys like you  never go out of style—what did you throw away?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hi guys!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, what have you guys been up too?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, we went to see a collection of Victorian doorknobs and the Cupert-Hewitt museum.

name: chandler
dialogue: Without me?!

name: emily
dialogue: My uncle dragged us there. But, it actually it turned out to be really interesting.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: emily
dialogue: They were so ornate and beautiful, I mean look at that!

name: monica
dialogue: I don’t know how museums work in England but, here, you’re not supposed to take stuff.

name: emily
dialogue: I uh, I got it from the gift shop. They have really lax security there.  It’s a joke.

name: ross
dialogue: Bye.

name: emily
dialogue: Right, I’ve got to be off, I’ll see you. Buh-bye then.

name: joey
dialogue: Wow! You guys seem to be having a good time.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh yeah, she’s-she’s amazing. And-and she’s so much fun. And! you know what? When I’m with her, I’m fun! I even signed up for helicopter classes.  She’s leaving in two days, I don’t have to do it.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh no, two days, you must be bummed.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, she’s got to go back to London. But you know what? I’ve been prepared for this from the start. We both knew we had two weeks together, and that’s it. you know.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey that’s what all my relationships are like.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, but in Ross’s case, they both know in two weeks that’s it.

name: ross
dialogue: Pheebs!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hello! Hello!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes! I know! I know! Yeah! So the baby is totally craving meat. This afternoon I tried tricking it, I made it a soy-burger to make it think it was getting meat, you know? And I got nauseous.

name: chandler
dialogue: Maybe that’s because soy-burgers suck!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Being pregnant is tough on your tummy.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, but at least you got that cool, pregnant lady glow.

name: phoebe
dialogue: That’s sweat. You throw up all morning, you’ll have that glow too.

name: joshua
dialogue: Okay!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, here’s that trench-coat that you wanted.

name: joshua
dialogue: Oh great!  Wow! Yeah, it’s comfortable.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah?

name: joshua
dialogue: Man, I could really flash somebody in this thing.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh no-no, no-no, they don’t want you to put your hands in the pockets until you are out of the store.

name: joshua
dialogue: Why not?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, that’s because of a lot of

name: joshua
dialogue: you know, they ruin it for everybody.

name: rachel
dialogue: I know!

name: joshua
dialogue: you know, I wore that cashmere sweater on a date last night.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh?

name: joshua
dialogue: Yeah, it was my first date since the uh, since the divorce.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, congratulations, so do you love her?

name: joshua
dialogue: No, no, no, she’s nice but, you know, it just it made me realize that I’m just not, I’m just not ready to be dating, you know?

name: rachel
dialogue: Huh. Well, uh, that’s uh, that’s interesting.

name: joshua
dialogue: Hey-whoa-hey-hey, what was that?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, it’s just an anti-theft device.

name: joshua
dialogue: Then uh, what’s-what’s this?

name: rachel
dialogue: You need that, you need that too because obviously, a thief could just tear this up.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oops, sorry. Listen, we-we have to have a party tonight! Actually, we have to have one in five minutes, so everybody cancel your plans.

name: chandler
dialogue: What are you talking about?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, what’ going on?

name: rachel
dialogue: We have to have a surprise Bon Voyage party for Emily. But it’s actually for Joshua.  Look, he said he’s not ready to date, so I had to invite him to a party if I wanted to see him outside of work, and now I have the perfect opportunity to seduce him!

name: ross
dialogue: Well, as much as I’d like to meet Josh and warn him, Emily and I aren’t going to be here. All right? I mean, she’s going to come by first to say good-bye, and then I’ve got a whole special evening planned. So I’m sorry, no party.

name: joey
dialogue: Aww!

name: emily
dialogue: Hello?

name: rachel
dialogue: Surprise!!!

name: chandler and joey
dialogue: Surprise!!

name: emily
dialogue: No one’s ever thrown me a surprise party before!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, it was all Ross’s idea.

name: emily
dialogue: You’re so sweet! And I’m so surprised!

name: ross
dialogue: You really didn’t know?

name: chandler
dialogue: Why are you in here if Joshua is all the way over there?

name: rachel
dialogue: Uhh, because I’m trying to play hard to get. Oh, quick he’s looking over here, say something funny.

name: chandler
dialogue: Like what?

name: joey
dialogue: What-what-what is so funny?

name: chandler
dialogue: I said, "Like what?"

name: joey
dialogue: Now that’s a thinker.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, you know what, you know what? This playing hard to get thing is not working. Umm, hand-hand me those cherries.  Okay. Okay.  Hi!

name: joshua
dialogue: Hi!

name: rachel
dialogue: Care for a cherry?

name: joshua
dialogue: Oh, no thanks.

name: rachel
dialogue: No? you know, I can tie one of these into a knot using just my tongue.

name: joshua
dialogue: You okay?  You all right?

name: ross
dialogue: So we should probably get going soon.

name: emily
dialogue: Oh, but the party’s only just getting started!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, but we-we have to be at the Four Seasons for drinks in 15 minutes and then you know, then The Plaza for dinner.

name: emily
dialogue: So why did you plan a party at the same time?

name: ross
dialogue: No-no-no, no, umm, actually American surprise parties are-are-are very short. It’s usually, "Surprise!" And then, "Oh my God, I’m so surprised—good-bye!"

name: emily
dialogue: But Ross, I’m such having a great time! Your sister has just been telling me that you used to dress up like little, old ladies and hold make-believe tea parties.

name: ross
dialogue: Monica said that did she?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh, yeah. Then what are you going to put on top of that?

name: joey
dialogue: A little salami.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh yeah! Then umm, what goes on top of the salami?

name: joey
dialogue: Pastrami.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh, yeah. You’re a genius.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, could somebody give me a hand with this zipper?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: Up!

name: monica
dialogue: You changed?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, I did. I needed my lucky dress.

name: monica
dialogue: And lucky means, more cleavage?

name: chandler
dialogue: Does for me.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, God! Look at him, he’s so cute. I want to go over there, grab him, and kiss him! How can I kiss him and not letting him know that I like him?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh! I know how you can get him, take off your bra.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

name: joey
dialogue: There was a seen in Footloose...

name: chandler
dialogue: Flashdance.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah-yeah, yeah, with that-that uh, plumber girl

name: chandler
dialogue: She was a welder.

name: joey
dialogue: What? Were you like in the movie, or… Anyway, she takes off her bra under her shirt and pulls it out the sleeve. Very sexy, and classy.

name: monica
dialogue: Or if you want to kiss him, umm, you could use mistletoe.

name: rachel
dialogue: It’s not Christmas!

name: monica
dialogue: Or Spin the Bottle?

name: rachel
dialogue: He’s not 11!

name: emily
dialogue: Thank you so much for this. It was really so thoughtful of you.

name: rachel
dialogue: What? You’re leaving?!

name: ross
dialogue: Yes, we have something we have to get to.

name: joshua
dialogue: Uhh, yeah, I think I’m going to take-off too.

name: rachel
dialogue: No! You guys can’t leave yet! You have to stay, we-we got the whole big thing planned!

name: ross
dialogue: What big thing?

name: rachel
dialogue: So, Spin the Bottle works like this

name: emily
dialogue: I’ll go.

name: all
dialogue: Yay!

name: joey
dialogue: Welcome to America.

name: monica
dialogue: Two in a row! You’ve got to use your tongues now!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yay! Emily!

name: chandler
dialogue: What are the odds? What are the odds?

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, that-that’s enough! you know, let’s, let’s let someone else play.

name: joey
dialogue: If you didn’t want to play, why did you come to the party?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, my turn!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God!! The baby just kicked!

name: all
dialogue: OH!

name: rachel
dialogue: It’s okay! It’s okay! It kicked once, it’ll kick again!

name: all
dialogue: Oh my God!

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, well, everybody just remember where they were sitting.

name: rachel
dialogue: Just a bug.

name: phoebe
dialogue: you know it doesn’t matter how much I’m craving it. you know why I’m never going to eat meat? Because it’s murder, cold blooded murder.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay.

name: chandler
dialogue: There’s a Phoebe on my sandwich!

name: joey
dialogue: Phoebe, what-what are you doing?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: I can’t help it. I need the meat. The baby needs the meat.

name: joey
dialogue: All right look, you know how-you know how when you’re dating someone and you don’t want to cheat on them, unless it’s with someone really hot?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, totally!

name: joey
dialogue: All right. Okay. Well this is the same kind of deal. If you’re going to do something wrong,  do it right!

name: joey
dialogue: Feel better now?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, but at what cost? Six more months, three meals a day, I’m going to eat like, you know millions of cows.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, what if I said, I could even things out for you, meat wise.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, I eat a lot of meat right?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: Well, suppose until the baby’s born I laid off it. No extra animals would die, you-you’d just be eating my animals.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Joey, I can’t believe you would do that for me.

name: joey
dialogue: Absolutely! I could be a vegetarian. There’s no meat in beer, right?

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, we could still make dinner if we skipped the appetisers and asked for our check right away.

name: emily
dialogue: But, we can’t go now. It looks like Rachel’s going to put on a skit.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! Have you lost your mind?

name: rachel

dialogue: Julie! Julie, isn't that great? I mean, isn't that just kick- you-in-the-crotch, spit-on-your-neck fantastic?

dialogue: Ah, oh God. Oh, honey, oh that is OK.

How can I watch him get married? you know it’s just, it’s for the best, you know it is, it’s… you know, plus, somebody’s got to stay here with Phoebe! you know she’s going to be pretty big by then, and she needs someone to help her tie her shoes; drive her to the hospital in case she goes into labour.

I’m so sick of being pregnant! The only happiness I get is from a cup of coffee, which of course is decaf, because—Oh! I’m pregnant!

dialogue: hormones, yeah.

dialogue: So uh, hey, that uh, that wedding ring, huh? Man, that’s nice!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, right!

name: joey
dialogue: I was uh, I was thinking I might want to pick one of those babies up for myself, I might want to get one of those

name: chandler

name: ross
dialogue: Oh absolutely! It has been in my family for generations, and every bride who has worn it has had a long and happy life.

name: chandler
dialogue: So you might say, it’s a magic ring.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, the stripper stole it.

name: ross

dialogue: I did that too! They wouldn’t give me her real name or her number. They said, "If I bothered them again they’d call the police." I said, "If you talk to the police, you tell them I’m missing a ring!"
