dialogue: Well, um, because mainly, um, they don’t like you. I’m sorry.

name: chandler
dialogue: What? What? Why?!

name: monica
dialogue: Maybe because you used to be aloof, or that you’re really sarcastic, or that, you know, you joke around all the time. Or that you take off your clothes and throw them on the couch.

name: chandler
dialogue: Is this why they don’t like me or why you don’t like me?

name: monica
dialogue: Look, I know that I should’ve told them. I know I shouldn’t care what they think. I’m sorry.

name: chandler
dialogue: you know, it’ll be okay. It’ll be okay. Because when they come over, I will be all charming, I will make them fall in love with me, and then we’ll tell ‘them.

name: monica
dialogue: You really think that’ll work?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, I can be pretty charming, babe, I won YOU over, didn’t I?

name: monica
dialogue: I don’t think you’ll ever get my parents that drunk!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey!  Oh, good, Ross! You’re parents like me, right?

name: ross
dialogue: Yes, of course they like you!

name: chandler
dialogue: Well Monica just told me that they don’t.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, they don’t like you.

name: chandler
dialogue: Do you know why?

name: ross
dialogue: I don't know, maybe it’s because you’re really sarcastic. Or maybe it’s cause you uh-

name: chandler
dialogue: Well if people don’t know they shouldn’t just guess!

name: chandler
dialogue: This is great, another Thanksgiving with nothing to give thanks for.

name: joey
dialogue: Maybe I could give thanks for you shutting’ up, eh?

name: chandler
dialogue: Maybe I could give thanks by taking my PlayStation over to my new apartment.

name: joey
dialogue: Well maybe I love you’.

name: janine
dialogue: Hey.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: janine
dialogue: Hey guys!

name: ross
dialogue: No I don’t want to play video games, Joey!

name: janine
dialogue: Are you guys going to Chandler’s for Thanksgiving?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! Yeah, why? What’s up?

name: janine
dialogue: Well, me and my dancer friends are thinking of doing Thanksgiving uptown. I thought you guys might like to come.

name: ross
dialogue: For real?

name: janine
dialogue: No, but you should go to Chandler’s. Because none of us knows how to cook, we’ll probably just end up drinking all day.

name: joey
dialogue: Ye-ye, we go to yours!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, see, we-we-we have to stop across the hall, because it’s my sister. But, uh, uh you know actually, growing up with a sister was nice because it really helped me understand women. Yeah, you-you should tell your friends that.

name: janine
dialogue: Okay.

name: joey
dialogue: How you got three women to marry you, I’ll never know.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey! Hey, Pheebs, check it out. Yeah, for my desert, I have chosen to make a traditional English truffle!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow, that sounds great! And what are you making Monica, in case Rachel’s dessert is.. so good that I eat all of it. There’s none left for anybody else!

name: monica
dialogue: Nothing.

name: rachel
dialogue: Nothing?

name: monica
dialogue: No, sweetie, I-I trust you.

name: rachel
dialogue: So, if-if I mess this up, there’s nothing else for dessert?

name: monica
dialogue: You’re not going to mess it up.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wow, Monica, I love that, you really have faith in me. Thank you. Technical question, how do you know when uh, the butter’s done?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, it’s done about two minutes before it looks like that.

name: joey and ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: all
dialogue: Hey!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, ooh the food smells great, Mon!

name: ross
dialogue: And the place looks so nice!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, hey hey, Happy Thanksgiving everybody!

name: ross
dialogue: Happy Thanksgiving!

name: the girls
dialogue: Happy Thanksgiving!

name: joey
dialogue: Well, this has been great!

name: ross
dialogue: See you!

name: monica
dialogue: Whoa whoa whoa! Where’re you going’?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, oh, we did say we’d stop by this little thing Joey’s roommate is having.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, Janine, the really hot dancer girl?

name: ross
dialogue: Some would say she’s attractive, yes.

name: phoebe
dialogue: And who else is going to be there?

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, some of her friends, yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: Her dancer friends?

name: joey
dialogue: Yes, all right? All of her hot dancer friends are going to be there and they’re going to be, be drinking’ and dancing, and we really want to go!

name: ross
dialogue: Dude, we were good!

name: monica
dialogue: You’re not going to go anywhere, you said you were going to eat here, and you’re going to eat here!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, and-and leaving us to go see hot dancer girls is not very Thanksgivingy.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, but-but it is, uh, it’s just like the first Thanksgiving, when the Indians and the Pilgrims uh, sat down to dinner.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, and the Indians taught the Pilgrims what it meant to be hot in the new world!

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Hello everybody!

name: mr. geller
dialogue: Hi!

name: all
dialogue: Hi!

name: monica
dialogue: Dad, Mom. Look! Look who it is it’s Chandler!

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Oh yes of course, hello Chandler.

name: chandler
dialogue: Mr. and Mrs. Geller, you look wonderful, it is great to have you hear, let us take off your coats!

name: chandler
dialogue: Whoa, snowing out there?

name: mr. geller
dialogue: No.

name: mr. geller
dialogue: Monica, all this food looks wonderful, you should think about doing this for a living.

name: mr. geller
dialogue: Ok, I have dandruff. There’s no need to laugh and point.

name: monica
dialogue: Dad, Chandler was just laughing at your joke.

name: mr. geller
dialogue: My joke wasn’t funny.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Rach, Rach, I just remembered. I had a dream about Mr. Geller last night.

name: rachel
dialogue: Really?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, I dreamt that he saved me from a burning building and he was so brave and so strong! And it’s making me look at him totally differently. you know, I mean he used to be just, you know “Jack Geller Monica and Ross’s dad” and now he’s he’s “Jack Geller, dream hunk."

name: rachel
dialogue: I don't know. you know to me he’ll always be “Jack Geller, walks in while you’re changing.”

name: monica
dialogue: you know dad, Chandler is one of Ross’s very best friends!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, Ross sure is a great guy, you know I’ve always felt that how a young man turns out is a reflection on his father.

name: mr. geller
dialogue: I always thought that too. Tell me, what does your father do?

name: chandler
dialogue: He’s the headliner of a gay burlesque show.

name: joey
dialogue: Rach, you’re killing’ us here, will you serve the dessert already? Those drunken dancers are waiting!

name: rachel
dialogue: Look at it, isn’t it beautiful?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, what is it?

name: rachel
dialogue: It’s a truffle. It’s got all of these layers. First there’s a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch, then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef sauteed with peas and onions, then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!

name: ross
dialogue: W-What was the one right before bananas?

name: rachel
dialogue: The beef? Yeah, that was weird to me, too. But then, you know, I thought “well, there’s mincemeat pie,” I mean that’s an English dessert, these people just put very strange things in their food, you know. Oh! by the way, can I borrow some Rum from your place?

name: joey
dialogue: Y-sure!

name: rachel
dialogue: And while I’m gone don’t you boys sneak a taste.

name: joey and ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: ross
dialogue: Beef in a dessert?! I- no no no, there is no way!

name: joey
dialogue: I know, and only one layer of jam?! What is up with that?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh my God, the pages are stuck together!

name: joey
dialogue: Chandler!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh My God, she-she made half a English Trifle, and half a...Sheperd’s Pie!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh man! Now she’s going to start all over! We’re never going to get to introduce the hot girls to the new world!

name: ross
dialogue: No, no, we will. We just won’t tell her she messed up.

name: joey
dialogue: Just let her serve the beef-custard thing?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, it’ll be like a funny Thanksgiving story!

name: joey
dialogue: Vomiting stories are funny...

name: rachel
dialogue: Joey, God, your apartment is like a hundred degrees!

name: joey
dialogue: Did-did it make you want to walk around in your underwear?

name: rachel
dialogue: No!

name: joey
dialogue: Still not hot enough!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Rachel?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, look at him. Look at those strong hands. Oh what I wouldn’t give to be that can of  condensed milk.

name: monica
dialogue: Mom, uh, Chandler was just saying how beautiful your sweater is.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Oh, thank you Chandler! I just bought it.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, yes. Well it’s very beautiful. It’s cream-colored and tight. I don’t mean tight, I mean it’s not too tight, not that I was looking at-

name: mr. geller
dialogue: What’s the matter with him?

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: I think he’s stoned again.

name: chandler
dialogue: What?

name: monica
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: Dude, I need to talk to you a sec.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, I think I might know why my parents don’t like you.

name: chandler
dialogue: You do? Why?

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, remember, we were young. Hey, Spring break, sophomore year, I got high in my bedroom and my parents walked in and smelled it and so I told them that you had gotten stoned and jumped out the window.

name: chandler
dialogue: What?! Why did you do that?

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t know, aheh, your’s was the first name that-that popped into my head, I’m I’m sorry. I-I didn’t think it would matter.

name: chandler
dialogue: How could it not matter?!

name: ross
dialogue: How was I supposed to know we’d end up being friends after college, let alone you-you would be living with my sister?

name: chandler
dialogue: What about all that “friends forever” stuff?

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t know, I-I was all high.

name: monica
dialogue: Mom and dad just sent me in here to find out if you  were trying to get Ross stoned!

name: chandler
dialogue: Your parents caught Ross smoking pot in college and he blamed it on me!

name: monica
dialogue: Ross, I can’t believe you’d do that!

name: chandler
dialogue: The reason we haven’t told them we’re together is because they hate me, okay? So will you fix this?

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, okay, I’ll tell ‘them it wasn’t Chandler who got high. Now who should I say it was?

name: monica
dialogue: You! It’s not like it’s a big deal! You-you don’t still do it or anything!

name: ross
dialogue: Alright, alright, now-now who should I say tricked me into doing it?

name: monica
dialogue: Dad, please don’t pick your teeth out here! Alright, and if you’re going to put your feet up, why don’t you sit on the-

name: phoebe
dialogue: Monica, leave him alone!

name: joey
dialogue: Will you hurry up? Did you not hear me before when I told you that all of Janine’s friends are dancers?! And that they’re going to be drinking a lot!?

name: rachel
dialogue: No, I did, but tell me again, because it’s so romantic.

name: joey
dialogue: Well you’re whipping’ so slow! Can’t you do it any faster?

name: rachel
dialogue: Joey! Come on! I don’t want to make any mistakes, alright? This is the only dessert and if I screw it up everybody's going to be like “Oh, remember that Thanksgiving when Rachel screwed up the trifle?”

name: rachel
dialogue: So why don’t you just let me worry about making the trifle and you just worry about eating it, alright?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh I am!

name: monica
dialogue: Ross, if you don’t tell them, then I will!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, fine!

name: joey
dialogue: Ross! Can I talk to you for a second?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, uh, can it wait a second Joey? I have to tell my parents something. No it can’t? Okay.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, look, I think we have to tell Rachel she messed up her dessert.

name: ross
dialogue: What?! What is with everybody? It’s Thanksgiving, not...Truth-Day!

name: joey
dialogue: Look, when everyone eats that...that...Banana-Meat thing, they’re all going to’ make fun of her, do you want that?

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, okay, we’ll just get everyone to act like they like it. That-that way no one makes fun of her and we still get to go to Sweet Potato Pie!

name: joey
dialogue: Dude, they’re not objects.

name: joey
dialogue: Just kidding,’ I’ll talk to them, you distract Rach.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey Rach, can I talk to you outside for a second?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay...

name: rachel
dialogue: What’s up, Ross?

name: ross
dialogue: So um...Thanksgiving. The holiday season is upon us, hm?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah!

name: ross
dialogue: And um...You look nice today.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh no. No Ross, don’t do this.

name: ross
dialogue: What?

name: rachel
dialogue: I just- I don’t think us getting back together is a good idea.

name: ross
dialogue: Eh?

name: rachel
dialogue: I thought this might happen today. Ross, I know the holidays can be rough. you know? And it’s probably really hard for you to be alone right now.

name: ross
dialogue: You’re alone.

name: rachel
dialogue: No, I-I live with Phoebe. I mean you’re alone, alone. And I just-it’s just not the time for us. I’m sorry.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah well, can’t blame a guy for trying!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh and  Okay, and uh if anyone needs help pretending to like it, I learned something in acting class, try uh, rubbing your stomach  or uh, or saying “mmm” and uh, oh oh! And smiling , okay?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, I’m not going to pay for those acting classes anymore.

name: joey
dialogue: Rachel, there you are! Come on, let’s serve that dessert already!

name: rachel
dialogue: Joey, you’re going to have to stop rushing me, you know what? You don’t get any dessert.

name: joey
dialogue: Really?

name: rachel
dialogue: No, I’m just kidding I would never do that to you! Okay, everybody, it’s trifle time!

name: phoebe
dialogue: So, now, Rach, this is a traditional English trifle, isn’t it?

name: rachel
dialogue: It sure is.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow. So then did you make it with beef or Eggplant?

name: rachel
dialogue: Beef.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I can’t have any. You know I don’t eat meat.  oh no.

name: rachel
dialogue: Alright, Monica, I want you to have the first taste.

name: monica
dialogue: Really?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh oh oh, wait! You only got whipped cream in there! You got to take a bite with all the layers!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: Op! Wait, you dropped a pea.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well?

name: monica
dialogue: Mmm! It’s good!

name: rachel
dialogue: Really? How good?

name: monica
dialogue: It’s so good, that I feel really selfish about being the only one who’s eating it, that I think we should have everyone taste how good it is. Especially Ross.

name: all
dialogue: Mmm.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, this is so good, that I’m going to go enjoy it on the balcony so that I can enjoy the view whilst I enjoy my dessert.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: I’ve got to call my friend Mary and tell her how good this is, from Monica’s room.

name: mr. geller
dialogue: I’ll help you dial.

name: monica
dialogue: I’m going to go into the bathroom so I can look at it in the mirror, as I eat it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, now what was that all about? Is it-does it not taste good? Let me try it.

name: ross
dialogue: What? No no! Ah!   All gone! So good! Maybe Chandler has some left.

name: ross
dialogue: It tastes like feet!

name: joey
dialogue: I like it.

name: ross
dialogue: Are you kidding?

name: joey
dialogue: What’s not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Good.

name: rachel
dialogue: ...So a bird just grabbed it, and then tried to fly away with it and, and then just dropped it on the street?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, but if it’s any consolation, before the bird dropped it, he seemed to enjoy it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Rachel, come here.  Okay, I was just starting to take my Thanksgiving nap, and I had another dream about Jack.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, Phoebe, do I want to hear this?

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don't know, let’s see! So, okay, I dreamt that we were going to get married, and he left, because he had to go fight a fire. And, um, so okay, I went to a night club, and I saw him making out with a girl.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God, he dream-cheated on you!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, but then Jacques Cousteau came and he kicked his ass for betraying me! It was so cool! Then, he took me diving and he introduced me to his pet seahorse, who, by the way, was totally coming on to me, and please, that is not going to happen.

name: mr. geller
dialogue: Boy, I’m glad I wore the big belt today.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Five minutes ago, a line like that would’ve floored me. Now nothing. Well, not nothing, I am still a woman.

name: monica
dialogue: Ross? Let’s go.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh yeah, about telling Mom and Dad, I was thinking about maybe writing a letter.

name: monica
dialogue: Alright, you know what? That’s it. You’ve had your chance.

name: ross
dialogue: What-what?

name: monica
dialogue: Mom! Dad! Ross smoked pot in college!

name: mr. and mrs. geller
dialogue: What?!

name: ross
dialogue: You are such a tattletale! Mom, Dad, you remember that-that time you walked in my room and smelled marijuana?

name: mr. and mrs. geller
dialogue: Yes.

name: ross
dialogue: Well I told you it was Chandler who was smoking the pot but it was me. I’m sorry.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: It was you?

name: monica
dialogue: And Dad, you know that mailman that you got fired? He didn’t steal your Playboys! Ross did!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, well, Hurricane Gloria didn’t break the porch swing, Monica did!

name: monica
dialogue: Ross hasn’t worked at the museum for a year!

name: ross
dialogue: Monica and Chandler are living together!

name: monica
dialogue: Ross married Rachel in Vegas! And got divorced! Again!!!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: I love Jacques Cousteau!

name: rachel
dialogue: I wasn’t supposed to put beef in the trifle!

name: joey
dialogue: I want to go!

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: That’s a lot of information to get in in thirty seconds! Alright Joey, if want to leave, just leave. Rachel, no you weren’t supposed to put beef in the trifle. It did not taste good. Phoebe, I’m sorry, but I think Jacques Cousteau is dead.  Monica, why you felt you had to hide the fact that you were in an important relationship is beyond me.

name: mr. geller
dialogue: And we kind of figured about the porch swing.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Ross, drugs? Divorced? Again?

name: mr. geller
dialogue: What happened son?

name: ross
dialogue: I-I uh, I got tricked into all those things!

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Chandler! You’ve been Ross’s best friend all these years, stuck by him during the drug problems.  And now you’ve taken on Monica as well. Well, I don’t know what to say. You’re a wonderful human being.

name: chandler
dialogue: Thank you!

name: mr. geller
dialogue: No! Thank you!  Monica, and Ross! I don’t know what I’m going to do about the two of you!

name: chandler
dialogue: I’ll talk to them!

name: rachel
dialogue: You guys! It was bananas, cream, and beef! I-I just cannot believe that you ate that so that I wouldn’t feel bad!

name: monica
dialogue: Well actually, I-I didn’t eat mine. It’s still in the bathroom.

name: joey
dialogue: No it isn’t, I ate that.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Well we left ours in Monica’s bedroom.

name: joey
dialogue: Nope, got it and I got yours  too.

name: chandler
dialogue: Let me ask you, why is everybody using these tiny lights nowadays? I remember when people used to use big lights.

name: rachel
dialogue: That’s a good story, Grandpa.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey

name: all
dialogue: Hey

name: ross
dialogue: Wow, Monica’s letting other people help decorate her tree! Did someone get her drunk again or?

name: monica
dialogue: Having a perfectly decorated tree is not what Christmas is about. It’s about being with the people that you love.

name: phoebe
dialogue: That is nice and we’re done. TADA!

name: chandler
dialogue: I don't know what it is, it just doesn’t quite feel like Christmas to me.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, here.

name: chandler
dialogue: See now it feels like Christmas!

name: ross
dialogue: and that’s the story of the dreidle. Now, some people trace the Christmas tree back to the Egyptians, who used to bring green palm branches into their huts on the shortest day of the year, symbolising life’s triumph over death. And that was like 4000 years ago.

name: rachel
dialogue: So, pretty much around the same time that you started telling this story.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey you guys.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey Joe what’s up?

name: joey
dialogue: I had to get out of the apartment. Janine is like stretching all over the place. you know, everywhere I look she’s like

name: chandler
dialogue: I can see why that’s hard to resist.

name: joey
dialogue: I like her so much!

name: monica
dialogue: Aw, I’m sorry sweetie that she doesn’t feel the same way.

name: joey
dialogue: I know. And she’s so sweet. I just want to feed her grapes and brush her hair.

name: chandler
dialogue: You are aware that she’s not a monkey, right?

name: ross
dialogue: I am so over Janine. I mean, yeah, at first I thought she was hot, but now she’s like OLD NEWS!

name: janine
dialogue: Hey guys!

name: ross
dialogue: Hi Janine!

name: janine
dialogue: I just got a call to be a dancer on a television special for New Year’s Eve. It’s called some sort of Dick’n Rock’n Dickie Eve.

name: monica
dialogue: Hold it! Are you talking about Dick Clark’s New Year’s Rocking Eve?

name: janine
dialogue: Yeah, that’s what I said.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! We love that show! I mean Ross and I have been watching it since I can remember!

name: chandler
dialogue: Ah, you’re still just a little fat girl inside aren’t you?

name: janine
dialogue: Well I’m going to be on it this year. I’m going to be one of the party people.

name: ross
dialogue: You’re going to be a party person! Those guys rock the most!

name: janine
dialogue: Well they said I should bring someone.  Do you want to be my dance partner?

name: joey
dialogue: Totally! I would love to spend New Year’s with you.

name: janine
dialogue: Well actually they’re taping tomorrow. I don’t really understand why.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, well you see how it works is, the part with Dick Clark in Times Square is actually live, but they tape some of the party stuff ahead of time. Yeah, not a lot of people know that.

name: janine
dialogue: Yeah well, do you guys want to come too?

name: ross
dialogue: Are you serious?

name: monica
dialogue: We are there!

name: chandler
dialogue: What, what are you laughing at?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I used to date him, but you’re still going out with her!

name: janine
dialogue: Thanks.  Great so we can all go together! I got to run. Catch you later!

name: all
dialogue: Bye!

name: ross
dialogue: Bye Janine!

name: joey
dialogue: Did she just ask me out on a date?

name: chandler
dialogue: I don’t think so.

name: monica
dialogue: What are you talking about? She just invited him to the biggest party of the millennium!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, but she also invited you and Ross. Yeah, honey, I’m sorry, but I don’t think that was a romantic thing.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh. Maybe. But hey I know how I can find out. We’re going to a New Year’s Eve party, right? So at midnight, I can kiss her. And if she kisses me back, great! you know? But if she says ‘Dude, what the hell are you doing?’ I can say ‘It wasn’t me, it was New Years!’

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, that’s a lot better than Ross trying to kiss me in High School, and saying that he did it because he needed chapstick.

name: ross
dialogue: It was a dry day.

name: monica
dialogue: We are going to Dick Clark’s New Year’s Rocking Eve!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh my God!

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh my God!

name: joey
dialogue: OK, listen I’ve been on sets before, so let me give you a little advice, alright? It’s a show, but we’re just dancing, OK? It’s no big deal. The important thing to remember – stay cool.

name: ross
dialogue: Got it!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh my God it’s just like I dreamed it!

name: director
dialogue: OK, everyone gather up.

name: monica and ross
dialogue: ‘excuse us

name: director
dialogue: Here’s what’s going to happen. The music’s going to start, you’re going to dance, we’re going to tape, you don’t look at the camera. Any questions?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, I have a question. When is this going to air?

name: director
dialogue: Uh, yeah. Now you guys dance over there, you guys over there, and I want you two right around here, and everyone else spread out.

name: joey
dialogue: Ross! So when is it going to air?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, you look in the kitchen, I will look in the back closet.

name: chandler
dialogue: I can save you time ladies, I’m right here.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, Chandler why don’t you take a walk? This doesn’t concern you.

name: rachel
dialogue: We are looking for our Christmas presents from Monica.

name: chandler
dialogue: What? That’s terrible!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No-no, we do it every year!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh well, that makes it not terrible.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, yeah, we never find them! She’s always best at us that wily minx.

name: rachel
dialogue: Don’t worry, we’re just going to search here for an hour, them we’re going to go over to Joey’s and search, OK?

name: chandler
dialogue: No not okay, you can’t look for Monica’s presents!

name: phoebe
dialogue: But we have to!

name: chandler
dialogue: No, you don’t have to, and you can’t because I live here too.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well then, you should look with us.

name: chandler
dialogue: Why?

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler, aren’t you worried about what to get Monica for Christmas?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, I have a great idea for a present for her.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, that’s it?  A great idea!

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler, that’s not enough. I mean what if she gets you a great present, two medium presents, and a bunch of little presents? And you’ve just gotten her one great present? I mean that’s just going to make her feel bad. Why would you do that to her Chandler? Why? Why?

name: chandler
dialogue: If I help, we can find ‘them faster!

name: rachel
dialogue: That’s right!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh ooh, we have a live one!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, it’s a Macy’s bag!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh, who’s it for?

name: rachel
dialogue: Dear losers, do you really think I’d hide presents under the couch? P.S. Chandler, I knew they’d break you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uh-oh. She may be onto us.

name: rachel
dialogue: We are so going to find them this year.

name: chandler
dialogue: you know when you guys said you were going to go across the hall and look, you don’t, you don’t do that every year do you?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: You don’t, like go into the back of my closet, and look under my gym bag or anything?

name: phoebe and rachel
dialogue: No, we never do that

name: chandler
dialogue: Because that’s where Joey gave me some stuff to store that I’ve never seen before in my life! Okay, that did not just happen!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, here comes another camera.

name: ross
dialogue: Right. No biggie. Stay loose.

name: ross
dialogue: Why do they keep doing that?

name: monica
dialogue: If we want to get on camera, I think we have to get up on one of those platforms. They’ve been taping those people up there all day.

name: ross
dialogue: Right.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, what’d you guys do to get up on there?

name: girl
dialogue: We learned how to dance.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh yeah? Well when you learned how to dance did you forget how to put on underpants?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!

name: janine
dialogue: Hey! You’re a good dancer!

name: joey
dialogue: Really?

name: janine
dialogue: Yeah, well you’d be better if you just loosened your hips a little.

name: joey
dialogue: What do you mean?

name: janine
dialogue: Like this.

name: janine
dialogue: That’s it, feel the rhythm. That’s better.

name: joey
dialogue: Uh-huh.

name: director
dialogue: Okay, you’re dancing with that girl over there.

name: joey
dialogue: No-no-no-no-no we came together!

name: director
dialogue: I don’t see it.  You are dancing with the tall guy over there. Tall guy, raise your hand!

name: joey
dialogue: No-no hey buddy, please let me dance with that girl, I really like her and I think I have a shot.

name: director
dialogue: Really, you think so? I don’t..

name: chandler
dialogue: I couldn't find anything at Joey--Hey-hey, oh hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, we found them. There were in the guest room closet behind some coats.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, and you have nothing to worry about 'cos they're all crap!

name: chandler
dialogue: Those are my gifts, I got them for you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: oh. Thanks Chandler they're great!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well Chandler, what is this very weird, metal A Z thing?

name: chandler
dialogue: Those are book ends! that is a great gift!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, okay, I'm sorry, thank you for my azzz.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ha!

name: chandler
dialogue: Make sure you put all that stuff back in the closet, okay?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, okay, oh, by the way, I just got to say, I think it's really nice of you that even after you've moved, you still keep storing that stuff for Joey!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey-hey dancer girl! Can I go to the bathroom? I just..  Here we go.  Looking good Gellers!

name: ross
dialogue: We know!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, see that snippy guy over there? He’s the one who decides who gets up on the platform. We should go dance by him.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

name: director
dialogue: Okay, everybody hold!

name: director
dialogue: Next on the platforms are… …you two! And… …You two!

name: monica
dialogue: Excuse me, sir, would it help if I weren’t wearing underpants?

name: ross
dialogue: Monica!  Would it?

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! Tall guy! Hey, listen, I wanted to talk to you about that girl that you’re dancing with.

name: tall guy
dialogue: She’s nice, huh? To think I almost brought my wife to this!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, okay. Uh, look buddy, I came with that girl, and I had this plan to kiss her at the new years countdown – I’m trying to win her over, so I was wondering if..

name: tall guy
dialogue: No I don’t think so.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh come on man, you can dance with my partner, she’s real, uh, mellow!

name: tall guy
dialogue: Look, are you dating this girl you came with?

name: joey
dialogue: Well, I was hoping after tonight that maybe I could you know

name: tall guy
dialogue: No, no. She’s fair game if you ask me, sorry buddy!

name: joey
dialogue: Alright, alright, hey you know fair is fair,  if you’re right, you’re right, what can I say, but hey oh no!

name: tall guy
dialogue: God! What are you, in second grade?

name: joey
dialogue: Hey, now you’re the one who wet his pants.

name: monica
dialogue: Man, this sucks! you know if Mom and Dad don’t see us on TV after we made them so jealous, I mean, who’s going to be the losers then?

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, I know what’ll get us up on a platform!

name: monica
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: The routine!

name: monica
dialogue: Ross, we haven’t done the routine since middle school.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, when the snippy guy sees the routine, he’ll want to build us our own platform!

name: monica
dialogue: Was it really that good?

name: ross
dialogue: We got honourable mention in the brother/sister dance category! Look, it’s almost fake midnight, do we really have any other choice?

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, let’s do it. Mom and Dad are going to be so faced!

name: ross
dialogue: So, do we really have to ask who’s going up on the platform next?

name: director
dialogue: Oh no! You get up there and do that again exactly like that!

name: monica
dialogue: Yes!

name: director
dialogue: Make sure you get this, they’re going to want it for the bloopers show.  Alright cut! Listen up everyone, when we start again it’s going to be the countdown to new years, so I want to see everybody’s excitement.

name: tall guy
dialogue: Hey, pal, you have about three seconds to get away from my partner.

name: director
dialogue: What’s going on over here?

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, take a look at the guy’s pants! I mean, I know you told us to show excitement, but don’t you think he went a little overboard?

name: director
dialogue: What’s the matter with you? Get out of here!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, take a hike wet pants!

name: ross
dialogue: Can you believe this? We’re going to be on the platform for the Millennium moment!

name: monica
dialogue: I know! Hey, you haven’t been practising the routine, have you?

name: ross
dialogue: No!

name: monica
dialogue: Me too!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, when the music starts up again, I was thinking of maybe going into the robot, you know?

name: monica
dialogue: Ross, I think we should stick to the routine, we don’t want to look stupid!

name: director
dialogue: Alright we’re back! Ten seconds left here we go! Ten! Nine! Eight! Seven!

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, it all comes down to this. Whatever happens, happens. Destiny.

name: all
dialogue: Three, Two, One!

name: director
dialogue: Cut!

name: joey
dialogue: No! Year! Happy No Year!

name: director
dialogue: Okay, here’s where we go to the live shot of Times Square, nice work everyone that’s a wrap!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey! Look who I found!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, hey guys!

name: phoebe
dialogue: you know, birds have a very good sense of direction, and I thought maybe they could help us find where the presents are hidden.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, if the presents are hidden south for the winter.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Or we could just follow your clever jokes – any ideas? No! Didn’t think so! Okay, c’mon guys, show us where the presents are!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh, the duck seems to think that Monica got me garbage! Hmm, I wonder what I could get Monica that’s as good as garbage?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hmm, how about my azzz?

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, this is hollow.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?

name: rachel
dialogue: This bench, it’s hollow! I can’t believe I never knew that!  Oh, the presents!!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, don’t look directly at them!

name: chandler
dialogue: What?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Alright, no, we could look at them!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, this one’s for me!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, this one’s for Chandler. Here.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh great!

name: phoebe
dialogue: And the big one’s for me!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, let’s open them!

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay! Okay! Okay!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hee hee!

name: chandler
dialogue: Wait, we can’t do this.

name: phoebe and rachel
dialogue: Why?

name: chandler
dialogue: I don’t want to know what Monica got me. you know? I mean, look, I’m sure she worked really hard at getting you a present, and wanting to surprise me, and you guys are going to ruin that, and I, look we have to put these back, this is not what Christmas is about.

name: rachel
dialogue: Whatever Linus, I’m opening mine.

name: chandler
dialogue: Nobody is opening anything ok? Look, I don’t know about you guys, but I want to see the look on Monica’s face when I give her my present, and I’m sure she wants to see the look on my face when I get mine. So please, please, can we just, can we put them back?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Will you get us better gifts?

name: chandler
dialogue: Fine!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey guys! You found the presents? Chandler, you let them find the presents? Great! Do you know how long it took me to find you that water purifier?

name: chandler
dialogue: That’s what you got me?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh yes, I see what you mean. That look is priceless.

name: joey
dialogue: Home sweet home, huh? Nice to, uh, get back to reality. Plus we know how the New Year’s going to go off. I guess there’s no reason for all that Y2K panic, you know? Anyway, good night!

name: janine
dialogue: Joey.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah?

name: janine
dialogue: 3, 2, 1.  Happy New Year.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, yoii. What was that for?

name: janine
dialogue: Well, I don’t know tonight when they yelled cut and we didn’t get to kiss, I was really, really, disappointed, and I just, really wanted to kiss you

name: joey
dialogue: Really? In the moment, I really wanted to kiss you too. In the moment.

name: janine
dialogue: In the moment, yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: But only in the moment. So do you want to kiss again?

name: janine
dialogue: Sure, New Year’s Eve is only two weeks away. Can you wait?

name: joey
dialogue: No.

name: janine
dialogue: Me neither.

name: janine
dialogue: Joey, you don’t have to count down every time we kiss.

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, yeah, okay. Except I sort of felt like I needed a couple of seconds to get ready.

name: monica
dialogue: We were on the platform, ready to dance the world into the new Millennium, and the guy yelled ‘CUT!’

name: rachel
dialogue: Uh, wait, so you guys are telling me you actually did the routine from eighth grade?

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah. But of course we had to update it a little bit.  Hey, by the way, great thinking about catching me!

name: rachel
dialogue: ‘Cos I was going to say there’s no way you could’ve done the end the way you guys did it back then!

name: monica
dialogue: What? We could do it!

name: ross
dialogue: I don’t know, I mean you were a lot bigger, I mean, stronger back then.

name: monica
dialogue: I can do it, okay? Come on, let’s go.

name: monica
dialogue: I can’t do it!

name: chandler
dialogue: Now you do that, you’re on TV.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: joey
dialogue: Listen, do you guys think I have a chance with Janine?

name: monica
dialogue: Honey, we have been through this before!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah. Don’t do this to yourself.

name: phoebe
dialogue: She’s made it pretty clear, it is not going to happen.

name: joey
dialogue: Well all right then, I guess I shouldn’t get to excited about the fact  that I just kissed her!

name: monica
dialogue: You serious?!

name: chandler
dialogue: That’s great!

name: monica
dialogue: Really?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah well, we’ll see.

name: ross
dialogue: You kissed her.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh we kissed it up real nice.

name: chandler
dialogue: So you kissed her, so what happened after that?

name: joey
dialogue: I came over here to tell you guys.

name: chandler
dialogue: So she’s just waiting over there for you?

name: janine
dialogue: I got to go.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.

name: janine
dialogue: I’m going to be really late for dance class!

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.

name: janine
dialogue: Okay, now I’m really late.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, I’m all right, okay, but hey, could you just leave your lips?

name: janine
dialogue: Bye.

name: monica
dialogue: Bye.

name: joey
dialogue: Have you kissed her yet? It’s awesome! I could do it forever! you know what? She-she kisses better than my mom cooks!

name: monica
dialogue: I am so glad you said cooks.

name: rachel
dialogue: I know.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh hey Rachel, sweetheart? You have got to tell the post office that you have moved. Okay? We are still getting all your bills and stuff.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh-oh, Pottery Barn!  You can throw the rest away.

name: chandler
dialogue: I’m not your garbage man. I’m your mailman.

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica look! Look-look-look! Here is that table that I ordered.

name: monica
dialogue: You got it from Pottery Barn?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah! It’s an apothecary table. Does anyone even know what an apothecary is?

name: chandler
dialogue: A pharmacist.

name: monica
dialogue: Rach, Phoebe hates Pottery Barn.

name: joey
dialogue: I hate Pottery Barn too. They kicked me out of there just because I sat on a bed!

name: chandler
dialogue: You took off your pants and climbed under the sheets!

name: joey
dialogue: I was tired!

name: rachel
dialogue: Phoebe hates Pottery Barn?!

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, she hates all mass produced stuff. She thinks her furniture should have a history, a story behind it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well this has story behind it! I mean they had to ship it all the way from the White Plains store.

name: monica
dialogue: It’s got to be one of a kind. you know like umm, you know uh, what’s that God awful ceramic fruit bowl she has on her counter?

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! I made that for her!

name: chandler
dialogue: You made pottery?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! I made it of this fruit bowl I found in the garbage.

name: monica
dialogue: I’m telling—If you put that in her apartment you’ll never hear the end of it.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay fine! I’ll-I’ll just tell her it’s an antique apothecary table, she doesn’t have to know where it came from. Oh! Look at this little drawers! Oh look-look it says that it holds 300 CDs.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ahh, just like the apothecary tables of yore

name: chandler
dialogue: so then the farmer says, "That’s not a cow and you’re not milking it."

name: monica
dialogue: I am so glad you guys got together, Chandler and I are always looking for a couple to go out with and now we have one!

name: chandler
dialogue: Look at us, we’re a couple of couples!

name: janine
dialogue: I had so much fun tonight, and what a great restaurant.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: And Chandler I can’t believe I let you pay for this one.  Thanks man.

name: monica
dialogue: So do you guys going to come over tomorrow? I’ll make that pasta thing I was telling you about.

name: janine
dialogue: Oh that would be great!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, but hey look, at least let us bring the wine.

name: monica
dialogue: Joey, you don’t have too!

name: joey
dialogue: Nope-op! I insist!  You get the wine right?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah all right.  Okay, good night guys.

name: joey
dialogue: See you tomorrow!

name: monica
dialogue: Tomorrow!

name: janine
dialogue: Can’t wait!

name: janine
dialogue: How are we going to get out of that one?

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: janine
dialogue: I can’t handle two nights in a row with them.

name: joey
dialogue: What-what’s wrong with Monica and Chandler?

name: janine
dialogue: I don’t know, they’re just a little blah!

name: joey
dialogue: Blah?!

name: janine
dialogue: Well you know, he’s blah, she’s just—she’s very loud for such a small person.

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, they’re like my best friends. Are you saying we can’t hang out with them? Because that would kind of be a problem.

name: janine
dialogue: No! Of course we can still hang out with them. Just you know, not two nights in a row. Okay?

name: joey
dialogue: I guess.

name: janine
dialogue: Thank you.

name: joey
dialogue: If you want, I’ll sell my friends and use the money to buy you presents.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh, what a great table! Where-where did you get it?

name: rachel
dialogue: Guess!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Umm, a flea market?

name: rachel
dialogue: Ha! See, I knew, I knew you’d get it on the first guess. Isn’t it cool! It’s an apothecary table.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow! Oh you can just imagine that this is where  they kept all the stuff to make their potions.

name: rachel
dialogue: OH, yes.

name: phoebe
dialogue: you know? Ooh, you can almost smell the opium.

name: rachel
dialogue: Almost.

name: phoebe
dialogue: How much was it?

name: rachel
dialogue: It was only 500 bucks.

name: phoebe
dialogue: 500 bucks at a flea market?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, okay see I thought, I thought you meant how much was it when it was new, you know like back then.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh no.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah no, I mean it was at a flea market, so it was you know, it was like a dollar.

name: phoebe
dialogue: A dollar?

name: rachel
dialogue: And fifty. So it was like one and fifty dollars.

name: phoebe
dialogue: OH, okay, they gave you the old time pricing.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, what period is it from?

name: rachel
dialogue: Uh, it’s from yore. Like the days of yore. you know?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes, yes I do. God, oh it’s just perfect! Wow! I bet it has a great story behind it too. Did they tell you anything? Like you know where it was from or

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes! That I know, this is from White Plains.

name: phoebe
dialogue: White Plains. Oh, it sounds like such a magical place.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey! We’re here!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: OH! Oh my God!

name: ross
dialogue: You like it?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh no!

name: ross
dialogue: It’s my new apothecary table!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross! Phoebe’s going to be here any second, she cannot see this!

name: ross
dialogue: Well why not?! She’ll-she’ll love it! It’s the real thing! I got it at Pottery Barn.

name: rachel
dialogue: I know you did! I bought the same one! And if she sees your table she’s going to know that I lied to her. I told her ours was an original.

name: ross
dialogue: Why did you do that?

name: rachel
dialogue: Because she hates Pottery Barn.

name: ross
dialogue: She hates Pottery Barn?!!

name: rachel
dialogue: I know! I know, she says it’s all mass-produced, nothing is authentic, and everyone winds up having the same stuff.  So come on, she’s going to be here any second! Can we please just cover this up with something?! Please?

name: ross
dialogue: What? No! No! I am not going to hide it from Phoebe—Ooh, although I did get some great Pottery Barn sheets!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooo! Oh, I forgot they made sheets!

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, yeah! I still can’t believe she hates Pottery Barn!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross, get over it! It’s not like she hates you.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah but Pottery Barn! you know what I think? It’s just she-she’s weird. you know it’s because she’s a twin. Twins are weird.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross, she’s not weird, she just wants her stuff to be one of a kind.

name: ross
dialogue: Huh. you know what’s not one of a kind? A twin!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ooh, Phoebe’s here! Okay, let’s turn out all the lights and we’ll just watch the movie!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay. Hey—Ooh, cool sheets!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, you like it? You want to know where I got it?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Sure!

name: rachel
dialogue: He got it a flea market!

name: phoebe
dialogue: You bought your sheets at a flea market? Ross come on, you got to loosen the purse strings a little.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey!

name: joey
dialogue: Hi!

name: monica
dialogue: The dinner will be ready in twenty minutes. This is so exciting.

name: chandler
dialogue: And here is the bottle of wine for you to bring over tonight.  You were also going to buy Monica flowers but you couldn’t afford it, because you paid dinner last night.

name: joey
dialogue: Thanks. Thanks, but uh actually it’s just going to be me again tonight.

name: monica
dialogue: What happened to Janine?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, she’s uh-uh really sick.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh that’s too bad.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, she’s been in there all day , uh high fever, a nose problem… Phlegm! Phlegm! Phlegm-phlegm-phlegm!

name: janine
dialogue: Monica! Chandler! I’m really-really sorry about tonight. I don’t know if Joey told you; I just couldn’t get out of going to this play. I’m sorry. Have a great time.

name: joey
dialogue: ‘Kay!

name: janine
dialogue: Bye.

name: chandler
dialogue: That’s funny, I saw no phlegm.

name: joey
dialogue: No-no, she really is sick!

name: chandler
dialogue: Then why-why is she going to a play?!

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, you know, starve a fever, go to a play for a cold.

name: monica
dialogue: Joey! Why is Janine not coming over for dinner?!

name: joey
dialogue: Well uh, she didn’t want to hang out with you guys two nights in a row. I’m so sorry.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, why does she not want to hang out with us?!

name: joey
dialogue: Because she uh, she-she thinks that you are blah and that you, Monica, are too loud.

name: monica
dialogue: What?!!  What?

name: chandler
dialogue: So she was just pretending to have a good time last night? She was lying to our faces?!

name: monica
dialogue: Ugh, I can not believe this! I mean, who is she to judge us? We could not have been nicer to her!

name: chandler
dialogue: And I am not blah, I am a hoot!

name: joey
dialogue: I know! I know! Come on, please-please you guys, don’t-don’t be mad. I’m sure she just, she just said that stuff because she was nervous and you guys are like my best friends! you know? And it was our first date! Plus, she’s really sick!

name: chandler
dialogue: No, you sh—No you said you made that up!!

name: joey
dialogue: I know, but don’t you think the sick thing is way better than the play thing?

name: chandler
dialogue: Eh, they’re both good. I generally just go with, Monica’s drunk again.

name: joey
dialogue: Come on you guys, come on please-please just give her another chance, huh? She’ll come around I promise.

name: monica
dialogue: Of course we will, come on we got to make dinner.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay.

name: monica
dialogue: I do not like that woman!

name: joey
dialogue: I can hear you!

name: monica
dialogue: I am loud!

name: all
dialogue: Aww!

name: rachel
dialogue: That’s funny.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey Pheebs, could you please not put your feet up on my new……old sheet?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh sure!  No!

name: rachel
dialogue: OH!!

name: ross
dialogue: My apothecary table!!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?!

name: rachel
dialogue: No!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ross, where did you get this?!

name: ross
dialogue: I got it at Pottery Barn!! Okay?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God, Phoebe, Pottery Barn has ripped off the design of our antique!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wow! Oh my God, well if they’ve ripped off our table ours must be much more than one and fifty dollars!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yes.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well this doesn’t even smell like opium.

name: ross
dialogue: Of course not, it smells like wine, which you spilled! And thanks for wrecking my sheet by the way.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh Ross, calm down, I’ll give you the 80 cents.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, one more time.

name: monica
dialogue: Chandler, would you like some more orange juice?

name: chandler
dialogue: Perfect decibel.

name: monica
dialogue: I know!!!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: joey
dialogue: So uh, what are you guys doing?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh nothing, we’re just talking. you know, blah-blah-blah.

name: joey
dialogue: Look, come on you guys, you said you were going to try! All right look, I came over here to invite you guys to a movie with me and Janine.

name: monica
dialogue: Well, I’d like to but,  I’m not sure we have time to go.

name: joey
dialogue: Ha-ha, very funny—Look! I don’t know what to do! I really want you guys to get along. Just please come to the movie with us. I mean you owe me!

name: monica
dialogue: We owe you?!

name: joey
dialogue: That’s right! I helped you guys out a lot in the start of your relationship. Huh? I helped you guys sneak around for like six months, and I looked like an idiot! And I was humiliated. And I only made 200 dollars!

name: monica
dialogue: We didn’t give you any money!

name: joey
dialogue: You don’t think I know that!

name: rachel
dialogue: see I can’t decide whether it would go better next to the new wicker dining chair, the Sahara desk, or the Parker console table.

name: ross
dialogue: Wow! I didn’t know that there was a Pottery Barn up here.

name: rachel
dialogue: I know, I know. I went a little crazy.

name: ross
dialogue: A little? Your place looks like page 72 of the catalogue. Oh look at that! The ornamental bird cage! Large!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh Ross no. Be careful, that is very old! Okay? Early Colonial bird merchants used to bring their birds to market in that.

name: ross
dialogue: Fascinating.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Another amazing find! Wow! Oh I bet this has a great story too!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh it does, it does! It is a room separating apparatus from Colonial times.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ah!

name: ross
dialogue: Hmm, a lot of this stuff is from Colonial times. Hey, what are some other time periods Rachel?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well there’s yore. And uh, you know, yesteryear.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah no, I’m telling you Rachel has such a great eye for this stuff. Ross, you know if you ever decide you need to redecorate—And I think that you should. You should, you should ask Rachel to help.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh honey he doesn’t need my help.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, come on! I think he’s ready to get rid of, what did you call it? The cheap knock-offs and dinosaur junk.

name: ross
dialogue: Really?!  Hey, you know what? Since you have such a great sense of what I need, uh ooh, here’s-here’s 60 bucks, why don’t you take Phoebe down to that Colonial flea market of yours and get me some stuff.

name: rachel
dialogue: you know what? I don’t, I don’t think Phoebe really wants to come.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No! I do want to!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, she does want to.

name: ross
dialogue: She does want to.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah!

name: rachel
dialogue: Pheebs, I don’t know what to say. I guess the flea market was just better last time.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well at least I got these sheets for Ross.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uck, look at this! Pottery Barn, yuck!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, you know what? Don’t look at it.  Seriously, don’t look at it.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No! Look-look! There’s the coffee table they stole from us!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ugh, those bastards! Let’s go.

name: phoebe
dialogue: That fan kind of looks like ours. And the birdcage and the…wait a sec! This is our exact living room!

name: rachel
dialogue: No! No! No! No it’s not! No it’s not! Come on! Phoebe, ours is totally different! I mean we don’t have the…  We don’t have the…that lamp! And-and that screen is you know, on the other side.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God. This is where you got all our stuff, Pottery Barn! Oh my God!

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay! Okay-okay look—no I did, I just wanted this stuff and I know how you feel about Pottery Barn. Just… Come on don’t be mad.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No-no-no, but I am mad! I am mad! Because this stuff is everything that is wrong with the world! And it’s all sitting up in my living room and all I can think about is how I don’t have that lamp!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well then honey, buy the lamp! Hey, we have that 60 bucks from Ross.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I can’t! I can’t! Unless… Well are you saying that-that you would move out if-if I didn’t buy that lamp?

name: rachel
dialogue: What?! No! I’m not going to move out!

name: phoebe
dialogue: But are you saying that you would move out if I didn’t buy that lamp?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh. Yes! I would so move out!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay then I don’t have a choice! I have to buy that lamp!

name: rachel
dialogue: That’s right!

name: phoebe
dialogue: But at least the apothecary table is real.

name: joey
dialogue: Well, this-this-this was great. Didn’t everybody have a great time?

name: janine
dialogue: Well I did. I really did. And you guys, I’ve got to say, I’m sorry if I was a little weird after the last time we went out. I guess I was just nervous or something.

name: chandler
dialogue: That’s totally understandable.

name: monica
dialogue: Don’t worry about it.

name: janine
dialogue: So we can go out again?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah!

name: monica
dialogue: Absolutely!

name: janine
dialogue: Oh good.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh well then, good night!

name: monica
dialogue: Good night!

name: joey
dialogue: See? Eh, wasn’t that fun?

name: janine
dialogue: We have got to move!

name: monica
dialogue: I knew it!! you know, you’re not so quiet yourself, missy!

name: chandler
dialogue: And I’m blah? Listen, the only thing more boring than watching modern dance is having to listen to you talk about it,  "Oh Chandler, I just lost myself in the moment."

name: janine
dialogue: you know, I know you’re talking, but all I hear is, "Blah. Blah. Blah-blah-blah."

name: monica
dialogue: All right! You and me! Let’s go! Right now!

name: joey
dialogue: All right! All right! Enough! Enough! Enough!! Enough!  You two go home! I-I-I got to talk to Janine!

name: chandler
dialogue: you know I think you can take her.

name: monica
dialogue: You’d better hope I don’t see you in the hallway!!

name: joey
dialogue: All right, uh, we’ve got a little bit of a problem here. These people are my friends; you can’t treat them that way.

name: janine
dialogue: They said stuff to me too, you know!

name: joey
dialogue: I know! I know! And I’m going to talk to them about it. They mean so much to me. They… They’re like my family. If you guys are going to be fighting all the time, I-I… I don’t think we can be together. It just, it just can’t work. It can’t.  I’m very upset.

name: janine
dialogue: Okay. Okay. Would, would it help if I went over and apologized?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! Yeah! That would be very helpful! Yeah.

name: monica
dialogue: What did I tell you about the hall?!

name: janine
dialogue: I was just coming over here to apologize for my behaviour! I’d really like it if we could be friends.

name: monica
dialogue: Well, I know that would make Joey happy, so, I would like that too.

name: janine
dialogue: Great.

name: monica
dialogue: Now come on.  Well, I’m glad we worked things out.

name: janine
dialogue: Me too.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.

name: janine
dialogue: I’ll see you.

name: monica
dialogue: Bye.

name: janine
dialogue: Or I’ll hear you.

name: monica
dialogue: That’s it big girl!  Come on!

name: janine
dialogue: Wait!

name: monica
dialogue: You’d better run!

name: chandler
dialogue: Did you hear that?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah uh, what am I going to do?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, I’m sorry man.  You want to go watch?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: joey
dialogue: How you doin’?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey so, did uh, did she move out?

name: joey
dialogue: Pretty much, yeah.

name: monica
dialogue: I cannot believe you broke up with her just like that.

name: joey
dialogue: Well, when it’s not right, you know it.

name: chandler
dialogue: You okay?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! Yeah. I’ll be all right.

name: ross
dialogue: you know what would cheer you up?

name: joey
dialogue: What?

name: ross
dialogue: I’m giving this lecture on erosion theories tomorrow night, I think you should come.

name: joey
dialogue: You’re right! That did cheer me up!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, you’re not going to believe this. I made up a joke and sent it in to Playboy. They printed it!

name: phoebe
dialogue: I didn’t know Playboy prints jokes.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, they print jokes, interviews, hard-hitting journalism. It’s not just about the pictures.

name: monica
dialogue: That didn’t work on mom, it’s not going to work on us.

name: ross
dialogue: Here, check it out. It’s the first one, too.

name: chandler
dialogue: That is funny. It was also funny when I made it up.

name: ross
dialogue: What?

name: chandler
dialogue: I made that joke up.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, oh-oh, no you didn’t. I did.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes, I did. I told it to Dan at work, and he said it was the funniest joke he’d ever heard.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, tell Dan, ‘Thanks.’

name: ross
dialogue: What?

name: rachel
dialogue: I’m sorry, I was just reading the joke below it. Man, that one is funny.

name: chandler
dialogue: Monica, you remember me telling you that joke, right?

name: monica
dialogue: No.

name: chandler
dialogue: Seriously?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, you tell a lot of jokes!

name: ross
dialogue: Look, Chandler, it’s my joke. But, hey, if it makes you feel any better they don’t print the name, so it doesn’t really matter who gets credit, right?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, I guess.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey guys.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey, Joey, Playboy printed my joke.

name: ross
dialogue: No, it’s my joke, it’s mine. You can call them, they’ll tell you.

name: chandler
dialogue: It’s my joke.

name: ross
dialogue: It’s my joke.

name: joey
dialogue: Whoa-whoa-whoa. Jokes? You guys know they have naked chicks in there, right?

name: chandler
dialogue: Dude, you have got to turn on Behind the Music. The band Heart is having a really tough time, and I think they may break up.

name: joey
dialogue: Let’s go watch it at your place.

name: chandler
dialogue: Nah, Monica’s watching some cooking show. Come on, I don’t want to miss when they were skinny.

name: joey
dialogue: Chandler, Chandler, you know what we should do? You and I should go out and get some new sunglasses.

name: chandler
dialogue: What? No, I want to watch this. . Did your cable go out?

name: joey
dialogue: No, that’s VH-1. I got to tell you, the music these kids listen to today . . . It’s like a lotta noise to me. I don’t know

name: chandler
dialogue: Joey, why is your cable out?

name: joey
dialogue: I uh, oh! Because, uh, I haven’t really paid the bill

name: chandler
dialogue: If you need money, will you please-please just let me loan you some money?

name: joey
dialogue: No, Chandler. Look, forget about it, okay? Look, I know things have been a little tight since Janine moved out. Oh, was she hot.

name: chandler
dialogue: Whoa ho.

name: joey
dialogue: I know! Yeah, but, look I can handle it. All right? Look, I can listen to the radio, huh? And Ross gave me this great book .

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, you want to see if the joke stealer will let us watch the show at his place?

name: joey
dialogue: Sure.

name: chandler
dialogue: Paid your phone bill?

name: joey
dialogue: Not so much.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey.

name: monica
dialogue: It’s only you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wh-wh-what are you doing?

name: rachel
dialogue: We are looking at a Playboy.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, I want to look too! . Yikes!

name: monica
dialogue: So do you think that these pictures—Are, are they trying to tell a story?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, yeah, sure. I mean, like in the case of this young woman, she has lost her clothes, so she rides naked on the horse, she’s crying out, ‘Where are they, where are they?’

name: monica
dialogue: Well, she’s not going to find them lying in the grass like that.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, yeah. Aw, remember the days when you used to go out to the barn, lift up your shirt, and bend over?

name: rachel and monica
dialogue: Yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: You see, now, I would date this girl. She’s cute, she’s outdoorsy, you know, and she knows how to build a fire. I mean, that’s got to come in handy

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, I’ve got a question. If you had to pick one of us to date, who would it be?

name: rachel
dialogue: I don’t know.

name: monica
dialogue: Me neither.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Rachel.

name: monica
dialogue: What?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: I don’t know.  Me neither.

name: joey
dialogue: You forget how many great songs Heart had.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: You know, Barracuda was the first song I learned to play on the keyboard.

name: chandler
dialogue: So, you heard it, you repeated it, so that must mean you wrote it.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, you guys, with this joke. I got to say, I know I cracked up, but I’m not even sure I got it.

name: ross
dialogue: What, you didn’t get it? The doctor is a monkey.

name: chandler
dialogue: And monkeys can’t write out prescriptions.

name: chandler
dialogue: You are not allowed to laugh at my joke.

name: ross
dialogue: Your joke? Well, I think ‘the Hef’ would disagree, which is why he sent me a check for one hundred ah-dollars.

name: chandler
dialogue: So, you stole my joke, and you stole my money.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I was going to stick it in the ATM, but now I think I’ll show the sexy teller that I am a published writer.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, she is going to know that you stole the joke.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, what are you going to do, follow me down there?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah!

name: ross
dialogue: Well, I’m not going to go now anyway .

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay .

name: gunther
dialogue: Here you go.

name: joey
dialogue: Ah, Gunther, I can’t pay for this right now because I’m not working, so I’ve had to cut down on some luxuries like uh, paying’ for stuff.

name: gunther
dialogue: Well, if you want, you can work here.

name: joey
dialogue: Uh, I don’t know. You see, it’s just, see I was a regular on a soap opera you know? And to go from that to this, I just… Plus, I’d have to wait on all my friends.

name: gunther
dialogue: Okay, but the money’s good, plus you get to stare at Rachel as much as you want.

name: joey
dialogue: What?!

name: gunther
dialogue: Flexible hours.

name: joey
dialogue: Maybe I could be a waiter. Could I use the phone?

name: monica
dialogue: She picked Rachel. I mean, she tried to back out of it, but it was obvious. She picked Rachel.

name: chandler
dialogue: He took my joke, he took it.

name: monica
dialogue: It’s wrong. You know what else is wrong? Phoebe picking Rachel.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know who else picked Rachel? Ross, and you know what else Ross did? He stole my joke. You know what? I’m going to get a joke journal. you know? And document the date and time of every single one of my jokes.

name: monica
dialogue: That’s a good idea.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah!

name: monica
dialogue: Do you know what’s a bad idea?

name: chandler
dialogue: Picking Rachel.

name: monica
dialogue: That’s right.  Did you hear something?

name: chandler
dialogue: Maybe it’s the sound of Ross climbing into my brain and stealing my thoughts.

name: monica
dialogue: It’s coming from the living room.

name: joey
dialogue: I finished my book.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey, you guys.

name: phoebe and rachel
dialogue: Hey.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, don’t you guys look cute. You guys make such a cute couple.

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica, what are you doing?

name: monica
dialogue: Nothing, I’m just trying to recreate some of the fun that we had at my place the other day.  Remember, when you picked Rachel over me? That was funny.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I guess it was kind of funny.

name: monica
dialogue: It wasn’t funny at all! Why would you do that? Why didn’t you pick me?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Fine. The reason that I was leaning a little bit more toward Rachel than you is just that you’re … just … kind of high maintenance—Okay let’s go to lunch!

name: monica
dialogue: That is completely untrue. You think I’m high maintenance? Okay, prove it. I want you to make a list and we’re going to go through it point by point!

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, okay, you’re right. You’re easy-going. You’re just not as easy-going as Rachel. She’s just more flexible and-and mellow. That’s all.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, people are different.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You, you know, Rachel … she’ll do whatever you want. you know, you can just walk all over her.

name: rachel
dialogue: What? Wait a minute. What are you saying, that I’m a pushover? I’m not a pushover.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, okay,  you’re not a pushover.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my … you think I’m a pushover. Well wait, watch this, you know what? You’re not invited to lunch. What do you think of that? I think that’s pretty strong, that’s what I think. Come on, Monica, let’s go to lunch.

name: monica
dialogue: You start working on that list.

name: rachel
dialogue: I cannot believe her.

name: monica
dialogue: I know. Where do you want to go eat?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, oh, I love that Japanese place.

name: monica
dialogue: I’m sick of Japanese. We’re not going there.

name: rachel
dialogue: All right, wherever you want to go is cool.

name: monica
dialogue: All right.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, hey, Gunther, check this out.

name: gunther
dialogue: Yeah, that-that Chandler cracks me up.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey Ross, listen, you want anything to drink, because I’m heading up there.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, yeah, I’ll take a coffee. Thanks, man.

name: joey
dialogue: Sure.  Coffee? Because I’m going up there.

name: rachel
dialogue: No.

name: monica
dialogue: No, thank you.

name: joey
dialogue: You guys need anything, because I’m heading up there.

name: woman
dialogue: I’d love an ice water.

name: joey
dialogue: You got it.

name: monica
dialogue: Joey, what are you doing?

name: joey
dialogue: Just being friendly.

name: rachel
dialogue: Joey, honey, I don’t think you’re supposed to go back there.

name: joey
dialogue: Nah, it’s okay. Right, Gunther?

name: gunther
dialogue: Don’t wink at me. And put on your apron.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, but I don’t see you asking any other paying customers to put on aprons.

name: monica
dialogue: Joey, do you work here?

name: joey
dialogue: No.

name: customer
dialogue: Hey, waiter.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah?

name: monica
dialogue: Joey, what’s going on. What didn’t you tell us you work here?

name: joey
dialogue: It’s kind of embarrassing, you know. I mean, I was an actor and now I’m a waiter. It’s supposed to go in the other direction.

name: chandler
dialogue: So is your apron. You’re wearing it like a cape.

name: joey
dialogue: I mean, the job’s easy and the money’s good, you know? I guess I’m going to be hanging out here anyway. I might as well get paid for it, right? I just feel kind of weird serving you guys.

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on, Joey, I did it and it was fine.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, why would it be weird? Hey, Joey, can I get some coffee?

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, I guess it doesn’t seem that weird.

name: ross
dialogue: Seriously, I-I asked you before and you still haven’t gotten it.

name: joey
dialogue: See, now it’s weird again.

name: chandler
dialogue: I think it’s great that you work here. You’re going to make a lot of money, and here’s your first tip

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, you know what? This is great. Finally, I have someone I can pass on my wisdom too. Let me tell you about a couple of things I learned while working at the coffeehouse. First of all, the customer is always right.  A smile goes a long way.  And if anyone is ever rude to you? Sneeze muffin.

name: joey
dialogue: Thanks, Rach. Look, you guys are just terrific. you know? Now, how about clearing out of here so I can get some new customers. It’s all about turnover.

name: ross
dialogue: Joey, seriously, can I get my coffee?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, I’m sorry, Ross. I’ll get it for you right now. And since I made you wait, I’ll toss in a free muffin.

name: rachel
dialogue: Phoebe. We would like to talk to you for a second.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.

name: monica
dialogue: So, maybe I am a little high maintenance. And maybe Rachel is a little bit of a pushover. But you know what we decided you are?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, we are very sorry to tell you this, but you, Phoebe, are flaky.

name: monica
dialogue: Hah!

dialogue: Apparently Howie’s editing now. Yeah, he-he-he calls me up and asks me if he can edit my new movie. Can you believe that?! you know I-I-I haven’t spoken to him in like ten years and he asks me for a favour!

dialogue: Okay.

dialogue: Yeah, so it turns out that it wasn’t the hair straightener that started the fire.  No-no, it was the candles. It’s very not good leaving candles unattended. In fact, one of the first things they teach you in fire school is…  Uhh… Uhh… Okay. Well, I have to go now.

name: ross
dialogue: We had such a great time! She’s-she’s incredible! I thought the-the age difference might be a problem, but it wasn’t. It wasn’t at all. Elizabeth is very mature for her age.   A concept lost on some people!

name: monica
dialogue: So it’s okay to date a student.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, not really. I mean technically it’s-it’s not against the rules or anything, but it is frowned upon. Especially by that professor we ran into last night, Judgey von Holierthanthou.

dialogue: Well Ross, you be careful now. You don’t want to get a reputation as you know Professor McNailshisstudents.

You see, I didn’t, I didn’t tell you but umm, but I-I had recently refilled the tissues and so you know let’s just face it, that’s just kindling! So I think it’s better that I stay at Joey’s.

dialogue: You pushed him!

dialogue: Uh-huh.

name: joey

name: ross
dialogue: Oo-oo!

name: elizabeth
dialogue: Doorknob?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, it kind of grows on you.  Actually, I wanted to finish talking to you about uh, spring vacation.

name: elizabeth
dialogue: Oh good.

name: ross
dialogue: Look, I…  Look, I’m having a great time with you and I just don’t want us to move to fast or put to much pressure on us. So, I’m sorry I just don’t think we should go away together yet. It’s-it’s too soon.

dialogue: Ross, I think you misunderstood what I was saying. I just wanted to tell you that I’m going to Florida for a couple weeks.

dialogue: No. I think you misunderstood what I was saying. What I meant was

name: ross
dialogue: What’s-what’s the difference?

name: monica
dialogue: Well, spring vacation is doing nice things with your grandparents. Spring break you’re doing frat guys.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey, you know what? Not all spring breaks are like that.

dialogue: What did you do on yours?

name: ross
dialogue: I went to Egypt with my dad.

name: chandler
dialogue: I can see it now, "Look dad, it’s the Sphinx!"

name: ross

name: monica
dialogue: And slept with the professor.

name: ross
dialogue: I’m going to call her.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah.

dialogue: Hey! You guys umm, I want you to meet Sebastian.

dialogue: Hi.

name: rachel
dialogue: We just uh, we just met at the newsstand. We both grabbed for the last Field & Stream.  What? I read that.

name: rachel
dialogue: What?

dialogue: You ask us to find you a guy and you come traipsing in here with your own!

dialogue: Yes! We found you a really cute and funny guy from Chandler’s work!

dialogue: Yeah and I-I found you one too who is not a weirdo.

dialogue: Are you sure?! Because our guy smells incredible!

dialogue: Uh, would you stop it with that already?!

name: sebastian
dialogue: Here you go.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, thank you.

name: sebastian
dialogue: Sure.

dialogue: So, Sebastian, do you do any volunteer work?

name: sebastian
dialogue: Uh, no not really. Why?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No reason, it’s just I know a single guy that cares about other people.

name: chandler
dialogue: Are you funny?

name: sebastian
dialogue: Excuse me?

name: rachel
dialogue: What are you guys doing?

name: monica
dialogue: Are you funny? Tell us a joke!

name: sebastian
dialogue: Look, I just wanted to have coffee with Rachel.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, so do a lot of people.

dialogue: Actually, I uh, I got to get going.  Give me a call sometime.

dialogue: Oh, but you know, no, you didn’t give me your phone number.

name: sebastian
dialogue: Okay! See you later!

dialogue: Turns out he is kind of funny.

name: rachel
dialogue: I cannot believe you guys! He was really nice and he left because of you!

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, but Sebastian? What is that? A cat’s name?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, you know what I noticed Rachel? He scares easy. Is that the kind of guy you’d like to take to a ball? "Hey Sebastian, would you like to dance?"  "Uhh, okay—I got to go!"

name: monica
dialogue: All right guys stop it. Rachel, we’re very sorry that is a very insensitive thing for us to do. And you know what? Let us make it up to you, we have two really great guys for you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah! What have you got to lose? you know you might even end up with someone really special  if you pick my guy.

name: rachel
dialogue: All right.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, so you will meet our guys?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, I’ll meet ‘them.

dialogue: Okay now it doesn’t matter which one you choose, you know? It’s completely up to you. Our guy is perfect, or you can go out with the guy Phoebe deemed not good enough to go out with herself.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay sure!

dialogue: Really?!

dialogue: Call it even?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay.

dialogue: Well, there you are! So what did Elizabeth say?

name: ross
dialogue: Well, it turns out that she is going to Daytona for spring break woo-hoo. That means, that means wet T-shirt contests, guys doing shots off of girl’s bodies, waking up next to people you don’t even know

dialogue: Man, she is going to have a great time! Is she staying at the Hotel Corona?

name: chandler
dialogue: You know the hotels?

dialogue: Sure! I was there! Spring Break ’81! Woo-hoo!

name: monica
dialogue: In 1981 you were 13!

name: joey
dialogue: So what? I drove down, sold T-shirts, had a blast. And you know who knows how to party? Drunk college chicks.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, she can’t go.

dialogue: Ross, you can’t tell her not to go. You just started dating.

dialogue: All right!
