dialogue: It's all going to be okay. They're just so happy that I'm not suing them that they gave me one extra month paid maternity leave. So long as I understand that the money should not construed as a down payment on this or any other child I should bear.

name: chandler
dialogue: Wow, Ralph Lauren is really going out of there way to show they're not in the baby buying business.

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler, can you give us a minute?

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh I'm sorry, you are kicking me out of my own living room?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: chandler
dialogue: I'll be in there.

name: rachel
dialogue: Joey, I'm really sorry that I lied to you. I was just trying to make things-;

name: joey
dialogue: I know. I know.

name: rachel
dialogue: It kind of worked. I mean you know, I don't know about you buy I haven't thought about our thing since all this.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey you are right. Yeah, it's kind of been like us again a little bit.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah I know! I miss that.

name: joey
dialogue: Me too. I mean I-;haven't thought at all about how I put myself out there and said all that stuff and how you didn't feel the same way about me and-and how it was really awkward.

name: rachel
dialogue: My gynaecologist tried to kill me.

name: ross
dialogue: Item J437-A, colour

name: mona
dialogue: Listen Ross, you don't have to apologize. I understand why you were there.

name: ross
dialogue: You do?

name: mona
dialogue: Yeah, you still have feelings for me. And-and to be honest, I-I still have feelings for you. And I wish that we can work it out Ross, but we can't. It's too complicated with you and Rachel and the baby, I-I just-; It just wasn't meant to be.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh God you are right.

name: mona
dialogue: Ross, we-;we have to be strong. Okay, I-I'm going to go.  Can I? To remember you?

name: ross
dialogue: No.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh, Ross, Mon, is it okay if I bring someone to your parent's anniversary party?

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: Sure. Yeah.

name: joey
dialogue: So, who's the guy?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, his name is Parker and I met him at the drycleaners.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ooh, did he put a little starch in your bloomers?  Who said that?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, he's really great though. He has this incredible zest for life, and he treats me like a queen, except at night when he treats me like the naughty girl I am.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, by the way. Would it be okay if I gave the toast to mom and dad this year?

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, yeah, you sure you want to after what happened at their 20th?

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah, I'd really like to.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, hopefully this time mom won't boo you.

name: monica
dialogue: Yes! Every year Ross makes the toast, and it's always really moving, and always makes them cry. Well this year I'm going to make them cry.

name: chandler
dialogue: And you wonder why Ross is their favourite?

name: monica
dialogue: No! Really! Any time Ross makes a toast everyone cries, and hugs him, and pats him on the back and they all come up to me and say, "God, your brother." Know what they'll say this year? "God, you"

name: joey
dialogue: Well I can promise you, at least one person will be crying.  I'm an actor, and any actor worth himself can cry on cue.

name: monica
dialogue: Really you can do that?

name: joey
dialogue: Are you kidding me? Watch!  Well I can't do it with you guys watching me!

name: chandler
dialogue: What are you doing?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh I'm working on my toast for the party, or as I like to call it. Sob fest 2002. Hey check this out.

name: chandler
dialogue: It's a dog.

name: monica
dialogue: It's a dead dog. that is Chi-Chi; she died when I was in high school.

name: chandler
dialogue: It's your parents' anniversary and you are going to talk about their dead pet?

name: monica
dialogue: The good stuff, huh?

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: You got a present for my parents. that is so sweet.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, in honour of their 35th wedding anniversary, I had a star named after them.

name: ross
dialogue: Aww that is so cool.

name: joey
dialogue: And I got them a book on Karma Sutra for the elderly.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey, do you guys have any extra ribbon?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, sure. What do you need? We got lace, satin, sateen, raffia, gingham, felt,  and I think my testacles may be in here too.

name: ross
dialogue: Aww! Chi-Chi! Oh, I loved this dog! You know Monica couldn't get braces because Chi-Chi needed knee surgery.

name: monica
dialogue: What?!

name: ross
dialogue: You were the 200-pound 11-year-old who rode her!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: all
dialogue: Hi!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Everybody, this is Parker, Parker this is-

name: parker
dialogue: No, no, no wait! Don't tell me. Let me guess.  Joey, Monica, Ross, Rachel and, I'm sorry Phoebe didn't mention you.  Chandler, I'm kidding all ready you are my favourite!

name: chandler
dialogue: Ha!

name: parker
dialogue: Why don't all of you tell me a little about your self?

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, actually, I'm sorry we-we probably should get going.

name: parker
dialogue: Classic Ross. Rachel, Rachel, oh how you glow. May I?

name: rachel
dialogue: I, uh, think you already are.

name: parker
dialogue: Rachel, you have life growing inside you. Is there anything in this world more miraculous than-Oh a picture of a dog! Whose is this?

name: monica
dialogue: that is my old dog. He passed away years ago.

name: parker
dialogue: Oh well, at least you were lucky to have him. Bow-wow old friend, bow-wow. So where's the party?

name: monica
dialogue: It's out on the island. It's in Massapequa.

name: parker
dialogue: Maaaassapequa, sounds like a magical place. Tell me about Massapequa, is it steep in Native American history? {Transcriber's Note

name: ross
dialogue: Well, there is an Arby's in the shape of a tee-pee.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, I got my note cards.  Do you got the presents?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah.

name: monica
dialogue: And I've got the car keys.

name: parker
dialogue: We're driving!?

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah.

name: parker
dialogue: Aces!

name: ross
dialogue: So uh, he seems like a nice guy.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, yeah I like him a lot.

name: ross
dialogue: You want to hang back and take our own cab?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, otherwise I'm not going.

name: mr. and mrs. geller
dialogue: Hi

name: ross
dialogue: Hi!  Hey mom.

name: rachel
dialogue: This is such a great party! 35 years. Very impressive, do you guys have any pearls of wisdom?

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Jack?

name: mr. geller
dialogue: Why would you serve food on such a sharp stick?

name: ross
dialogue: that is a good question, dad. that is a good question-

name: rachel
dialogue: Hmmm-.

name: woman
dialogue: Congratulations you two!

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you-we're so excited

name: woman
dialogue: And also, congratulations on your wedding.

name: ross
dialogue: Wha-What?

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Can we talk to you for just you know- It's just a little thing. Well we think it's absolutely marvellous that you are having this baby out of wedlock, some of our friends are less open-minded. Which is why we've told them all that you are married.

name: ross and rachel
dialogue: What?!

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Thanks for going along with this.

name: ross
dialogue: Dad so what we have to pretend that we're married?

name: mr. geller
dialogue: Son, I had to shave my ears for tonight. You can do this.

name: ross
dialogue: Can you believe that?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, if you are going to do the ears, you might as well take a pass at the nasal area.

name: ross
dialogue: No, us having to lie about being married.

name: rachel
dialogue: No, I know I don't either, but you know what, it's their party, and it's just one night. And we don't even have to lie; we just won't say anything. If it comes up again, we'll just-smile. We'll nod along.

name: woman
dialogue: Ross!

name: man
dialogue: Rachel!

name: ross
dialogue: Hi Aunt Lisa, Uncle Dan

name: aunt lisa
dialogue: Congratulations on the baby, and on the wedding

name: ross and rachel
dialogue: Hmm-.

name: uncle dan
dialogue: Here's a little something to get you started.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh-

name: aunt lisa
dialogue: So, how's married life treating you?

name: rachel
dialogue: Unbelievable!

name: ross
dialogue: We love marriage!

name: aunt lisa
dialogue: Great!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: parker
dialogue: What a beautiful place. What a great night! I have to tell you, being here with all of you in Event Room C-I feel so lucky. I think of all the good times that have happened here. The birthdays, the proms, the mitzvahs both bar and bat, but none of them will compare with tonight! My God, I don't want to forget this moment! It's like I want to take a mental picture of you all! Click!

name: chandler
dialogue: I don't think the flash went off.

name: parker
dialogue: Dahaaa!  I'm going to find the men's room, be right back.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I'll go with you

name: parker
dialogue: Come on!

name: chandler
dialogue: Somewhere there is someone with a tranquilizer gun and a huge butterfly net looking for that man.

name: joey
dialogue: I have to go to the bathroom too, but I don't want him complimenting my thing.

name: ross
dialogue: I'm so we weren't in the car! Did he ever let up?

name: monica
dialogue: He called the Long Island Expressway a concrete miracle.

name: ross
dialogue: This room! This night! That waiter! His shoes! I must take a mental picture!  Ooh sorry-

name: phoebe
dialogue: Were you guys making fun of Parker?

name: ross
dialogue: That depends, how much did you hear?

name: phoebe
dialogue: So, he a little enthusiastic, what's wrong with that?

name: monica
dialogue: It's just that, it's so much.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, so what I like him! Do I make fun of the people you've dated? Tag, Janice, Mona? No, because friends don't do that. But, do you want my opinion? Do you want it? Because in my opinion, your collective dating record reads like the who's who of human crap.

name: monica
dialogue: I feel terrible.

name: joey
dialogue: I know

name: ross
dialogue: What was wrong with Mona?

name: rachel
dialogue: Open it! Open it! Open it!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah baby!

name: man
dialogue: So we never got to hear about your wedding!

name: woman
dialogue: We were surprise that we weren't invited.

name: ross
dialogue: No, no, it was just our parents and 1 or 2 friends. It was a small wedding.

name: rachel
dialogue: But it was beautiful. I mean it was small, but kind of spectacular.

name: man
dialogue: Where did you have it?

name: rachel
dialogue: On a cliff, in Barbados, at sunset, and Stevie Wonder sang Isn't She Lovely as I walked down the aisle.

name: woman
dialogue: Really?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, Stevie's an old family friend.

name: woman
dialogue: Oh my God. That sounds amazing. I would love to see pictures.

name: rachel
dialogue: So would I. You wouldn't think that Annie Liebawitz would forget to put film in the camera.

name: ross
dialogue: Would you excuse us for a second?  Umm-. what are you doing?

name: rachel
dialogue: What? I'm not you. This may be the only wedding I ever have. I want it to be amazing.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay, okay. Ooh, ooh maybe I rode in on a Harley.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, Ross, it has to be realistic.

name: parker
dialogue: Are you okay? You seem kind of quiet.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, I'm fine. I'm great. I'm with you.

name: parker
dialogue: And I'm with you! What a great time to be alive! Look at this plate-bouncy thing.  What an inspired solution to man's plate dispensing problems.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hm huh, yeah.

name: parker
dialogue: Ah! Oysters! Let me feed you one.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, that is not necessary.

name: parker
dialogue: Please.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, actually I don't eat-

name: parker
dialogue: I won't quit until you try.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, fine! Fine!  Mmm-hmm-.

name: parker
dialogue: What are they like? I've never had one.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Why don't you just try one?

name: parker
dialogue: No, they look too weird.

name: chandler
dialogue: What are you doin'?

name: monica
dialogue: Just going over my toast. Those two will never know what hit them. I can't wait. They're going to be crying so hard. They're going to be fighting for breath.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know if you want to, I can just hold them down and you could .

name: rachel
dialogue: And my veil was lace, made by blind, Belgium nuns.

name: woman
dialogue: Blind?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, not at first, but it was very intricate work and they said even though they lost their sight, it was all worth it.

name: aunt lisa
dialogue: I'll bet you looked beautiful-

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I don't know about that, but some said that I looked like a floating angel.

name: woman
dialogue: So, how did you propose?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah. that is a great story.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, um, actually, I-I took her to the planetarium. that is-that is where we had our first date. Um, she walked in and I had the room filled with lilies, her favourite flower-

name: aunt lisa
dialogue: Oh that is so sweet!

name: rachel
dialogue: Shh! I want to hear the rest!

name: ross
dialogue: Then, Fred Astaire singing The Way You Look Tonight came on the sound system, and the lights came down. And I got down on one knee and written across the dome in the stars were the words "Will you marry me?"

name: rachel
dialogue: And the ring, was the size of my fist !

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah uh, Phoebe! Look umm, I want to apologize about before, okay? We were being jerks. Parker's a nice guy and I'd like to get to know him.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Then you better do it now.

name: joey
dialogue: Why?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Because I'm going to kill him

name: joey
dialogue: What-what?

name: phoebe
dialogue: You guys were right. He's just too excited about-everything. I mean I'm all for living life, but this is the Geller's 35th anniversary. Okay? Let's call a spade a spade this party stinks.

name: joey
dialogue: I know I'm having the worst time. There was a 15-minute line for the buffet, and when I finally got up to the plates, I slipped on a giant booger!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Are you sure it wasn't an oyster?

name: joey
dialogue: I guess it could've been, I didn't really look at it. you know, I just wiped it on Chandler's coat and got the hell out of there.

name: phoebe
dialogue: He's just such a great guy I'm so excited about him.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh hey, you should be excited about him. There's nothing wrong with him he's a good guy.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You think?

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah. You know what I think; I think we were all just being too negative.

name: phoebe
dialogue: you are right. you are right, he's just embracing life. We could all stand to be a little more like Parker. You know what? I am like him! I'm a sunny, positive person.

name: joey
dialogue: Actually, you have a little bit of an edge.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What's that now?

name: joey
dialogue: Nothing-

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh look it's Parker!

name: parker
dialogue: Look! It's the bunny hop!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh I love it!

name: parker
dialogue: You do?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Are you kidding? People acting like animals to music. Come on!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay it's time for the toast! Umm now-now, I know that Ross usually gives the toast, but this year I'm going to do it.

name: monica
dialogue: No, no it's going to be great. Really! Mom, Dad, when I got married, one of the things that made me sure I could do it was the amazing example the two of you set for me. For that and so many other things I want to say thank you. I know I probably don't say it enough, but I love you.  When I look around this room, I'm-I'm saddened by the thought of those who could not be here with us. Nana, my beloved grandmother who would so want to be here, but she can't because she's dead. As is our dog Chi-Chi. I mean look how cute she is. . Was.  Do me a favour and pass this to my parents. Remember she's dead. Okay, her and Nana, gone. Wow! Hey does anybody remember when Debra Winger had to say goodbye to her children in Terms of Endearment?  Didn't see that? No movie fans?! You want to hear something sad? The other day I was watching 60 Minutes these orphans in Romania, who have been so neglected, they were incapable of love.  You people are made of stone! Here's to mom and dad! Whatever!

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Thank you Monica that was uh, interesting. Wasn't it interesting, Jack?

name: mr. geller
dialogue: Why don't I remember this dog?

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Ross, why don't you give us your toast now?

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, no, Mom, it's just Monica this year.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: you are not going to say anything? On our 35th wedding anniversary

name: ross
dialogue: No, of course, Um- Um, everybody? Um, I-I just wanted to say-on behalf of my new bride, Rachel , and myself. Umm, that if-if in 35 years, we're half as happy as you guys are, we'll count ourselves the luckiest people in the world.

name: mrs. geller
dialogue: Oh Ross-

name: mr. geller
dialogue: I just wish Nana were alive to hear Ross's toast.

name: parker
dialogue: My God what a fantastically well lit hallway!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Can I get you something to drink? Like a water and Valium?

name: parker
dialogue: I must say this apartment, its, its, There are no words-

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh thank God.

name: parker
dialogue: It's a haven. A third-floor paradise. A modern-day Eden in the midst-

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah? I know! I know! Uh huh? Listen why don't we just um, sit and relax? You know just be with each other. Quietly!

name: parker
dialogue: That sounds great.  My God this is the most comfortable couch I've ever sat on in my entire life.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Let's try something else, let's play a game.

name: parker
dialogue: I love games!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Shocking! Let's play the game of who can stay quiet the longest.

name: parker
dialogue: Or-Jenga.

name: phoebe
dialogue: But, let's play this one first. And remember whoever talks first loses!

name: parker
dialogue: I lose, now Jenga.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God! Oh my God!

name: parker
dialogue: Is something wrong?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wrong? Really? You know the word wrong. Everything isn't perfect? Everything isn't magical? Everything isn't a glow with the light of a million fairies? They were just brake lights, Parker!

name: parker
dialogue: Well, excuse me for putting a good spin on a traffic jam!

name: phoebe
dialogue: You don't have to put a good spin on everything.

name: parker
dialogue: I'm sorry that is who I am. I'm a positive person.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No! I am a positive person. You are like Santa Clause on Prozac, at Disneyland, getting laid!

name: parker
dialogue: So what do you want me to do, you want me to be more negative, less happy?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Much less happy!

name: parker
dialogue: Fine! Well then to quote Ross, "I'd better be going."

name: phoebe
dialogue: So long! Don't let the best door in the world hit you in the ass on your way out!

name: parker
dialogue: Isn't this the most incredible fight you've ever had in your entire life?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uh huh.

name: ross
dialogue: -and then, we could've gone from the ceremony to the reception with you in the sidecar!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross, it just wouldn't have been feasible.

name: ross
dialogue: But having a dove place the ring on your finger would've been no problem?

name: rachel
dialogue: It was really fun being married to you tonight.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah! And! And, it was the easiest 400 bucks I've ever made.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay Ross, can I uh, can I ask you something?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: That proposal, at the planetarium-

name: ross
dialogue: I know, I know it was stupid.

name: rachel
dialogue: Are you kidding?! With the, with the lilies, and-and the song, and the stars! It was-really wonderful! Did you just make that up?

name: ross
dialogue: No, actually I thought about it when, when we were going out. It's how I imagined I uh, I would ask you to marry me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, that would've been very hard to say no too.

name: ross
dialogue: It's a good thing I didn't do it, because it sounds like it would've been a very expensive wedding.  Okay, good night

name: rachel
dialogue: Goodnight

name: ross
dialogue: Even if the sidecar had a windscreen so your hair wouldn't get messed up?

name: rachel
dialogue: I will think about it.

name: ross
dialogue: that is all I'm asking'

name: monica
dialogue: Okay that is it. I give up. At mom and dad's 40th anniversary, you are the one giving the speech.

name: ross
dialogue: You know I don't understand why they didn't cry. It was a beautiful speech.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, come on.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey! All that stuff you said about true love, you were right, I mean, we did learn a lot from Mom and Dad! And that picture of Chi-Chi with her mischievous grin. And what you said about Nana. OH, yeah she really would've wanted to be there. And you know what? I think she was.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh good God, Ross! How the hell do you do it?

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey!

name: rachel
dialogue: So, I'm in my apartment doing the Soap Opera Digest crossword puzzle, and guess who the clue is for three down.

name: joey
dialogue: Three down, Days Of Our Lives star blank Tribbiani. that is me!! I'm blank!!

name: monica
dialogue: How cool is this?! We know three down! I'm touching three down!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah you are baby.

name: monica
dialogue: Three down knows I'm married, what's three down doin'?

name: rachel
dialogue: So did they call you to tell you your name's going to be in this?

name: joey
dialogue: No. They really like me over there. They want to do a big profile on me, but I said no.

name: ross
dialogue: Why'd you say no?

name: joey
dialogue: Remember what happened the last time I did an interview for them? I said I write a lot of my own lines, and then the writers got mad and made my character fall down the elevator shaft. So who knows what I might say this time.

name: chandler
dialogue: If only there was something in your head to control the things you say.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, come on Joey! You will totally keep it in check this time, and plusyou know the publicity would be really good for your career! And you deserve that! And if you do the interview you can mention, oh I don't know, gal pal Rachel Green?

name: chandler
dialogue: Is that gal pal spelled L-O-S-E-R?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay, don't listen to him. Please?

name: joey
dialogue: Fine! All right, I'll do it. But hey! You guys have to be at the next table so you can stop me if I you know, start to say something stupid.

name: ross
dialogue: Just then or-or all the time, Because we-we have jobs you know.

name: rachel
dialogue: Come on! We will be there for you the whole time! Just remember gal pal Rachel Green.  Ha-ha! I'm going to be in Soap Opera Digest! And not just in the dumb crossword puzzle.  Seriously, proud of you.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah.

name: the interviewer
dialogue: I really appreciate you taking the time to do this.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, not at all. Happy to do it.

name: monica
dialogue: You think we're being obvious?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, we're just four people with neck problems. You talk like this.

name: the interviewer
dialogue: You know I think its great you wanted to meet here. you know when most people hear the magazine is paying for it they want to go to a big fancy restaurant.

name: joey
dialogue: Actually, I didn't know the magazine was paying for it. Wouldn't have mattered, I'm doing this for the fans, not for the free food.

name: gunther
dialogue: Can I get you anything?

name: the interviewer
dialogue: Umm, I'll have a cup of coffee.

name: joey
dialogue: And I'll have all the muffins.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey!

name: ross
dialogue: Shh! We're not talking.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh. Finally! Oh.

name: the interviewer
dialogue: So, according to your bio, you've done quite a bit of work before Days of Our Lives. Anything you are particularly proud of?

name: host
dialogue: Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get a nice glass of milk,  and these darn cartons are so flinging'-flanging' hard to open.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, you said it Mike.  Aw! There's got to be a better way!

name: mike
dialogue: And there is Kevin.

name: mike

dialogue: Eight weeks. I mean I love my mother, but my God, a long lunch with her is taxing.

name: monica
dialogue: I personally would be honoured if she wanted to live with me.

name: phoebe
dialogue: She can't hear you.

name: rachel
dialogue: What? You guys, come on! What am I going to do?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, if you don't want your mother to move in with you, just tell her.

name: rachel
dialogue: you are right. you are right. I mean I'm about to have a baby, I can tell my mother that I don't want her to just be sleeping on my couch! Oh my God! She's going to want to sleep in my bed with me. This cannot happen!

name: monica
dialogue: that is right. That is right, you go over there and tell her you don't want her to live with you. Do not take no for an answer!

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.

name: monica
dialogue: This is great! Now she's going to be mad at Rachel! You know what? And I'm just going to swoop in there and be like the daughter she never had.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I have new respect for Chandler. All right everybody! It's time to open the presents!

name: monica
dialogue: Yes! Yes! And I think that the first gift that Rachel opens should be from the grandmother of the baby, because you are the most important person in this room. And in the world!

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Well uh, I don't have a gift because I wasn't invited until the last minute, but thank you so much for bringing that to everyone's attention.

name: phoebe
dialogue: How about you less important people, let's open your presents!

name: rachel
dialogue: Mom that is okay that you didn't get you a gift!

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Well, I kind of did. Me. Eight weeks of me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah. Okay, see mom, the truth is I can do this on my own.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Sweetheart I know you are going to be terrific mom, I just think you need a little help, especially at the beginning.

name: rachel
dialogue: But mom, I really know what I'm doing. I can handle this.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Really? Remember Twinkles?

name: rachel
dialogue: He was a hamster! I am not going to vacuum up my baby!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, come on Rach it's present time! You know you are the glue that is holding this whole party together. It's kind of falling apart here.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Oh look.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wow!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Okay, this is from your friend at work.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my gosh! Oh wow! Oh, I know what this is!  Wait a minute. That can't be right. Is that a beer bong for a baby?

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Darling, that is a breast pump!

name: rachel
dialogue: Did I say I was done guessing? Okay, thank you for that. Oh wow! What's this?

name: woman
dialogue: It's a diaper genie.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, it dispenses clean diapers!

name: woman
dialogue: No! It's where you put the dirty ones!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well that is gross, why don't you just take it outside and throw it in a dumpster?

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Oh you are going to do that ten times a day?

name: rachel
dialogue: What?! It goes ten times a day! What are we feeding this baby?! Indian food?!

name: mrs. green
dialogue: No dear, that is what babies do.

name: monica
dialogue: Rachel, listen to your mother. She is very smart.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Plus, what are you planning on doing with the baby while you are trotting out to the garbage ten times a day?

name: rachel
dialogue: I don't know, I'd leave it on the changing table?  What?! What'd I do? What'd I do?!

name: mrs. green
dialogue: You can't leave a baby alone!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh come--Of course I know that. I mean of course you never leave a baby alone! I mean who would-she wouldn't be safe as she would be with me, the baby dummy. Oh God, okay. You know what? I think opening the presents right now is a little overwhelming right now. So I think umm, I'm just going to maybe open them a little bit later, but thank you all for coming. And for these beautiful gifts, and this basket is beautiful.

name: woman
dialogue: It's actually a bassinet.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay mommy, don't ever leave me.

name: joey
dialogue: In what John Houston film would you hear this line, "Badges? We don't need no stinking' badges!"

name: chandler
dialogue: Treasure of the Sierra Madre!

name: joey
dialogue: Correct! There's a possible backwards bonus!

name: chandler
dialogue: Madre Sierra the of Treasure!

name: joey
dialogue: Yes!

name: chandler
dialogue: I'd like to go up the ladder of chance to the golden mud hut please.

name: joey
dialogue: Wise choice, how many rungs?

name: chandler
dialogue: Six!

name: joey
dialogue: That noise can only me one thing.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hungry monkey.

name: ross
dialogue: Hungry monkey!  Haaa!  I'd like a Wicked Wango card!

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, it's an audio question, name this television theme song.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh.  Oh! Oh my God! Okay, I know this, give me-give me a second!

name: chandler
dialogue: Tell it to the Time Turtle!

name: ross
dialogue: Shut up! I Dream of Genie!

name: joey
dialogue: Yes! Yes, you are back in the lead!

name: ross
dialogue: I'd like to spin the wheel!

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh come on!!

name: joey
dialogue: All right! All right! Uh, umm, Super-Speedy Speed round!

name: ross
dialogue: Is there a hopping bonus?

name: joey
dialogue: Of course!

name: joey
dialogue: Who invented bifocals?

name: ross
dialogue: Ben Franklin.

name: joey
dialogue: Correct! Which monarch has ruled Great Britain the longest?

name: ross
dialogue: Queen Victoria.

name: joey
dialogue: Correct again! But, you forgot to switch legs between questions, so no hopping bonus!

name: ross
dialogue: No!!! Every time!!!

name: joey
dialogue: Now, over to Chandler.

name: chandler
dialogue: I'd like a Google Card.

name: joey
dialogue: Are you sure?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yes!  No!  Google!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh my God! Congratulations Ross, because Chandler, you've been Bamboozled!

name: chandler
dialogue: No!!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!!

name: chandler
dialogue: This is the best game ever!!!

name: rachel
dialogue: So umm, you are going to stay with me as long as I need you?

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Of course I am!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh mom, I swear I'm not an idiot. I've read all kinds of books on pregnancy and giving birth, but I-I just didn't think to read the part about what to do when the baby comes. And-and then guess what? The baby's coming and I don't know what to do. Oh, can I throw up in my diaper genie?

name: mrs. green
dialogue: No. Sweetie, you are going to be fine.

name: rachel
dialogue: Wait-wait where are you going? Where are you going?

name: mrs. green
dialogue: I'm going to the bathroom.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Now don't worry! Everything's going to be okay.

name: monica
dialogue: It is going to be okay!  It was worth a shot.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey! Why are you all red and sweaty?

name: ross
dialogue: I just Bamboozled Chandler!  Which is not uh sexual thing. That was a quick shower.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Not if you were here.

name: ross
dialogue: Wow! It looks like we got a lot of good stuff.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh we did, but my mom got us the greatest gift of all.

name: ross
dialogue: A Play-Dough Barber Shop?

name: rachel
dialogue: No. She's going to live with us for eight weeks.

name: ross
dialogue: Uh, what?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes! She's going to help us take care of the baby! Woo-hoo.

name: ross
dialogue: What-you are not serious. I mean she's a very nice woman, but there is no way we can take eight weeks of her. She'll drive us totally crazy.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Hi Ross!

name: ross
dialogue: Hi roomie!

name: man
dialogue: Hey Joey, hi! I'm Ray; I'm the producer of the show.

name: joey
dialogue: It's a pleasure to meet you Ray.

name: ray
dialogue: And this is Duncan  and Erin, they're going to help us out with the audition. So uh, let's get the camera rolling.

name: joey
dialogue: Rightie-O Ray!

name: ray
dialogue: Whenever you are ready.

name: joey
dialogue: Hello, I'm Joey Tribbiani! Let's play Bamboozled! Erin, you get the first question! In hockey, who is known as The Great One?

name: erin
dialogue: Wayne Gretzky.

name: joey
dialogue: Correct! Now, would you like to pick a Wicked Wango card or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?

name: ray
dialogue: Uh Joey, didn't your agents give you the revised rules? We've eliminated all of that. No wheel, no cards.

name: joey
dialogue: What-Why?!

name: ray
dialogue: Uh well, the game was too complicated and research showed people didn't follow it.

name: joey
dialogue: Well what's complicated? You spin the Wheel of Mayhem to go up the Ladder of Chance. You go past the Mud Hut through the Rainbow Ring to get to the Golden Monkey; you yank his tail and boom! you are in Paradise Pond!

name: ray
dialogue: Yeah all that is gone. It's basically just a simple question and answer game now.

name: joey
dialogue: Well what's fun about that? You expect me to be the host of a boring game that is just people standing around answering questions?

name: ray
dialogue: Well, there'll be women in bikinis holding up the scores.

name: joey
dialogue: Let's play Bamboozled!

name: mrs. green
dialogue: #NAME?

name: ross
dialogue: Well we-we don't have a garage.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Did I say garage? I meant garbage.

name: ross
dialogue: You know what? Maybe, Mrs. Green, it's not absolutely vital that you live with us.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Well Rachel needs help with the baby.

name: rachel
dialogue: I do. I really do. I don't know anything.

name: ross
dialogue: I'm-I'm sure that is not true.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh no? Pheebs? Monica? Do I know anything about babies?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No, not a thing.

name: monica
dialogue: It's frightening.

name: ross
dialogue: Well uh, you know what? Even if she doesn't know anything, I do! I have a son. And his mother and I didn't live together, and whenever he was with me I took care of him all the time, by myself.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: that is true. You do have another child.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: With another woman. Have you no control Ross?

name: ross
dialogue: that is a different issue. Uh, the point is, when the baby comes I will be there to-to feed her and bathe her and change her. And more than that I want to do all those things.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Well then you really don't need me to live with you.

name: ross
dialogue: Yes! Yes, you are going to be so missed.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: you are going to be a great father.

name: ross
dialogue: Well you are going to be a wonderful grandma.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hello?! I still don't know what the hell I'm doing!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, come on, every first time mother feels that way. You'll-you are going to pick it up.  Hey! You will! Uh look, you know when you first came to the city? You were this spoiled helpless little girl who-who still used daddy's credit card. Do you remember?

name: rachel
dialogue: I hope you are going somewhere with this.

name: ross
dialogue: Look at you! What-you are-you are this big executive! You are much more capable than you give yourself credit for. I-I have no doubt you are going to be an incredible mother.

name: rachel
dialogue: Really?

name: ross
dialogue: I'm telling you.

name: rachel
dialogue: Thank you.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: All right you two, I'm going to get going.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh.

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Oh no-no-no-no sweetheart, you stay put. I'll let myself out. It's like I'm not here, which I almost wasn't.

name: monica
dialogue: you are still so funny. you are so funny.  What do I do?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Nothing! You have apologized to her like a million times and she's been nothing but terrible to you. And don't forget you just threw her daughter a lovely, albeit slightly boring, shower, and she hasn't even thanked you for it.

name: monica
dialogue: You know what? you are-you are right.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah I mean if you want to say anything to her, I'd tell her off.

name: monica
dialogue: Really?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Uh-huh!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay! I will! Mrs. Green? Mrs. Green!  It is rude to leave a party without saying good-bye to the host! Yeah, and-and also when someone apologizes to you the decent thing to do is to accept it! Now what I did to you, it wasn't on purpose! But what you are during to me now is just plain spiteful!

name: mrs. green
dialogue: Spiteful?!

name: monica
dialogue: that is right! Maybe it's time you took a good hard look at a mirror young lady-old lady-lady!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wrap it up, wrap it up, wrap it up-

name: monica
dialogue: So whenever you are ready to apologize to me, I will forgive you. Good day!  I can't feel my legs!

name: phoebe
dialogue: You were fantastic! I'm so proud of you!

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah? I'm proud of me too.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You should be!

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah could-could-could you get me something to drink?

name: phoebe
dialogue: You got it!

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.  Mrs. Green! Okay I'm really sorry!! I'm apologizing for the-  Okay, I bit my tongue, but I'm still really sorry!

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay! I'm ready.

name: ross
dialogue: You sure?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yes, I've done my studying and I really know my stuff.

name: ross
dialogue: All right then.  Rachel Green! Let's play Bamboozled!  How do you test the temperature of the baby's bath water?

name: rachel
dialogue: Uh, put your elbow in it.

name: ross
dialogue: Excellent! How do you put a baby down for a nap?

name: rachel
dialogue: Full, dry, on its back, and no loose covers.

name: ross
dialogue: that is correct! This is an audio question, what do you do when the baby makes this sound?

name: rachel
dialogue: Check if it's wet, check if it's hungry, burp it!

name: ross
dialogue: Excellent! Excellent, now-now do you want another question or a Wicked Wango card?

name: rachel
dialogue: A card! A card! I pick a card!

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry you've been Bamboozled! you are going to be a terrible mother!  I've lost sight of why we're doing this!

name: ross
dialogue: Hey you guys I got some bad news.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well that is no way to sell newspapers. Why don't you try, "Extra! Extra! Read all about it!"

name: ross
dialogue: No, Monica's restaurant got a horrible review in the Post.  I didn't want her to see it, so I ran around the neighbourhood and bought all the copies I could find.

name: joey
dialogue: Man, this is bad! And I've had my share of bad reviews. I still remember my first good one though.  "Everything else in this production of Our Town was simply terrible. Joey Tribbiani was abysmal."

name: monica
dialogue: Hey!

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God! Look at all the newspapers! It must be a good review! Is it great?!

name: ross
dialogue: Umm-

name: monica
dialogue: Oh dear God!

name: ross
dialogue: But the good news is, no one in a two-block radius will ever know.

name: monica
dialogue: What about the rest of Manhattan?!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah, they all know.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh my God, this is horrible!

name: chandler
dialogue: I'm so sorry.

name: monica
dialogue: I'm so humiliated!

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah but you know what they say Mon, "There's no such thing as bad press."

name: monica
dialogue: You don't think that umm,  "The chef's Mahi Mahi was awful awful," is bad press?

name: rachel
dialogue: I didn't write it.

name: monica
dialogue: Is he right? Am I really-Am I awful?

name: all
dialogue: No!

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah! Yeah Monica! You listen to me, okay? And I'm not just saying this because I'm your friend, I'm saying' it Because it's the truth. you are food is abysmal!

name: rachel
dialogue: Ross!

name: ross
dialogue: What?! What?

name: rachel
dialogue: I am freaking out!

name: ross
dialogue: Are you?

name: rachel
dialogue: My due date is in one week!

name: ross
dialogue: What are you doing up?

name: rachel
dialogue: That is seven days!

name: ross
dialogue: Okay look, I had a lot of water before I went to bed. Can we do this after-

name: rachel
dialogue: No-no-no-no-no Ross! Please, come on we do not have any of the big stuff we need! We do not a changing table! We do not have a crib! We do not have a diaper service!

name: ross
dialogue: It's funny you should mention diapers.

name: rachel
dialogue: I'm serious.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay look, there's nothing to worry about. We have plenty of time. There's a great baby furniture store on west 10th. Tomorrow, we will go there and we will get you everything that you need. Okay?

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay. Thank you. that is great. Thank you. Wait-wait! Where on west 10th? Because there's this really cute shoe store that has like this little-

name: ross
dialogue: Okay. Okay. If uh, if you are going to do this, then I'm going to do that.  So-

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, wait Ross! I'm sorry, one more thing!

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah!

name: rachel
dialogue: Umm, our situation. You know umm, what we mean to each other. And I mean we-we're having this baby together, and we live together. Isn't that, isn't that weird?

name: ross
dialogue: Well uh-

name: rachel
dialogue: I'm just kidding! You can go pee!

name: joey
dialogue: Hey uh Monica, I can't remember. Did we say we were going to meet here or at the movies?

name: monica
dialogue: We said at the movies, but-

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, I'll see you there.

name: monica
dialogue: Joey!  Now that you are here-

name: joey
dialogue: Sure, I can hang out 'til I have to meet you.  What uh-How come you are not going?

name: chandler
dialogue: I have a job interview I have to get ready for.

name: joey
dialogue: I thought you already have a job.

name: chandler
dialogue: And people say you don't pay attention. No, this is a much better job. It's vice-president of a company that does data reconfiguration and statistical factoring for other companies.

name: joey
dialogue: Wow! How do you know how to do that?!

name: chandler
dialogue: that is what I do now.

name: monica
dialogue: Hey Joey, come taste this.

name: joey
dialogue: What is it?

name: monica
dialogue: Remember that guy that gave me a bad review? Well-  I'm getting my revenge!

name: joey
dialogue: You cooked him?

name: monica
dialogue: No. He teaches a course on food criticism at the New School, so before we go to the movies I want to go by there and make him try my bouillabaisse again. Oh, I cannot wait to read the front page of the Post tomorrow! "Restaurant reviewer admits

name: chandler
dialogue: The front page? You really do live in your own little world, don't you?

name: cashier
dialogue: Do you uh, want these things delivered Mr. and Mrs. Geller?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh.

name: rachel
dialogue: No-no-no! No, no, no, we're not married.

name: ross
dialogue: We are having a baby together, but we're not involved.  I mean, uh we-we were seeing each other a while ago, but then we were just friends. And then there was one drunken night.  Or, yes stranger, we'd like this delivered please.

name: cashier
dialogue: Why don't you fill out this address card.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, okay.

name: cashier
dialogue: I notice you picked out a lot of our dinosaur items.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah! Actually, that is one of the reasons why we're not a couple.

name: ross
dialogue: I chose those, I'm a palaeontologist.

name: cashier
dialogue: Really?! That is so cool!

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh. Oh yeah, don't get to worked up over it. I mean it-it sounds like he's a doctor, but he's not.

name: cashier
dialogue: Oh no-no, I'm fascinated by palaeontology. Have you read the new Walter Alvarez book?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah! I-I teach it in my class.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh my God! I'm standing at a cash register, holding a credit card, and I'm bored.

name: cashier
dialogue: Oh, I love your neighbourhood. There's a great gym right around the corner from your building.

name: ross
dialogue: that is my gym.

name: cashier
dialogue: I can tell you work out.  A palaeontologist who works out, you are like Indiana Jones.

name: ross
dialogue: I am like Indiana Jones.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hi Pheebs!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey! Oh, how did baby shopping go?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh, it was great! We got everything that we needed! Oh and Ross, almost got something that wasn't on the list. A whore.

name: phoebe
dialogue: What?!

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, we were paying for our stuff and this saleswoman just started flirting with him.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well did she know you two weren't married?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God! Well the idea of a woman flirting with a-with a single man, we-we must alert the church elders!

name: rachel
dialogue: You don't understand! You didn't see how brazen she was.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Sounds like you are a little jealous.

name: rachel
dialogue: No! I'm not! I-I-I just think it's wrong! It's-it's that I'm-Here I am about to pop and he's out picking up some shop girl at Sluts 'R' Us!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Is that a real place?  Are they hiring?

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey Phoebe!  Fatty!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey Chandler, why so fancy?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, I got a job interview. It's kind of a big deal too. Its a lot more money and I'd be doing data reconfiguration and statistical factoring.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Wait, I think I know someone who does that.

name: chandler
dialogue: Me! I do that. So- Seriously, do I look okay? I'm little nervous.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh yeah! You really-You look great.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah, just don't get your hopes up.

name: chandler
dialogue: Why not?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well, the interview-

name: chandler
dialogue: What about it?

name: phoebe
dialogue: You know! You don't make a very good first impression.

name: chandler
dialogue: What?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh you don't know.

name: chandler
dialogue: Are you serious?!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yes, when I first met you, you were like, "Blah, blah, blah." I was like, shh!

name: chandler
dialogue: What is it that I do?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Well it's just like you are trying too hard. Always making jokes, you know, you just-You come off a little needy.

name: chandler
dialogue: Did you like me when we first met?

name: rachel
dialogue: Chandler, I'm not going to lie to you, but I am going to run away from you.

name: monica
dialogue: Hi! Umm, I'm Monica Geller, I'm the chef at Alessandro's.

name: the food critic
dialogue: Still?

name: monica
dialogue: I think the things that you said about me are really unfair, and I would like for you to give my bouillabaisse another chance.

name: the food critic
dialogue: I don't see any reason why I would do that to myself again.

name: joey
dialogue: Either eat it, or be in it.

name: monica
dialogue: Spoon?  So, what do you think?

name: the food critic
dialogue: I'm torn, between my integrity and my desire to avoid a beating. But I must be honest, your soap is abysmal.

name: joey
dialogue: Thata girl! Huh? We should get out of here; there's a new class coming' in.

name: the cooking teacher
dialogue: Welcome to introduction to cooking. Now, before we start, can anyone tell me the difference between a hollandaise sauce and a bearnaise sauce?

name: monica
dialogue: I can.

name: the cooking teacher
dialogue: Okay, go ahead.

name: monica
dialogue: Well umm, they both have a egg yolk and butter base, but a bearnaise has shallots, shirvel, and most importantly tarragon.

name: the cooking teacher
dialogue: that is very good, what's your name?

name: monica
dialogue: Monica.

name: the cooking teacher
dialogue: Monica, you go to the head of the class.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay.

name: rachel
dialogue: All this stuff takes up a lot of room. Hey how uh, how serious are you about keeping Ben in your life?

name: ross
dialogue: My son? Pretty serious.  Oh hey Katie!  What uh, what are you doing here?

name: katie
dialogue: Well, the delivery went out to you and I realized they forgot this.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah, must've been fairly obvious since it was the only thing left in your store.

name: katie
dialogue: Listen, to be honest, home deliveries are really a part of my job description.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh.

name: katie
dialogue: Oh uh-I actually came here to ask you out.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh! Wow! Uh, yeah! That sounds great. I'm just going to put this  back in my pocket, pretend that didn't happen. Uh yeah, actually I'm free now. Do you want to grab some coffee or-

name: katie
dialogue: Sure!

name: rachel

dialogue: Phoebe!

dialogue: So... Oklahoma is a crazy place. You know, they    call it the Sooner state. Frankly I'd sooner be in any other state.  And what's with Oklahoma    having a pan handle? Can all states have stuff like that? Hey yeah, I'm from    the waistband, Wyoming. But when I was seven, we headed over to the crotch.

You know, your new poodle could be your noodle. And fried    chicken? Could be fricken. Waiter, waiter excuse me, I'll have the freaking?  See, that is... that is funny with the freaking, right?

dialogue: No, it just remind me of something this guy did today    at work. I told you about that funny guy, Geoffrey, right?

dialogue: I really do understand how hard it's got to be to leave    your child with another person. I mean, it's leaving behind a piece of your    heart...

dialogue: Sandy, that is exactly what it is...

dialogue: Are you gay?

dialogue: Ross!

dialogue: Oh, that is pretty.

dialogue: I realise how it's... a bit unorthodox for some people,    but I really believe, the most satisfying thing you can do with your life, is    take care of a child.

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.

dialogue: Like in my last job, I met Daniel when he was three    weeks old. And I got to watch him grow into this awesome person...    When I left, I said

dialogue: Oh God, she mu... she must need her diaper changed.

dialogue: hmmm...

dialogue: I mean, uhm... you know when I was growing up he was    kind of a tough guy... You know a-a-and as a kid I wasn't the athlete I am now.

dialogue: Huh ha ha!

dialogue: I play squash...! Anyway, uhm... I uhm... I always get    the feeling he thought I was too sensitive.

"What are you doing with those things?    What's wrong with you, why aren't you... why aren't you outside playing like    a... like a real boy?

dialogue: I know I am!  ...And when it's    summer, and it's hot, why can't you wear a tank top?

dialogue: Hi!

dialogue: How come?

name: amy
dialogue: Oh. that is a funny noise.

name: joey
dialogue: Pheebs, I still need some help here

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh right, ok um. Ok so its not just the lie you tell.   but its the way you tell it. . For example if you look down at the ground when   you are talking, people know you are lying.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh.. I don't know why this is so hard for me. you know..   I mean lying is basically just acting and I am a terrific actor.

name: phoebe
dialogue: You are a terrific actor.

name: amy
dialogue: Hey. Hey where's the baby?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh we just put her down for a nap.

name: amy
dialogue: Oh I was just thinking. You know what would be incredible?   If you guys died.

name: ross
dialogue: Thank you   Amy.

name: amy
dialogue: no, no, then I would get the baby. I mean you know it   would be just like a movie. Like at first I wouldn't know what to do with her,   then I would rise to the occasion and and then I would get a makeover and then   I'd get married.

name: phoebe
dialogue: that is a great movie.

name: amy
dialogue: Now listen, not that you guys could stop me or anything because you know you'd be dead. I was thinking about changing her name. I'm just not really a big fan of Emily.

name: ross
dialogue: Emma.

name: amy
dialogue: Emma, Ross wants you.

name: phoebe
dialogue: PHOE-BE.

name: amy
dialogue: Why does she keep making that   noise?

name: rachel
dialogue: Honey, I don't know how to tell you this, but um,   if something were to happen to Ross or to myself um you wouldn't get the baby.

name: amy
dialogue: Well who would?

name: ross
dialogue: Well we haven't officially asked them yet, but we would   want Monica and Chandler.

name: chandler
dialogue: I can't believe you'd want us to raise Emma.

name: monica
dialogue: yeah oh my god, I'm so moved.

name: amy
dialogue: I don't believe this, hold on a second. You guys die   and I don't get your baby?

name: rachel
dialogue: See look Amy, we're a lot closer to Monica and Chandler.   We see them every day. And truthfully honey, you don't seem very connected   to the baby.

name: amy
dialogue: Connected? I mean.. to what? She's.. she's  a lump.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know, guys I got to say. This means so much   to me. That you would trust me with your child. I mean, we all know that Monica   and I have been trying to have a baby of our own. You know I've had my doubts   about my skills as a father, but that you two.. that you two....

name: amy
dialogue: This guy? Seriously?

name: monica
dialogue: Okay! It's time for dinner. Everyone we're using our fancy china.. um and its very expensive so please be careful.

name: ross
dialogue: Woah. Woah... Woah.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, just to be clear comedy with the plates will   not be well received.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! How come my plate's less fancy then everyone else's?   Do you not trust me with a fancy plate?

name: monica
dialogue: No, honey, its. that's a special plate.  See   its a game, whoever gets that plate wins.

name: joey
dialogue: I can't believe I won.

name: amy
dialogue: Its such a slap in the face. I'm your sister and you   would give your baby to these strangers over me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Monica is Ross' sister.

name: amy
dialogue: No, Ross' sister was really fat.

name: monica
dialogue: That was me.

name: amy
dialogue: No, she was this really dorky girl in high school that   used to follow Rachel around like a puppy dog.

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey. Amy. You've got to stop doing that.

name: monica
dialogue: Okay, listen I know you are having a little   bit of a family crisis, but you don't have to take it out on the plates. I   mean, I mean in fact I think that everyone should cut their food like this.

name: monica
dialogue: Now see, this way you protect the plate.. and lets   face it you have fun.

name: amy
dialogue: Okay, how about this, you guys die and the crazy plate   lady dies, then do I get the baby?

name: chandler
dialogue: No, if crazy plate lad.. If Monica dies then I would get Emma, Right?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well actually...

name: chandler
dialogue: Actually what?

name: ross
dialogue: well.. its just. its just in that case, then um. Emma   would go to my parents.

name: chandler
dialogue: What?

name: amy
dialogue: Hurts, doesn't it?

name: joey
dialogue: Uh.. who has to die for me to get her?

name: chandler
dialogue: So if Monica's not around, then I'm not good enough   to raise Emma?

name: ross
dialogue: No,  that that is not what we're saying.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah he's lying. He looked down.

name: chandler
dialogue: Well what is wrong with me? Am I .. am I incompetent?   Because I managed to survive whatever it is that killed the three of you!

name: rachel
dialogue: Honey, you are taking this the wrong way. We think   you are going to be a wonderful parent. It's just.. you are more the fun parent.

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah and we'd want to make sure Emma has someone like   Monica who is more uh. uh disciplinarian.. someone who can be firm and strict.

name: monica
dialogue: That's not how you see me, is it?

name: phoebe
dialogue: No you are all about the fun.

name: chandler
dialogue: Look, I may not know a lot about babies, but do   you really think I'm not capable?

name: ross
dialogue: No, you both are equally capable. Its just.. you are   strongest when.. when you are together.

name: chandler
dialogue: Ok. So if we both had Emma and I die she'd have to give her up.

name: ross
dialogue: Sure, Monica would have to give her up.

name: joey
dialogue: I lie better then that, right?

name: chandler
dialogue: So.. let me get this straight. So my two friends   die, I get Emma. Then my wife dies, then Emma the one tiny ray of hope left   in my life gets taken away from me?

name: phoebe
dialogue: There's your movie!

name: monica
dialogue: Hey. There you are. You disappeared after dinner.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh? Did somebody miss me? Is there a child to raise   poorly?

name: monica
dialogue: Ross and Rachel don't know what they're talking about.   I mean its not like their so responsible. Emma is a product of a bottle of   Merlot and a five year old condom.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah but they're right. I mean, I'm not a strong   father figure and I never will be.

name: monica
dialogue: No you learn these things. You grow into it.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, but its not who I am. Everything they said   was exactly why I was worried about having a kid. And its true. And look everybody   knows it.

name: monica
dialogue: I don't know it! I want to have a kid with you because   I think you are going to be an amazing dad... at the fun parts and the hard   parts.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah, well can you picture me saying "Go   to your room! you are grounded"?

name: monica
dialogue: Can you hear me say "you are grounded"?

name: chandler
dialogue: You said that to me last week.

name: monica
dialogue: How hard is it? No shoes on the furniture.

name: joey
dialogue: The producer from Days left a message   on my machine asking why I wasn't at the parade. They said everybody's pissed   off at me.. And they all got to meet Santa!

name: phoebe
dialogue: It's ok. I thought of the perfect lie for you. It's   easy to remember and doesn't invite a lot of questions. You weren't at the   parade because you had a family emergency.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, I like that, yeah. Wasn't at the parade because   I had a family emergency.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh, what happened?

name: joey
dialogue: Oh.. My sister's   raccoon.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No! Nothing with a raccoon.

name: joey
dialogue: Arg... Alright, I'll take care of it.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh wait.. What are you doing?

name: joey
dialogue: Setting the table.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Yeah we thought it would be nice to use the fancy   china for dessert too.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh how nice. Maybe later we can all go blow our noses   on my wedding dress.

name: ross
dialogue: Hey dude, you okay? Sorry about before.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh no that's okay, you are totally right. I don't   know anything about disciplining a child. But it did hurt my feelings and I   want you to know that when I die, you don't get Joey.

name: amy
dialogue: Ucch. Uchh. In case you hadn't noticed, I'm not talking to you.

name: rachel
dialogue: UCHH!

name: amy
dialogue: You know.. this.. this is classic Rachel.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.. yeah right.. Remember in high school when   I died and didn't give you my baby?

name: amy
dialogue: This might be my one chance to have a baby Rachel. I   mean, you know that I have been so busy focusing on my career.

name: rachel
dialogue: What? What career?

name: amy
dialogue: Um.. I'm a decorator.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ok. You decorate dad's office and so now you are a   decorator. Okay! I went to the zoo yesterday and now I'm a koala bear.

name: amy
dialogue: Why can't you ever be supportive?

name: rachel
dialogue: Sup.. You want to talk supportive? You didn't even   come and visit me when I was in the hospital having the baby.

name: amy
dialogue: Oh. Yeah. Well.. You didn't come see me when I was in   the hospital when I was getting my lips done.

name: rachel
dialogue: I did the first time! Oh. Oh.. And you know what. You want to know why I'm not giving   Emily to you.

name: ross
dialogue: Emma.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh whose side are you on? I'm not giving you Emma because there is no way you could handle the responsibility of a child.

name: amy
dialogue: How hard could it be? You do it.

name: joey
dialogue: ooh ooh..

name: amy
dialogue: Do you want to know why you don't want  me to have   the baby?

name: rachel
dialogue: uh huh.

name: amy
dialogue: Because you don't want me to be happy. You.. you have   always been jealous of me.

name: rachel
dialogue: Jealous of what? Of your lack of responsibility? You,   your immaturity? Your total disregard of other people's feelings?

name: amy
dialogue: Uh.. To name a few.  You know.. You know.. You've   just always been like this. You just have to have everything. And I couldn't   have anything. Like in junior high, when you stole Timmy from me. I mean, do   you even realize how much that hurt me?

name: rachel
dialogue: Timmy was my boyfriend and you made out with him!

name: amy
dialogue: Oh come on, that was 20 years ago. Get over it.

name: rachel
dialogue: I cannot, I cannot believe that I invited you here   today.

name: amy
dialogue: Yeah, well you know what I cannot believe. That my so-called   sister, gets a 30% discount from Ralph Lauren and I still have to pay retail.

name: rachel
dialogue: ah ha ha. ah ha ha. It's forty five.

name: amy
dialogue: You bitch. You just think you are so perfect. With your   new baby and your, your small apartment. Well let me tell you something. Your baby isn't even that cute.

name: ross
dialogue: Too far, Amy. Too far.

name: rachel
dialogue: You take that back.

name: amy
dialogue: No.

name: rachel
dialogue: Take it back!

name: amy
dialogue: No! What are you going to do? Make me?

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey man, I work out.

name: amy
dialogue: So do I.

name: rachel
dialogue: I do pilates.

name: amy
dialogue: I do yoga.

name: rachel
dialogue: Bring it on!

name: monica
dialogue: Put the plates in the boxes!! Put the plates in the   boxes!

name: rachel
dialogue: Did you just push me?

name: amy
dialogue: Uh, yeah I think I did.

name: rachel
dialogue: Alright. that is it!

name: monica
dialogue: Forget the bubble wrap! There isn't time!

name: rachel
dialogue: Frizzy frizzy frizzy frizzy!!

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my god! Shouldn't we stop this?

name: joey
dialogue: What? Are you out of your mind? Lets throw some jello   on them.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ew! Gross.

name: chandler
dialogue: Alright! That is it. This is our apartment and   you can not behave this way. Now if you can't act your age then you shouldn't   be here at all. Now those plates may not be as nice as the pretty pink ones   I picked out, but they're very important to Monica. I want you to apologize   to her right now.

name: amy
dialogue: I'm sorry.

name: rachel
dialogue: Mon, I'm so sorry.

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay. That's better. Now I want you to both apologize   to each other and mean it.

name: amy
dialogue: Sorry.

name: chandler
dialogue: By the way, that fight was totally arousing.

name: ross
dialogue: Dude. Well done. You know what? If I die, and Rachel   dies and Monica dies then you can totally take care of Emma.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh yeah? Well thanks.

name: ross
dialogue: So, so now do I get Joey?

name: chandler
dialogue: Okay, but you should know he eats five times a   day and shoves pennies up his nose.

name: rachel
dialogue: Are you okay Mon?

name: monica
dialogue: uh huh.. I mean these things happen. Its' just a   plate. Its not like somebody died.

name: phoebe
dialogue: It's all right. You can mourn.

name: monica
dialogue: Thank you. It was so beautiful. I'm going to go to Joey's and get the pies.

name: joey
dialogue: Actually its not pies, its just pie.

name: monica
dialogue: I don't care. Oh my god. I've lost the will to scold.

name: rachel
dialogue: Look Amy, it got a little of control.. Um.. and I'm   sorry. you are my sister and uh.. if it really means that much to you..

name: amy
dialogue: So you are going to give me the baby?

name: rachel
dialogue: Uh. No.. I was going to let you use my Ralph Lauren   discount.

name: amy
dialogue: You are not going to regret this.

name: rachel
dialogue: She needs changing.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh no no no.. I'll get her. I'm super-competent   and totally responsible and fourth in line to raise Emma. I'll be right there   Emma. Just let me get my trusty diaper bag here. Well.. what do you know? I guess, I'll be the one who dies first.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hey, does Monica know about her broken plates yet?

name: chandler
dialogue: Nope...

name: phoebe
dialogue: Broke them all, huh?

name: chandler
dialogue: Yep...

name: phoebe
dialogue: You going to tell her?

name: chandler
dialogue: Nope...  Hey... so I'm going to...   put the plates back. You know, I think you were right, I don't think we should   use these plates again for a long time.

name: monica
dialogue: Like only if the queen comes?

name: chandler
dialogue: Maybe not even then.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey! I did it. I called my producer. I told him I had   a family emergency, he totally bought it. Thanks for teaching me how to lie   Pheebs.

name: phoebe
dialogue: No problem! Next week

name: monica
dialogue: Bye plates!

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, you told her you broke all the plates, huh?

name: monica
dialogue: What? Something happened with the plates?

name: joey
dialogue: Uhm...  Yeah... this uhm... raccoon came   in...

name: jo lynn
dialogue: This kitty is Mittens and this one is Fitzhugh, and this little guy    in the cat condo is Jinkies.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yep.  that is a lot of cats Jo Lynn.  Single are ya?

name: chandler
dialogue: Chandler Bing.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey.  How come you are answering your own phone?  Where's your crazy assistant?

name: chandler
dialogue: What's up Joe?

name: joey
dialogue: Okay, what have we always wanted to do together?

name: chandler
dialogue: Braid each other's hair and ride horseback on the beach?

name: joey
dialogue: No, no, no.  When you get home tomorrow night, you and I are going to    be at the Wizzards-Knicks game . . .  courtside!

name: chandler
dialogue: Courtside?  Oh my God.

name: joey
dialogue: Yeah.  Maybe Michael Jordon will dive for the ball and break my jaw with    his knee.

name: chandler
dialogue: that is so cool.  I'll let Monica know.

name: monica
dialogue: Hello?

name: chandler
dialogue: Joey just called.  He's got courtside Knicks tickets for him and    me tomorrow night.

name: monica
dialogue: Really?  But tomorrow night is the only night I get off from the restaurant.     If you go to the game, we won't have a night together for another week.

name: chandler
dialogue: But hey, it's courtside.  The cheerleaders are going to be right    in fr. . .   that is not the way to convince you.

name: monica
dialogue: Chandler look, I don't want to be one of those wives who says, "You    can't go to the game.  You have to spend time with me."  So, if you could just    realize it on your own . . .

name: chandler
dialogue: I know.  you are right.  I want to see you too.  I've just got to    figure out a way to tell Joey, you know?  He's really looking forward to this.

name: monica
dialogue: Tell him that you haven't seen your wife in a long time.  Tell him    that having a long-distance relationship is really difficult.  Tell him that    what little time we have is precious.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yeah, ah, ah . . .  I'll think of something.

name: ross
dialogue: Wow!    Wow, You look . . . uh . . .   It's just, ah . . .   That    dress . . . uh . . .

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, I hope the ends of these sentences are good.

name: ross
dialogue: Well, well, they're good.  It's been a while since I've seen you like    this.  You, you clean up good.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh well, well thank you.    Okay,    stop.  Stop looking at me like that.  The last time that happened,  that happened.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh right, right.    So, are you . . . ah . . . you excited about your, your first night    away from Emma?

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah, yeah.  Phoebe and I are going to have so much fun.  And thank    you for watching the baby, by the way.

name: ross
dialogue: Oh, it's fine.  Actually, I, I invited Mike over.

name: rachel
dialogue: Phoebe's Mike?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: rachel
dialogue: I didn't know you guys hung out.

name: ross
dialogue: We don't.  But I thought it would be nice to get to know him.  You know,    maybe have a little dinner, drinks, conversation.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh that is so cute

name: ross
dialogue: I don't know.  But, you know, we, we have a lot in common, you know.     He plays piano; I played keyboards in college.  He's been divorced; I have some    experience in that area.

name: rachel
dialogue: Yeah.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Hi

name: rachel
dialogue: Hey.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh.  Girl's night out indeed.

name: rachel
dialogue: Ok.  So now, I think Emma is probably down for the night,    but if you need anything Ross . . .

name: ross
dialogue: Rach, Rach, we'll be fine, all right?  You go have fun.

name: rachel
dialogue: Okay.  You too.  And I hope you score.   Bye.

name: mike
dialogue: Bye.

name: ross
dialogue: So . . .  Welcome.

name: mike
dialogue: I got beer.

name: ross
dialogue: I got bottled breast milk.

name: mike
dialogue: Eh, why don't we start with the beer?

name: ross
dialogue: Okay.    So, um, Phoebe tells me you, ah, you play piano.

name: mike
dialogue: Yeah.

name: ross
dialogue: You know, I, I used to, ah, play keyboards in college.

name: mike
dialogue: Ah?   Do you have one here?

name: ross
dialogue: No.

name: mike
dialogue: Okay.

name: ross
dialogue: Um . . . ah . . . you know, I'm divorced.  Um, Phoebe, ah . . . Phoebe    said you . . . You've been divorced?

name: mike
dialogue: Yeah.   Yeah, I'm sorry.  I don't . . . I don't really like to    talk about it.

name: ross
dialogue: that is okay.  We'll talk about  something else.

name: mike
dialogue: So, you are a palaeontologist, right?

name: ross
dialogue: Yeah.

name: mike
dialogue: My cousin's a palaeontologist.

name: ross
dialogue: Ah?    Well, he and I would probably have    a lot to talk about.

name: monica
dialogue: Hi.

name: chandler
dialogue: Hey.

name: monica
dialogue: Welcome home.

name: chandler
dialogue: Oh well, look at you.

name: monica
dialogue: Yeah.  What do you think?

name: chandler
dialogue: Well, it looks great.  It's just that . . . well, I'm wearing the    same thing underneath.  So . . .

name: monica
dialogue: Oh.

name: chandler
dialogue: See what I mean . . .

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!  How come the door's locked?

name: monica
dialogue: Just a second.

name: chandler
dialogue: No, no, no, no, no.  Joey can't know that I'm here.

name: monica
dialogue: Why not?

name: chandler
dialogue: Because I didn't know how to tell him that I couldn't go to the Knicks    game.  So, I just told him that I had to stay in Tulsa.

name: monica
dialogue: So, you lied to him?

name: chandler
dialogue: Achhh.  It's always better to lie than to have the complicated discussion.       Except with you.

name: joey
dialogue: Hey!  Open the door.  What's going on?

name: joey
dialogue: What are you . ..    Why are you dressed    like that?

name: monica
dialogue: Oh, because, um . . .  well, Chandler's going to be home in a couple    of days.  So, I thought I would, you know, practice the art of seduction.

name: joey
dialogue: Oh, I thought I heard a man's voice before.

name: monica
dialogue: Oh I was just doing Chandler's side of the conversation.  You know,    like, "Hi, How do I look?"   "Really sexy.  Could I BE any more    turned on?"

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.       Whoa, whoa.  Why are there two glasses of wine out?

name: monica
dialogue: Because. . .  one of them is for you.

name: monica
dialogue: Cheers.    Okay, buh-bye.

name: chandler
dialogue: You know, it's funny.  I've been, ah, practicing the art of seduction    myself.    Hi ya.

name: monica
dialogue: You might want to keep practicing.

name: chandler
dialogue: Yah.

name: chandler
dialogue: It's Joey.    Hey Joe.

name: joey
dialogue: Dude, come home!

name: chandler
dialogue: What? Why?

name: joey
dialogue: COME . . .  HOME.

name: chandler
dialogue: Look I, I can't.  What's going on?

name: joey
dialogue: I don't know how to tell you this but, uh . . . I think Monica's cheating'    on ya.  I told you shouldn't have married someone so much hotter than you.

name: joey
dialogue: All right look.    If you can't come home and    deal with this, then I'm going to.

name: chandler
dialogue: NO!

name: joey
dialogue: I just heard him!

name: chandler
dialogue: Can you . . . hear him . . . now?

name: joey
dialogue: No.   All right, I'm going in.

name: chandler
dialogue: No! Wait!

name: joey
dialogue: I heard him again!

name: chandler
dialogue: All right, look.  Just stay there.  I'm    coming home.

name: joey
dialogue: Okay.  Great.  I'll see you when you get here.  I'm going to wait out in    the hall in case the dude comes out.

name: chandler
dialogue: Is that really necessary?

name: joey
dialogue: Absolutely.  You'd do it for me.  Not that you ever have to because I    know how to keep my women satisfied.

name: ross
dialogue: Shouldn't the pizza be here by now?  I mean, they said thirty minutes    or less.  Well, how long has it been?

name: mike
dialogue: Eleven minutes.   And now twelve.     So, do you like the beer?

name: ross
dialogue: I do.  I do.  Although, it's actually a lager.

name: mike
dialogue: huh.   What's the difference between beer and lager?

name: ross
dialogue: I don't know.  We could look it up.

name: mike
dialogue: Things are about to get wild.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh God.  Remember the girls' nights we used to have sitting around    talking about you and Ross?

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh God.  It seems like forever ago.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I know.     So, what's going on with you and Ross?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, um . . . I don't know.  I mean, for a long time nothing.  But    you know, actually right before you picked me up, Ross and I had a . . . ah    . . . little thing.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Oh my God!  I love things.  What happened?

name: rachel
dialogue: Well, um, first he told me he liked how I looked.  And, ah, then we    had a little . . . um . . . eye-contact.

name: phoebe
dialogue: Eye-contact?

name: rachel
dialogue: Mm-hmm.

name: phoebe
dialogue: I hope you were using protection.

name: waiter
dialogue: Excuse me.  Um, these are from the two    gentlemen at the end of the bar.

name: rachel
dialogue: Oh.   Should we send them something back?

name: phoebe
dialogue: Ooh.  Let's do.  Let's send them mashed potatoes.

name: rachel
dialogue: No!  Wait!  No, no.  Don't do that!  that is going to make them think    they can come over here.

name: phoebe
dialogue: So?  What if they do?

name: rachel
